articleTitle: IKEA failed to deliver in the agreed…
articleText: IKEA failed to deliver in the agreed date (they failed to inform the delivery company), and proposed another date, more than a week for now, to try the delivery again. articleTitle: Delivery from IKEA Wilrijk in Belgium
articleText: A year and a half ago, while living in Greece, we ordered from an IKEA shop in Thessaloniki. It was supposed to be delivered in a couple of days, but it took more than a month! That time the staff referred to some problem with the "system". Ok, whatever. Being late is not considered such a serious offence in Greece.But history repeats itself, this time in Belgium.Last week, on 27/11, we placed an order number 1480812052 at the IKEA Wilrijk shop. It was supposed to be delivered today, 02/12. Of course, nothing was delivered. No one even warned us that there was no point in sitting at home all day waiting for the order. After a long (more than an hour) wait for a reply in chat, we were told that our order was "stuck in the system". Ok, probably right in the middle. So, once again, it was nobody's fault but the proverbial "system".As a result, our order was assigned a different number (1482990540) and its delivery was postponed for 4 days. Well, we'll have to sit at home for another day waiting. Will our order arrive, or will we have to wait a month for it, as it was in Greece? We'll see.It seems to me that the company's policy is to blame for this situation. It allows customers to place more orders via the website than the shops are able to process. And in the case of customer enquiries, the employees are forced to blame "the system".

Bought a kitchen and paid for installation in June 2024. Kitchen was fitted 2 Sep 2024 but wall panels were damaged. Received email stating panels delivery date was 23 Nov 2024, the panels were not ordered until 18 Oct 2024. No explanation was given, there was no communication from Ikea at all regarding this issue. No delivery arrived and again no communication from Ikea. I phoned yet again but was given no explanation and told the delivery would be 28 Nov 2024. Again no delivery and still no contact from Ikea.

articleTitle: Terrible customer service. Avoid the PAX wardrobe system
articleText: I paid £40 for delivery of a wardrobe from Ikea, designed using their PAX system which they advised me would be delivered over 2 deliveries on consecutive days. One of the deliveries never arrived, so I now have a wardrobe with a missing shelf and a large gap at the top of it and a mesh basket bought with no shelf to put it on.Despite numerous emails to the customer service team the shelf has not been redelivered and my email a month ago to customer service, escalating this to a complaint, has remained unanswered. Absolutely non existent customer services.Avoid the PAX wardrobe system if you hope to have a complete wardrobe.

articleTitle: If I could rate lower than 1 star at…

articleTitle: I buy an Ikea toy kitchen in Italy on…
articleText: I buy an Ikea toy kitchen in Italy on Ikea.co.uk in December 2023, after a few months we move to London and this toy kitchen does not fit in our new house. I enquire at Ikea Italy to return it here in the UK as I have the receipt and am within the 365 day return period, they confirm (and send me the policy valid ALL OVER THE WORLD) that I can return it to an Ikea shop and be refunded (I change my mind).I inquire at Ikea UK customer service who start throwing up excuses saying that for them the document issued in Italy is not legible because the tax matrices are different and it's as if I don't have a valid tax document. And so they cannot organise my return. They ask me to go with the item (which specifically weighs more than 20 kilos) to a store to possibly get an assessment for the return and resell service (the item is not even among those that Ikea takes back at a minimum price). The result is that once again Ikea proves to have very bad customer service and violates its own policies to the detriment of consumers, I lost 129€.Last time

articleTitle: Appalling Service and Endless Delays with Kitchen Installation
articleText: We hired IKEA to design and install our kitchen, and it’s been a nightmare from the start. After months of back-and-forth, with multiple incorrect drawings and repeated errors, we finally thought the installation was on track. IKEA assured us the kitchen would be delivered two days before installation, but weeks later, the boxes are still sitting in my home.The initial install date of November 4th was delayed to the 12th, yet today is the 12th, and no one has shown up. Despite calling IKEA multiple times, we received no follow-up. We were repeatedly promised call-backs that never happened.With two young children, having no kitchen for weeks is beyond inconvenient—it’s unbearable. IKEA’s lack of communication and accountability has turned this process into a complete disaster. I expect much more from a company of this size. Avoid their kitchen service if you value your time and sanity.

articleText: Please don’t buy your kitchen from here!We purchased our kitchen from Ikea after shopping around, they were the most reasonably priced and we liked the style and options, our kitchen planner in store was really nice and created a super positive experience for us.However it’s been a complete nightmare ever since the purchase. Original delivery date, the delivery never turned up, I phoned customer service to be told the truck it was on had broken down.. sure.So the whole order is repurchased by Ikea and a new delivery date is set, it gets delivered a day before the fitters arrive instead of a week. Fitters show up and can’t do anything due to missing items from the delivery, no cupboard stands or anything. Fitters leave and we await the delivery of the missing items, these arrive in loads of different delivery’s and boxes forcing our neighbours to take in loads of different parcels.Fitters take ages to be rearranged due to the incompetence of Ikea, they arrive one day without even informing us they were booked to arrive! They finally arrive at a date we were informed of just to tell us they are still missing items from the order and that his apprentice was supposed to account for those items?Unacceptable.So we’ve been left without a kitchen for over 8 weeks, no running water as we don’t have a tap or anything. Customer service are absolutely useless, at least an hours wait on the phone before you can even speak to someone.Please please get your kitchen from somewhere else! What was supposed to be an exciting time of our first kitchen for our first house is now just dread, worry and constant frustrating phone calls. Worst experience ever.

articleTitle: Order delivered damaged but chat not…
articleText: Order delivered damaged but chat not working, phone number not working and the returns in my account is not working!!Ikea use to be the place to buy from but they are now very complacent and I really hope the British Public wake up to their attitude and buy from somewhere else!! Stop treating us like this Ikea its not a way to conduct business... I would give ) starts but TP does not allow this

Non-existent customer serviceChat with customer service -> Open today 08:00 - 22:00 -> 10:00 -> Button still grayed and inactiveArrived to store, and asked to convert my recipient to the invoice. Wait 10 min, and recieve the answer: we can't do it an error in the system, try next week ...Same time made an online query for the invoice, after 2 weeks still silence...

I've seen a lot of crappy customer service but IKEA is the worst. Had a pickup delivery with a 2h window, the diver arrived 30 minutes late and took another 15 minutes to hand out the orders. A ceramic plant pot that I ordered was damaged and he kept it and told me to get in touch with customer service instead of just initiating a refund automatically. The order doesn't even show up in my online profile, there is no contact email, chat doesn't work, on the Messenger chat nobody is answering, hotline is 30+ minutes wait time. There is literally no way to get in touch with support at all. Hard to believe how deep they've sunk. Don't order from IKEA!

articleTitle: I am extremely disappointed with the…
articleText: I am extremely disappointed with the service I received from your store. First, I paid for a furniture installation service, but the item arrived damaged, and your team was unable to resolve the issue. I was informed it would take some time to replace, and I expected it to be completed within a week, as is standard procedure. However, it has now been over a month, and my furniture is still unfinished in my home, awaiting repair. This is unacceptable, especially given the significant amount paid for this service.Secondly, the quality of your shipping service is subpar. The delivery personnel seem untrained and unprepared, causing unnecessary delays and wasting valuable time. This lack of professionalism is both frustrating and disappointing.

Yesterday morning, I purchased twoclocks from Al Wahda IKEA andapproached one of their staff members to test them.However,She told me to go home and test them, stating there was nothing wrong with the clocks. I expressed my desire to test them before leaving the store,but the sales lady was very rude and insisted that their products were already tested and it was unnecessary for me to do so.She also mentioned that I would need to purchase a battery in order to test the clocks

Online ordering service is terrible. Unless you are getting it in person I DO NOT recommend IKEA. Order has been delayed multiple times (not convinced it’s going to show up at this point) and customer service reps are unhelpful and rude (not IKEA ones but for whatever company does the delivery).

Fantastic duo came to my house to deliver quite heavy items (shelving units) they didn’t hesitate to bring inside and leaned it up against something for me. They were polite and went the extra mile so thankyou

Terrible, I made a transfer for 2000 but they never sent the item they claimed they didnt recieve the money even tho the money has gone from my account. They showed absolutely no interest to investigate the problem :( terrible :(

articleTitle: Went to Bristol to buy a wardrobe
articleText: Went to Bristol to buy a wardrobe, a lot of choice and needed help with the measurements and internal design of the wardrobe. Luckily I was helped by Roxy in that department and she was extremely knowledgable, patient and very helpful. She took the time to discuss the different options and made the whole process so easy, really great customer service.

articleTitle: It doesn't look as though Ikea care…
articleText: It doesn't look as though Ikea care about what customers think, as long as they are making money.Why doesn't anyone (from Ikea) respond to all of these negative reviews?For what its worth - I bought a bed but as I was putting it together noticed the headboard was damaged. I called Ikea and was offered a free replacement or a refund. I really didn't want to take the bed apart to swap headboards so decided to take the refund offered. I was then told the bed will not be under warranty anymore! 'Company policy' or 'Terms and Conditions'!So you buy something from Ikea, have it delivered, it's damaged and yet you lose the warranty. Incredible.

articleTitle: IKEA used to be great BUT
articleText: IKEA used to be great at delivery and assemblyBUTwith them now using a third-party (TaskRabbit) for assembly, it is a deeply frustrating experience. Disjointed and time consuming for customers.Last week, the delivery we planned for did not show up, so I had to cancel the Tasker ...and rebook delivery and Tasker. Today, with delivery on the way, the Tasker cancelled. IKEA's customer support line is DOWN ...and after much communication, they were not able to get a Tasker in good time.
Wife and her friend came home after questioning an item which was incorrectly priced at Cardiff branch. A member of management was called to sort who got very personal and intimidating.

tried for almost a month to get 2 closets from them. every time they send something broken. at some point they suggest you go drive across the country yourself and pick it up on a rented car. even though you paid for delivery.will never again buy anything here.

I waited 5 hours for a delivery that never took place. After the designated delivery window, I received an email message indicating they would contact me to reschedule but they also provided a number to call to get faster service. I waited on the line for over an hour with no service from them when I tried calling. Two days later I still haven’t heard from them. I want to cancel my order but their website lets you buy and pay, schedule delivery that may or may not happen, but there is no option to cancel an order. Just really bad. I also tried their online chat with no help. Worst customer service I have experienced in a long time although I did have a pretty bad interaction with an Ikea employee once in the US. I won’t be buying from Ikea in the future.

articleTitle: Ikea for one has terrible products
articleText: Ikea for one has terrible products. They are not sturdy and they are made from cheap material. When they deliver to your address they give you a 12 hour window of delivery when you order. However they never call you the night before like they say they will giving an estimated time of arrival. I ordered a dresser and I had to return it. For both delivery and pick up they did not give me a courtesy call like they claim they will. Instead they called me when they arrived. Save your money and get pre-built furniture instead of this garbage.

articleTitle: Hi I have just finished putting my new…
articleText: Hi I have just finished putting my new wardrobe together but the doors has a gap in the middle and when I adjust the gap closed the a gap opens at the hinge end of the door frame can anyone help please.

articleTitle: Never order online, they don't deliver
articleText: Paid for expedited delivery, IKEA missed that delivery date and 3 more, each time cancelling without my knowledge. I had to call customer support daily. Every day they said it would be delivered and the website was then cancelled that day for no reason.I had to drive to Oak Creek, WI to get my stuff eventually.Definitely going to stick with Amazon and never do IKEA again!

articleTitle: i AM SO DISAPPOINTED WITH IKEA
articleText: i AM SO DISAPPOINTED WITH IKEA. I was on the phone with ikea for 6.5 hours and my problem was still not resolved. They kept putting me on hold and. Writing my complaints without solving anything. I went to ikea to get my closets designed. They ORDERED the wrong colour. They then never came to pick it up. They then made me reorder it and pay. i did, and they ordered the wrong size. They assembled it and refused to dissemble the closet. I then reordered the piece a third time. articleTitle: Another week delayed of my order…
articleText: Another week delayed of my order 1443796477 order from 23june can't fit my kitchen due to not full order recived IKEA Is FU NG JOKE where is my order every time same excuse DX have issue with lorries. DX is next for review.

articleTitle: The Worst Shopping Experience of My…
articleText: The Worst Shopping Experience of My LifeI purchased a dresser from IKEA in Orlando, FL, and it turned into a nightmare. When the product arrived, several crucial pieces were missing. After contacting customer service, they assured me the missing parts would be sent, but they never showed up. Weeks later, I was told that the parts were unavailable and was left with two terrible choices: either disassemble the dresser I had already spent hours assembling or keep an incomplete, useless product.I had no choice but to take apart the dresser, haul it back to the store, and process a refund. The whole ordeal was exhausting and beyond frustrating. What should have been a simple purchase turned into a time-consuming, stressful experience. The lack of care from customer service and the failure to provide a solution made this the worst product purchase experience I’ve ever had.I expected much better from IKEA, but I’ll definitely think twice before buying from them again.

articleTitle: Ikea sells terrible stuff and have terrible management
articleText: Yes the prices are relatively low but quality is very low for most items  You can get lucky once and awhile and get a product that doesn't fall apart or is scratched or dented but that is rare occurrence.Returns are difficult because they make you jump through too may hoops because they say many people are clever enough to take advantage of their return policies.Add to that, you have to assemble different items makes shopping at Ikea a nightmare.

articleTitle: I visited IKEA in Weston I had the best…
articleText: I visited IKEA in Weston I had the best experience with Leyla. She was an incredible person who listen to my problems and execute to the best of her abilities. Thank you so much and you are amazing.

This company has the most appalling customer service. It is impossible to talk to the store you have purchased from directly. The only number takes you to an operative who has limited resources to help you. No one rings back and nobody solved the problem. I have had my order lost then found waited twice for delivery that did not come. No apologies no explanation and just stuck in an endless loop when trying to complain. It is the worst customer service ever. I still have not received an order placed two months ago!

articleTitle: Delivery guy wont available to delivery…
articleText: Delivery guy wont available to delivery to door, and I had to move all items by myself. Charge more than 100 RM for just left at Lobby and items not available, just remove items from catalog and that's it, it is a waste of time and poor services

IKEA India Customer Care team is the most inefficient I have encountered so far. They are least bothered about customer support.Since May-2024 inspite of innumerable number of calls, chats, emails, escalations etc., refund has not been credited to my bank account against Ikea credit note issued against goods returned.Customers must think ten times before placing an order on Ikea India.

I've been a loyal IKEA customer for years and have always appreciated their designs and affordability. However, my recent experience has been disappointing. I purchased the FRIHETEN sofa-bed, and initially, it was a great addition to our home—comfortable and functional.After about 2.5 years of normal use by two adults (no kids or pets), the sofa started showing significant wear. The cushions sagged, foam pieces began falling into the storage compartment, and eventually, metal springs snapped and protruded through the material on one side.When I reached out to IKEA customer service, I was informed that the damage was due to misuse and improper maintenance, so it wasn't covered under their 10-year guarantee. This was frustrating because we used the sofa exactly as intended and took good care of it.While I still appreciate some aspects of IKEA, this experience has left me questioning the durability of their products and the support provided when issues arise. I hope IKEA addresses these concerns for future customers.

articleTitle: We had to return/exchange an item we…
articleText: We had to return/exchange an item we purchased because it was missing parts. After waiting 30 minutes in the return line to process it, we waited another 25 minutes to receive a new order for another box that was yet missing parts also. Once it was all figured out (another 30 minutes), we were missing a whole box and then was made to wait another 30 minutes for their pick up person to walk to a shelf to pick it out - what would have taken me 5 minutes to walk over and get myself but I was not allowed to. IKEA needs to come up with a better system as this was very inconvenient for have wasted 2 hours of my time just for an exchange. Extremely inconvenient and frustrating.

articleTitle: Very bad service the company full of…
articleText: Very bad service the company full of scammer Sending wrong items Left me the assembling drawer in floor The job has not done properly

Useless (GB) website. Got all the way to checkout but was told I was a bot. I managed to clear the browser cache (without losing my shopping bag) but was then told my password was incorrect. Requests for one-time codes did not appear in inbox. Had to switch to Android app where everything was fine. Order confirmation email appeared straightaway.

articleTitle: Dishonest business with shady business practices
articleText: Items constantly out of stock or discontinued. Rarely does sales. When they do, they do them on items of which they have only 2 units in the whole country (!), they don't ship/deliver them to Lisbon (!), both units sell overnight (?!), and they don't restock until after the sale (!). No contact form. No e-mail support. Chat support is just a virtually-useless bot. Must repeat yourself multiple times to reach someone unhelpful who basically just repeats the information on their app or website. Refused return of unopened items (!). Refused return of damaged items with 5-year warranty because the warranty was allegedly 2 years when I purchased it ~4 years ago (?!). Provided no evidence of this (!). Provides no warranty information on item documentation (stated by IKEA representative), must rely on, believe, and accept whatever they tell you (often incorrectly) when you try to return it (!). Awful smart home products, constant issues and unhelpful errors, no support. Advertises item availability and deliverability, then refuses to deliver it when you actually try (?!).

articleTitle: People with foreign phone numbers be…
articleText: People with foreign phone numbers be aware. One tiny typo can cost you 800kr and your delivery to be postponed with 1 week despite if you change the phone number on the website on your profile before the order is sent out for delivery.I am really disappointed with the level of service they were able to provide - actually the service in my situation was nonexistent.There’s a huge lack of information towards the consumer here which can cause such big problems and stress.

articleTitle: We had a 1800 bucks delivery scheduled…
articleText: IWe had a 1800 bucks delivery scheduled from Ikea with the rxo compagny. We received 3 text messages to say that our delivery was confirmed with a time frame. After a while the delivery guy didn't shows up. When we called Ikea and the delivery company (RXO) they didn't bother to explain why they didn't come of just offer us a new delivery, 10 DAYS LATER. We had bed frame and mattress in this delivery, so we had to bought air mattress for this 10 days and live without any furniture because of them. And of course no refund a commercial gesture. Don't ask for a delivery with Ikea and RXO, it is a nightmare.

My wife and I ordered a kitchen after a long decision making process and paid in total in May. We had visits from the fitter to assess and all appeared well. We were promised a delivery date of 29th September  (today). Our old kitchen has been removed and we are basically camping in the house. We awaited the kitchen and when it did not appear contacted customer services. Several long calls later and told that several items were no longer available, such as the dishwasher ( that we assumed wrongly would be reserved for us as we had paid for it), the oven and several other small items. We were told that they could cancel so that we could reorder but this would affect the installation date. We have ordered lighting and worktops from a different supplier that have arrived for the install. I have arranged annual leave for the installation. No offer to compensate. Little in the way of apology. It's like they couldn't care less. Shockingly poor customer service.

articleTitle: Entire new kitchen order was wrong
articleText: Entire new kitchen order was wrong, many parts you have to pay for in advance and then return for refund only if full pack!Bad service on assembly and left hanging for days.Took days to try and resolve many issues.Customer service in the Algarve has no teeth although after making a complaint in the official complaints book I received a voucher but it represented less than 5 percent of my spend! Therefore when I reclaimed the voucher it only costs IKEA THEIR net cost of goods so refund actually around 2percent of purchase.My hours of time and visits to the store cost me far more. Mind you the customer service staff although having no power were always most polite.

articleTitle: I am extremely dissatisfied with the…
articleText: I am extremely dissatisfied with the company's service.  The goods that were paid for, available at the time of payment, with paid transportation, were not delivered because, at the time of packing, they were no longer in stock. A workday was lost waiting for the delivery, and a worker hired for assembly was paid, which caused additional costs and inevitably lost money.

Terrible delivery. I paid for delivery, waited a long time, and received a product missing the entire assembly kit. articleTitle: An item was missing from my order
articleText: An item was missing from my order, though Ikea order on the webpage says order completed. There is no option for how to contact them about this information, no chat, no nothing, so what do I do now? I have just spent over 2,500€ with them!

articleTitle: Ikea is good BUT the shipping company used: awful
articleText: TLDR version: IKEA is great, it is their in-home delivery service I had a major issue with and will never use again, because of the shipping company used.I have recently experienced an ordeal which prevents me from rating one of otherwise really nice stores higher. Actually, I am only giving three stars at all just because I am rating IKEA, not the delivery fiasco. IKEA is nice. Their customer support did their best. In the end, they did all they could, really, and once I cancelled the (probably cursed) order, they returned my money straight away with no problem, I went to IKEA myself, and picked up at least a bed with no issues, quickly, and with the staff on site being really kind and helpful. But before this happy ending, a literal nightmare took place over the course of 3 (or 4, don't remember anymore) days. Thing is, I moved to the US from Europe. And because I was moving into an unfurnished apartment, I turned to IKEA to purchase some starting necessities like a bed with a mattress and sheets, some basic cookware, a bin, some glasses... things you don't pack when you're moving overseas. Because I needed a US phone number, which of course I couldn't get before getting to the US, I used an app that could give me a temporary US phone number, and my goal was to arrange a normal US SIM a soon as I arrived. Everything went smoothly, I ordered an in-apartment delivery for my move-in date. Unfortunately, the day of, I found out the app doesn't work and I couldn't access my temp phone number. I immediately called IKEA, a few hours before the supposed delivery, hoping I will be able to get a message across to the driver of the truck to call a different number which I was able to arrange upon my arrival. IKEA informed me that for these deliveries, they cannot change the phone number once the delivery was placed. Thus ended my first call with them. I called again and asked if anything can be done at all, like them giving me contact info for the delivery company. They did not, but made a note in their system with the new number. Nobody called me, and the delivery was noted as failed a little while later, so I called IKEA again (call number 3, still okay-ish), asking what happened and if they could put me in touch with anyone in the shipping company to hopefully get the message across to the driver. They did, and I started calling the shipping company. This is where my patience started wearing thin, because for such a simple thing as a different phone number, there appeared to be no solution. The customer service kept telling me what they cannot do and what IKEA must do, so I kept calling back and forth with both, resulting in no less than 18 (yes, bloody EIGHTEEN) calls with customer support of IKEA and the shipping company. The shipping company kept asking IKEA to change the number in many different ways, and IKEA kept doing it and helping me as best they could but still the driver apparently kept calling the old number on a total of four (as far as I can recall, could have been more) failed delivery attempts. When the situation started to come truly full circle, I have decided that repeating the same pattern and expecting a different result would indeed be a sign of insanity, and called IKEA for a final time to cancel the order. Before that, I called the shipping company to inform them that unless the driver calls the correct number and delivers my stuff that very day, I won't be able to receive the goods anyway because I started at my new job on the next business day and will not have time to wait for a call that is not coming at home anymore. They tried to persuade me to still wait, but were unable to give me any specifications or assurances the driver will indeed call the correct phone number that by that time has been probably plastered all over every piece of documentation regarding that order by both IKEA and, if one could believe them, the shipping company. At that point I just wanted my bed, and to not sleep on a borrowed air mattress anymore, so I said I do not care anymore, cancelled the order and just asked a friend to help me get some of the stuff in person.

articleTitle: Ordered a kitchen table online for my…
articleText: Ordered a kitchen table online for my daughter who lives out of state. Table arrives damaged. I have no phone number in my email order to call. Go around in circles trying to find someone to help me. Never actually speak to a person. Was told in their FAQ section that if there’s a problem with an item, I need to pay return shipping…on THEIR damaged item! My daughter loads this big table in their tiny car and drives an hour to the store. There she get a merchandise credit card and has to go pick out the table again and rebuy it. Worst customer service I have ever seen. I buy a lot of stuff online. First time buying online from Ikea and LAST time buying from them!

articleTitle: I’m so disappointed and regrate why did…
articleText: I’m so disappointed and regrate why did I purchase OVEN from IKEA. I bought OVEN from IKEA in May 2024, and I found out the OVEN faulty. I called IKEA and advised me to wait for engineer to see the exact fault. Waiting for engineer for a week after the inspection we told the OVEN need to be replaced. We must wait for month to exchange the OVEN nothing happened. I called IKEA to see when they going to replace the OVEN, I been told to wait for a week to receive the delivery, but nothing happened. We called IKEA again to find out the delivery I been told over the phone, you should have your OVEN why didn’t they delivered and asked me are you available tomorrow so we can deliver, and I said yes please do so, I waited the whole day nothing happened. I called IKEA again to find out and I been told to wait until 7 October to receive your delivery. Today is 11 October and I have not received my delivery yet, so I called them and they said sorry we doo not have the item in stook you need to wait until 18 October once we receive the item in stook then call back. Can’t believe IKEA is unreliable to keep you wait for 4 months for OVEN which you need it for your daily routine. I wonder why they can’t just say we don’t have it and please arrange somewhere else simple.

I would have given 0 if there was option, worst customer care I have ever spoke,  they communicate all the lies.We got a mattress, I had to return it due to its size, it was not opened.after that all the problems started for refund, its been more than 2 months still not received refund.

Very bad service!!I ordered a bed. There were complications before it was finally delivered. When it was finally there, I noticed during the assembly that the important middle part where the slatted frame is placed was missing. The missing part does not have a serial number in the instructions, so you cannot register it. After 15 and later 39 minutes of waiting on the phone I gave up and two emails remained unanswered. For reasons of space, I had to put the mattress in the assembled bed frame. During the night I come across the sharp metal. What if I hurt myself?? Will Ikea respond to this post?

Pathetic customer service. Don’t even listen to the customer’s concerns and pass mocking remarks. Asked a repair for my mattress which has deformed and it hasn’t even been 2 years. Representative put me on hold for 15 minutes and then disconnected the call without resolving issue. Poor quality products and unprofessional customer service representatives. Stay away!

articleTitle: Kitchen Inspirations - don't make me laugh!
articleText: If you buy an Ikea kitchen ensure they don't propose Kitchen Inspirations as the kitchen fitters. A cacophony of errors starting from very beginning. Incorrect measurements during the kitchen survey, long lead times for installation, damages during installation, and we’re now looking at another 8 weeks for them to return to complete the fit.If they return in November we’ll be looking at 10 months from order to complete. Ikea appear to have limited control of their sub-contractors.

articleTitle: Indeed the most functional assembly experience
articleText: Compared to several other furniture brand, which claim to offer a high-quality service, IKEA truly offers the better experience when it comes to easiness of assembly and clarity of the instructions. Furthermore, never a scratch on the furniture.

I am beyond frustrated with the terrible service I’ve experienced. I’ve had to deal with multiple issues surrounding my order, including receiving the wrong wardrobe frames and incomplete deliveries. Despite assurances from customer service that everything would be sorted, only two out of three wardrobe frames arrived, and I had to contact them yet again to arrange the delivery of the missing item.To make matters worse, the customer assistant struggled to fix the issue, and I’ve had to request a manager callback multiple times and each time the manager refused a callback. This entire process has dragged on through at least six different delivery/collection attempts, causing unnecessary stress, inconvenience, and wasted time.I expected much better service, and I'm appalled by how poorly this has been handled. If this situation isn’t resolved promptly, my next step will be to contact Retail ADR to escalate my complaint.

articleTitle: I bought a Chest of Drawers from Ikea…
articleText: I bought a Chest of Drawers from Ikea recently. Besides making me pay for it and then not delivering on time, when i called them to check they said the product was out of stock. Then they sent me the product late by 4-5 days, Anyways, I assembled it but realised the design was faulty. It’s a nice piece but the open part at the back could have been resolved by providing a small plank to cover it avoiding, insects and dust to get inside, and also incase I don’t want to pin the chest of drawers to the wall and want to keep options open to place it anywhere in the bedroom.They refuse to publish my review on their website and keep sending me emails as to why their design is not faulty and I need to hang the chest of drawer on the wall, which I don't want to.

Do not buy from IKEA.  It's a never ending money pit of low quality GARBAGE.  I paid for the furniture, then I paid to have it delivered, then I paid to have it assembled.  Now I am paying with my health.  The couch is made from some material that has a strong odor that has given me a headache.  Do yourself a favor.  If you see something in the store and you have a good knowledge of how to put it together go for it.  Or pay dearly with health and money.

Ikea France steals clients' money! In January 2024 I requested a reimbursement for products that were not delivered. Now it's July 2024 and part of that reimbursement has not yet been paid to me in spite of a dozen of calls that I've made.

(I write using English translate)Yesterday I went to Ikea Vaughan branch to return 2 arm chairs that I bought 10 months ago and never took out of their boxes. They were in their original boxes, I bought them as a gift, but I couldn't take them to the person I bought them from, I didn't have a big car for the return. We only cut off the robes. I went thinking the return period was 365 days but they said they wouldn't take them. The person at the cash register was named Meyar, she was very rude. They didn't care about us because our English was bad. The only thing she said was the word no. Then his supervisor came and he said definitely couldn't take them. Then another manager came and looked at the product and said she could take it back but give store credit. Then another manager came and said the same thing, we didn't want it and while they were there checking the return policy, they first said they were open until 9 o'clock and you can wait, but then when a few customers supported us, they told us to leave Ikea or they would call the police, my husband and I said call them, we are not causing any problems, we are just here to get our rights. Of course we waited there and they couldn't call the police because we didn't do anything wrong. The customers there said they listened to the issue and were sorry about the situation, how immoral it was to threaten us with the police and that they would write a complaint to IKEA. Now we expect a solution from you, if you can return a product that we never use, why don't you refund my money. We have shopped from you for years, we wanted to have a kitchen built but I have decided never to buy products from IKEA from now on.

articleTitle: I will truly never use IKEA again
articleText: I will truly never use IKEA again. They have messed up my delivery NINE TIMES in a row. First they messed up my phone number, fine. I went to another colleague because the other one forgot to put something on the order, two birds-one stone sorta thing, cool. NOPE. She added the piece but then TOOK THE DELIVERY PART OFF. And STILL didn't fix my number, she said I could fix it online, THANK GOD. I had been waiting for DAYS!, call them? They couldn't get through cause my number was 'STILL WRONG.' HOW!?!?! Then they tried to deliver my package, I spoke to THREE different people only to find out MY ORDER WAS NEVER ON THE TRUCK. So the IKEA tracker lied? Super disappointed and disgusted at how this is being handled. NO communication between departments and NO way to reach management. I will never shop at IKEA again.

articleTitle: I waited for 3 weeks for it come when…
articleText: I waited for 3 weeks for it come when it came it was damaged they were ment to saturday but they never came and they were ment to come today and again they never cameIm very disappointed with this i paid £550. I will never use ikea again its genuinely so bad

ONLINE BUYERS BEWSREPathetic Customer SupportOnly Lip ServiceFalse Messages Saying Delivery Attempted 5 days in a rowDelivery person says he has not enough battery in his vehicle to deliver5 complaints lodged with customer service over 5 days - including an escalation callSadly - Besides saying sorry IKEA seems not interested to fulfil delivery

articleTitle: The delivery and customer service was not good at all.
articleText: Related to delivery and customer service of IKEA:I understand that IKEA is the destination for affordable furniture, but the quality of their delivery/customer service should not be kept at the low standard at all.My order was split into 2 deliveries: one that came on time without issue. The second delivery was late and then not delivered at all because DHL cannot find my apartment. I called IKEA to explain that if the first delivery was without problem, how came that it didn't work out for the 2nd delivery. They ignored my complaint, and told me to order the second time. What I found disappointing is that I already paid 90 EUR for the delivery fees, and with the new reorder, IKEA told me to pay the delivery fee by myself. I find the service very bad. With this solution, why should the customer care department exist? I hope that IKEA can improve their logistics and especially customer service soon, to retain loyal customers.

We ordered a kitchen with IKEA also to be installed by them.  In total was just under 15.000eur.  When the installation started on the 1st April it went ok, usual issues with workmen not always taking care but nothing too problematic.  After 6 weeks (the usual wait time for dekton kitchen worktops to be cut and delivered) the installer found that the side had been cut incorrectly.  Since then IKEA have ghosted me.  I have called multiple times, always at least 30 mins before I get to speak to someone to find out that 'someone is working on it they will call back'; 12 weeks later and neither me nor the installation company that was sub-contracted can get any information as to when it might be finished.  IKEA even told the installation company that I never answer calls and emails! Absolutely disgusting after sales.  I have found no way to escalate the problem and am left with an unfinished kitchen and ongoing stress of wondering if the problem will ever be solved.

articleTitle: It takes up to 3 weeks for Ikea to refund your money.
articleText: It is absolutely unacceptable that it takes up to 3 weeks for Ikea.ca to refund the customer's money after I wasn't able to pick the purchased online furniture in 24 hours. After missing the deadline we called to check if we still could pick the items, but the representative said that the items were back to stock, and we will get a refund soon. Now it is two week later, and still there is no refund. Today I called, and a representative tried to explain about the refund, but he also told me that my purchased items were still available for pick up for a couple days after 24 hours of the deadline. When we called first time nobody told us about that. I had to spent another 600$ to buy the same furniture in the store because refund wasn't available from IKEA. They also could covert my money into a gift card, which I could receive online and use for the purchase of the same furniture in the store. Nobody did anything except the last representative who tried to calculate the days, and tell me when I will be getting my money back. I learn my lesson: I will never purchase anything on Ikea's website again

articleTitle: They randomly cancelled one of the…
articleText: They randomly cancelled one of the items at 7pm and shipped the rest... That one item was a deal breaker. We tried to contact them but customer support isn't available after 6PM...

articleTitle: I am extremely disappointed with IKEA’s…
articleText: I am extremely disappointed with IKEA’s customer service. I ordered a full kitchen, including a dishwasher, which I paid for upfront. However, the dishwasher was missing from the delivery, and despite contacting IKEA multiple times, it has now been over two months, I still haven’t received the missing item. Customer service has been absolutely useless, offering no clear answers or resolution. Every time I call, they can’t provide any helpful information or a timeline for when I’ll get the dishwasher. The lack of communication, follow-up, and basic accountability is incredibly frustrating.This has been the worst shopping experience I’ve ever had, and I regret choosing IKEA for such a major purchase. I wouldn’t recommend their services to anyone, especially for large, expensive items like kitchen orders. They seem completely unprepared to handle issues, and their customer support is a nightmare.

As you walk around an Ikea store you will hear bradcast messages about sustainability and recycling. This is anything but a sustainable company. Careless excessive packaging, adhesive and plastic labels on everything that is often inappropriate or unecessary, many cheap poor quality furniture products that wont last and a company that consumes huge quantities of the worlds hardwoods, many not from sustainable sources. Resin filled poor quality composite materials. Please don't pretend youre a sustainable focused business. Its not honest and excessively annoying to listen to when you visit. Anyone who believes you is ill informed.

articleTitle: Lost Trust after Ikea Kitchen fitter got it wrong and I cannot do anything about it!
articleText: As much as I love Ikea, it irritates me that the biggest expense, my Ikea kitchen, every day I open a pull out draw that we meticulously designed, through the Ikea service bangs into my Belfast sink and therefore pushes the drawers next to it out of line all of the time and I have to push them all back because the Ikea fitter, did not measure correctly and fitted not allowing the drawer to open and clear the sink!You would think that I could do something about it, but no, after spending an hour on the phone waiting for Ikea kitchen 'support' to answer, I was told 'we have images and it all looks ok', but someone will call you, (but they never did!) I remember the fitter telling me, oh its ok, you do not have to sign for anything!  Unfortunately I accepted his word as I was so desperate to get my kitchen after waiting for months for it to be fitted and I guess I trusted the Ikea fitter!So their 25year guarantee only if you use their fitters is worthless!  I will never trust them again!

A day before the delivery, I received an SMS that my package should arrive between 14:10 and 15:10.The following day, the driver calls me 11:54, and he tells me he is coming with my package! I asked him "ok, how long, 20 minutes, 30 minutes?", and he says "in 1 minute".So he comes 2 and half hours BEFORE the agreed time, and he doesn't even calls before, so I have to leave work early, take a taxi to get home in time, so I can receive the delivery.When I called the phone support about this they said they can't confirm this and they can't do anything about it.

articleTitle: One day heaven one day hell
articleText: Thought Ikea should be better than 1.5, however, their performance today would definitely deserve lower.I returned a mattress (8Oct24)used for 2 years as the centre began to slump. Exchange was impossible as the product was out of stock and I chose another one which was scheduled to be delivered three days later (11Oct24). Fabulous! Everything was swift and hassle free. Three days later, the heaven turned out to be hell.With help, I pushed the 10 inch King size mattress from bedroom to living room. Waited a whole day with constant online check. At 1852, I called and was told there would be no delivery as the new mattress was out of stock. The earliest stock may be available on 14Oct and I have to call the hotline to check the stock and arrange for delivery. I told them why didn’t they come and collect the return mattress first and deliver the new one after the stock replenish. Been answered they could not do it and if I wanted a separate collection, it would be 6 days later. No updates on the stock and no buffer for any delivery or collection. I would need to push the mattress up to bedroom or dare sleeping in the living room for a week. What a service!Update: IKEA missed its second delivery, hour before the SMS claimed its arrival. Called twice to ask with no avail. Only answered it was their company policy. Started to stress out with IKEA, Even cancelling order needed at least two phone calls, still no confidence when and how the service will be done. Absolute nightmare.

ABSOLUTELY WORST ONLINE STOREEasily the worst and most frustrating online store to use, I don't know why I bother as Ikea is not even cheap anymore but their products are still cheap and nasty. Literally every time I try to purchase something online I end up having to contact them on chat, and even that is a royal pain in the you know what. Comes up with "ypou seem to have connectivity issues" when I know 100% there is nothing wrong with my internet, and its a bit sus it happens every time I contact them regardless of time of day. They are slow to reply and it's the usual OS call centre reading from the same old tired scripts, The only reason I have used them at all is because my daughter keeps finding stuff on their website for her bedroom and won't change her mind. otherwise there is no way I would ever buy anything from them again. The latest issue is trying to change a delivery date by one day, the message I keep receiving "Sorry, there's an unexpected problem with the rescheduling system at the moment. Please try again, or come back at another time." the reschedule button seems to be directly connected to this message as they have no intention of rescheduling.

Appalling customer service. We ordered a Havsta storage cabinet with a combination of pieces. When we unpacked a couple of the boxes, we discovered marks all over the wood (it turns out it's the wood knots and with the thin paint on top, it looks like there are lots of dirty marks everywhere). We then organised a collection / delivery of the faulty pieces, thinking that was all fine. Then I received a confirmation email and noticed that they have noted down the wrong items for exchange, but after a phone call, we were told that all has been ammended and everything was fine.Cue the delivery date, I phone in the morning to get a time estimate (as it's a 12 HOURS long slot), and I'm told "everything is fine" and they'll let me know when the delivery will take place. Several hours pass, and I phone again to get a timing, and that's when I'm told that the collection has been cancelled - because of the original issue with the bar codes of items having been wrong. No warning, no communication. The delivery of the exchange items has been remade without checking with me, and now the collection can only be re-arranged for a week's time.I explained that having all these boxes in my home everywhere is really difficult and that given it's their mistake on several counts (faulty product, mistake noting the car codes of items for exchange, cancelling the collection with no communication), it's really for them to resolve. This is the part that I'm the most shocked by, there was literally no flexibility, and a "it's your issue to deal with, not ours" attitude. I asked to speak to someone else and was told that that I couldn't do that, as they would just say the same thing. Effectively it was too bad, and I'd just have to lump it.I'm now left with a room full of boxes, having spent all day during the children's half term at home waiting, and just a really unpleasant feeling about how badly IKEA treat their customers. I know IKEA is good value for money but I wouldn't order from them again, as if it goes wrong, you're on your own!

A faulty ikea dishwasher flooded my apartment and the one underneath and the process of trying to deal with customer service to get a replacement has been horrendous - holding on the phone for hours, being directed to other numbers that are not answered, unanswered emails. After spending €10k on an ikea kitchen, the whole process has been a nightmare

TL;DR: DO NOT RECOMMEND IKEA BUY BACK. Arrogant approach and a lot of hassle for much less money than you'd expect. Lost 2.5 hours and €25-35 (ca 30% of value) for believing fake promises and getting pushed into can't-decline situation. Better sell on online marketplace.Offered a king sized bed (RRP €200) in perfect condition on Marktplaats (local classifieds marketplace) for €110. Got 3 offers, accepted first, last minute no-show. Renovating -> quick sale desirable -> let's try the IKEA buyback program, online offer €100 following their terms. Disassemble bed, load to a car, travel to IKEA Amersfoort. Long wait (as always on their CS to be fair), then we were asked to assemble again to be considered. Sure, it was mentioned we need to 'deliver the product assembled', not really possible for 180x200 bed, but anyway. We put it together. The guy, Mateo, danced around for 5 minutes and finally found a single hairline ca 8 mm long "scratch" on the back side between joints (most likely a manufacture issue, second employee was unable to find for 2 minutes even though he knew which side of the bed to look at, see picture below). Smug smile "good shape, you'll get €75". "No, that's not what your terms say." "I'm not here to discuss, it's a large piece, it'll take a lot of space, accept 75 or you can take it back home. Bye." Generally like IKEA (who doesn't), but DEF not jumping on their "circular" buyback promises ever again.

articleTitle: YOU DONT DESERV EVEN ONE STAR
articleText: YOU DONT DESERV EVEN ONE STAR. SUPPORT IS A DISASTER.WAITING FOR SUPPORT FOR A PRODUCT. They DO NOT EVEN CONNECT with each other, unacceptable customer support.

Recently bought Article Number 005.712.45Suprisingly there is a defect in frame.One frame didnot have a hole to the screw.So i gave them a review, but ikea removed myreview and told my review is not about the product.

I purchased an induction, never worked and I tried to bring it back to the store with the fast return but they didn’t take it because wasn’t them problem that what they said, they sent me to Electrolux and was even worse, the customer service is terrible they give ve me a few wrong appointments and I’m still waiting for someone coming to take a look, it’s a nightmare more than one month

articleTitle: I ordered from ikea and they used the…
articleText: I ordered from ikea and they used the most useless DPD delivery company. I was home and they kept claiming they missed me without even buzzing or calling me. Both Ikea and Dpd very useless

articleTitle: Thanks for the Hooks, but Where Are My Curtains?
articleText: I ordered curtains and hooks since they were available online. Two days later, IKEA decided to cancel part of my order—just the curtains, of course. So now I'm getting hooks with no curtains. Great job, IKEA!You’ve always rocked your offline service, but your online store? Total disaster. Maybe it's time to shut it down since matching your in-store service seems impossible for you.What am I supposed to do with just the hooks? Maybe I'll hang them up and imagine the curtains that you decided not to send. Thanks for that!
Quality furniture. Didn’t arrive at the time I was told it would though…

articleTitle: Click & Collect service not at all useful
articleText: I live outside of Winnipeg, and I order on line frequently for convenience. Ikea has a ‘click & collect” system since they don’t deliver rurally, I did not realize that I only had one day to pick up my merchandise. I don’t think this is a very convenient service. I have to coordinate any Ikea purchasing with a trip to Winnipeg rather than order and pick up at my leisure. I won’t be shopping at Ikea again. Other merchants are more easy to shop with online.FROM IKEA WEBSITE: Click and collectWith IKEA Click and collect, you’re in control. Place an order online when it’s convenient and choose when and where to collect it. You’ll still make a trip, but we’ll gather your items so that you have more time and energy for assembling instead. *** ‘choose WHEN…. To collect it. They have given me either Today or Tomorrow or they will cancel the order.

articleTitle: Visited for the first time in many years ....
articleText: For the first time in many years, I went to the Wednesbury branch a couple of times in the last week, to get ideas for a kitchen extension.1. Plenty of great ideas for kitchens, organising etc. Well thought out stuff.2. Their very short standard lengths of laminate worktops are well priced. The moment you go over the standard length by even a cm, as many people will as the standard lengths are so short, the price triples.3. The Kungsfors range of shelves, suspension rails and organisation is excellent and a huge centrepiece of Ikea kitchen organisation - but bizarrely, there's not a single example of the shelf system set up in any of their kitchens, or any demonstration of their versatility.4. Too many (all?) of their kitchens on display are completely without mock electricity sockets. It gives an unrealistic view of organising the worktop space and walls above it.5. I hated visiting Ikea in the past because once in, it is very difficult to leave - few exit signs, a long walk to get out. It's like a nightmare you struggle to wake up from. Their buildings always gives me a nauseating, sick feeling, very claustrophobic.6. If you try to order a lot of stuff online, you'll run into delivery and availability issues; some products will be available online but not in a store, and some available in a store but not online, and some will be available in one store but not another. But surely, all products should be available at all times online? Very difficult to order all the items you need without faffing about.7. The restaurant area was dirty on both visits. Too few (I didn't see any) staff clearing up and wiping down tables.8. The stuff I bought on the visits was all well made and complete!
Ordered online and picked up from my local Tesco.Saving me over 2 hrs of driving. Great option

Pathetic customer service; Very bad experience with Ikea Product and Customer Care Department. I was on the call with them more than 2 hours and every other department is transferring me another department for help. Nobody knows how to resolve the Customer query. If your Credit card is approved, you don't even receive a single email saying the "Congratulations, you are approved and you can generate your temporary credit card here". Order department can't place the order on your behalf with the credit card details on file. Credit Card Department don't even know how to generate the temporary credit card details for customer. Very very bad customer experience with Ikea.
Ikea NL... the worst delivery all around the world.  You pay an the "clever and smart" delivery company let it outside .Don't pay for this unprofessional  service !
They are terrible at delivery. Noone calls you for delivery. They called you we missed the delivery. They dont even ring your bell. They work with terrible delivery companies.
Despite recent change of the stratregy still the best furniture retail company.

articleTitle: We PAID for an order, that was NEVER delivered
articleText: We placed AND PAID for an order and asked them to deliver it. We agreed for our order to be delivered on 11/7/2024, today is 25/7/2024 and no order has arrived.We have been on calls everyday and they lie every single time but they were more than happy to take our 447€ in a blink of an eye.Do not buy anything from IKEA Ever again.
Good products good prices. Very convenient delivery and pickup. Nice driver.

articleTitle: How cheap does it have to be?
articleText: Had to wait 20 minutes for a staff member to scan every item we just scanned as a “ Tandom check procedure.

IKEA online returns and customer service is the worst I have ever experienced in my life and I am not young. I bought chair pads for my dining room set. My fault they were too small but returning them turned out to be a living hell! It was in no way straight forward. I had to purchase the label  myself and I chose USPS as it is what I use in my business. I followed their directions to send it to the closest store since we don't have a store in my city. Sent the return to Tempe AZ. Well nobody at the store would sign for the package so it sat collecting dust at USPS and there was no way for me to contact the actual store as they don't take phone calls! So I am stuck with these crap pads and out of my shipping money and the only way to talk to anyone at ikea is through a chat with people that live in another country that have no power or way to solve my problem whatsover so I am also out of all the time I wasted pretending I could get actual customer service! DON'T BUY ONLINE EVER!!

articleTitle: No items delivered, shocking customer service
articleText: I was supposed to receive a delivery today the 18th between 9am-1pm as stated in the message I received last Friday. At 12:25pm I phoned IKEA in Dublin to query where the delivery was as there wasn't any updates on my online account. I spoke to a man named John who apologised and assured me my delivery was 15 minutes delayed but I would receive it shortly. At 2:06pm I phoned back and was speaking to a different man who told me I probably wouldn't have my delivery today as it actually never even left the hub. So clearly John couldn't be bothered looking into this correctly and fobbed me off. I specifically booked a Sunday delivery to ensure I would be around to receive the order to which now was a complete waste of my day. They told me they could leave the delivery at the front of my house if I wasn't at home but seriously who would willing want to leave over €300 worth of goods out in plain sight for anyone to take. The 2nd man I spoke to told me I would receive an email confirming I would be compensated from IKEA if I didn't have my order by 7pm this evening and surprise surprise that's another lie as I still haven't received the official email. Absolutely shocking service considering they charge enough for delivery. What's the point in booking a specific day if they don't bother sticking to it...... ***UPDATE*** they have now locked me out of MY OWN ACCOUNT

If I could give Houston IKEA's delivery service with CRST NAL Group zero stars it would be less than that. I spent close to $3000 to have furniture shipped from Houston, Texas to Louisiana. It never arrived. I think there's a scam operation running from Houston. I waited 14 hours. I was given 4 time frames throughout the day. Constant no shows. I finally get a call from the delivery idiot at 8:23pm saying he would be there in 20 minutes. 20 minutes, no delivery. 9 pm, no delivery. I left my house at 9:15pm but my sister was still there. Mark, the delivery person, said he was there. I asked my sister if this was true. Nope. No delivery truck was there. If IKEA is going to offer delivery, at least get reputable people to do it. Houston IKEA contracted out a "delivery" service that delivers absolutely nothing except blatant lies. Houston IKEA and CRST NAL Group should be investigated. I wish I would have read the reviews before purchasing online. IKEA HAS NO IDEA HOW TO OPERATE THIS PART OF THEIR COMPANY. AND THE SAD PART IS THEY DO NOT CARE. One other reviewer mentioned a class action law suit. I'm ready to go. Houston IKEA is AWFUL. And if you see CRST NAL GROUP as the "delivery" company for anything, think twice. I'm pretty sure this company is just a company of scammers.

I did not suspect that IKEA, the huge company IKEA, would allow their customer service to be this horrible. I literally contacted them around 20 times. They delievered a closet system with two different sizes for the base and the doors.  I spent 200 building it until the builder noticed that it did not fit. I made a Request for a pickup. They had me waiting 2 weeks for the first "pickup". I missed the day from work waiting. Nothing. They kept telling me to wait. Until it was 7 pm and they said, sorry, something happened, theyre coming tomorrow, and then tomorrow, they never came. Same story. for 2 weeks. I called two to three times daily with their horrible waiting times. Each time they said something different but were consistently clueless about what the last person said. They said they would refund the product but did not. I tried talking to supervisors, but they said they were not allowed to talk to supervisors. Get this: they gave a FAKE email of a supervisor! It was so stressful!  I had to dispute the charge with my credit card! And afterward, guess what? They did come to pick up their items on a Sunday without letting me know!  I will never buy from them again. UNBELIEVABLE!!

articleTitle: The best to buy everything when your…
articleText: The best to buy everything when your girlfriend dumb to. No need to search anywhere alse. You can buy all in one shop

Ordered a kitchen and its installation in August this year. The quality is good and the montage team is professional and friendly. At least that’s what I can say based on a half assembled kitchen.On the other hand the delivery and IKEA support are just terrible. Delivery guys will look for any excuse to deliver everything only to the ground floor (I live on the 4th floor and IKEA support assured me that the delivery will be to the flat). Kitchen should have arrived in four parts. Two times the delivery team rejected bringing the packages to the 4th floor. First time I had to bring the heavy oven myself to my floor. Second time after a quick argument the guys just drove away together with the working tops and reported that I wasn’t at home when they arrived.As for IKEA support. The chat on the website is always “too busy, no one is available at the moment”. Every time you try a phone call, you have to wait for 20-30 minutes for their response (which also might end with a hang up).The montage team promised me that in a few days IKEA will contact me and they will finish the delivery and the installation. Two weeks have already passed and nothing happened. When I tried to call IKEA support. After another 20-30 minutes of waiting they said that they don’t have support for that question in English and suggested that I try my luck and go to their store: maybe there will be a person who will be able to help me. I’m sorry but that’s definitely not a service that costs more than €1600. And that’s definitely the first and the last time I buy at IKEA something that requires delivery.

articleTitle: I purchased an Order from Ikea…
articleText: I purchased an Order from Ikea Hammersmith branch on their assurance that all the items would be delivered to the third floor.Please note my purchases amounted to £ 1736.00 and I was assured that the delivery would be door to door.However, your Ikea Driver  failed to fulfil this service and dumped the 2  large packages containing the sofas, outside the building and left.I first received a call from the driver this morning informing  that he was at the premises and would need some one to come down and meet him.my builder who was working on my apartment met him. The driver then called me back to say he was unable to deliver the 2 sofas to my apartment door. I immediately called customer Services and spoke to Temilola , who was most helpful and spoke to the delivery transport department. She asked me if I would take full responsibility for any damage which might occur if they took it up to the third floor, to which I assured I would do so. She tried to contact the driver but was not able to speak to him . Eventually the driver informed my Builder that he would leave the packages outside the building and go off.I immediately went personally to the Hammersmith Branch and spoke to Tony the manager, who confirmed that all orders are door to door service.I told him that it cost me an additional £300.00 to pay for two people to carry the goods to the third floor.He said he would reimburse me if I would give him a VAT receipt from my builder. However my builder is not registered for VAT.Your delivery service has been absolutely shocking.

articleTitle: The worst customer service I have ever experienced
articleText: I placed an order with IKEA e-shop in Greece on 16 June 2024. I waited patiently for a month (!!!) because I didn't need the products urgently and I have better things to do with my time than complain to customer service.Then I got a notice that "my order has been completed". That was around 17 July. So I called IKEA, and the first representative I spoke with said he would look into it and get back to me. He never did. So I called again (waiting on hold for 10-15 minutes each time). The second rep said the same. Never got back to me. Then again, with a third rep. Then AGAIN, with a FOURTH rep. They STILL haven't got back to me, a month and a half after I placed my order!Meanwhile, I was beginning to need some of the products I had ordered, so I had to purchase from another site. I ordered on Wednesday 31 July and today, 2 August, the merchandise has already arrived.This is the SECOND time an IKEA order has been delayed. And most certainly, the LAST time I will ever order from IKEA.
On hold for 53 minutes! Ikea's idea of customer service!
waiting more than 30 minutes for someone to answer the phone. not acceptable!

I am reticent to write this review, because I genuinely think IKEA has some wonderful products and their showroom is amazing, but the customer service is dire.I had an issue a few years back regarding part delivery of a sofa. I took a day off for redelivery of the missing part but it still didn’t come. I then had to take another day off, go to a showroom and wait two hours whilst someone signed it off to get the final part of the sofa, that I had bought.The reason for this review is that I bought two wardrobes around six years ago. The wardrobes are great and have lasted, but the backs of the wardrobes haven’t survived my last move unfortunately. I went onto live chat during my lunch break to see if I could BUY (not blag for free) two new backs for the wardrobes and some nails. I am offering to buy something that they will have in every warehouse up and down the country.I was asked for an all the details of my original order, which I don’t have due it being six years ago. The advisor then said my purchase fell outside the guarantee and that he could not help. I re-emphasised that I do not want these items for free, I will pay for them (and delivery. And for the damn nails, of which they will have millions lying around) but he said they don’t do that.I was then told the only solution is to buy two new wardrobes (in order to get the two backs in need for the wardrobes I already have). Honestly, no word of a lie, that is the only solution offered.I just don’t understand, ikea has a wonderful concept and great buying experience but the customer service afterwards is awful. I’ve spent £,000’s with them over the years, even after my first issue, but now I won’t. I’ve literally got a list on my table (also from ikea) of 10 things I was planning to get from them for my upcoming move.A real let down and a shame.

articleTitle: Avoid IKEA for Kitchen Installation - A nightmare Experience!
articleText: I am incredibly disappointed with the kitchen purchasing and installation service I received from IKEA.The design service was great, and the staff were professional and helpful. However, that's where the positives end. The assigned kitchen installer, visited my home to inspect the site on and he didn't agree with the drawings. My kitchen was scheduled for delivery 8 weeks later, but the delivery was incomplete, and installation was delayed multiple times. I was left without a functional kitchen for five weeks – no running water, no sink, no basic kitchen facilities. It was an absolute nightmare, leaving me in a situation that no household should have to endure.Worse still, the responsibility for these delays was continually passed between IKEA and their installation team. IKEA blamed the installers, and the installers pointed the finger back at IKEA. The complete lack of coordination and accountability was frustrating, to say the least.Despite numerous calls to IKEA’s customer service, I was repeatedly given empty promises. I was assured that the issues would be resolved, but no one ever followed up. I spent weeks chasing answers on my own, and the level of customer service I experienced was far below what I would expect from a company like IKEA, especially after spending such a significant amount of money. After the installation was completed, I contacted IKEA to highlight the issues I had and once again I was completely ignored.This experience has been so negative that I would strongly advise anyone to avoid IKEA for kitchen installations. While the initial design process was great, everything that followed has been an utter disaster.IKEA needs to seriously improve its service, communication, and accountability. This ordeal has been stressful, inconvenient, and entirely unacceptable. Save yourself the frustration and look elsewhere for your kitchen needs.

I bought a dresser online 7/29/24 and it was delivered damaged so I called immediately and took pictures. We are now at 9/24/24, so right at 2 months and I am still dealing with trying to be refunded for this dresser. They give you the run around by taking the same information over and over on every call and then tell you it has to be escalated to a higher tier to approve a discount. It went weeks with no response to be told that they would only offer 35%. Even though i didn’t agree because i felt the damage and my time spent dealing with them warranted more than 35% I went ahead and accepted the offer which was sent to me via email. I called to confirm I would accept the discount and again all my info was taken again and I was told it would be 3-5 days and I would see the refund…. Well that didn’t happen. I got an email on 9/4/24 saying they couldn’t reach me by the number I gave them (untrue) because it’s the number I call from and verify everytime I call them. So I Made another call today and explained the entire story again to be put on hold for 20 min so Anupoim the person helping me could ask if the refund could be put on my debit card ( that was not what he was doing, I can assure you that) he comes back and and just says OK and I say ok what? What’s happening, because he never verified the card, never said when to expect the refund, and when I asked he said “you just wait” I had to ask how he was planning on refunding my money and when.  So I’ve been told again 3-5 business days.. I have no trust in this happening because it’s been 2 months of dealing with them and over 15 calls to them and nothing has happened at this point in time. They have awful customer service and follow through. I will never order online from them again because this is the run around you get if you receive an item that’s damaged. Then if you want to return it they want you to disassemble and put back in their boxes.. that’s a joke because it’s been 2 months those boxes long gone in the trash.  Not to mention my time to disassemble the product. IKEA does not value the customer experience nor do they want to really make it right for the customer, in fact they use every tactic to try not make it right by making the process as long and complicated as possible. BEWARE IKEA IS NOT ABOUT THE CUSTOMER!!!!!!

articleTitle: IKEA needs to stop using Top Delivery Service
articleText: Awful service with getting my IKEA kitchen delivery. I used IKEA to design and process my kitchen. Planned and paid for weeks ago for the kitchen to be delivered on September 19th 2024. Top Delivery Service didn’t show up. According to the email and text messages, TDS is supposed to ring you half an hour before they arrive, they never did. According to TDS track and trace, they were 1 stop away for more than an hour. Then suddenly 3 stops away. They were already extremely late according to their own delivery window. At this point I contacted TDS and they said that the truck had an issue and they won’t be able to deliver the kitchen, and that they have contacted IKEA and that IKEA will contact me to create a new appointment. TDS made no attempt to contact me. I only found this out by me contacting them. I had to call IKEA support the next day as it was already gone 18:00. Next morning I called IKEA support, they had no idea that there was an issue with my delivery. So TDS lied about contacting IKEA. IKEA support called TDS to find out where my kitchen was, and IKEA said that my kitchen was still in the truck, because the truck had an issue recharging. (Electric vehicle). I asked IKEA to ask TDS to send another truck to get my kitchen. (I had hired contractors to help me build the kitchen, taken time off work, and have no current working kitchen because it was supposed to arrive on the 19th.) IKEA said they will call me back in 30 mins to see what solution they can get me. 4 hours later I heard nothing from IKEA so I called them again. This time IKEA contacted TDS and said the truck was in an accident. And the truck won’t get fixed till next week. And the driver is refusing to allow another truck to collect my kitchen. IKEA said I will get compensation for each day the kitchen is delayed. I got a new order delivery date which is 24th September, as TDS couldn’t deliver on Monday and they wouldn’t know if the truck would be working. I also emailed TDS asking why a delivery company doesn’t have an extra truck to collect my kitchen from the broken truck. I have had zero response. On Monday (23rd September) I call IKEA to make sure that TDS is actually delivering on Tuesday (24th September). IKEA support couldn’t tell me because they had no way of contacting TDS. So, to recap. TDS truck ran out of electricity, also had an accident, IKEA can contact TDS and IKEA cannot contact TDS. Luckily I got a track and trace message on the Monday night saying my kitchen should arrive between 12:45 and 14:45 on Tuesday the 24th of September. It is now 00:27 Wednesday 25th of September and I still have not got my kitchen, and zero communication from TDS. I do not understand why IKEA keeps using this company to deliver its kitchens. This has been an awful, stressful and expensive experience. I will not be buying from IKEA again and I certainly hope TDS never delivers anything for me again.So now Top Delivery Service has failed to delivery my kitchen twice, with zero communication. I will have to call IKEA again…
