This has been a nightmare!I should have known when the order was placed and 6 out of the 9 doors needed were listed as “out of stock”. The customer service agent was very positive on that call. She stated that she was sure they would be back in stock on Monday (this was a Saturday) so we could place a second order for those on Monday to accompany this order. She was absolutely correct! They were back in stock……but then we have problem #2, delivery on those doors were no longer an option as it states the “truck was full”. After speaking with MANY customer service agents, was finally transferred to one who could resolve the issue and had the 6 remaining doors Fed Ex to my home to arrive the same day as the delivery of everything else on the 18th.Fast forward to the 18th…at this point, I have received several text messages confirming and appointing a time for delivery for this day from the delivery company. Original time is between 4p-8p. Then another text stating 7p-9p. At 9:25, an email arrive stating that the distance for delivery was too far for the delivery company and my order would have to be rescheduled. I called customer service and the gentleman confirmed my order would be delivered the next morning by 9am. At 9:30, no delivery received, so I once again call customer service. I spoke with another lady who states #1 it was not rescheduled for today, #2 the next available delivery date would be the 25th, #3 the delivery address was too far for the delivery company, #4 Fed Ex was not an option for these pieces, #5 a Supervisor has to be notified by an open case and will return your call. The agents cannot forward calls to Supervisors.#1- So I was lied to the night before?#2- The issues and concerns with why it hasn’t been delivered as of yet will not exist on the 25th for a delivery?#3- IKEA sent my order to a delivery company that cannot deliver to this address, but your agent would like to reschedule with the same delivery company?#4- She further stated Fed Ex does not deliver large items which I had to call her on as I told her we have had multiple large items delivered by them which is why Fed Ex utilizes large trucks.#5- You, as a customer, are not important enough to speak with Supervisors when your issues are not being resolved by customer service. You must be “scheduled” (as I was told she had me on the schedule to be called at 1pm).Very, very poor customer services! One of the solutions offered was for me, as the customer, to drive over an hour away to “pick up” my order, which would require a trailer rental, and they would “waive the pick up fee”. However, that also has to be scheduled on their timeframe. It was very easy to accept my order stating my address was acceptable, accept my money, but cannot deliver customer service or delivery of what was promised when my order and money was accepted.
Love the augmented reality feature, which provides an immersive shopping experience

I recently ordered and paid for a kitchen from IKEA to arrive on a set date.  The Friday before the delivery, I received a confusing email with both confirmation of the order, and a pdf of a refund for some of the amount paid.I checked my bank the next morning and a partial sum was there. Why? I called customer service any they said that no problem, the delivery was still planned, but then after checking to confirm, said ah yes, it had been cancelled, as IKEA had taken the decision to reimburse for the kitchen as some of the items were not available any more (although they had been when I paid for them). I'd also bought a bed ( needed for during the renovation), which had been voluntarily cancelled by IKEA too. However, it seems some €160 worth of spare pieces (batons for mounting dishwasher, carbon filters, decorative mouldings) are still arriving by post on Tuesday!This is just a mess, and a major inconvenience as the cost in time and money is considerable - we had also made travel arrangements to be there on site for Tuesday.  Needless to say we are furious at the lack of service and valid explanation for this failure to fulfill a completed order.. Noone bothered to let me know,  or check if we may need some of the other items on the order (bed?) before to taking the decision to cancel the order.Neglectful, soulless big business, and very far from 'The Wonderful Everyday'. Not feeling it from IKEA. Shameful.

articleText: I have never used worse products. Yes it is easy to setup and instructions are clear, but the products do not last a year before they are quite literal trash, ready to be thrown out. Due to high inflation in Turkey, the prices are also so high, they are basically a luxury brand here, and yet, the worst furniture company ever.

I have frequented Ikea, primarily in their physical store. Although I faced some issues in March with the product that required several interactions with customer service, I have generally found their service to be excellent.

I love the quality of food at IKEA, but the waiting time is often unacceptable! The service at the IKEA in Burlington, Canada, is simply terrible. Right now, I'm standing in line for breakfast, and there are about 50 people ahead of me! There is only one woman working at the counter, and no one is helping her. The process is going excruciatingly slow, even though IKEA offers the same breakfast for everyone, just two dishes!I've been standing here for 20 minutes and haven't even reached the middle of the line! And this happens all the time, at any time of day. There are no utensils available, and no one is bringing them. It's disgusting that such a wealthy company, making billions off of us, is cutting corners by not hiring enough staff!

articleTitle: So many products were sold out and not…
articleText: So many products were sold out and not in store. Went there for a specific pot for a plant but it was sold out. As I walked around the warehouse, it was evident that many products simply were not in store. I wasted time and money going.

articleTitle: IKEA’s customer service is a load of…
articleText: IKEA’s customer service is a load of crap! I placed an order for 2 children’s desks and was informed that the item was out of stock for in-store pickup, which is free of charge. Consequently, I had no choice but to opt for home delivery, incurring an additional fee of €60.To my dismay, shortly after my order was dispatched and the delivery fee was charged, I received an automated email notification indicating that the product was now back in stock for pickup. This timing seems highly suspicious and gives the impression that the item was deliberately restocked only after my order was processed, forcing me to incur unnecessary delivery costs.I have tried to address this issue via email but have yet to receive a response from your team. This lack of communication and resolution is unacceptable and does not reflect the level of customer service I expected from IKEA.

articleTitle: Kitchen was supposed to be delivered…
articleText: Kitchen was supposed to be delivered today, got an email this morning saying delivery changed to next week... I rang Ikea before placing the order and explained I had tenants due to move in amd they assured me it would be delivered as I had a delivery slot.. I had a kitchen fitter organised to fit the kitchen this weekend, the kitchen fitter is going on holidays on tuesday for 4 weeks and is fully booked for the next 6 months so now i have to cancel my new tenants until I get it sorted and loosing out on 1250 monthly in rent.  Going to publish this all over social media,newspapers and the radio station.

articleTitle: Just popped in to return some patio…
articleText: Just popped in to return some patio cushions… almost 1 hour wait and still not at the front of the line … two people working one has been with the same person the entire time . In my opinion not just customer service but products and quality and prices are going down… sadly

articleTitle: Never order anything from IKEA online
articleText: Never order anything from IKEA online . I ordered items online and was supposed to get them delivered on Sunday and on Sunday they delivered me all wrong items . I rang IKEA and had to hold on the line for over 30 mins before a representative spoke to me , she said that she couldn’t find my eircode and asked me for another one near my house JUST FOR REFERENCE, she ASSURED me that the items will still be delivered to MY HOUSE even though she took the other eircode for reference , she also said that they will deliver my correct items and pick up the wrong ones on TUESDAY. When Monday came around I got a notification that my items won’t be delivered till THURSDAY now . Thursday comes around they end up delivering  my items to the WRONG house to that eircode that she said is only for reference even though she assured me several times that I will still get them delivered to my house . The delivery guys not only delivered my items to wrong house but also didn’t pick up the wrong items. I had to ring them and complain for them to turn back around and come to collect the wrong items . And once they arrived I showed them the email reference with my address and told them they delivered to the wrong house , and one of the delivery drivers went on to argue with me and was very very rude even though I’m the customer who was actually wronged by their company several times . It wasn’t my fault that they label the items wrong or deliver to wrong addresses . This was my first time ordering and never again . That delivery driver should have at least apologized to me for all this inconvenience that I had to deal with for no reason but he went on to argue with me , blame me for everything even though it’s there company fault he was so rude to me slamming the doors of their van and sticking the invoice into my face trying to prove me wrong he was so busy trying to argue with me he didn’t even help the other driver with the boxes he had to carry all on his own . And now I’ve to go and pick my items up from a wrong house after I’ve also paid a €60 delivery charge !!!!

I went to order garderobkast.. With Ikea opening at 10am comes a smiling pleasant man.. Though busy on phone attending another client, signed us to excuse him. The moment he finished with a client on phone attended to us whole heartdly.. Giving all options to build our garderob... HIS NAME IS CARRY... GO TO CARRY IF YOU WANT A GARDEROBE.. HE IS AN ASSET FOR IKEA.. CHEERS CARRY!!!!?, 👏👏👏

In 1996 we ordered an IKEA kitchen, some items came, some came late. Some we had to go and buy. Bad service, but long ago, water under the bridge. But now, after 28 years of use,  the kitchen looks shabby. Need new doors, side panels, drawer fronts. So today we drove to IKEA, four hour round trip. We had to go there in person as IKEA no longer produce catalogues and paper documentation and the IKEA website is useless. So what did we find ? Panels, doors etc still sold but hinges won't match our old base units. Means ripping out complete kitchen and buying all new units. Makes a mockery of a huge IKEA poster near the door urging people to renovate. And as said, no leaflets with specs available. Would have helped as I still have the complete paper documents from my original order. Spent three hours there looking for replacements we could use and gave up. Will hire a local painter to sand and repaint units. Good guy, used him for thirty years. Ikea's loss, but after seeing the staff I don't think they care. It's just a job.

Extremely poor packing and delivery, half the items had some issue, scuff marks or damaged corners. Mirrors were broken and IKEA refused to collect. The amount of waste they produce must be in millions of tons. Customer service is trained to offer discounts which is basically selling a damaged item at 30% discount to a customer who ordered new items.

articleTitle: I WONDER IF THEY REALLY WANT TO SELL ANYTHING
articleText: I wanted to buy cotton sheets to go with my Ikea bed.  There are no delivery options despite me living only a few miles from store.  Nearest collection option is about 40 minutes drive away.  It also won't let me log into my account or start a new one.  At this point I gave up.

Waiting 6 days on an order. Delivery agents DPD issued an email to me at 1848hrs advising I wasn't in. Oh yes I was.....I've been in ALL day DPD !!! My projected delivery slot was 1840-1940hrs.My intercom buzzer rang at 1900hrs and the "gentleman" advised I had a delivery....email must have been a mistake I thought ??!! Lo and behold when I went downstairs to assist, the delivery driver, Marek, had disappeared off the face of the earth. No sign of him anywhere !!!!I called IKEA call centre who were as useful as a chocolate fireguard. I was, and remain, absolutely furious. I requested cancellation of my order, given that I had waited 6 days for a suitable delivery date around my working hours but was expected to wait in for another delivery attempt tomorrow....eh, no thanks DPD 🙂 IKEA call advisor informed me a supervisor would not call me for such a matter as I had requested. Stated the complaint process had been followed, they had processed a full refund on my behalf.....yes, only because I requested the refund.IKEA, I will NEVER, EVER, EVER, order from your company online or visit any of your stores to purchase anything, ever again. This behaviour from your delivery agent's driver has disgusted me immensley. Yes, its Saturday. Yes, it's 7pm. But do know what IKEA & DPD, you's should ensure that all individuals taking on roles as delivery drivers for your companies are aware that they are THE true representatives of your companies. I wonder how many  of the Marek's in this world have lost companies good business and given some such a bad name. Marek surely knew that his role with DPD included Saturday working at 7pm and IKEA, you's probably chose DPD as your Agent thinking that their drivers would be honest, efficient and reliable. Not the case.

I had a Bestå TV cabinet delivered. Nearly £200 is not big money for a piece of furniture but it replaced an excellent Ikea TV bench that was only £80, albeit 10 years ago.It arrived in two boxes, including one huge box, opened with the shelves and other items just tossed in. All 4 shelves had chipped corners. I only noticed 2 were chipped before contacting them for replacements unfortunately. No account or phone options so spent nearly 1 hour online waiting for someone to answer (you can return from your account but once you get through the process, right at the end you’re told to contact customer service. Terrible customer experience!)Onto the unit. It’s cheap, featherweight chipboard of the poorest quality, unbelievably soft and shows any marks - in fact it’s almost impossible not to damage when assembling with the baffling instructions (one of the problems of the modular design - the instructions come with each individual item and parts that don’t apply - and the instructions for the hinges are on the plastic packaging and barely readable.)The whole unit is so cheap and flimsy, with plastic fasteners, and cheap wood that it’s not even square. The hinges are adjustable and you will need that adjustment as it’s simply not possible to get the middle and the outer vertical edges of the doors square. It’s something I’d expect from a no name cheap discount store for £50, not from a global branded product nearly four times that price!They did send 2 new doors free of charge that were thankfully not damaged in transit - more luck than design as the packaging was again poor.The icing on the cake was deleting my review on their website. There are some negative reviews but I wouldn’t trust what’s written as there are a lot of similar glowing reviews that look suspiciously like bots.If you like reasonably priced decent quality products - shop elsewhere.

Poor delivery and customer service. Very unprofessional of a reputed company like IKEA partnering with another unprofessional delivery service like RXO to cause mental distress and loss of time and money to customers. I wish i could give no stars . I dont think i will be ordering from IKEA anymore till they improve delivery service as their commitment to customers is not upto mark . As nuch as possible i will also be discouraging other customers order from Ikea. Not worth the money spent.

articleTitle: VERY VERY VERY BAD DELIVERY SERVICE
articleText: If possible i would have given less < 0 for ikea on their delivery service partner. It is very frustrating and shocking to see that Ikea and its delivery partner can be so callous about their customers and their delivery issues. We had ordered all important products like bed, mattress and couch and etc for setting up a new apartment. Scheduled a delivery date. We flew in(expensive plane tickets)  from out of state so that we could be here to accept the delivery on time. also reserved the loading dock and elevator since we were given a time from 8 am to 8 pm for delivery and what happens on the scheduled day of delivery, the delivery service never gets in touch with us and when we call to find out about the estimated time frame of delivery, they tell us that there is no driver to deliver. When contacted IKea is unable to help other than reschedule the date of delivery, As if IKEA is going to pay for our flight tickets if we reschedule. Is this the kind of service that we all should be expecting from a reputed company like IKEA. They would not even let us cancel the order. The delivery service RXO that is partnered with IKEA does not have good reviews. Despite this IKEA is still partnering with them and putting their customers through distress. How is IKEA and RXO going to compensate for our wasted time, money and the emotional stress caused.

I ordered 1200$ of stuff from them and paid the 40$ delivery fee. When the stuff arrived and was unloaded the delivery driver that was hired by Ikea ran over my gate and caused 1800$ of damage. Reached out to ikea and they said there was nothing they could do about the situation. Reached out to Actcess Service llc wich was the name of the delivery company and was told it wasn't covered under there insurance. Now no one want to take responsibility of fixing the gate. This is ridiculous and I will no longer do business with ikea. If there was a no star option that is what they are worth both company's. Only thing ikea wanted to do is pay the 40$ delivery fee back. What a crock.

Bought a Köldgrader fridge/freezer combination through Ikea. I already had my reservations about Ikea equipment, but the price (€1,000) suggests that it should provide a little bit of quality. Not. After three years it was already done because the coolant was leaking from all sides (see photo). Thanks to Ikea's warranty (5 years), we now get a new one. This fridge/freezer combination is made by Electrolux, and hopefully they have solved this cocktail of weaknesses in a revised version. But I hold my breath. See photo, about all connections are leaking. And we've had a kitchen for three years where this leaked coolant was hanging in the air, which is also not a pleasant thought.

Shocking delivery service.They took the lighter items to the room as requested on the delivery and left the heavy ones downstairs.Single woman I cannot lift them where they need to be. Customer services said nothing they can do. I asked them to collect as they are useless to me as they are. They told me it would cost me £25 to collect. Really appalled.

articleTitle: Shopping online with IKEA really is a…
articleText: Shopping online with IKEA really is a pointless experience. I found a few items that I liked and according to their website the item's were available for delivery to my postcode so I added them to my basket. Clicked the button to check out and suddenly half my item's are now not available for delivery to my post code. I opened a new tab on my laptop just to double check, I went back on IKEA's website, found what I wanted again, it was available for delivery to my post code, so I added them to my basket once again, clicked check out and once again suddenly they're not available for shipping to my post code. So their website is extremely unreliable! Staff at their Croydon branch couldn't be anymore belligerent and unpleasant either!

articleTitle: I was missing a part of a king size base…
articleText: I was missing a part of a king size base. I phoned and explained my problem. The lady said I could collect the missing item in IKEA Dublin. When a I got Dublin (an hour and a half journey) the lady at customer service desk said there was no record of my phone call and the product was out of stock.The lady Simona did her very best to find a spare in the back room. She eventually she got it for me. She was so helpful and kind. 5 stars for her. I am now down the cost of petrol and tolls due to a mistake on Ikea's part.

articleTitle: some randomer named simon right who…
articleText: some randomer named simon right who worked there had some bad attitude right and when i went to swap something at the restauramt he was like ExCuSe mE in like a really rude tone and i felt really disgusted like someone really should fire him

Absolute joke of a returns, such a long wait! Then given a voucher that didn’t work, to then cue up and wait again. Now the lady had to go to other till to void it off and come back. Shambles of a system!

articleTitle: If I could give them 0 I would
articleText: If I could give them 0 I would! The stress of trying to get hold of the items you’ve ordered and PAID FOR is not worth it even for the reasonable IKEA prices!  I am not one to bother with reviews as it takes a lot for me to complain but the IKEA delivery service is so diabolical I want to save others from the stress - shop somewhere else!

articleTitle: Ikea.bg.Especially poor service and a number of…
articleText: Especially poor service and a number of ikea people unwilling to solve, help assembly at Ikea.BG

Worst customer service ever I have a refund case and asked to speak to a manager regarding an agent mistake. No one called me for 2days and the end of it they said no one free to call you and assign me a day for pick up without asking me first . Zero rated is too much for them

articleTitle: I grew up with Ikea and was a fan
articleText: I grew up with Ikea and was a fan. But how things are handled now is unacceptable. This company has gone down hill terribly. I was purchasing two bathroom vanities from Ikea and needed matching sinks. Before placing my order I called to make sure that the sink I chose would actually fit this particular vanity. It was confirmed to me that it would. In the middle of the remodel when every hour counts, we had to find out that both sinks were 2 inches shorter than the vanity, I called again and the lady from customer service was still insisting that it was the right sink!!!! I was losing my mind. Then she suggested that I would get a consultation with a specialist and made me an appointment for a kitchen consulation insisting that this person also does bathrooms. Of course that was wrong. When I finally had a consulation with the bathroom design agent, it was just as useless as the last. We had to figure out which sink ourselves. But then when I spoke with resolution to organize a new delivery and pick up of the wrong sink, I was promised that it would all be taken care of the next day. We were on a time line, so I thought one more day would be ok. I had it in writing, pick up of the 2 sinks that didn't fit and drop off of the two sinks that would fit. It said from 8am till 8pm. The 2 wrong sinks were picked up, guy didn't speak english. So at 8pm after waiting all day I had to call again. Then I was told that there was not going to be a delivery. Not only was I promised over the phone but i had it in writing. If they screwed up, they could have called, emailed or texted. Nothing!!!I am furious!! Every single step that Ikea assisted me with was horrible. Every single employee that I spoke with was incapable. This will be the down fall of a once great company. Sad, so sad...

articleTitle: I am deeply disappointed with my recent…
articleText: I am deeply disappointed with my recent experience with IKEA. Despite having paid for a Saturday delivery, my product was not delivered as promised. This caused significant inconvenience as I had arranged for someone to help me install a wardrobe over the weekend.The delivery was rescheduled to Sunday without any prior consultation. However, to my dismay, it was once again postponed to another day. This lack of reliability and disregard for the customer’s time is unacceptable.Furthermore, I found IKEA’s customer service to be extremely unsatisfactory. It appears that there is a lack of concern for the customers and their needs. This experience has left me with a negative impression of IKEA as a company.I strongly advise potential customers to consider these issues before deciding to purchase from IKEA.

I furnished a whole flat in IKEA furniture in 1992 with great furniture.. in fact, sitting on one of the dining chairs now.  So when IKEA Exeter managed to deliver a carpet instead of the ordered mattress to my wife's elderly mother I came on to TrustPilot expecting to be a lonely dissatisfied voice.  (Perhaps, Swedes sleep on the floor!!) Instead, it appears we are just adding to a long list of complaints.  How sad to see a company like yours lose the ability to live up to its promises, and cause my wife's mother such anguish.
You shouldn't offer the service if you can't fulfill your promises. Just leaving Tescos carpark as I've sat here over an hour.

Ordered online for next day delivery of a chair only to wait most of the day until 2pm to see my order had been randomly cancelled in an email. Trying to contact anyone to figure out what actually happened is useless. I have been in the chat queue for over 30 mins with no response.

articleTitle: I’ve had the worst experience with IKEA customer services
articleText: Had a kitchen from Ikea they started insulation on the 6th of May and told me this would only take one week, I’ve been left six weeks with half a kitchen, electrics wires hanging from the walls, plugs missing, only been able to use the sink and the air fryer on the 29th of May install washing machine then the kitchen fitters left without doing any other work, i’ve had no contact from IKEA at all, I’ve had to call every single day sometimes twice a day, all I’m told is that it’s been logged and somebody is dealing with this, you will get a call back ,kitchen Fitter taken on the job is now too busy to come back and finish my job, has anybody had the same issues? Can advise on what to do next?

I’m so angry. Placed a very large order on bedroom wardrobes. Requested 1/6 delivery unfortunately hadn’t noticed the lady in the store put the wrong date of 30/5. Got a text on 30/5 saying it was about to be delivered. Phoned and explained situation and changed delivery to 1/6. Got NO confirmation email so called again to be told all slots for 1/6 were gone so arranged delivery 2/6. Called 2/6 as hadn’t received a confirmation text of the time to be told it wasn’t on the delivery van despite being promised it’d be delivered. Rearranged delivery again for 5/6 and requested pm. Got an email day before saying it’d be between 7am & 11am. Called again and explain why it had to be pm but it absolutely had to be delivered on 5th as rearranged builder that construct. Was promised delivery on 5/6. Called on 5/6 to check it’d all be ok as had no faith whatsoever. Was absolutely promised delivery by 11.30am. And guess what it never came!! Builder now not available for weeks, massively out of pocket and still no goods. Would never place a big order again. How can a company this big be unable to deliver!  Have been given compensation but this doesn’t cover the costs we’ve incurred and time wasted. Furious and frustrated.

We have been regular customers for years and have spent plenty there. Two and a half years ago we bought a boxspring bed complete with a mattress and top mattress. The assistant told us that there was a 10 year guarantee on everything. Two and a half years later, the topper was not useable any longer. It was lumpy, flat and painful to lay on. I contacted Ikea and was told that the top mattress only had a two year guarantee so there was nothing they could do to help. The topper was one of the most expensive ones in the store so we expected more than two years use. I was not happy with the online chat so called the customer service dept. The lady on the phone was very rude and unhelpful. We were lied to and had to buy a new topper. Needless to say, we didn't buy it at Ikea. The customer service used to be good. When did Ikea stop caring ?

articleTitle: Keep all your tracking numbers etc
articleText: Ordered out door furniture in early May. Delivered as planned, but part of the order was missing. IKEA informed and missing part sent out. This was the wrong part, so returned. Numerous contact by phone and web chat, but as of 4th June still no part, despite promises of delivery on the 28th May. Most recent conversation was for delivery on the 6th June. All the agents are very helpful, but it’s the behind the scenes part that appears to not know what’s happening. We have been offered some sort of goodwill gesture, which is good, but it really is a poor reflection on IKEA, that this level of disorganisation exists in IKEA. Today is the 7th June, and still we have no delivery. I have spent more time than I care to think chasing this order. IKEA are simply useless, and to be avoided at all costs. One star is being generous. I also requested a call back from a supervisor and to date still awaiting that. You can see the level of dissatisfaction in the reviews, so use your feet, and take your business elsewhere. The cheaper option often ends up being the dear one.
Great experience after I found out the closets I had bought were damaged. Thanks!

Spent more then 4000 € in closets, apliied in a new house, and before beeing used and after few time, the shelves are bulging in the center by 5 to 10 mm. IKEA declines any responsability saying that the problem is with the poorly nailed back card...
Ikea is a good store . You can find everything you want there , they also have a restaurant there with very good food

articleTitle: IKEA 10 year sofa guarantee is usel.ess
articleText: Bought a 3 seater sofa with 10 year guarantee. After 7 years covers are looking shabby and cushion pads have squashed so that covers look too big. Spoke with IKEA and they said it is covered for "domestic" use only, just my 73 year old husband sits on it, is that not domestic use? Also said it is not covered for "wear and tear". Not sure what it is covered for then.

articleTitle: Bad service and delays dealing with my…
articleText: Bad service and delays dealing with my case. Purchased a sofa in Sept 21, sofa was faulty, poor craftmanship and materials. Ikea sent their not very impartial sofa agent to inspect, who found sofa to be faulty. Ikea acknowledged faults/failings. But it has taken them almost two years now and still there is no replacement sofa, the price of the sofa has gone up from 669.00 in 2021 to 930.00 now. So for almost two years they have provided regular excuses on sofa unavailable, or out of stock or something similar. Now they are threatening me with closing my case - Enrika has decided, unilaterally, like some fascist state that Ikea  can decided when they have had enough of customers who have been failed by Ikea. Work that out. Dreadful service, products and experience. I note from other online reviews  that Ikea has been providing awful service and care to thousands of others.

Bought boxed states with lids. Waited in another queue as supervisor said till was closing. Stood chatting three of them for a good five minutes massive queues then decided to open it again.Paid for boxes and wad charged separately  for lids.Cashier not bothered. Customer service agreed wording was wrong and misleading said previous  customers had complained but basically didn't give a toss. The boxes were to add insult to injury stacked in the wrong place with a cheaper price. Went for a coffee in the restaurant that was nearly  as rancid as the woman who served us.What a poor and disappointing experience as it always is. IKEA never take feedback and do anything with it as if they did it would improve. I remember whennit first opened and service was excellent obviously profits are up complacency has set in.

articleTitle: Jack at valley park was so so helpful…
articleText: Jack at valley park was so so helpful to me and my husband. He helped us find the wardrobe items we needed, even when they weren’t they he  got them for us. So helpful, polite and nice.

articleTitle: Poorly organised and lack of customer care
articleText: Went to the Milton Keynes branch. After an hour long journey we decided to get some food in the cafe. After queuing for half an hour we finally got served.  By the impression we got, the serving staff clearly don't like their jobs.  We then had to queue for another ten minutes to pay!  By the time we got back to our table the food was stone cold, to cap it all the 'fish' and chips tasted like pollock coated in plastic. There were no members of staff to take this issue up with and upon ringing their customer service I've been told to go all the way back to Milton Keynes to complain!  Poorly organised and don't give a stuff about their customers, only how much money they make!

No delivery attempts made on the scheduled dates and no communication from the company. Have had to reschedule three times with customer service now, not a single delivery attempt has been made. Maybe this Friday will be third time lucky? Absolute shambles, no updates or communication and the DX tracking number is not recognised. DX customer service is appalling, can't get any answers from them so I don't know where the furniture is.

The worst experience.. First they didn't send one of the wardrobe' s doors. They lied about reporting the missing, never was reported. After a week the normal fighting call asking for the door, after 1 hour, showing evidences the decided to send it. When I ask for hinges they said they’re not included (???), after 30 min more I decided to repay fir the hinges. They supposed to send the missing door today. The driver decided it’s to far away and he never came, not answering his phone. Again to square one.. A fricking hell purchasing online from Ikea. Never more!!!
Absolutely horrific kitchen service (custom worktop cut incorrectly and it took countless emails and calls over 3 months to get them to send a new one). Avoid like the plague

It's just a Thank you to a young man by the name of Noah that served us in IKEA today on the customer service desk.Very well mannered and polite.He showed me how to use the buy back estimater on my phone but then to my surprise explained that I was entitled to a full refund as the furniture I was returning was in perfect condition and a recent purchase.I still had the receipt.I knew I could return furniture to ikea but I didn't realise I could return it after it was built.I was so happyThank You Noah

articleTitle: The worst experience ever at Leeds it…
articleText: The worst experience ever at customer services Leeds it was like waiting in a doctors surgery nothing was happening and the queues were growing. Just a nightmare

This chair is a highly regrettable purchase!! The customer service people seem to be trained, not in conflict resolution, but rather in creating arguments and being inflammatory. The advert for this chair should simply say that, no matter how you adjust the tilt or tension, it will always thrust you forward into an uncomfortable upright position. I have only ever had office chairs in the past, which I can tilt back and relax in, but this horrible chair keeps thrusting me forward and I feel completely deceived and misled by the advert. I will not be shopping with IKEA again but I will return to my beloved and trustworthy Wayfair, who have far more honest advertising and friendly staff. IKEA want to charge me 25 pounds to return this chair and I highly recommend anybody reading this review to shop elsewhere because these people do not care about or respect you as a customer.

I am unbelievably angry and upset with the quality and care of some of the people working at IKEA.I am heavily pregnant, I also have a toddler with me in a pushchair, and I asked two different members of staff to see if they could help me carry a box out to my car, which was in the loading bay.I was told no, if your car isn't directly outside, we're not insured, and we can't help you.I don't understand where the wires kept getting crossed but I said my car is directly outside, I said you can clearly see I'm heavily pregnant and have got a toddler with me in a pushchair, can you just help me carry it to the car please.Both members of staff (WOMEN) as well! Basically, just said no, nothing we can do about it, sorry.The humanity care and compassion just isn't there. I was so upset,I will be taking this matter further because they can't treat customer never mind human beingslike that it's absolutely appalling.I even told them a third time my car is in the loading bay I don't understand why you can't help me carry this box out, there reply was we can give you a trolley, even though I had a toddler and a pusher with me.Not one other person offered me any help. I had to ask a passerbyer.I can't even express my anger because the review would probably get taken down!
Bought some hat racks, perfect as described and delivered on time.

So, I had a schedule for furniture assembly for today between 14:00 and 21:00; had a lot of furniture, so I knew that work will require some hours. Until 19:20 noone came, so I contacted customer support to understand what happened. Customer support confirmed that service will be provided in time. Of course, noone called and noone came until 21:00.Really dissapointed both with customer support and with the people responsible of service delivery.

articleTitle: Terrible experience, our money were stolen!
articleText: Really a bad experience with product and customer service. We sent back a closet that was not working good as the structure was not strong enough for the doors. We purchased the structure online but we had to go to Amsterdam to buy the doors. We shared the ticket of what we bought with the delivery (delivery costs included) and the one of the doors. We also shared the proof of payment of each purchasing. At the end they just decided what they wanted to give us back, regardless of all the proves we provided and kept for them almost 100 euro.. and last but not least they don't even let us leave the review in their website.

I bought 3 Pax wardrobes (including transport and assembly) online, the order was carried out by the Warsaw Janki store. One of the wardrobes was damaged, but the complaint was quickly resolved. IKEA employees came to assemble it.Part of the assembly process involves attaching the wardrobe to the wall with dowels. The gentleman took a large drill with a large drill bit and smashed it into the wall, drilling through the wall to such an extent that a piece of several centimeters flew a distance of a meter in the next room. The pieces fell onto the office chair and, as it turned out, scratched the leather-like material. When I realized this, I informed the employee about the fact, who calmly replied "happens" and continued working. After a while, he said it was my fault, because I should have informed him that the wall was thin, because he thought it was wall between apartments. I will add that  he could easily enter the next room, and there is no door yet, so he could measure the wall withaout any issue.In the end, he behaved no better - he stood with his back to me and said 'I'm sorry for damaging the wall'. He wrote in the report that the wall was damaged, but the chair was not. I don't know on what basis they stated this. When they left, the chair was covered in shrapnel. I refused to sign the protocol with the content they proposed.Of course, I filed a complaint about the service, expecting the wall to be repaired and monetary compensation for the damage to the chair. Ikea wrote back to me that they were sorry about the situation, but they were unable to help me because, quoting Ikea's letter, "IKEA does not provide renovation and construction services" and "The verification of the case and the entry in the protocol after installation showed that the swivel chair was not damaged. Only a wall." Of course, they are very sorry "Please accept our apologies for any inconvenience you have experienced.". My first and last purchases at IKEA. I decorated the entire apartment, bought furniture from various companies, but I am still shocked at behaviour of Ikea. Shame on you.

Ikea management, have an educational conversation with your subordinates. Explain to them that whistling in the workplace is not acceptable and it annoys customers. It just puts you off to come to Ikea and buy anything there. Whistling - is unacceptable and does not reflect basic work ethics. Bring this fact to the attention of your staff.I returned my entire order, including furniture, because the employee was whistling non-stop.

articleTitle: my experience with IKEA has been an  ONGOING NIGHTMARE SINCE APRIL!!!
articleText: My experience with IKEA has been an absolute nightmare since April 18 2024, It is now May 23 2024!!!!We purchased two nightstands & had Taskrabbit come to put them together. One of the nightstands was defective so IT COULD NOT EVER BE PUT TOGETHER!!!  . Although IKEA replaced it, THEY WILL NOT REFUND THE MONEY THAT WE PAID TO TASKRABBIT IN ADVANCE TO PUT THE NIGHTSTAND TOGETHER, BUT NEVER GOT PUT TOGETHER. Instead they  offered a gift card which we immediately declined… THEY SENT IT ANYWAY!!! … we told them day one we wanted The money refunded to our credit card since it’s IKEA fault the item could not be put together .NOTE: The refund we requested is only a $36 refund to our credit card. They refused not once but 7  different times with  7 different reps (one  woman getting nasty telling us we got a gift card what more do we want??) She couldn’t Understand my point was THAT I DID NOT WANT THE GIFT CARD… ????So we drove 40 miles to the store, & spoke to a SO-CALLED Supervisor named WENDY & after 40 minutes she told us she was changing the gift card over to a refund   on our credit card,  we just had to wait  2 wks  for it to go thru. We requested a copy in writing of this, but She said there was nothing she could give us & we just had to be patient. We left the store knowing deep down in our gut we would be back! ! Well we waited the 2 weeks & as we suspected we  received nothing again! so I called Corperate & Corperate informed me that No one in the store , Including Wendy the supervisor ,has the ability to give $$$ back on a credit card? !!! The only thing that they are at liberty to do is give out a gift card , PERIOD!!!! So back again, we drove 40 miles to IKEA this time to speak with an on duty manager named Jesse, who said he’d be off the next day but would PERSONALLY see to  it that something got done &  that we’d get a  call. He took our personal info &  phone number & said he would follow up &   himself. ,&  AGAIN WE GOT NOTHING!!!So to wrap up …EVERY SINGLE PERSON WE HAVE DEALT WITH EITHER ON THE PHONE (telling me a supervisor would call me back & then didn’t) & IN PERSON  HAS BLATANTLY LIED!!! Both Representatives  &  supervisors . To me that says the company itself is telling them to do this!!! How can it be every single employee  is the same way???? This  must  be policy… “ LIE TO THE CUSTOMER AGAIN & AGAIN, THEY WILL GET TIRED & FRUSTRATED, & THEY WILL GO AWAY!!!”ABSOLUTELY HORRIFIC, UNPROFESSIONAL OUTRAGEOUS. DISGUSTING BEHAVIOR.!!!So sad! This company clearly  has no honor , no character & no self value that they think nothing of lying to your face like they do!I would NEVER recommend this company to anyone due to this & I would NEVER recommend their products to anyone since they don’t feel they have any responsibility in returning your money when their sub-par products cannot be put together! They obviously think people have plenty of time on their hands to sit around  & wait for somebody to TRY TO put something together FOR HOURS, THEN HAVE TO WAIT FOR A NEW ITEM TO BE DELIVERED, THEN HAVE TO WAIT AGAIN FOR THE SAME PRODUCT THEY GOT THE FIRST TIME TO BE PUT TOGETHER ALL OVER AGAIN, & HAVE TO PAY FOR IT NOT ONCE BUT 2X   AS WELL!!!I am seriously considering small claims court if this review does not end with a $36 refund on our credit card!. And if I do, I will be filing for not just the  the $36 Lost to taskrabbit, but also The return of both night tables .($357) I still have in my possession & THAT I WILL GLADLY RETURN . court fees,($30,) the 3 hrs  of time  I spent back-n-forth to IKEA ($225) ), plus  whatever amount of hours I’m not working & sitting in a courtroom because of this. I get paid $75 an hour , so  if court takes 3hrs wait time, IKEA would possibly be looking at a minimum bill of  $836 bill when all they had to do is put  $36 back to my fathers card!!! Does this make sense to anyone? ,ANYONE??, BUELLER ??? BUELLER????#UTTERLYRIDICULOUS

articleTitle: Purchased and paid for book cabinets…
articleText: Purchased and paid for book cabinets but did not receive the full order, When I contacted IKEA they told me I passed the 7-day missing items policy. They refuse to send me the missing product. I tried everything but they will not fix their mistake. IKEA is like computers, when they work good they are good, but when IKEA screws up, YOU pay the price. You know what, there are many companies out there that will give you good service. I say, stay away from IKEA. Don't chance it.

Ikea BurbankMember number 6275980387768338193,3 years ago I bought what was supposed to be high quality kitchen units with 25 year warranty, now the base corner unit double door hinge was ripped from the side wall attachment due to the base unit is made from chip wood which is not strong enough to withstand the weight of the double door.complaints to customer service lasted several weeks as they kept asking over and over again for photos of the damage although they sent every time.Eventually they send me a replacement base corner unit which is no good to me as I have to get the counter top and most of the kitchen units removed to replace the base corner unit. It needs a repair scheme  but they said they do not do repairs although they have subcontractors who could easily do the job.I had to pay $150 to get it repaired. The kitchen unit cabinets are of inferior quality and not worth the money. You can get cabinets made from plywood which are less than half the price and much stronger.The 25 year warranty is not worth the paper it is written on. I would never buy any furniture from Ikea again. Just to note that the price of the units now are 50% more than what I paid then!Mike Mossess

IKEA BLETCHLEY, zero stars if i could, used the Bletchley store to design PAX wardrobes in the master bedroom in a recently purchased property. the property had just been recently renovated.the final design was ordered and paid for and a week to be delivered. loads and loads of boxes arrived and TaskRabbit were booked to erect and install the wardrobes at a cost of £420! on the day of the install i dismantled the bed and some units and moved them into the en-suite so that they had enough space to erect the 2 corner Wardrobes and chest of drawers. 5 hours later and all was complete and fixed into position by screwing into the external blockwork.i check through the install and all looked good and worked as expected, it was a nice snug fit so the measuring had been done correctly...Once the installer had left i proceeded to re-erect the bed and slid that into position between the two wardrobes.. this is were it all starts going wrong!!with the bed in position the wardrobe doors will not open! with the corner wardrobe you have to fully open door no1 by at least 110 degrees to be able to open the door no2, but as the bed was next to the wardrobe you could only open door no1 by 90degrees which didnt allow enough room to be able to open door no2, so now the wardrobe is effectively useless as i cant even open the doors.Back to IKEA design department to see what they can do! and after scratching his head for 10 minutes the only solution was to apologise and tell me to go to the customer care dept and request a refund.so feeling a bit p!55ed at this, off i went to the CCD and told them of my problem. this was not an issue and a full refund was going to be given as soon as the wardrobes were dismantled they will be collected,  i asked who can dismantle them? they replied that it would be my responsibility to arrange this as it was my decision to return the wardrobes! i checked with Taskrabbit and they quoted £350 to dismantle them which IKEA had confirmed they would not refund me even though it was their mess up by designing  wardrobes that would clearly not work.after refusing the dismantling cost i dismantled them myself and the wardrobes have been collected.once the wardrobes had been removed the damage caused to my newly decorated bedroom is horrendous with holes in the wallpaper where the units had been screwed to the wall and 6mtr sections of coving removed as the wardrobes were full height.i emailed ikea requesting help to repair the damage cause by their mess up and all they said was i am lucky to be getting a refund! they also refused to help with the install costs of £420 which i paid out needlessly for.if their designers had been given the correct training these errors would not happen and i wouldn't be out of pocket by £420 with also £1000 worth of damage that requires repairing due to no fault of my own.they are a truly awful company and i will never shop at this place again..

articleTitle: Me experience with IKEA is horrible
articleText: Me experience with IKEA is horrible. I have bought 2 things and it’s been 17 days that I am waiting for an answer, my delivery.On the day of delivery I did not answer my phone, so they changed the situation of my package to delivered, and after that I called them 4 times, I went there 2 times and they did not solve my probles. articleTitle: IKEA shops fine, catastrophic delivery service
articleText: The IKEA shop is fine, but the delivery service from IKEA is such a mess/disaster (having experienced it several times in the Netherlands)!Having recently ordered a desk, it first got delayed twice (1st time: the driver had sickness or so which can happen, 2nd time: there were too much traffic on the road), having to re-schedule it, followed by a final cancellation due to the parcel being "damaged during transportation".Despite receiving a voucher (of about 4 euros, youpi!), it is impossible to feel satisfied by that service.The last time I experienced this was 2 years ago, ordering more than 800 euros of furniture. I waited at the ground floor and saw the truck coming, waiting 1 min, then suddenly going away. I received a message stating "the parcel could not be delivered"! I had to spend so much time on the phone with IKEA hotline, to re-schedule, etc. Such a waste of time/energy/money...!No improvement has been achieved by their service for the last 2 years which is surprising.Even though I was born in Sweden, I cannot stay silent.Either you deliver PROPERLY 3 weeks after having ordered OR YOU JUST DON'T DELIVER.Boiling regards.

articleTitle: I love IKEA and shopping at the IKEA…
articleText: I love IKEA and shopping at the IKEA store. But when it comes to delivery and the customer service, it's absolutely shocking! 😳I made an order of around £450 and paid the £35 express delivery since I wasn't avaliable any other day.The next day comes, I wait for my IKEA delivery, and around 7pm I was told it was coming the next day.Devistated and a waste of one of 52 free days a year.So I called to have it cancelled.First they accused me of already getting the item and had to guide them to the message THEY had sent. 💀They didn't want to cancel it it and just wanted to send me a £15 voucher.That's no good if I'm not in, especially with all the rain.So after a bit of an argument about how I should be able to cancel and it being a waste of my day now along side being argued with, it got cancelled and he was sending a voucher.Thursday comes, still no voucher, I was waiting to get it before placing another order.I called and someone said they'll fast track I and I should be with me in 24 hours, if not call again.It's now Sunday, I call up and before saying anything was "Hello Sir"?This already got my back up a little bit as it's not the usual way someone from a call centre would respond.He couldnt find any logs of my order being canceled, who, canceled is and the voucher.The only thing he could see was whoever fast tracked it on Thursday.He denied any acknowledgement of last Saturday and kept saying I need to wait 7 days from the day I called which was Thursday. "NO IT WAS SATURDAY".He kept telling me I've not called before then. I said I wanted to make a complaint and he said I can't until after 7 days.At this point I got mad. It's been 8 days! 😡 I said.I said there seems to be alot of messing with cancellations and vouchers that aren't on the books and you seem to to be in on it.I then calmly said do you work for or represent IKEA... Silence.I asked the same question again.He said yes quietly...I said so do you work for IKEA?He hung up.So my conclusion is an internal scandal and I'm convinced the silence either meant, yes he does work for IKEA and doesn't want to be found out.Or he doesn't directly work for IKEA, or shouldn't be and is nervous about being found out.
Worst customer service ever!! I wish i can share few pictures how bad the quality is and after two years only the wood is already rotten!! Don’t recommend at all!!

Horrible experience with the IKEA delivery service! The drivers were very aggressive and refused to carry the furniture. After I finally managed to get through to customer service, they could only reschedule the delivery in one week. But guess what? IKEA did not even arrive.As a result, I had to cancel arrangements with workers and bear the financial costs and wasted time. It's absolutely unbelievable.I will never ever be an IKEA customer again.

Hopeless experience with Ikea purchase. Products are average, non-durable, assembly partners are unreliable. Too many hidden charges... not worth the price at all.The process for replacement of damaged products is so lengthy that buyer is most likely to give up, like I did. Even normal returns take ages to be processed. All this after taking the paid advanced planning service. Planning part was still ok.. but after sales services are worst.I got logged out of my account for unknown reasons... I am trying to log into my account... and no support on that. So now I cant place returns online.After spending almost 2.5 lac ... the least I expect is an assigned manager or one point contact. Every time you call on toll free number, a new executive is answering, so one has to repeat the whole story, then they say I will look into this and revert.. and they never call back.This is not what I expected from a multinational company like IKEA. Wish I had not dealt with them.

articleTitle: The food court has really taken a turn…
articleText: The food court has really taken a turn for the worse.When you order a French hotdog, the bread is cold.The sauce for the French hotdog doesn't taste good.The Kanel Bulle are very dry.When you order ice cream, there are no sauce choices available.There are fewer choices for meat eaters than for non-meat eaters.
Great standing desk

I ordered a worktop, a divider screen, and a few other items from IKEA to redecorate my office.The box for the worktop arrived with dirty footprints and a small hole on it. The box for the SCREEN also had footprints(!!!!) and several large holes in the cardboard.Predictably, the worktop had a gouge in it, and the plastic panels on the screen were warped out of their frames and have permanent stress marks on them from being walked on, so one side of the screen is essentially ruined.As for the couriers, All-star logistics, they forgot to bring in one of the items I had ordered, a MALM chest of drawers, so I had to phone them and have them come back. To their credit, they were apologetic and returned within 20 minutes, but it still shouldn't have happened, and speaks to the overall professionalism of the couriers that IKEA is working with in Ireland.I ordered a few smaller items too (a wastepaper basket, some table legs, etc), and they weren't packed at all in the truck, they were just loose. The wastepaper basket arrived with minor scuffs along the top edges.And would you believe it, one of the smaller items I ordered was missing (a bracket for a shelf)! I can't imagine how that happened! The courier told me that it was missing upon arrival, and said that he had put in an order for a replacement that would be delivered by DPD in 10 days. (What good is that going to do me?)IKEA only seem to offer full returns or exchanges instead of an as-is discount, which is a huge bloody nightmare considering I've just spent the day hauling a 60lbs worktop around corners and up a spiral staircase before noticing the damage and need to get things done on a schedule.Also, do not believe the product photos on IKEA's website for worktops. For the Ekbacken worktop, the website shows a shiny surface with the edges of the laminate well finished, but the thing in person is a textured surface with ugly thin black lines around the seams of the laminate. I'm going to have to vinyl wrap it to make it look decent. Might as well have just bought bloody particleboard and done it myself from scratch at this point.Thanks for nothing IKEA. Never again.Also, IKEA's wonderful delivery service costs €60.
Outfitted my entire office AND kitchen from Ikea. No idea what all the bad reviews are about, everything has been PERFECT.
thankyou so much for such a  no fuss returns policy. amazing staff too

articleTitle: The drivers refused to deliver our…
articleText: Regarding Kitchen Cabinet Delivery:  Our experience with the planning service and with IKEA in general has been excellent.  Peak Delivery Inc. was tasked with the delivery. Upon arriving, the drivers refused to deliver our kitchen cabinets to the room we had cleared for them. It was a straight, open pathway from the truck to the cleared out space. The drivers insisted that they wanted to leave the goods in the garage, where they might be susceptible to water damage. They were going to drive away with our cabinets still in the truck, until we agreed that they could leave the goods in the garage. They said they were physically incapable of taking the boxes to the agreed upon spot. So, my husband and I started doing the heavy lifting and moved the boxes from the garage as they were placed down, to the designated room. When we asked the Peak Delivery Inc. drivers how elderly customers fare with this type of service, or how they deliver to people living in apartments, they told us that IKEA does not deliver to apartments. This was a case of complete laziness. Instead of a nice tip, they have dissatisfied customers.  Well, at least we got our steps in.
Unspeakably bad! Delivery five days late, made to wait home each single day including a whole Sunday. Call centre unspeakably unhelpful. Just appalling! Final engagement with them for me!

IKEA what a disappointment!So me and and my little sister went through to our eldest sisters  to help our eldest sister and her partner move house and help build furniture etc.They ordered their sofa, bed and wardrobe sets etc from IKEA, spent a lot of money for them and paid extra for express delivery to be delivered next day which was meant to come Friday, to their disappointment it hadn’t shown up. So my eldest sister got on chats and calls to IKEA being told numerous different tales off of different advisors, one of the advisors which said it would be delivered Saturday between 10-2, also being told it is waiting to be dispatched. We was also told a few times Saturday morning that they would be delivered still, till we finally got through to someone again yesterday at 3/4 o’clock arguing toss with them, for him to keep sighing down the phone at us, and at this point we was farley calm with him, for him to say it will not be coming and their is nothing they can do.So we proceeded to ask for a manager or someone a little higher up to be told numerous times he couldn’t do that, which we all know they can. We finally got put through to a team leader, as we had nothing to sleep on and one of reasons I went through was to help them build, we ended up having to get Ubers and pay out for air beds which we shouldn’t of had to do.Then the team leader we spoke with admitted to us that the advisors on Friday and the ones Saturday morning should have known already that it wouldn’t be coming this weekend at all, so they lied to us multiple times. If they would have told them Friday they could have held off the rubbish removals and movers so they had something to sleep on.All in all be cautious what you’re doing when ordering big items etc from IKEA because they don’t seem to give a damn and their customer advisors are absolutely useless and need more training.And as of today, they are not delivering tomorrow either what a disgrace.

We went for the pax wardrobe solution with mirror doors and do not realise that the whole wardrobe had to be anchored to the wall in order to be stable. By this I mean that the wardrobe doesn't collapse when you open the doors which is exactly what happened to us. We had to get a local specialist to come and modify the wall behind the wardrobe as this was plasterboard and ensure that the wall can take the 200 kg of load without coming down as well. Ikea did not provide any guidance or any support following our complaint.I was under the impression that if a product requires a specific technical assembly or follow-up work that you would at least be notified so that you avoid buying that product if you're not able to anchor it in the right way. It would have helped to have a notification on the website saying that this wardrobe is not stable without complete anchoring in multiple points. It would have enabled me to select a different product or company all together.

articleTitle: Buying online was the easiest BUT
articleText: Buying online was the easiest and fastest part. After paying… it’s nightmare after nightmare dealing with sub subcontractors for deliveries. After 2 attempt, I cancelled my order, got a refund… and tried my luck.. third time lucky, right? No. Always a 6-hour window for delivery. They expect you to waste half a day waiting around for delivery ppl who don’t care about ikea customers. One called 3 hours into the window time and told me his truck broke down. One lied blatantly about calling me numerous times when I didn’t even have a single missed call. Ikea should get serious about their game if they don’t want to lose frustrated customers. Hire your own delivery people. Subcontractors and their subcontractors don’t care about your customers. Brisbane. Australia.

Requested a refund of the express delivery charge but the rep told me that under no circumstances would I be refunded. Rep was rude and abrupt. Will be a long time before I use ikea again!

Worst customer service EVER. IKEA in Bayamón PR is the worst experience I’ve had and am glad that it just had to do with an ottoman. I was planning to spend +$2k in other furniture for a beach apartment, but now I’m glad I didn’t! The Customer Service supervisor, Neisha, is the most disrespectful sales person I’ve met, and let me tell you… I’ve met more than a couple of incompetent self absorbed store clerks. But this person is atop, and comes with an attitude. She even declined to provide her supervisor’s name: in fact, she identified herself as the General Manager of the store. A person so blunt and lacking of basic manners and education skills… Unbelievable! After leaving the store, I called IKEA’s Customer Service, and an agent by the name of Brian not only told me that he didn’t have a supervisor either, but declined to provide a physical or email address to write a complaint. I’m still asking myself if he is, indeed, an Earthlink. Afterwards, I googled and learned that IKEA not only has one of the worst customer service ratings, but that the quality of their products is subpar and are also known for unethical and illegal practices around the world. So, hey IKEA, thank Neisha for saving me a couple of thousand $ by not spending them in the stones and sticks you sell. Still, I will be filing a formal complaint in the local Consumer Affairs Department. (I tried to not leave a One Star review, but did not find a Negative-Cero-NoGood option.)

articleTitle: Threatening Clients - the new experience from Ikea
articleText: Purchased something from Ikea (DE) and received what were clearly used items on the first part of the delivery and a bunch of broken / damaged items on the second part. Also delivery was made in a haphazard manner and they provided the wrong delivery date, so I ended up having to pick up a number of heavy pieces and lugging them up the stairs despite paying already a hefty delivery fee.Customer support was useless, so I tried to reason with them via PayPal - I even returned the broken pieces to a store and accepted to keep the used After that they committed to a partial refund, which never happened despite many reminders, calls, emails and follow ups for over a month.As I was I was still not receiving the agreed reimbursement, I then escalated the situation to PayPal who considering the situation issued a full refund within a few days - indicating that they had assessed the situation and decided in my favour due to the default of Ikea.Guess what happened?! On the same day the same Swedish store that had said nothing over a month, immediately issued a letter indicating that a payment was overdue from my side; I replied and said that while potentially  open to that, such should be discussed with PayPal who resolved the dispute and also highlighting that I had lost many hours following up on this matter. I have not received any reply to my email and now I receive a reminder threatening with a debt collection agency?!What the actual hell is wrong with you people?! You don’t reply to anything, don’t perform the refund you promised, and then threaten your customer with a debt agency? What kind of a clown show are you running?!

I spent more than €7k in IKEA Düsseldorf and the delivery company simply refused to bring the furniture up to my apartment (as agreed with IKEA) despite having ideal conditions to do so; plenty of parking space a few steps from the building entrance, wide doors, a large lift… and what did IKEA do? Absolutely nothing.

I recently had the most disheartening and frustrating experience at IKEA Warrington, one that starkly highlights a grave lapse in the quality of customer service that one would expect from a brand of such repute. I approached the customer service desk with a simple request for a refund, an issue that should have been resolved swiftly and with minimal fuss. Instead, what I encountered was a staff that not only lacked the basic tenets of customer service but also exhibited an arrogance and dismissiveness that escalated a simple matter into an unnecessary confrontation.It is utterly appalling that in a customer-facing role, the staff at IKEA Warrington would choose to be not just unhelpful but outright abusive towards customers. Their behavior was not only unprofessional but also indicative of a disturbing lack of empathy and understanding. To be met with such arrogance and to have a straightforward issue turn into an argument speaks volumes of the dire need for a significant overhaul in their customer service training and attitude.I am deeply disappointed and shocked at the level of disdain shown towards customers. This experience has not only soured my view of IKEA Warrington but has also made me question the values and customer service ethos that IKEA purports to uphold. It is imperative that this matter be addressed with the utmost seriousness and that significant measures are taken to ensure that no other customer has to endure such an appalling experience. The staff in question should be held accountable, and a thorough review of customer service practices at IKEA Warrington is urgently needed to prevent such incidents in the future.

articleTitle: Ikea does not respect promise/duty to replace goods delivered damaged
articleText: Horrible experience and not expected from Ikea. When there are no problems, you get cheap, mass-produced products which may do you fine. When you get delivered a damaged item, there is NO RESPECT FOR DECENCY, they promise to replace the damaged (paid for) item but do not do so. I ordered two pieces of furniture Feb 15 which were delivered Feb 20, one fine, the other obviously fallen off a lorry or dropped in transit, corner of packaging squashed and torn. Just looking at the corner I could see it was broken so opened a little more. Immediately submitted request for replacement and pick up of damaged goods. Was surprised they didn't even ask for photos but said they would exchange on Feb 28. I  asked for earlier but no, this was the date, they said. Feb 27 I had not had a confirmation of a window smaller than 7-19, so I contacted customer service. They said no, it would not be delivered on 28, as the goods were not in the UK yet; delivery required another week, and would be on March 6.  By now deeply suspicious, I called on March 5 to request confirmation delivery really would take place the following day but no, they "couldn't see any record" of the order, so issued a new one (but what about the complaint and request for replacement from the original order? What about the new order number given for the supposed Feb 28 delivery??)I have no reason to believe that the latest "new order" (funny ha ha, when I have been waiting since Feb 15 for this article!!)will be fulfilled any more than those of others who  have written of similar experiences. So I wondered whether they have a supply chain issue, or are about to stop making the very widely sold ALEX series..... but no, if I order the article tonight and pay for it, I can get express delivery on March 9 or normal delivery on March 11.  HOW COME IKEA CANNOT REPLACE A FULLY PAID DAMAGED ARTICLE IN LESS THAN A MONTH, BUT WILL SUPPLY A NEW ONE IF PAID AGAIN IN 1-3 DAYS???  THIS IS NOTHING BUT DELIBERATE KEEPING OF MONEY WITHOUT DELIVERING GOODS. I will complain to consumer organizations and also see if my bank can reverse the card payment made.  I am disgusted to discover that it is not mere inefficiency, or the accident that can happen to deliveries, but a deliberate choice to save money by not providing service.

articleTitle: Wrong delivery over and over and over
articleText: Ok. This is my experience. I went into the IKEA store at Logan to build a cabinet on the computer. This was done ok, but I wanted it delivered and built. They didn't have have all the parts and told me to buy a couple to take home and avoid delay. So I did. Just two, that's ok. The items were delivered at the right date besides two pieces that were incorrect. After the builder (who was amazing) built it, they said two drawer cover parts were too small. So, I sat online (for ages) waiting for someone to talk to about it. After a lengthy process, they agreed to exchange the two pieces via delivery. But this wasnt before asking if I'd prefer to just go in and exchange them. Well, no, because it's 40 minutes away and I paid for delivery. Just deliver the right parts. So, the order was created and they had the nerve to say, you won't need to pay for these since it was our fault, consider it gesture of goodwil. Like excuse me? When they issued me the order after I stopped the chat, I read it and it was incorrect. They were issuing a replacement for exact same parts. Fml. So, I went back onto the chat and did the same process. They then did it correctly. The drivery wasn't coming for a week, but that day came and no one showed up. So, again, I went through the lengthy chat process only to be told they didn't pick it up. Well fk me right. So, I did the online chat again! They issued another order for another week later. I was travelling in the area and thought, maybe should just drop in (the day before delivery) to save the hassle and get them myself, and cancel the delivery. No, they could that, it was too hard. Wow, what a great system. They did say, but if they don't deliver them again, you can come in. Oh yes please! Not now while it's convenient for everyone, after the fact. So, true to their word, the delivery came. I opened it up, and you wouldn't believe it. They gave me the wrong colour. The wrong fkn colour. You can only guess what I need to do now. There is definitely some special people and systems at IKEA.

Three days later and still no call. This company is obviously worthless.

Very bad experience with Ikea service and product.We got a Kivik sofa 6 years ago and Ikea stated a 10 year warranty on its sofa. It specifically stated that cuscions/pillows and frames are included in the warranty. False.Sofa and pillows caved in. And we were getting back pain. We brought the sofa back to the store as it was of no use to us at that state.At Ikea store they refused us the warranty stating that these kinds of defects are specifically excluded from warranty by some internal document that was absolutely impossible to show to us. So we repeatedly asked to give us the proof of that statement in written form. The person who was at customer service desk and than his “manager” refused to show it. Therefore promised 10 year warranty appeared to have no real value.We called Ikea support. Yet we heard the same answer. We can not provide you with the written proof of misterious exception from the warranty.We consulted the site of Ikea. Product is positioned as a good quality and long lasting with good resistance to normal use, citation “Door de stevige pocketvering behoudt de bank zijn vorm en blijft hij comfortabel, jaar in jaar uit.”Kivic sofa did not keep the shape and it was not comfortable as stated. In another document Ikea states“…..What is covered under this limited warranty?This limited warranty applies to domestic use only and covers defects in material and workmanship in the following components: • frames• seat and back cushionsin the following products:…• KIVIK seating series…” closing citation.And than one little add up “IKEA will examine the product and decide, at its sole discretion, if it is covered under this limited warranty….”.So seemingly Ikea stated that it sells a nice quality product and it is ready to increase a normal 2 year warranty up to 10 years for how good it is and yet it will decide if it actually does that at its convinience.So you buy it on misleading information and get into a deal you maybe otherwise would not ever conclude. You loose your money and you do not have a usable product. We have spent thousands of euro in Ikea products and closed eyes on minor things. But this one is gross.We started checking online and apparently we were not the only ones to have an issue with the same product.So my question is : Is it a willingly omitted information to induce consumer to buy something he otherwise would not buy? If this defect is known to this product then why isn’t it specifically stated to beware of this issue. Why is refusal of warranty based on some kind of secret internal document?The sofa is rather expensive, is it just a hunt for a profit and promotion of sales on base of deceipt? We would not buy the sofa if we would know that it has such quality issues and such post-sales support.We were the only users of sofa. We have the original bill. The defects that we discovered are clearly  and expressively covered for the type of defect and the product itself. And yet we can not get to any solution.I guess a common action with this regard would be the best thing to do with other people who had the same issue.Ps. Chatting with client support was also not specifically useful. First person just like with call dropped from chat. Second one gave us an email which we used to send a complaint. That will 99.9999% end up with no real reply or solution.

articleTitle: Ban on access to dogs in your shops
articleText: In all countries of the world it is possible to access your shops with dogs, especially small ones, with the exception of Spain and Portugal.It is truly retrograde to remain tied to old traditions.It's also true that the Portuguese are rude and don't even pick up their own dogs' excrement.One would expect an important and established group to be oriented towards looking to the future by aligning itself with the practices used by your group in most industrialized countries.The ban on dogs entering your shops shows how Portugal is still an old and retrograde country.Your most important competitors, directed by international manager,  are much ahead of you.You'll probably get there too, in the meantime you're just losing business.
