articleTitle: Frustrating Experience with IKEA PAX System and Bestä Cabinet Delivery
articleText: I recently ordered the PAX system and Bestä cabinet from IKEA, with a total cost of around 7000€. The delivery process turned out to be a significant disappointment, leaving me with a mix of frustration and inconvenience.The delivery was divided into 5 shipments, and immediately, issues arose. One of the deliveries has been stuck for a month due to a problem in the IKEA system. This forced me to contact customer service and request a refund, adding an unnecessary hassle to the overall experience.Another delivery contained only a single glass door, which arrived with a noticeable crack in the corner. While this was certainly inconvenient, it paled in comparison to the most disappointing delivery of all. This particular shipment included a whopping 70 items. The delivery team worked so swiftly that I couldn't count the packages in real-time. However, upon closer inspection the next days, it became apparent that six crucial packages, including core components for the PAX and Bestä, were missing, along side few grffs while they were mentioned in the delivery note of that shipments.This forced me to reorder the missing items to complete the assembly process, causing delays and added expenses. The situation highlighted the need for customers to meticulously verify every piece of their delivery, as missing components can lead to significant setbacks. This task becomes even more daunting when considering the delivery cost, which was already a substantial 370€.In conclusion, It's advisable for future customers to be prepared to thoroughly inspect each delivery and, if possible, explore alternative delivery options to mitigate potential issues.

I'm deeply disheartened and frustrated with the entire experience of ordering made-to-measure wardrobes from IKEA. Despite being a long-time and high-value customer both in-store and online, the service I've encountered has been shocking.Over the course of December and early January, I attended three in-store planning service appointments, providing precise measurements for a 'L' corner unit wardrobe in the bedroom, shelving units for the living room, and a set of chest drawers – all totaling over £1000.00. After a considerable wait for a delivery date, I received my order on January 14th.Professional assembly took place on January 16th, revealing a significant error in the measurements of the bedroom wardrobe corner unit, despite multiple face-to-face appointments to prevent such mistakes. Additionally, one of the living room shelves was chipped. That evening, I contacted IKEA customer services via telephone and faced three disconnections after expressing my concerns.When I finally reached an advisor, a complaint was raised for the chipped shelf, and I was directed to return to the store and speak with a manager about the bedroom wardrobe error. The next day, I visited the store, and while the manager was amicable, the proposed solution involved collecting excess furniture, providing missing hinges and assembly of one door outstanding, and replacing the chipped shelf. There was no mention of compensation or the replacement of the wardrobes with the originally planned design. I am now left with a wardrobe unit that deviates significantly from my intended design, offering less storage space than desired. This experience has left me thoroughly disappointed with IKEA's customer care, particularly as a loyal and high-spending customer.

articleTitle: Scam, shocking experience, file a claim
articleText: I ordered a PAX wardrobe for 1400€, with delivery fees of 129€ included. The delivery was scheduled for January 8, 2024, between 4 PM and 8 PM, but it never arrived. We called customer service, who told us to opt for an "express" delivery to be delivered the next day, which cost us an additional 10€. The customer service agent said that we would be refunded and receive a commercial gesture once the order was received. The order was supposed to arrive on January 10, 2024, between 10 AM and 2 PM; it never did. We called customer service again, who told us that the agent had made a mistake and should never have offered an "express" delivery, as the telephone customer service was not authorized to do so.Therefore, we had to reschedule a "normal" delivery for January 14, 2024, between 8 AM and 10 AM. It was a Sunday! We received the order at 8 AM.I later called customer service again, who told me that they could not refund the "express" delivery as there was no record of it, only the shipping fee of 129€. No other compensation! We took 3 days of paid leave, waited a week for the order, received the order on a Sunday, and paid for express delivery.This is clearly a scam, and there should be an investigation into IKEA's customer service practices. I am going to file a complaint with 30 million consumers, the DGCCRF, leave comments on all corners of the internet, and send a registered letter through my legal insurance. I am now looking at Trustpilot and see the comments. I wonder how this is possible under the pretext that it is a multinational company. The consumer is deceived and has no recourse on the pretext that they are smaller.

When i arrived, there was no van in sight, and was told i'd receive a seperate text when the van arrives. Surely if theres a delivery slot of 9-11, the van could make it there for the 2 hour window! When the van finally got there, the shoe cabinet wasn't fit for purpose and I was told they'd return it to the ikea and I would be refunded. I contacted ikea to let them know, they stated the refund could take up to 14 days. Fast forward 2 weeks, with no refund in sight I call ikea again. This time I'm told the courier company they use to do the click and collect, didn't return the item to their shop. But they'll authorise the refund anyway, but it'll take a further 14 days. 28 days for a refund of an item, that ikea were told on the day of delivery was no longer required, seems laughable. Be wary if going to a click and collect point. It's not as easy or as straight forward as you may think.

articleTitle: Too hard to find things, good value
articleText: I want to give a higher review, but I just can't.  Okay, we love their products, and when it's in stock and findable, the value is good on most items. Staff are mostly friendly in the stores, some are very helpful, but it's a marathon visiting them or ordering online.

IKEA For many decades, IKEA stores around the world have offered furniture at very attractive prices. Last year, accusations surfaced in Germany that during communism, IKEA made a lot of money by using forced labor of prisoners in the German Democratic Republic, which was the name of the state established after World War II in the Soviet occupation zone in Germany.According to the documents of the Stasi, the East German security service, this practice began in the 1960s and lasted almost until the end of the GDR, which in 1990 reunited with the Federal Republic of Germany, established in the territories of Germany occupied by Western powers.Nazism is eternally alive in October's IKEA. Its founder belonged to the Nazi party, and political prisoners of the GDR worked as slaves in IKEA factories.IKEA has a long tradition of oppressing and doing business with totalitarian regimes. After a Catholic was fired from his job in Krakow, the gloomy past of a Swedish seller and furniture manufacturer of shreds is recalled.Swedish journalist Elisabeth Åsbrink, describing the history of the October giant, revealed in 2011 that its founder Ingvar Kamprad was an activist of the Swedish Nazi party.The Swedish services collected information about him and classified him as a Nazi. In 1942, when millions of Europeans were being murdered and the final plan for the Holocaust was being prepared, Kamprad joined Svensk Socialistisk Samling, which was the successor of the Swedish National Socialist Labor Party - the equivalent of the German NSDAP.Earlier reports of his Nazi activity appeared in 1994, when letters were found revealing that the later founder of the Nazi empire was involved in recruiting for the Nazi organization and supporting it financially. Kamprad also never commented on the allegations that he belonged to the Nordic Youth, the equivalent of the German Hitlerjugend.These were not just the mistakes of youth. In the early 1970s, IKEA established very close cooperation with the communist fascist regime in the GDR. The October giant built its factories there and used the slave labor of political prisoners. One of the plants was built near the prison in Waldheim.According to Hans Otto Klare, who was convicted of trying to get to West Germany, it was "slave labor". Prisoners slept on the upper floor of the factory, and production took place downstairs. Political prisoners worked downstairs without any protection - without gloves, headphones to protect against noise, they did not even have a place to sit for a moment. Conditions were much worse than in other communist plants.

articleTitle: Bought IKEA kitchen from Vejle studio
articleText: Bought IKEA kitchen from Vejle studio. As per recommendation we provided dimensions to order bordplade. Signed papers given by ikea , paid and all done. We have the drawings to carpenter to fix cabins as per bordplade dimensions.Few days later , received call from ikea employee that he made a mistake. And he has changed some dimensions. He pushed us to sign right away as change is small and will be no issue. We disagreed and insisted we can’t sign without understanding change. We were told there is no meeting slot available before Wednesday and our delivery will be late. We showed flexibility and said late delivery is ok but we can’t sign without knowing change. We were told it’s ok and let’s meet on Wednesday 10 Jan 2024.First surprise - found many options available on Monday 8 Jan 2024 to meet and we wondered why we were not offered earlier option to meet ?Second surprise - got a call from IKEA to provide account number. We were told we cancelled the order and ikea wants to return us money. I explained - No we didn’t cancel order and how we can do that ? It’s Ikea mistake and they wanted to change that we want to discuss . We are fine to get what we paid for without any changes. No change is fromOur side. Person on phone was not listening and just want account to return money. She was not concerned about actual situationOn request , an order cancellation email was sent. And it didn’t say who told them to cancel order ? And IKEA also don’t want to return 800 kr delivery charges. Really ? What’s our fault in this ? IKEA made mistake , ikea decided to cancel order and made 800 out of this .. seriously ? Is it really ikea ?I am shocked as I never ever assumed this is how things work at Ikea .. I was at way different expectation level that I decided to buy expensive kitchen from Ikea despite a good offer from a designer brand ( offer can be presented if anyone in doubt )Trust is broken .. I still willl visit shop to manage this but be careful if you are thinkin to buy IKEA kitchen . Something is seriously wrong there

Told me they only hold the order for 48hrs and then told me my refund will take 14 days even though it was their incompetence for the error.Quick enough to take my money though weren't you!I will be taking this further

articleTitle: Ikea is a god send :) Cheap and easy to…
articleText: Ikea is a god send :) Cheap and easy to assemble furniture.

We ordered two kitchens with IKEA Amsterdam. Maybe it's reassuring to know that we, as colleagues are treated just as terribly as other customers.We paid in full for our kitchens in July 2023. We were required to have a measurement service to have Kasker countertops ordered. The lead times suggested in store were significantly shorter than the reality quoted. In the end we did one kitchen with Kasker and one with custom wood counters. Both kitchens were a disaster and are still not fully installed (it's almost January 2024).For the kitchen with wooden counters:1. IKEA didn't show up to deliver half the kitchen (was more than a week delayed with no communication and me having to call over and over because no one called or emailed me back). This cost additional bills with the installers. (Out of pocket more than €6k with all the issues)2. Kitchen didn't include the plans (by email, in the kitchen planner or in print). We later got these 2 weeks later.3. IKEA told us to send a comaint email and gave a deadline (in September) they still haven't responded despite followups4. The wooden counters were warped and couldn't be installed flat.5. The measurement service didn't measure the entire room and was inaccurate (why force us to take a service and not fully provide it?)6. Items included in the original order that were paid for went out of stock and are supposed to be delivered. No one has followed up. No refund is recieved.The kitchen with Kasker counters:1. Had ongoing delays due to lack of communication between ikea, the delivery company, the counter company and the installers - we were required to use their installation partner.2. The sink in the kitchen counter was damaged so couldn't be installed. We were told someone would contact us to fix a new date but it's been 3 months and no one calls us back. We have a full stone work counter sitting on the floor in the way and causing damage to the floor because no one has bothered to follow-up.3. There were missing items in the order. The installer said he'd have IKEA deliver them but because they were late we'd have to install them ourselves. We still haven't received these items.4. IKEA sent one guy to install the entire kitchen. He was nice but from an external company and needed help because he couldn't lift things on his own. We were told we had to pay for their installer and wouldn't be allowed to use our own installers... but then needed to get additional help.5. The IKEA kitchen planning staff missed multiple things in this order meaning there are all sorts of exposed screw fittings were cover panels should have been recommendedI'm shocked that two orders could both be such disasters. Mistakes happen but for IKEA Amsterdam to lie to us and avoid following up again and again is shocking. As a colleague, it's difficult to continue to work for a company that treats its customers like this.

This order with ikea has been my worst experience as a customer ever. I have have had assembly. cancelled on me two days in a row. I've been messed around with my refund for assembly as it never happened. I've had to make numerous phone calls and emails to try get it assembled. I've been put on hold for more times than I can count and still no resolution. The mirror to my wardrobe arrived broken. Was told I'd receive a new one the next day. Nobody came. Nobody called. I spent hours again on the phone. Greg was rude and kept cutting me off. Now I have to wait until next Tuesday to get the broken part delivered. I'm not confident it will come as this is the most unreliable company I've ever dealt with and I've been waiting at home, taking time off work, to get the items assembled and then waiting for a replacement part so I can get someone else to assemble it.This was a Christmas present for my daughter. I have been financially inconvenienced, taking time off work for nothing and paying for assembly which never happened. Waiting around 3 days for nothing and no assurance it wont happen again as now I have to wait around again next Tuesday. I will be sharing my story to social media and online reviews and not recommending ikea to my worst enemy. Worst shopping experience ever.

Our first IKEA experience.  Salesman put together a kitchen island package and our intent was to install it ourselves.  One part of the package (a 15x15 base cabinet) needed a side panel which was the wrong size. Customer support said they couldn't find the part on the site.  We were forced to have our contractor provide a work around.  The product is OK, it's the support that is the worst I've seen in my life (67 years old).

articleTitle: I dont get the hate about IKEA!
articleText: I dont get the hate about IKEA!It simply gets me - the perfect combo of easy transportation plus functional style to make my first apartment shine bright. Flatpack furniture tackles big items like beds and shelves that lookup stylish once assembled. With genius innovations like that plus cheap yet chic decor spanning all rooms, how could IKEA not earn top honors? Minor assembly headaches happen but totally worth the haul for instant space elevation on a budget. For that delightful blend of affordability, aesthetics and solutions perfect for small spaces, IKEA rocks!

Delivery is horror!First time we ordered a closet at Ikea, went first to look at the item in Alfafar, we got it on time, no complains at all!But than……We ordered and paid the 2nd of december online an other closet, order should be brought in at 12th of december.The 12 i got a call from the driver to send the location were to drive to, exactly like the first time. I did send location, but than instantly i received an email from Ikea delivery failed!!Called back the driver, he did not pick up the phone.Called customer service, after 35 minutes i got an very friendly guy on the the phone, i explained everything, ha called the delivery company and they told the van broke down. That is precise what i thought they would tell. Next delivery would be 21th. The nice guy told me that was not acceptable and he would get an earlier day to deliver.Whole house is up side down because we had to clear the bedroom to build the new closet.Anyway new date became 16th, that was nice still everything done before X-mas, we are having guests over for a couple of days.16th in the morning call from delivery driver, please send location, thats what they do when living in the campo. After sending this clever guy called back, he showed me by picture he send, that they did not ha€ the right postal code, was the one from the Ikea branch in Alfafar Valencia. We are living just 25 minutes away from that branch.Th delivery guy told me to call ikea, the closet was again not coming in for the second time!Again costumer service after 52 minutes waiting on the phone!New delivery day today 21th of december.Was not possible to give earlier delivery, ok 21th still all done before guests come in.Got email and second today in the morning, delivery between 13.00 until 17.00 hrs.At 17.30 hours no closet, decided to call again, after 40 min on hold got an service desk employee on the phone. Told the story, she called the delivery company, came back and stated the delivery was delayed!Ok acceptable we wait.Until 21.00 hrs called customer service and after record breaking time of 22 minutes i got a lady on the line!Told the whole story, and stated that this is unacceptable, she called delivery.Came back, no one is picking up the phone.New date of delivery 26th. Not willing to speed up at all, resting in what they must do daily with delivery delays.What is the problem now?Totally pissed off.House up side down since 10thNo place for our guests to sleep now. They come from abroad.Paid and ordered the 2nd of december.No one gives a sh**I personally think this is not how you treat costumers.

articleTitle: I just spoke to Agent Sabah about a…
articleText: I just spoke to Agent Sabah about a pickup of return items that was supposed to take place today. She said that they are not coming, as they tried to call yesterday but did not get through to me to confirm the pickup.The original agent who I arranged the pick up through did not mention anything about needing to further confirm a date - the date and time window had already been confirmed in an invoice/letter I received from the original agent. The person that did call yesterday (during normal working hours when it is not always possible to answer the phone) did not even bother to leave a voicemail message, text message or any sort of contact number or information about their call.We deliberately arranged the pickup for today as we cannot do other days. Agent Sabah said that they could rearrange for 23rd December. I said that we needed it today, but when I was told this i not possible I asked that they please arrange for 23rd and I would also like to raise this as a formal complaint as the service has not been good.Agent Sabah then decided to rudely end the chat without either logging the complaint or rearranging the collection, stating that I was away from the chat - even though the last message was from me saying "ok" when they said they would log the complaint for me. I had also asked for them to rearrange the collection, but they did not bother.Terrible customer service.

articleTitle: IKEA Croydon Customer Care Manager Was Rude, Abrupt and unhelpful
articleText: We ordered two 2 seater sofas from IKEA Croydon.  It was not delivered and we wasted a whole day waiting.  We didn’t get any update by text or calls as was promised.  We were given the runaround when we called customer care, again with no answer.  At the end we went to the Croydon Branch and spoke to customers care.  The young woman Sakata was extremely helpful and patient.  Her manager Jamie was rude, abrupt and short tempered.  He gave us misleading information by claiming we have to call customer care on the phone to cancel and get a refund.  Then he disappeared and left his staff to pick the pieces.  She managed to get the cancellation and refund done in 3 minutes.  Very disappointed by the customer care management lack of care for their clients.  There attitude is out of the playbook of the Soviet Union.

No body takes responsibility of the order. So it's purely a mess. And they are not bothered about any reviews. So please don't use any of their services. If use them, you will surely have sleepless nights.

I was told 90days “ No questions asked” & 365 for exchange or, store credit. “No Signage posted & visible at the cash counter about return/ exchange/ Store credit” I strongly feel like cheated & duped. No more IKEA for me & my friends for sure.

We did purchase a big PAX combination with lots of extra items for the corpses on 2.12.2023.Securing all items in store was possible, what's amazing. Around Christmas season they could have been a shortage.After we started to assemble the cabinet we discovered missing and damaged items. Due to us assembling it our self (my Dad and Brother) we had to do it in sessions.Over here Ikea employees are having a protest until the 13.12.23 so all service stations are down. An exchange and getting the missing items was impossible. My dad did wait 2 1/2hours in line to just get told that this is something Ikea can't help with atm.Due to me having health related issues all the work fell in the leps of my family. Not being able to finish something you started and wasting your time to wait in line are things that are very stressful on all involved. But we understand that people are fighting for what they need.Thankfully a call center customer care employee by the name Mr. T. Niebusch (IKEA Germany) was very understanding and helped us out by placing a delivery of the missing and damaged items to be received at my home.We are very grateful. The scheduled delivery was the best solution.The employee also helped out with an issue with my ikea family card and was even willing to read up on information.So a special thank you to Mr. T Niebusch I hope Ikea will give you a lil star 🌟 for very good service.

articleTitle: IKEA did not ship the goods that I paid and never answered to call, chat or online form
articleText: IKEA did not ship the goods that I paid and did not respond to my communications via call, chat and online form.- On 13 November 2023, I paid 95 EUR only for the shipment itself for the goods bought.- They sent an email as they are shipping and made me using 1 day vacation from my work on 15 November.- They did not ship anything.- For 7 days I tried every communication way to clarify the goods that I paid for. But they did not answer from any of the of the communication ways (sending form, chat and phone call) that they are listing on their webpage.- On 22 November, I needed to spend my evening and went to IKEA Store in Altona. When I explained them and showed the evidences of my communication trials, they spent 15 minutes (including some talks between them) and finally arranged the shipment. When I asked what has happened, they did not share any info expecting from me to be happy that they fixed the shipment of the goods that I paid.- They told me that the customer services department would be responding to me for compensating the faulty service that IKEA did.- The goods that I bought arrived after 2 weeks. The packages were dirty and one item was partially damaged.- I shared the pictures of dirt and damage with IKEA reminding them their faulty service.THEY NEVER RESPONDED.

articleTitle: I think Ikea is the best place ever
articleText: I think Ikea is the best place ever. We really enjoy going there.

Our experience was terrible. We received broken items, and in the replacement delivery an item was missing. The warehouse and delivery team just don't care about the goods. Labels are stuck on so items are damaged when they're removed, things aren't put in protective packaging, they're chucked in the vans any old how so they get moved a lot and trampled on, it's disgraceful. It means they have to redeliver multiple times, it's hardly eco friendly. This really is the last time I will buy furniture from ikea, it's not as good as it used to be and they can't get it to me without damaging it.

I live in Jerusalem, Israel, and own a glass food container with a plastic cover made by IKEA. Two weeks ago one of the flaps attaching the cover to the glass broke. IKEA Israel initially refused to replace the cover without my coming into their store. They have no store in Jerusalem. Their nearest store is at least an hour away by car and two hours by public transportation. I asked them again to send me the cover. They finally relented and promise to send me the cover, but since them several more days have passed without my hearing from them. When I complained to IKEA’s CEO, Jesper BRODIN, he sent me cheerful automated messages saying “Hej!” and promising that he and his team would get right on it, but they never did. My appeals to IKEA’ chairman, Lars-Johan JARNHEIMER have not even elicited any reply. IKEA Israel continued to drag its feet and to give me bureaucratic answers, without anyone calling me or sending me the promised cover. They finally sent me a much smaller cover, and have opened a new case number for me but have not sent me the right cover and have not called me. It has now been TWO WEEKS now and no cover. IKEA’s chiefs do not care.

Everything from the order to the delivery, customer service, and returns is terrible.  After 6 months of trying to get some cabinets installed, the installers said they ordered too much and I had to return pieces that were too large to take back myself. So they charged me to make these returns.  You can never speak to a supervisor.  They had to deliver 21 cabinet doors before I received 4 that were not damaged. All these deliveries required me to be home in a 4-hour window.  They never read or respond to any reviews.  Protect yourself.
I love IKEA, but the app is working quite slow

I visit IKEA Schaumburg regularly to eat swedish meatballs. Today 11/18/2023 was the day of disappointment . The plate with 8 meatballs (which meanwhile were 14 in  the years before) had a price  of $ 9.49 before taxes. The plate  was almost empty: half a scoop masched potatoes ( not even full scoop) , tastless peas ( about 2 table  spoons ) thrown in the middle of the plate,  teaspoon cranberry sauce and 8 meatballs. Looked bad. Higher price, less food, no visual appearance. Was the staff new,  was the person that served that not experienced or the store policy changed? I do not know. But I am convinced I will never come back again.

articleTitle: Annoying minor faults caused extra visits and costs
articleText: Having shopped for many years at Ikea, (mostly at Wednesbury) as have most of our grownup family, we have usually been delighted with our purchases, including self-assembled furniture for every part of the houses we have lived in.However the last purchase, a small BESTA, was a disappointment and involved 3 extra journeys of quite a few miles to sort out the problem. We then emailed Customer Services and received our requested compensation for fuel and inconvenience, and  CS were fair for which we thank them, but could have resolved quicker.We do, however, wonder if the quality of some of the ranges have lessened in an attempt to keep costs down.

Worst orders ever.Placed two orders, one for myself and one for my mother. My order included a large mirror, which was delivered broken and one other item was missing. Four weeks later I still follow-up daily with IKEA customer services and still no resolution. No one even apologized for the inconvenience.As for the bed I ordered for my mother, it appears as though lost in the mail. Delivery company does not know if and when it will be delivered. They cannot even give me an estimation of when delivery will be done.Never ordering again. Ever.

articleTitle: Rude Customer Service Manager at IKEA Milton Keynes
articleText: When I was living in Ireland I have been buying some of my furnitures from IKEA at least for 4 years, and I did not have any problem. When I moved to the UK, I thought my experience would be the same but unfortunately, it was not.On 11.11.2023, I bought IKEA PAX from IKEA Milton Keynes and set the delivery date as 25.11.2023. On the delivery date, I received the tracking link and then the driver called me to notify that he will be at the house in an hour. After 30 minutes, he called me back to tell me that he cannot do the delivery because he does not have enough battery in the van! I told him that as long as my order is delivered before Monday, it is okay with me and he agreed to do the delivery on Sunday morning. On Sunday morning, I received an email from IKEA saying that my new delivery date is the next Thursday (30.11.2023). The problem is I hired somebody to come and do custom fitting for me on Monday (27.11.2023) morning 1 month ago and I could not postpone it or cancel it. So I called the customer service and explained my situation. They could not do anything but they told me that it might be helpful for me to go IKEA Milton Keynes and talked to the customer service there. So I went there and had the worst experience with the customer service manager at IKEA Milton Keynes.First, I talked to a nice lady in the customer service. She tried to find a solution but when I noticed that she always has to talk to her manager, I asked her if I can talk to the customer service manager directly.I explained the situation to her and ask for a solution. She said the delivery was not done on Saturday because the delivery address was wrong(!). So it is my fault. I asked her to check the previous and the new delivery addresses because they are the same and I explained the real reason is the low battery of the van. She said these things can happen. I told her that I need a solution becuase it is not my fault. She said I can collect the order from the store but the order is nearly 400kg, according to the invoice. I told her that if I can, I would do it when I bought my PAX on 11.11.2023. She said she can cancel the order and provide full refund. But I need a wardrobe and I have already booked a person for fitting the wardrobe, so I also refused that. She said then I should wait Thursday for the delivery. I did not want to accept that because it is not my fault and I arranged everything in advance.  So I asked her to arrange a delivery on Monday morning because I cannot cancel or postpone my appointment with my builder but she refused to do that. Then I asked her if she can guaratee a delivery on Thursday. She said she is "almost sure" because now they have the correct address. I reminded her that the address was correct and that was not the problem and her reply was she is "almost sure" for the delivery. Then I asked her to compensate my loss due to cancelling my builder, if I accept the new delivery date. She told me she could do it if I had booked a builder that they suggested. But for my situation, she refused to compensate and offer 30 pounds(!) discount voucher. When I asked her if she truely believes 30 pounds is enough to compensate everything, including all the stress that I had to face, all the additional expenses that I have to do and all the time I spent to drive to Milton Keynes, in a mocking tone she said they cannot compensate the time I lost and the stress that I had, and 30 pounds is the maximum she can offer. And finally, she said unless I want to cancel my order, there is nothing that I can do there and I can leave(!).I am not sure how successful I was to explain my disappointment at the rudeness of the IKEA Milton Keynes customer service manager, but I did my best to explain the situation. I can't forget the sarcasm in her voice. I hope someone at IKEA sees this and takes action.

articleTitle: I would give zero stars if I could
articleText: I would give zero stars if I could. Ordered 3k worth of furniture, items were missing from delivery. Called and arranged for the missing items to be delivered. Day of delivery - nothing. I called - no delivery scheduled. Another person scheduled missing items to be delivered few days later. Again, waiting for delivery amd nothing. Called again to be told someone made a mistake again and there is no delivery coming. Lost my patience at this point. Yet again, they scheduled. This time delivered missing items but also items i did mot want or need so now arranging a pick up. Disappointed and angry

Came for return and waited in line for 50 min. Lost my patience when I saw that all the people who came 30 min after me were served. Only after I started an argument I was eventually served. All the items I was returning were in original package, but I was robbed by Ikea for about $30 for loosing my receipt. They did not return me my money, but issued a store credit. articleTitle: I usually have a good experience when I…
articleText: I usually have a good experience when I shop in-store at IKEA but their online delivery is sub-contract out to DPD and if the parcel is missing, the customer has to call DPD to sort it out!  Never again to shop at IKEA online.  Although IKEA is taking the money for the postage, they are not responsible to contact DPD, the customer is!

Terrible customer service. Paid for 3 day express delivery it will now be at least 6 days. Customer service offered a 10 pound voucher not even real money as a way of compensating for the 50 pound delivery fee. It would have been easier cheaper and quicker to hire a van on my return from working away than use this substandard service. Lots of notifications saying it would be delivered then nothing until we checked the order in the evening and the delivery date had changed. Son took a day off work to wait for it so that is a wasted day for him, no we need to do the whole thing again on Friday.

articleTitle: Bad in-store system for kitchen items, horrible customer care
articleText: We went to the store in Draper UT, and had a horrible experience due to their pull system for kitchen items resulting in a 45 minutes for two items! (Make a line for 20+ item and under 20 item orders if you HAVE to have all kitchen items treated that way. There is no reason a customer cannot take a simple drawer off the shelf themselves...)  So, as the store was a "never again" experience, we ordered online with scheduled delivery. Big mistake. IKEA delivered an order of two kitchen cabinets with a door missing. I was lied to by the delivery people that the missing piece would be sent out the same day. When I went to my account and saw no acknowledgement of a missing piece, I contacted customer "care". Nobody was aware the door was missing. Then, I was told I will have to wait 10 days for the missing door! Next, after getting disconnected from customer care chat, I was sent an invoice by email stating that I need to pay $17 before the missing door will be sent!! Unacceptable! It is their mistake!So I had to go back to customer care chat, explain everything all over again. When I told them that having to wait 10 days was not acceptable, I was told to just go to the store myself to get what I needed. And then I was just disconnected. So I called customer care on the phone (their menu does not work properly!) When I finally talked to a person in customer care, I only received a snarky chuckle and "what are you gonna do? It sucks to be you" type of reaction. When I told her that nobody has shown any concern for my experience, that there is not the least attempt to make this truly right, I only got attitude and "your problem". When you ask these customer care agents to talk to a manager, it is clear IKEA does not want you to complain about how you are treated. Bad experience made worse by horrible customer "care". IKEA simply does not care. Don't have your representatives laugh at your customer's inability to be treated right. It left a weird "abuse of power" feeling. Who knows if I'll ever see the missing door?
Ikea, get out of the forests of Lithuania! Stop destroying our forests! 🤬😠

articleTitle: IKEA furniture is not as cheap compared…
articleText: IKEA furniture is not as cheap compared to other brands as what it used to be. But quality is usually substandard. I continue to shop at IKEA for small items, but will stay away from them for larger furniture.

Online chat for their "10 year guarantee" waste of my time essentially, can't determine online even with pictures if something will or wont be covered. Don't seem to know what is and isn't warranted on their products. Basically go instore and hope for the best, it's a long drive to hope for the best. Their furniture is pretty bad quality anyway, I'll not use them again in my lifetime.

articleTitle: If I could give 0 Stars I would have…
articleText: If I could give 0 Stars I would have today. I attended today IKEA ASHTON store customer services. I was told because the box was opened IKEA would not issue a refund. But the man next to me with an opened box also received a refund so therefore I was discriminated against. I asked why the customer next to me received a refund I I did not.The sales assistant told me he could do what he felt right to do so. I said your point of sales states if unhappy you could bring your purchase back 365 days after purchase. I brought my purchase back only a couple of days after purchase. I asked why at point of sale it did not state refunds are not given if a package is opened even if not suitable or a problem, I was greeted with terms are on the website.But I said I bought in store not on line so therefore your terms are not stated at point of sale. The staff smirked at me behind customer services and seemed to get a kick out of not issuing refunds. I would not recommend this company due to the fact I was discriminated against and the customer stood next to me received their refund. If you buy an item from Ikea and it is not suitable and you should even patial or open the parcel kiss your money goodbye. I was about to buy four large wardrobes so they have now lost over £4,000+ worth of business I portrayed this to the customer service attendant and he just shrugged his shoulders good business sense.As I was walking out of Ikea I spoke to the Security man he stated he was attending hassle at customer services everyday. Buyer beware  even though terms are listed at point of sale and as far as I am aware acted within. I feel cheated and discriminated against by this company.

Such a huge company, massive advertisting, yet their customer services is some of the worst I've ever experienced.I'll try to condense this.Called customer services as my mattress which is less than 6 months old has started to dip. Apologetic, sent me an email with a case number to attach photos.Email 1 - I sent photos. Only to be told I didn't put personal info on the email (though she has taken at call)Email 2 - told I didn't label the photos to give descriptions of where taken from (wasn't told this)Email 3 - told this case number doesn't exist anymore, given new case numberEmail 4 - told not to reply to that email and do a fresh email with case number on top (as too lazy to read the email???)Email 5 - WAS RETURNED AS NO LONGER ACCEPTING DIRECT EMAILS TO CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!!!So I'm left with a faulty mattress, no way to directly take it back to a store. Uncomfortable sleep everynight and to go through the whole process again.Shocking. I think my credit card company needs a call.1.4 stars on Trustpilot..it's like they don't care as we they have enough business selling £20 duvets.....

articleTitle: Alot needs to change going by people's…
articleText: Alot needs to change going by people's experiences at ikea. I attended carrickmines today where I was returning an item.the collection point and the customer returns are beside each other.the woman in front of me was having a difficult time returning items and was having a debate with the customer service representative I didn't want to listen in on their private conversation so I asked the guy in the collection point would he mind returning my item.he said no that he was busy on the computer dealing with another customer and I would have to wait. I said fine thank you and I went back to the returns desk. A customer came to collect items and immediately he stopped his pc work to look after the customer. that kind of customer service is what these to change in my opinion obviously the person he was dealing with on his computer could wait where he attended to a collection customer. This is not about having to wait in the queue this is about listening to private conversations of a customer trying to return a product and having difficulty doing so  it was awkward and the guy in the collection point could hear all this conversation going on should have in my opinion just returned my item to give that woman some privacy there's something lacking in that store. I don't know if it's IKEA as a whole I've never had to complain before about any department or area or products in IKEA this is the first for me.i felt strongly enough to do it I hope IKEA are watching and reading and take proactive action to train their staff to be more compassionate towards customers like that woman and also like me who had to listen to that private debate. thank you

articleTitle: They're better at meatballs than Web Development
articleText: Blimey, these guys must try really hard to be this bad at ecommerce....where to start?Went online, and added around £200 of items to my cart. Got to checkout and prices in the basket were different to those on the product pages in 3 cases.Then, tried to sign up with a business account and the process forces you to open an email and confirm. Fair enough. But after half an hour of waiting and several reattempts at sending the email, there is still no email. It came over an hour later.When setting up said account it asks (and forces you to answer) 'where do you like to shop' and you have to select one of their stores. I am based 80 miles from my nearest store hence why I order online. I don't, and never have visited my most local store. The postcode validator is also broken (you can't have gaps). Generally website UX is terrible. Plus, after creating my account, finally, and getting to the checkout stage...my postcode has been changed by 2 characters?!

Why would we ever order from here again with such a shocking delivery service?Their excuse was that 1 item out of the order wasnt in stock. So they didnt bother? No notice? It shows how much they care about customer service.£40 for an order that never arrived! I cant believe it. And again, 0 communication. It takes 5 minutes to call or text or set up an auto text that somebody at the warehouse could send to let us know that we don’t need go stay in the house 7-7. articleTitle: Why do I keep wasting my time trying to re-order
articleText: Placed order online, in stock and delivery to local Tesco store available and payment confirmed.  Next day order cancelled and refund issued (not by me!).  Repeated procedure and lo and behold cancelled again.  I have today spent 45 mins including holding, being told this happens if issue with stock or payment which they confirmed was not the issue in both instances.  Would speak to team leader if I could hold, unfortunately then cut off!!!!  Really do want item so re-ordered opening an account and different payment method so we will wait and see.I was tempted to just place order and pay for delivery but don't see why I should pay £40 for delivery when it is offered to Tesco. I would love to be busy assembling my item.UPDATE - third time order placed today, used different payment method which was approved and also opened IKEA account.  What a waste of time no less than 7 hrs later again order cancelled and refund issued.  Please get your act in gear, this is useless I now have to consider (as I want this item) whether to pay £40 and see if they will see the order through or spend even more time on the phone just to get cut off.  Please contact me IKEA.

The worst company I have ever dealt with ,shockingly poor customer service they just don't care, for them customers are just statistics and  numbers robotic responses robotic excuses even though they know it's their fault. Booked a mattress collection return 1 month ago got a text the day before all confirmed, took day off waited all day dint turn up, called ikea only to be told that  it was cancelled that's despite  me confirming the collection for the next day. Second  collection date i was given was in 4 weeks time absolutely ridiculous i have to wait for 2 month for a mattress to be collected , this company is a joke NEVER AGAIN !!!!

On 9/23/23, I called to arrange the return of this item and spoke to Hassan.  He processed the pick up and told me I can schedule it or any day I wanted.  Being that I ordered the sofa version of uppland for delivery on 10/7, I asked him if I can schedule the pick up/return for 10/6/23.  He said yes, and told me that he scheduled the pick up for that date, and I needed to call anytime before the 6th to pay a nominal fee (he said likely $60 USD.)I called the next week to process payment, and was notified the fee was $199.  I was also told by the agent I spoke to that there was NOT a scheduled pick up for that date, and that was not how the pick up was arranged..  She informed me that pick up was arranged AFTER I made payment, and that I would receive a call within 72 hours for scheduling pick up of the loveseat.  (contradicting Hassan.)After the 72 hour mark -- not receiving a call -- I called AGAIN (10/4) and was told by another agent that Ikea did NOT call to schedule the pickup, but that I had to call to schedule the pickup. (contradicting the last 2 agents.) While this woman was helping me, she put me on hold for TWENTY minutes, and then the call was disconnected.I called back, and while reviewing this with a male agent, I was transferred mid-sentence to the closest Connecticut store to leave a message for Rebecca at the New Haven office resolution department.Rebecca returned my call, but told me she could not assist me and passed the ball to another agent, who she said would be calling me the next day.I did receive a call the next day from another male agent, who left a voicemail for me telling me he could not help me and to call the 888-888 phone number.This is a pattern of terrible customer service, ineptitude, and blatant disregard for a customer who has spent thousands over the last several months furnishing my new home.  All to arrange pick up of a loveseat.Thankfully, pickup was arranged (without calling me, so the date did not work.). I called today and spoke to agent Deena, who graciously and promptly arranged for a new date, which hopefully processed without error.I'm furious at the lack of care involved in this transaction.  I strongly recommend you look into how these agents handled this experience, since no one seems to know how to process a return, as I was given many different scenarios that all contradicted each other.

Over priced mediocre fake furniture with industry worst customer service. I purchased 3 bedroom pieces. One of the faces of two draw nightstand was chipped so I reached out and they said they would send a replacement. Nearly two weeks later it arrives in an oversized box with zero protection so of course one of the corners was blown out. I called and was left on hold for 10 minutes B4 hanging up and calling again. The next rep left me on hold for 9 minutes until I hung up and called again. The third rep was clueless but at least didn't leave me on indefinite hold. I had basically given up and was ready to return everything but upon being informed I'd have to disassemble everything I reluctantly agreed to wait for a replacement of the replacement. That took 16 minutes, that's 35 minutes today, plus two prior calls to get first replacement and check status of. So moral of the story is IKEA SUCKS and don't start assembling until you checked every piece, than wait for replacement before assembling in case they keep failing you, your still free to return their trash furniture.

I've just moved to a new apartment that has no furniture. So, my family and I trusted that Ikea could help us having a great experience furnishing and decorating our home.However, we had a few troubles with the biggest order (in price and quantity of items).The first problem was the delivering, the first attempt did not happen. The driver/courier went to a wrong address (I guess he was in another similar building close to mine based on the photos he showed us). He tried to call me but I was at work and in a meeting, so I couldn't answer the call. But if he had come to the correct address, he would see a sticker close to our bell containing my wife's phone number, and could complete the deliver successfully. I had to call the driver and Ikea to request another attempt of delivering as soon as possible. As I said before, my apartment has no furniture, so every day counts. Hopefully, Ikea allowed a second attempt at the same day.But, that's when the second problem begins. The driver/courier wasn't happy with this outcome.So, they were NOT careful with our items/packages. My wife reported they basically dropped the packages careless at the floor.Finally, but not a surprise at all, we had the third problem. A lot of packages got damage, and three items were affected. Sadly, we only saw all the damage when we were assembling the furniture. For example, the back part of my daughter's wardrobe is severely damaged in at least four places. It seems it was threw from a higher place or maybe it hit something hard.The other two damaged items have some small damage and other kind of marks on them.In summary, now we have two already assembled wardrobes that got marks on them.And another one half assembled that cannot be used.We already raised a claim on Ikea Customer Portal twice (yes, and they did not reply yet). Moreover, there is no option to replace only the damage parts. So, we kind were obligated to use the two items that less damage, and request the replacement of our daughter's wardrobe that is severely damaged. My daughter's clothes are still in a travel luggage since our home country.
They promise 10-year warranty, but make it absolutely impossible to contact them, making their "warranty" worthless.

I wish they’d open one of their High Street stores in Middlesbrough we need something in the area to help reinvigorate the town. Easy access and replace empty department store the nearest ones are Leeds and Newcastle which are on congested motorway routes. Middlesbrough has A19 and A66

I am doing a kitchen remodel with IKEA cabinets and appliances  and it has been the most stressful, time consuming, and horrible customer service experience that I can remember. They have charged me over $1500 for items they didn't send from my original order that were ALREADY PAID FOR and sent several items more than once and charged me for each of them as well.I started by designing the kitchen with someone online. DO NOT DO THIS. I thankfully  decided I should go in to check on everything. When I went in the person I worked with at the East Palo Alto store in northern California explained that so much was wrong with the design that she had to go through it all to correct the dimensions and replace and change items that were ordered.I was grateful very for her time and after several hours together and a payment for all of the items on my shopping list except for 9 items that were placed on a waitlist I thought I was finished. BEWARE, your waitlist items are for you to find. I had to call over and over again to try and locate them. I did that and after two weeks was finally told that two of the items were no longer made by IKEA and that a replacement SHOULD be coming in 2024.They sold me this kitchen design in early September.  That meant I couldn't finish my cabinets. I searched and found them at other stores, but they said their policy does not allow for transfers between stores. No one seemed to care that they sold me a kitchen plan that could not be completed.My original items for delivery were promised in 2  shipments, one on a Sat so I didnt miss another day of work. They were finally sent in different 5 deliveries that I had to be home for with a window of 24 hours each until they texted that morning with a 4-hour window.I had to keep track of what was still missing and make endless calls that included hold times of over an hour each time just to be told they would be sent separately. When I finally thought I had all of the items, my cabinet guy went through them and made a list of  what was still missing based on my original receipt.I called the kitchen resolutions dept, as instructed, and after 9 hours on the phone over several days begging to talk to a supervisor (one was never available) I cried and they sent me through to a very nice gentleman who had a woman named Amber call me back.We spoke for 3.5 hours just that night as I explained what I had gone through. She said it was the worst customer service experience she had ever encountered and was so sorry. She said that she'd be happy to send the stuff over but indicated that I would have to pay for it again in order to get the items here asap (I had paid contractors doing nothing based on the precise schedule I was given by IKEA) but that Id  be called within 24 hours and refunded for all of it right away. She gave me her extension and I thought I was finally through with the nightmare. I was so wrong. The endless stress and frustration continued and has gone on for about a month now.Ive tracked my calls with them and I'm up to 18.5 hours either explaining my case and relisting the items still missing as well as the ones they sent twice without my request and charged me for anyway. Each time I was promised that I would get a call within 24 to 48 hours. I have now been promised that eight times and laugh when they say it. No one has ever called.When I tried to reach out to the helpful Amber to tell her I did not get my refund  I was told over and over again that they can't call extensions from their customer service lines and no one should have told me that and that they had no idea who she was. I emailed her several times. She ghosted me. Never heard back.In the meanwhile, I can't wrote to me and said they found my to cover panels that we're still missing and told me I had to buy a gift card and use that gift card to purchase them and just write them back with the information after I made the purchase. I spent another $129 in an effort to finish my project but my information went into the ether and I never heard back from anyone. I called to get refunded it was promised I would but never received a refund for that eiher.When I called to ask them to at least come pick up the stuff they delivered that was NOT REQUESTED they asked that I pay $89 for the pick up process. I am at a loss. I have not received one dime in a refund. I have huge packages that won't fit in my car and no recourse whatsoever. PLEASE LEARN FROM MY EXPERIENCE. They are great at the outset but anything that requires customer service will result in hours of hold times, promises that never come to fruition and endless case and order numbers you're suppose to keep track of just to be told theyll call for the refund and never hear a thing. It might seem like the budget option but it is not. I'm so frustrated and upset and THERE IS NOTHING I CAN DO. BEWARE!!

articleTitle: Don't shop there if you need things delivered
articleText: The company does not understand what customer service is at all. Folks over there are doing the minimal work they can when answering phones or on the chat and passing customer to someone else. The delivery service is a joke. Their delivery is a guess game on when it will arrive and if it will arrive. IKEA takes no responsibility for delivery or schedule. They pass you to their delivery partner who, in turn, passes you back to IKEA. I waited once 4 hours on already scheduled delivery and no one showed up. Then, after spending 6 hours on the phone between IKEA and their delivery partner, I was rescheduled for next day; just to find out that the delivery partner rescheduled me for week later, without letting me know. I was long time customer but now, I am done! Never again!

articleTitle: Last week i had my old sofa replaced…
articleText: Last week i had my old sofa replaced with an Ikea new convertible sofa bed, once unfolded i discovered that it is more comfortable than my full king size bed. It was worth the money and no - it is not hard to assemble it at all.
Bought a tv cabinet  3 doorScrew don’t holds hinges properlyDoors all sitting at an angle don’t waste your money

IKEA online kitchen planner difficult to use - switched to a free online room planner in the end, which was better designed, had plenty of options, and easier to use.Kitchen planning online all automated, involved, and easy to miss an email leading to the appointment being cancelled.Re-booked online appointment - had email direct from IKEA employee this time - only able to send one email in reply.There's no record of my new appointment against my login, can't add any documents. Called the customer service line given for kitchen planning, 5 different sets of options, some sets of options didn't apply to kitchen planning (were about buying, faults or returns etc.). Got through to someone who said the line was bad and they couldn't understand.Really frustrating big company and extremely poorly thought out IT.Will go elsewhere for my kitchen
Besta cupboards are total schrott.Just google "Besta Wobbly" before you waste your time and money, as I did.

IKEA Tvattad wash machine worked terribly since new and eventually broke down after about a year and ~3 months. IKEA sent me to electrolux, electrolux said everything with the machine was fine and charged me ~1100dkk for the "service". Complaint was not accepted and I had to buy another wash machine.In total: 4000dkk for the wash machine, 1100 for electrolux, 1000 for VVS to connect it, so around 6000dkk plus so much time wasted on this garbage product with "sorry, no can do" attitude.Never again.

articleTitle: bad selection but there is one good…
articleText: bad selection but there is one good chair i got for gaming

IKEA Houston is Terrible. Not the experience I've had with other IKEA locations. I made a sizable order on their website. Received a text from IKEA that one item was not on the sales floor but would be shipped from the distribution center and be available for pickup the next day. Never heard anything back. I called the 888 number and couldn't get a straight answer then was hung up on. Called back. The new person proceeds to tell me she can't give me an update and there's nothing she can do about it. I now don't have my items and don't even know when they're going to be available for pickup. The store is 1-1/2 hours from my house. So I can't just skip up there. I asked if there was someone I could talk to higher up, and the rep said "I could try but it won't do any good. Call back in 4 or 5 hours"Shameful and disappointing.

articleTitle: Ordered for pick up collection at tesco…
articleText: Ordered for pick up collection at tesco store between 8am-10am no email/text to say order was ready to be collected. Got here at 9.20 and van was already gone. They are meant to stay at collection point until 10am as per their website.  30 minutes on hold to customer service.

articleTitle: I purchased a standing desk from IKEA…
articleText: I purchased a standing desk from IKEA quite some time ago and initially, I was pleased with the product. However, after the motor failed, I was sent a replacement—only for that motor to fail as well. Unfortunately, customer support has been unwilling to offer a second replacement, essentially telling me that one replacement is all I'm entitled to.I'm increasingly convinced that their customer support is simply a bot spitting out canned responses based on the company's terms and conditions. This experience has eroded my trust in IKEA, and I won't be shopping there again.It's disheartening to see that the majority of reviews echo my sentiments; a staggering 74% are 1-star reviews. It seems to me that the company has grown too large to care about individual customers, focusing instead on revenue generation at the expense of customer satisfaction.I will be exploring alternative options for my future furniture needs.

articleTitle: Dont ever support this Company or buy…
articleText: Dont ever support this Company or buy their products! We have ordered a kitchen from Them, and Then they make the tabletop wrong, and Then they dont even wanna deliever a New correct tabletop within a couple of days eventhough they made a mistake!!! We are still waiting for the New tabletop, and it has now been 3 weeks, and they havent even got to our case jet 😡😡😡Then we ordered 2 products from Them afterwards, because we needed it for the kitchen that is being made, this woth deleivery. And Then they only deleiver 1 of the things????!What is wrong with this business????They dont even apoligize or offer some extra service?!! And they dont pay our workers, for having to work more days, now when Ikea is late!Hate this Company!!!!!!

Affordable prices and good return policy. Online shopping is not good and shipping/delivery is expensive. Best to buy things in the store. Be careful about the quality of some of the furniture and the assembly requirements. Great kitchen items like appliances, cabinets, countertops, and dinnerware/flatware. Good lighting and kitchen tools/gadgets.

Greedy company. Insane fees for delivery - even for smaller items. Even the option to pick up yourself has an expensive fee.I gave in to the fees but still couldn't order because they don't even offer delivery options in my area - even though they did just a few months ago.The site and app aren't good either - I had to go in incognito just ot get the checkout. Oh, and it keeps logging me out even if I check the option for it to not do that, and every time I log in they empty my basket.Nothing about the shopping experience is smooth.

articleTitle: Misleading terms and conditions that caused me a hell lot of pain
articleText: After being promised a doorstep delivery by your delivery person, he ignored all my calls and left everything downstairs with no concierge to supervise it. The person deliberately ignored my calls repeatedly and thanks to your horrible service, my years of subsided spine problem has been re-triggered. If I had to do all the heavy-lifting by myself, I'd have just gone to a Penguin Pick-up. A cab would've cost me half of the money I paid you guys to cause me double the problem, pain and torture. NEVER recommending IKEA to anyone else, never shopping from you folks ever again. Thank you for looking after the ill-being of your customer.

articleTitle: First and last time I shop at IKEA
articleText: I ordered a Kallax 5 x 5 shelving system and paid £40 for delivery. Got a delivery date for the Friday. As Friday approached I saw a tracking number but it did not seem to work. However, it still said online my delivery could be anytime up to 7pm. Waited in all day and nothing! So I thought maybe it would come the next day, tried to contact online chat which no-one ever seems to answer. So I phoned them on Monday and they put me on hold for ages which got cut off and then I got an email saying my order had been cancelled with my refund taking up to 12 days (and they are not joking, its been over a week and I am still waiting for the refund). I have never shopped at IKEA before and I never will again.

Pax wardrobe door adjustmentI am sick of watching youtube videos that show things so quickly. Why can't Ikea include a paper diagram of how to adjust the door hinges.This is the last Ikea item I will buy. Had issues with furniture missing predrilled holes for screws. The worst customer service of any company too.

I'm happy with IKEA overall. But I feel obliged to report here that the "Recensioner" on ikea.se is filtered. The many products I gave 5 star appear immediately but the one I gave 1 star has not appeared after nearly a month.

The English-speaking customer service hangs up after a 15-min waiting if you ask whether they could help you in English. Not even considering replying in Spanish, the customer support agent simply hangs up the call. Really frustrating!

articleTitle: Incompentency and luck of trust in Ireland
articleText: Unfortunately, the zero mark isn't possible!Received a wardrobe with a damaged part, and was told it would be replaced and delivered a few days later. It was rescheduled three times with no communication to the customer just an automatic email. And it didn’t turn up.Called Customer service several times and the problem is in Ireland. They can't cope with the deliveries the customer paid for. It's a really bad service and zero logistics plan.The Customer service changed the plans and tried to force them to deliver a new wardrobe, in place of one single part, and IKEA Dublin continues doing the same. Rescheduling the delivery services over and over again. I believe trying to force you to cancel it and ask for a refund.Almost one month passed, and I don't have my wardrobe just a long list of complaint numbers about IKEA Dublin service. It's a shame a big company like IKEA let that happen. Never again!My advice for any other customer in Ireland: NEVER BUY ONLINE!!! THE DELIVERY SERVICE YOU PAY FOR IS A JOKE AND THERE IS NOT GUARANTEE YOU WILL RECEIVE YOUR PRODUCT OR MONEY BACK!!!

articleTitle: Only because I can’t give zero
articleText: Only because I can’t give zero! Damaged part, told it would be delivered the next day, didn’t turn up. Told it would be delivered the day after, didn’t turn up! Spoke to customer service about making a complaint, told to respond to the email, didn’t get acknowledged. Spoke to customer services again to be offered a £30 E voucher and to take it or leave it. I said I wouldn’t accept it and they said they wouldn’t offer anything else and the complaint wouldn’t go any further!
Terrible web site (cz version). Planners are not working properly or at all, favorites sometime disappear.

articleTitle: Been waiting for kitchen for +6 months!
articleText: In March, I ordered a kitchen island from IKEA Amsterdam, hoping for the quality and reliability IKEA is known for. However, what ensued was a frustrating experience with missing Askersund components. Even more concerning was IKEA's inability to respond adequately to my numerous attempts at communication.Warning to potential buyers:If you're considering purchasing a kitchen from IKEA Amsterdam, I strongly advise you to double-check whether all necessary components are in stock. The ongoing stock issues have caused significant delays and headaches for me. The lack of any proactive communication from IKEA only exacerbates the problem.Areas for Improvement:1. Customer Service: An improvement in communication is urgently needed.2. Stock Management: Ensure that stock levels match what's promised to customers.3. Transparency: If there are stock issues, inform customers in advance.My experience with purchasing a kitchen from IKEA Amsterdam was far from ideal. I'd advise other potential buyers to tread cautiously and be fully aware of potential stock issues.

articleTitle: The kitchen planner loves to sell
articleText: The kitchen planner loves to sell, most of your items will arrive, but some won't.  They will tell you that they will be in stock soon.  But maybe they won't.  But ikea made money and your kitchen will look like garbage.

IKEA Greenwich, the worst customer service ever and dirty plates, cups and cutlery in the restaurant. More complaints about this store by customers than other store I know. No contact number to call Customer Service. For a National household name this store is a mockery of the company name. Staff couldn’t care less how rude and aggressive they are to customers and even each other on occassion. Team needs a complete overhaul from management downwards. Otherwise there is no hope for this store and even less hope for the poor customers subject to this dreadful store with the worst customer service ever.

articleTitle: Awful service - shame as their products are usually pretty good
articleText: Awful service. Shame as their products are usually pretty good. I ordered a butter dish, they sent me something completely different, when I asked for a replacement they said it is no longer in stock, so then I asked for a full refund (delivery cost + ~£3 worth of other stuff I added to the basket) they refused and said they could only refund me for the incorrect item. No apologies from them at all, customer service agent Chiatiah was rather curt and rude on the Live chat. Don't order from IKEA if you can avoid it.

articleTitle: I'm not a native german speaker, so what?
articleText: I'm not a native german speaker, but I can absolutely maintain a conversation. I called the reklamation department to discuss the warranty of a kitchen we installed 2 years ago. According to IKEA's own website, you have up to 25 years of warranty.Little did I know that the agent had psychic powers.The minute I mentioned that there is an issue with the sink and the Arbeitsplatte she immediately said that's the customers fault. They do not make themselves responsible for any water related damages to a SINK or to the Arbeitsplatte altogether.After stopping her to say that she cannot even know how bad the problem is bc she hasn't even seen a picture yet she simply said she doesn't understand my german level and she encourage me to work on that (?!!)She even went on to ask me how long have I been studying german and how long have I been in this country.At this point I just want to burn my entire kitchen down bc I don't want to see any IKEA furniture ever again.

Worst customer support and process ever. They’ve done a series of blunders over last week with a simple replacement item. It has taken me around 5 calls and I’ve yet to receive the item.If I am not compensated for the stress, misery and waste of my time this is a case for the Ombudsman. I am hoping someone responsible will listen to the call recordings for all my phone calls to understand the shambles their customer services is in.A week ago I called in to get a replacement for an item that is under warranty. The agent agreed it was under warranty and transferred me to another agent who said I’ll have to come and collect as the item was not available for delivery. I challenged why should I be required to collect (by the way, I could see the item online available for delivery from nearest store). When I challenged the line dropped (or he hung up??). Nobody called me back so called again after a couple of hours and this time someone was able to book a delivery for last Friday saying I will receive text message with a 4hr slot closer to time. I also asked to change delivery address as we’ve moved!!Come Friday and I had not received a text or anything, so I called again and asked where my order was, to be told that the previous agent had made a mistake in placing the order and this time they’d get it right. Then the agent tells me that I need to call again on Monday as the item was going to come in stock (all this time I can see the item is available online). When I said why do I need to call and why can’t they place an order for me based on this and the last call, she said ‘that’s the process’. When I said I want to put in a complaint the agent laughed and said she was from the complaints department and ‘the complaint won’t go anywhere’ (horrendous and unacceptable customer service).I hung up and called again and repeated my whole dilemma to a new agent who on a very long call tells me that the item is discontinued and everything I’ve been told so far was a lie. He then tells me he can send an alternative item that will fit, but I will have to pay for the difference. I challenged that as well and after a few long holds he confirmed they’d do a like for like replacement with out any charges. The item was booked for today, and I got text messages yesterday and today that the item will be delivered in a 4hr slot.When the driver called me closer to arrival I’ve realised he was on his way to the old address.Now I have a fitter coming in tomorrow for another work and the item will not arrive on time. When I mentioned this to customer service on the call today all they could offer me was £20 and increased to £30 after a 5min hold.This is absolutely unacceptable customer service from IKEA. I do not need a goodwill compensation but expect them to pay for the fitting which I’ll have to arrange separately.If I don’t get a response on my complaint soon, this is for sure going to the ombudsman.

articleTitle: Wrong cabinet for a kitchen and no refund?!
articleText: I have worked with Ikea Lichtenberg in Berlin on my kitchen planning (which is a very expensive purchase as everyone knows) and on the day of the building it was found out that they had sent a white cabinet for a fully black kitchen. I was told on the day of the building that I either had to wait an indefinite amount of time for the black cabinet to be delivered, leaving me in a ridiculous situation without a fully built kitchen or I could keep the white one and ask for a 15% refund on the whole kitchen order to Ikea. Since the cabinet was inside anyways, I decided to accept and ask for the refund.On the phone I was told that I couldn't receive any refund because in the original order (made by the kitchen planner, not by me) there were 4 door joints missing that Ikea did not make me pay for. Since I had not noticed those small parts were missing in a FULL KITCHEN ORDER, I was blamed. The cabinet and the joints sort of had the same price, so in their eyes the fact that I was given a white cabinet instead of a black one for a 4000 euros kitchen apparently had no importance.They might do in price, but 4 door joints and a CABINET do not have the same value. It is not the same thing. Not to mention that I was told a straight out lie about the 15% discount that also contributed to my decision to keep the white cabinet in the first place. On the phone I was treated like an hysteric by the Ikea Lichtenberg customer service for trying to point it out.This is not the way you treat a client. I feel fooled as a client that had always trusted Ikea for its professionalism. (The builders were lovely and very professional though)

Hello ,I bough a bad and a mattress from Ikea and ordered delivery, they brought me bad but mattress never came and no one told me it's sold our after days I can they say it's sold out I go to ikea again they refund i 'm buying new mattress which supposed to arrive latest on Sunday and if any issue they supposed to call me no call no mattress and no call support no know know anything when i'm calling there . So I hope when they see my public post someone will contact me .

I have lived internationally for a number of years and I have used IKEA world-wide and I have never had a problem before – my recent experience does not reflect well on IKEA in the US and it has given a very bad first impression. IKEA advertises itself as being able to furnish homes and so an order of the size that I placed should not be out of the ordinary.  I have not had issues with other companies eg Amazon and so it highlights the system failures clearly evident at IKEA. I have just moved to the US and I was so excited about my move; I have had a wonderful transition with my employers; I found a superb apartment in a beautiful area - everyone I have interacted with have been so welcoming and friendly. Yet the extremely poor experience I have had with IKEA these past three weeks has diminished all the positives - IKEA have so nearly ruined my move to the US and tarnished what should have been an smooth, stress-free transition.
I like IKEA, it's affordable price and fast service.Bought many times online and delivery successfully in front of the door.Will always purchase at IKEA, but please lower the delivery fee.

articleTitle: I ordered furniture online from one of…
articleText: I ordered furniture online from one of the Ikeas in Toronto at the end of August. I came from Europe for a few days, especially to pick up the order and assemble the furniture (last week). Not only did they delay the order and tell us about it not even 24 hours before, but when the rescheduled date came, they still did not send everything they promised. The customer service is extremely rude and lies about every detail when asked. Pardon my French, but they will not move their asses to help you out. Forget about any civilised conversation with them. They do not care, especially if you are not a local.

I was given different phone numbers and waited on hold there for a long time..and again told everyone about this problem.And how many nerves I spent for a spoiled mood and a day is very difficult to tell. Well my son slept on the floor. I don't know who to say Thank you for such a "Service"..and I would like to get a good discount for Something that is not our problem.My regards.
