articleTitle: Crooks liars and thieves, stay clear of this company
articleText: I placed an order for a clock, a filing cabinet and some other small items.  Based on my past experience with their sloppy shipping practices, the heavy filing cabinet was thrown together as expected in a large box with the clock and other items banging around on its way to my destination. I received a broken clock, defective looking filing cabinet parts, bent metal with cracking and paint peeling everywhere. I called The customer abuse line and this time the rep was very pleasant in her conversation with me and promised to replace the broken clock and refund me for the filing cabinet. I requested the refund in the form of store credit so I could put it towards another purchase with the company.  I also asked if I needed to pack the unit back up for them to retrieve it since I had started assembling it and paused the process once I realize there were some defective parts. I was instructed to take photos of the defects and provide them via email so an assessment could be done to see if the item needed to be sent back or disposed of. After supplying the photos via email there was no confirmation email of a return being accepted, photos received...NOTHING.  3 weeks passed and I called them to inquire about my refund and was told that a refund was issued 5 days or so prior to me calling so I thanked the rep and went on my merry way.3 more weeks passed and still no gift card arrived via email I called them once again and this time a rep told me a refund was issued but it was back to my original form of payment. I told him there was no refund received on my end and asked them for this information in writing and to provide some kind of confirmation and this is where things got really weird. The rep claimed this was impossible because the case was closed. He insisted he could provide no proof  then put me on hold for almost a half and hr only to come back and tell me he had nothing. I asked to speak to a supervisor he said his supervisor insisted that he should refuse to transfer me to anyone higher up. I insisted on speaking to a manager and he once again put me on hold for about ten minutes then came back saying that he went ahead and canceled the original refund and issued another one but still could provide nothing in writing about the specifics of the refund. At this point I told him that I am going to hang up and call back to speak to someone else because I felt like I was getting the run around and simply pure dishonesty.  I attempted to call back and all I got was a message saying "You're call cannot be completed at this time" .So to sum it all up this crooked company shipped me a defective item, lied to me about refunding my money and after I called in to get down to the bottom of it I was continually lied to then they blocked my number from calling their 1888 customer abuse line while still holding my refund hostage.I have been shopping with them locally for over 20 years and I am officially done with them and a charge back will be filed for the defective product they sent me.

My husband ordered online two cabinets on July 23rd 2023 amounting to £130.00, along with a couple of other things. These were due to be delivered on July 27th. One small item arrived then and on the next day another part arrived. When asking when the two cabinets would come, the van man was unable to tell us. Then a delivery van arrived delivering to our neighbours but nothing for us! On querying by telephone, where were our cabinets? My husband was told that they did not have any and they were out stock. Upon asking why did they take the money for them, they just replied it would be refunded! Now 14days later and several phone calls no monies have been refunded! So somewhere our £130.00 is being held long with the £40 delivery charge! Unless our neighbours have them, we are being ripped off by IKEA who could have just not taken money for products they say they did not have.

articleTitle: Ikea's terrible customer service and delivery service
articleText: I was left thoroughly disappointed by my recent encounter with Ikea's delivery service. Despite shelling out a significant fee for delivery, the delivery team adamantly refused to transport heavy items upstairs. Regrettably, Ikea's customer service proved inadequate in addressing this concern, casting doubt upon the brand's dedication to customer contentment and accountability. This distressing incident has significantly marred my perception of Ikea. The premium I paid for delivery proved futile, leaving me exasperated and prompting a reevaluation of my future interactions with the company.Also, my endeavor to engage in Ikea's touted furniture reselling initiative took an unforeseen detour. Upon arrival at the store with my furniture in tow, I was informed that reassembly was mandatory for eligibility, a stipulation not sufficiently emphasized on their website. While the notion of ecologically sound furniture resale is laudable, the unexpected demand for reassembly injected an unwelcome degree of inconvenience into the process. This served to diminish the overall experience, highlighting a dissonance between the promoted ease and the practical realities of the procedure.

articleTitle: An absolute nightmare to deal with.
articleText: An absolute nightmare to deal with.My husband and I had been shopping around for sets of bookshelves, and found the perfect modular set on the IKEA website. Since the nearest IKEA is 2 hours away, our first plan (back when we were younger and naive and assumed IKEA functioned like any respectable box store) was to order the items to this store and make a day of it - drive in, peruse the store to see if there was anything else we wanted, eat meatballs for lunch, pick up our order, drive home. Sounded lovely.EXCEPT. IKEA doesn't ship to its own stores? If you want to pick-up, it has to be from some random 'pick-up location' - like, say, a parking lot - which you STILL get charged to use?  Well fine, we thought, we can still make a day of it.  Went to place the order online, but OH WAIT! some of the items in the order are listed as "not available for pick-up." Well, I don't need HALF a set of anything, that would be stupid and pointless. The name of my shelves isn't HALFENSHELV, is it?WELL fine, we thought again, what about delivery, then? Ah, look! All items are available! Wonderful!  Placed the order, picked one of the delivery dates THEY offered, recieved confirmation, and it's off the bookcase races we go!(I'll spare you the extra rant here about the TWELVE HOUR delivery window, and the $150 delivery fee, because we don't have all day.)(Though IKEA seems to think differently.)The day of delivery, I am emailed the tracking information for my order - oooh, fancy! I can watch my shelves trundle around Ontario in real time! Stop 1, stop 2, stop 3... Go shelves, go!  EXCEPT... huh. Weird. Why are there 2 tracking numbers?  Ok... they've split my order in half?  Three pieces with one tracking number, one piece with the other tracking number. So while truck #1 is dutifully dropping orders left and right like the little engine that could, number #2 isn't moving at all. In fact, it's still listed as 'being packaged for delivery.'So I call IKEA for what I thought was simple query, and unbeknowst to me, embarked on the Worst Customer Service Experience of All Time.After an hour and fifteen minutes on the phone, I am told, 'that item isn't coming because it's on backorder.'But, I insist, the website clearly said it was available!'That happens all the time,' they explain, as if this is a perfectly reasonable justification.  Which, for the official record, it is NOT.  'When it comes in we'll ship it.''No, I travel frequently, and will not be home for the next 3 weeks - let's schedule it for the Saturday I get back, then.''We can't schedule anything that far in advance.'  (FFS, REALLY?)  'We'll put a hold on the order and you can call to book that day when you get back.'WELL FINE.  LET'S FRICKEN DO THAT, THEN.Fast forward 3 weeks - back home, rested and rejuvenated and ready to finish the HALFENSHELV that's been partially assembled in my livingroom since last month.I hold my breath, pinch my nose and call IKEA customer service, on Monday morning.  The following is a brief synopsis:Nope, can't deliver to you Saturday. Care to book a day off work, cause we can do next Monday!  No?  Next Saturday? Oh, at a wedding, ok.  Thursday? Oh, right, that pesky job again. Ok is there a date you'd like? Ah, sorry, no, WE CAN'T BOOK THAT FAR IN ADVANCE.  Ok, well, you can always cancel the order and try again later.TRY AGAIN? I'M SORRY, WHEN DID THIS BECOME A CARNIVAL GAME?  SHOULD I CHECK WHICH PLANET IS IN RETROGRADE BEFORE ORDERING NEXT TIME?Seriously, though. What the hell, ikea. What the honest, ever-loving hell.Oh, and in the midst of all that, they hung up on me. But I called back, purely out of spite at this point, and am now at hour #3, with rep #4.So now I'm taking a day off work, to (HOPEFULLY) be done with this horseshit once and for all.And, of course, IKEA offered nothing to compensate for any of this. (Oh, sorry - they graciously offered to waive the second delivery fee.  You know, the SECOND $150 they were going to charge me for stupidly expecting that the one order I ordered, as one order, would be delivered as one order? Yes, they waived that.  How benevolent!)In the end, however, I WAS offered an extra $150 gift card (we'll see if it ever arrives! Knock down all five milk bottles, win a refund!), only after I made this offer to customer service rep #4:"Give me a refund, OR... just say these exact words back to me: 'IKEA doesn't care about you, or any of our customers.  We lied, and we didn't deliver, because you, and your time, don't matter to us.'  Say this to me, and I'll hang up satisfied."I highly recommend everyone try this, because hearing them stutter and stammer out off-script excuses about how saying that would be 'disrepectful' to you (unlike the rest of the experience, of course), is the closest you'll ever come to feeling satisfied by an IKEA delivery.

We ordered, paid, arranged delivery. The night before they cancelled 2 of the modular units claiming they’d oversold and sent us one unit, 2 arms, and 3 covers. Annoying, but we forged ahead. Items came back in stock, we ordered, they waived delivery fee, we scheduled delivery. They contacted us to say the original refund had gone through so we had to pay again. Fine. Then, the night before the second delivery, they cancelled again. More annoyed but forged ahead. Came in stock again, but although it said available for delivery online, the order wouldn’t complete and customer service told us there must have been a problem on the website. Meanwhile, our first refund has gone through but not the second. And now they’re trying to tell us we only paid once. And we have one section of a 6-piece sofa and 2 covers with no bases. articleText: As many others have stated, my delivery was NEVER delivered. They do not honor their delivery window times that are texted to you, NOR will they KEEP YOU UPDATED. Terrible, terrible after sales/delivery/installation service.We bought kitchen appliances from IKEA Goya on 20 July.  We had no choice as we purchased a home with newly built IKEA kitchen furniture that was designed for the size of IKEA appliances.  After much consultation, we were assured of the compatibility of the appliances to the furniture, and the scheduled delivery and installation on 26 July.  When the delivery and installation personnel came, they told us the cabinets needed some modification that they cannot do.  This came as a surprise to us but we could not do anything.  They left the appliances with us, uninstalled.We had to go to IKEA Goya personally to settle the matter but customer service could not help us. Instead, they lectured us on their reporting protocols (can only act on a delivery report within 24 hours), instances of liability and their inability to do minor adjustments to the kitchen cabinets simply because we do not have a receipt in our name!  We offered to pay for the modification service but they said it cannot be done.  Since the agent who attended to us during our purchase was not reporting for work that day, all that customer service could offer was for us to schedule a meeting with him the following day and book a new installation date on 28 July!Frustrated, we had an independent carpentry crew do the minor modifications to the furniture (remove brackets to allow space for appliances to be introduced) to ensure that installation can proceed on 28 July.  We also went to the store again to meet with the agent to ensure that the installation will be on schedule.  We were assured of such.Come 28 July, from 9am to 9pm, we waited (and cancelled other schedules for this), but no one came.  We called at 4pm to make sure that the schedule was confirmed and were told that it was on the crew's work list and that they may be on their way.  At 9pm, another call to customer service and it was confirmed that they are unable to make it.  We were even asked, did anyone call you? (And by the way, we were always asked our phone number and told that we will receive a call--no call came.)  We were "offered" the next available schedule of Monday, the day that we clearly informed IKEA we will already be leaving.  And what were we told?  That's all that they can do.Now we are in a bind because this only gives us one option--rebook very expensive flights to wait for IKEA.  Pathetic.

articleTitle: Vert Bad Customer support and Refund process

articleTitle: Poor customer service at IKEA Melbourne
articleText: I am writing with great frustration with IKEA customer service.  I have purchase online some furnitures and expecting them to deliver on 17th July.  This has been planned by booking the slot with our building management to allow delivery on 17th July afternoon (1 TO 4PM).  And the installer is supposed to come the next day. With these, we had to sleep on the floor in sleeping bags for 2 nights.  Notes have been given on the order about the delivery time slot however on that day, the logistic partner - Kings Transport & Logistic company didn't contact us despite new number has been updated to IKEA.When we reached 4pm, someone from IKEA (Jason) called us to inform us that the driver would be lated.  Eventually the driver called us  around 4:30am and they asked about the location of the loading bay as well as its height.   They claimed that the address given wasn't complete but we have provided full information on our order. My daughter went downstairs to ensure delivery was possible since they were late. Building manager asked them to wait 5-10 mins since there was a truck unloading. He commented that they were late.  Then to our surprise, the delivery guy commented that they could cancel the order and not deliver.  Very very petty and rude to us but push the blame to the building manager.  It was such an unbelievable experience and I think that guy was crazy.  How could IKEA partner with a logistic company which has such a poor attitude?  The delivery guy with a wrap over his head (don't know his name) was complaining and complaining.  He acted like a king and refused to deliver our furniture.  We left with no furniture and the appointment with the installer was forced to cancel.   Then the delivery was rearranged on Tues, same thing happened that they had cancelled on our order.  They claimed that they had waited for 45 mins and there's no space for unloading. Again, it was not true.The delivery company has BIG issues with the people they had hired.  During the 3rd attempt, the team has shared with me that those 2 orders were delivered by subbies, not full time staff.  I am truly disappointed with IKEA as I am the customer to IKEA and not the logistic company.  Yet, they had not take responsibility to resolve the problem caused by their logistic partner. In the end, IKEA has refunded the delivery fee and I had to cancelled the assembly because of the long wait and again IKEA wasn't helping me out.  We had literally slept on the floor for the whole week.  This incident has given me a very bad impression on IKEA and their logistic service provider.  I hope the IKEA management could look into this matter else I have no confidence to patronise IKEA anymore.  Bear in mind, I am a regular customer of IKEA in other part of the world and I had never come across such bad service. It is such a BIG disappointment.

I visited Ikea fort Lauderdale with my family . For lunch we went to the cafeteria . The people serving were very very rude, impolite and non-cooperative. I left all the food and left. I do not accept to have such a treatment , especially that we were very polite to them. They act like they are giving food to prisoners. They do nto answer our question, always looking at the next person in line, and only on thing in mind, ket your food and move .Terrible food , terrible treatment. Stay out , you deserve better

articleTitle: Cheap company they dont respect their…
articleText: Cheap company they dont respect their clients. Don't believe their card gift.

articleTitle: DO NOT BUY A MATTRESS. If I could give a minus score I…
articleText: If I could give a minus score I would.......please please please never buy a mattress from IKEA, Our mattress is just 8 months old and it is dreadful, no longer flat, in fact it undulates like the waves on the sea, going up and down like a range of mountains and its getting worse, the surface is just a mass of bobbles despite have a good mattress protector on it. I rang the eshop here and was promised a call back...that never happened....managed to track down the email for the CEO and was promised some sort of response but yet again that didn't happen. They even went so far as to email to say my contact phone number was incorrect so they could not contact me.....that would be the same number they used to arrange delivery. Absolutely no customer service or after care.

articleText: I ordered but wasn't delivered for 4 times. Then I decided to cancel it and IKEA's employee told me that I will be refunded. I did not received it 14 days after, as it was supposed to arrive. I keep calling them but they are not able to find any solution.
The worst online shoping experience! The worst customer service You can ever had. The rudest staff! I ordered a product online in VA, USA. It was a horible experience

By far worst experience ever. We went to the store to pick out kitchen cabinets and draws. They wrote up an order for $2700. We called to find out when the remaining items were on backorder they said you have to figure it out based on your receipt. We had 40 items on the receipt. They all have codes and names of items. I can't believe such a big company can't figure out which items are on backorder!. Besides that many of the items were wrong. Well now if you have to return it you have to go into the store and figure out which items match and which don't

articleTitle: The floor plan of the store is…
articleText: The floor plan of the store is deliberately designed to trap one there and to make it as difficult as possible to leave in a timely manner.It is discriminatory as it is detrimental to the mental health of those who suffer panic attacks, ptsd etc.I believe that it is dangerous in event of a fire as well.I've tried to navigate the shop several times and have found the arrows etc often direct a person into dead ends. They highlight the way to other sections in large bold lettering. Rarely is the word EXIT mentioned.Under Australian law I believe the store layouts are unsafe and discriminatory and should be changed.I have written to Ikea twice about my concerns, but they HAVE NOT given me the courtesy of a response.
Ikea in Sicily, Italy is a disaster to deal with. Avoid using their transport service (Rhenus) or Task Rabbit for assembly both never turn up. IKEA yet to apologize for their poor service.

articleTitle: I went there to get a shelf for my…
articleText: I went there to get a shelf for my bedroom, they didn't have one that I was looking for, but they did have a good enough alternative.

i hate IKEA. Ive fallen victime to them 3 times now and it's my own fault. Have placed at least three 600$ orders over the course of 2 years and not one of them was even remotely correct...and the CS to support it was even worse. Paying double delivery for damaged items, items being cancelled 1 day or day of delivery but not able to adjust rest of order, items arriving broken, pick up times not correct, delivery vendor problems, the list goes on.

Almeria Ikea.After such a build up and looking forward to visiting and buying things.What a disappointing experience.Only a third of the stock is not on display, and what was on display looked like it a warehouse and thrown together.Most of the merchandise you have to order on a screen at the do it yourself checkouts, then go around the corner to a small desk and room get your purchases  which is totally unorganisedIf you wanted to eat a meal, then it is like a fast food chain, order on a screen and not actually see the food.We went to Burger King for quicker service and less queues.Ikea have made so many cut backs in this store, the pleasure has gone in using them, definitely not worth the 100km round trip.Bye bye Ikea.

The rating of this company on this resource doesn't seem to be truthful. I personally order and buy lots of stuff from Ikea once I have a need.Shelves worth their weight in gold, and some other handy things too. Simple and useful! Everything is about lagom concept spread in the Swedish culture.
tres bien, pas eu de probleme, super concept

Ikea Lakeside - Breakfast was bland and not fresh, was also not really edible.  After shopping we used their collect service and had to wait for 40mins for a simple hand held small item.  The collection screens are not all working and are confusing.

articleTitle: I purchased ikea products from the…
articleText: I purchased ikea products from the Costa Mesa store. Fortunately, I had the same Ikea delivery man, Estefan, twice in a few weeks.  This gentleman was so amazing and extremely professional and exceedingly helpful. He definitely went above and beyond in helping an older lady, like myself. Estefan should be promoted and be training all of your other delivery men. He is an asset to your company and should be commended. I will definitely choose Ikea again because of how kind and helpful Estefan was in my delivery.Nancy Scholar

articleTitle: Beds need slats…. But don’t expect them to admit that
articleText: Contacted customer services today. Complained about why the website does not advise slats are required.The bed does NOT work without them. Whilst they automatically add the main bar into your cart when you select the bed, they do not do the same for the slats. It’s crazy.I was advised this was due to “customer preference”. I’d love to know how that works.I’m now scared about whether I will get my slats on Sunday. I’m not even bothered about the money.Having initially been really impressed with the click and collect service, I now could not recommend IKEA. In part due to this kind of nonsense but also the attitude of customer services.Update. Weeks later complaint not responded to.

My Trysil wardrobe broke. The plastic guide at the bottom cracked due to wear and tear. The customer service said we can get a similar new one. BUT. But we have to spend our precious time (we have 2 kids) to carefully disassemble the broken wardrobe and then from our small apartment carefully package the broken wardrobe so it won't be damaged during transportation. When we got it, it came wrapped in half a kilometer of carefully measured cardboard. There is no way in hell I am going to be able to wrap that in the same fashion in between diaper changes.My plan is to take a hammer to the wardrobe, leave the pieces in a big IKEA bag (or maybe 10) and send it back and see what happens. Such is my rage. It is clear they want me to just give up and buy some new crap from them.

articleTitle: I noticed that a Malm white 4 draw unit…
articleText: I noticed that a Malm white 4 draw unit I purchased had gone yellow on only the edges and we are not smokersIt was only by chance that I looked on line to see how I could maybe try and get it back white that I noticed that I was not the only person this had happened to I saw quite a few people on fb having the same issues ikea seemed quite helpful to there posts asking for a picture to see how they could help so I decided to contact ikea firstly by phone when I spoke to customer services they asked if I had the receipt or order number I said no this was purchased more than a year ago she then said well because the unit is out of warranty sorry there is nothing I can do I explained that this as happened to lots of other customers and obviously is a known issue and this is happening after after the warranty period the unit is obviously as got a defect because only the edges are turning yellowing not the rest of the unit and ikea is aware because of the post on social media from other customers,so I asked so is ikea knowingly selling this product knowing that it will go yellow on edges after a year because this would look good on there business and if they was to say this would or could happen no one would buy this product,customer service response was sorry it’s been more than a year there nothing I can so I asked to speak to someone else but there wasn’t all they said was I could put in a complaint and gave me a email address, I emailed ikea with my complaint and also sent the post from other customers and pictures of my unit I got the same response because the unit was out of warranty nothing could be done other than it would be passed on to some other department to be look into  they also said that they would offer some voucher as compensation if I could provide my receipt and order number which I obviously haven’t got I’m not a receipt fanatic you either  keep them and they fade or you lose them and I only realised that ikea do e receipts but there staff do not always offer this because I purchased products only a few days ago and they never asked to send receipts by email and when your packing stuff and someone just gives you the price it’s easy to forget to askPlease be warned ikea may offer a year warranty but when there aware of this malm product yellowing unless it’s a safety issue they won’t recall or offer any good will gesture for there own malfunctioning product when there well aware of this happeningIf you have any white malm products I’d check the edges for consistent yellowing and if you do have your receipt still under a year take it back and get a new one every 12 months before your warranty runs out until ikea does something about there product or products that only last a year!🤬

articleTitle: Wish I had looked on trust pilot before…
articleText: Wish I had looked on trust pilot before purchasing!!1st delivery day came and went, no delivery (a "system glitch"). articleTitle: I had an outstanding customer service…
articleText: I had an outstanding customer service experience at the Tukwila, WA store today. I waited my 20 plus minutes in line to return a comfort I had bought two days before that I had not opened and was the wrong color for my room. I picked it up in the clearance area and asked before I made my purchased if I could return it, and was told yes.  So I bought it.  The return department nicely advised me it was a final sale and I had been misinformed and they could not return it. I was not happy about it, but was resolved to accept my error and chalk it up to a $60 learning experience. That is when the employee conferred with her supervisor and advised me they would note in their system this would be a one time exception and returned it. Technically they did not have let me return the comforter but they did.  Thanks!!!

articleTitle: I placed an order on June 20th and…
articleText: I placed an order on June 20th and scheduled the delivery for June 23rd which was one of the options Ikea was offering me. On the 22nd I got a text message and email rescheduling it to the 26th, on the 26th I was notified it was going to be rescheduled for the 28th. On the 27th evening I got a message confirming the delivery between 9am-1pm and on the 28th at 8am I got a new email rescheduling again for the 1st of July. All those days they scheduled I had to work from home what became a problem with my employer. This morning I called them to try to understand what was happening and they simply cannot do anything but ask me to wait because it will be delivered on Saturday, but if I want to cancel the order that's ok for them. Absolutely no respect with its clients. They charge 50 euros for delivery and that's what we get from them. Now I need the items, if I order with a competitor it might take another 10 days to get it. So I just have to sit and wait to their goodwill in delivering my stuff that is even already paid. I called their customer service and all I was told is it will be delivered on Saturday and there is nothing else we can do. If you want to cancel your order that's ok with us. Zero Customer Service quality!

I had an unbelievably bad experience with IKEA. I made an order a couple of weeks ago for a total value of roughly $3'000, and paid the additional fee for the In-home delivery scheduling June 30th as delivery date. The reason why I selected June 30th is that I'm currently in Italy and will be landing in NY on that day, so I can't be home to accept deliveries any day before that and my building is not able to accept deliveries on my behalf.Unfortunately, though, two days ago I got an email from IKEA saying that I would receive part of the order on June 28th and part on July 3rd. I thus immediately called customer service (despite currently being in Italy and having to pay extra for overseas calls), and was told that the part scheduled for July 3rd was brought back to June 30th as I had requested, and the part scheduled for June 28th was managed by FedEx and could be changed only after I got an email from FedEx, and that I would have had to call again IKEA after I got this FedEx email. So, yesterday I called IKEA again, right after receiving the FedEx email, and was assured that they had informed FedEx that the package should be delivered June 30th. Today I woke up to another FedEx email that confirms that the package is on its way and confirmed to be delivered today, June 28th.Now, I honestly don't know who's to blame here, but what I'm getting from IKEA is an enormous sense of incompetence and lack of care. I spent a ridiculous amount of time (taken from my holidays in Italy) on the phone with customer service or on the chat with IKEA agents, and that was still useless given the zero results I obtained.

articleTitle: There is only ONE person waking at the…
articleText: There is only ONE person working at the Exchange and Returns on a Saturday morning. There are TWENTY-SIX people waiting for assistance.

Ikea's Dublin Carrickmines click-and-collect service is an absolute joke! We placed an order on Wednesday, booked collection for 12 noon on Friday, arrived at 12:15 and were told the order wouldn't be ready for collection until after 3pm. Utter disgrace! We had to pick up kids from school in Co Wexford at 2:30, so couldn't wait around in Carrickmines. We requested they deliver the items free of charge to make up for their delay but the earliest delivery was Monday. We had driven up in 2 cars from Gorey (an hour and a half wasted each way, for 2 people, €26 diesel and €29 in petrol) but were told by the online chat complaints team that no further compensation would be offered. I'd compare it to booking a table for lunch at 12, with the food prepaid, then turning up and being told "sorry, we don't have your food or table ready for you, you can wait 3 hours, or we'll send you free takeout in 3 days' time instead". Who in their right mind thinks this is decent customer service? The chat team also told me I "should wait to be told when the order is ready for collection", which is all well and good when you're living a 10-minute drive away, but not 2 counties and 1.5hrs away! My email confirmation clearly stated a 12 noon pickup when I paid for my items. The "4-hour window" they referenced seems to mean (to them!) that they can bring it to the pickup point anytime within those 4 hours, when any rational customer would understand a 4-hr window to mean that the purchases would be there at 12 noon and the customer would have 4 hours to collect them. Shocking service, shocking lack of compensation, shocking lack of acceptance of responsibility. I am still soooo angry about the fact that both my husband and I wasted 3 hours of our lives (1.5 up and 1.5 back), petrol and diesel and have nothing to show for it AND are getting our furniture 3 days late and IKEA think they have done nothing wrong and owe us nothing except a limp apology.

articleTitle: was lied to and talked down to by every…
articleText: was lied to and talked down to by every staff member i had to deal with. absolutely appalling experience and will never ever shop here again

They sent the wrong item. I didn't notice they changed the order to a different size until it had almost arrived. I attempted to return it, and they stated I would have to drive 2 hours to my closest Ikea to return it, or pay the $100 of shipping myself (it was a $60 item). I asked for a refund instead, which they refused, because they stated I should have noticed their error right away, and called to correct it. When you call customer service, they don't answer the phone, though . . . . and their Chat function is kind of hard to find. Terrible website, terrible customer service, and the shoddy furniture is made in China. It's not the highly-customizable, affordable furniture I remember from childhood. You might as well buy stuff of of Wayfair or Target or whatever. At least there are so many Target or WalMart store fronts that you can easily return the shoddily-constructed item.

articleTitle: They couldn't even deliver my order
articleText: Placed my first order with IKEA, BIG MISTAKE !I paid 20€ for the delivery of a 600€ order that was supposed to be delivered in 7 days, which is already bad considering that most furniture shops offer free 3-5 day delivery. On the 7th day at 8 AM I receive a call from the courier to let me know that he's about to deliver my parcels, I thought that was right on time. However, few hours later he calls to tell me that they made a mistake and forgot to load my parcels into the van. Inconvenient of course, but mistakes happen and he told me he would come the next day and that was fine. The next day I waited until 4 PM when I received another call from the same guy telling me that my parcels were the only transport to my city and there was no point to come to my address just for me, but they will deliver the next day (again). 2 or 3 hours later I receive another call from IKEA informing me that there was an issue with the dispatch of my order and that I should expect it to arrive in another 6 days.I canceled the order and now I can only hope I'm getting my money back. Their customer service don't care to help you either.Complete garbage, my first and last order, that they couldn't even deliver. Will never in my life order from them again and everytime I meet someone who is considering buying even a single thing from IKEA, I will make sure they change their mind.There's better shops that sell good, quality furniture and actually offers good customer service, go find those shops and stay away from IKEA.

articleTitle: Their manager Julie is a joke
articleText: Their manager Julie or Julia Asian  is a joke, rude and not professional…. She needs training how to deal with customers problems or how to solve it at least!! Absolutely disgusting behaviour from her

articleTitle: Failure to deliver items. Shocking customer Service
articleText: My items were never delivered - I tried multiple times to contact them - it would be three weeks after the delivery date before I could get hold of a human being. articleTitle: Store design and almond cake at IKEA
articleText: I really like the store design at IKEA. It is interactive, engaging, and thoughtfully planned, making every visit an adventure. They have a big range of products with different prices and quality. In general, I believe it’s a good value for money. My main 160 cm mattress was delivered as a 140 cm. 40 min in this chat with a useless woman who in the end told me she was in sales and could not help me. Terrible delivery who exhorted 50 euros for another 25 meters.  I believe the delivery company is XPO who should be prosecuted for extortion. I asked never ever to be served by them ever again, just to get the delivery done by that nasty company and only to get informed that the delivery would be delayed by 3 days on a Saturday. This is the very last time I would ever, ever order from IKEA again, despite being Swedish. I’d rather have quality goods, service and delivery than this utterly deplorable service. I hope that you will learn a lesson from their poor performance and consider other alternatives. Au revoir IKEA a plus jamais!

I booked someone to install the kitchen island for me on the day of the delivery, but given the wrong worktop, I had to pay him £300 for doing nothing! It has been 15 days since and after calling them several times and even visiting the store in person, they cannot give me a new date for delivery of the correct worktop!I wonder how they were able to place my initial order in a couple of minutes to take my money, but now that they messed up, they cannot fix it! In my house, I have a kitchen island with no work top and no one knows when I will receive the work top I paid for more 45 days ago!! Really frustrating.

Why are people so negative? Yes, the quality is not the best one, the service is average, but design is satisfactory, and the price is perfect for many living in rented apartments. My voice is for it.
Bought pax through ikea family and I damaged an item accidentally whilst building. IKEA replaced this free of charge and of any hassle. Great touch IKEA, thank you.

I returned 2 items I had purchased online due to it developing a defect. A month passed and I had not heard anything back, so I contacted them online with their chat function. The first person I was connected to was incredibly slow at responding and then transferred me to someone else because they couldn't deal with the issue. The second person I spoke to then informed me a refund couldn't be issued because I had apparently 'misused' the items and said that nothing could be done. I asked them why I wasn't informed of this sooner and they ignored the question until I pressed them on it and they eventually told me I was notified about this when I contacted them about a refund a month ago, which never happened. When I told them I had never contacted them before this, he angrily replied that I had just mentioned in this chat that I contacted them a month ago about a refund, but I pointed out that I never said this and in fact said I returned the items a month ago. They finally looked into the issue properly and issued a refund. It was clear from speaking to the person that they barely understood English and the customer service had been outsourced.

Appalling customer service. I spent £700 on a sofa which arrived damaged and missing screws. I was told that I had to wait two weeks until they can provide a collection/exchange service, and was only offered a £30 gift voucher for this inconvenience (less than the delivery fee!) and was told I could not speak to someone higher up within the team about my complaint. When following up my complaint, I was lectured and told that “next time you shouldn’t accept our compensation offer until you’re satisfied” - unfortunately due to this experience there will not be a next time. Avoid at all costs!

Ikea product broke after 4 years.  The product had 20 years guarantee.  When we contacted for replacement, they sent an inspector, whom concluded that the fault was on us.  However, their described cause was not justified, and when we asked for further information for their justification, IKEA said they trust the inspection report, so they will close the case without any replacement/refund.  At the same time, IKEA asked me to complain to the inspection company if I wish further complaints.  I saw the review of the inspection company that IKEA provided on Trustpilot, and I really feel that I will not get any fair answers back from this company.  We really hate this kind of situation where we feel that things can be a long exhausting experience.  But we will continue to share our experience about IKEA and the inspection company to everyone around us.  Yes, IKEA has some good products, but it does not mean that they are fair when their products broke.

articleTitle: I don't understand so many negative…
articleText: I don't understand so many negative reviews. I used it for my home and the price is unbeatable.There are different qualities (and prices), if you buy the cheapest one it won't last a lot, but for a bit more you will have furniture for years

IKEA has truly impressed me with its outstanding range of products, unmatched quality and an unforgettable shopping experience. From start to finish, my journey at IKEA was filled with delightful surprises and I can say that it become my go-to store for all my home needs!

Sooo bad!!!  Customer is absolutely horrible. They need to have people that speak clearer English. Otherwise, it’s the most frustrating dreadful time especially over the telephone trying to figure out your order. If a service person cannot speak clearer English, then they need to put you through to somebody that does.

Ikea Sunrise is horrible, thief store. They sell Terrible quality items yet refuse Return. You’ll be stuck at your loss. Their Customer Service is non existent. Came to return 2 Receipted items & they denied. manager Mikle allowed return but cashier was so mean refused it after & didn’t listen to the manager. Called another, store manager Adam & he denied patty $9 & $45 items return without explanation. He made offensive remarks & I was humiliated. Shocking experience. Their store is empty of customers, feels like dying. They should be banned & put out of business

This awful company is buying beautiful New Zealand, Otago, Lawrence farmland and stripping all of its beauty away and replacing it with pine trees. The north island has already been destroyed due to companies like this. Let me state this clearly DO NOT SUPPORT A HORRIBLE GREEDY ENVIRONMENTAL DESTROYING COMPANY. I am disgusted. New Zealanders are not going to let this go.

I initially thought it was a great company. But this is a company of thieves!!! I promised to never buy anything from there. I had an awful experience with them in Germany. Quality - rubbish, customer service - rubbish, thieves - great ones!
No stars if possible. Horrible staff smart and cheeky to an extent I have never experienced anywhere before. Waiting on a refund at present. First and last time shopping with IKEA .

articleTitle: The best affordable furniture store ever
articleText: No stars if possible. Horrible staff smart and cheeky to an extent I have never experienced anywhere before. Waiting on a refund at present. First and last time shopping with IKEA .

Dreadful.Faulty goods deliveredRefusal to refund assembly on said faulty goods.I paid Ikea for the assembly but they will not refund it because they subcontract to another org. This is against the law in Ireland. "Sale of good and supply of servcies Act"Instructions to disassemble before they will collect. I explained I had it delivered and assembled in first place as Im 9 months pregnant and cant do it myself. Agent ignored me. Will not refund me if I do not disassemble.2 Customer Service Agents didit listen or try to help, simply parroted off the lines theyve been trained to say.On email i received a reply from them saying they couldnt help me and Id need to call on the phone.Agent claimed that she was the highest place i could complain to and that my issue would go no furtherFor price of furniture plus assembly and delivery, can buy real non flatpack furniture. Will never bother with Ikea again

This is not a complaint, but a review. I wanted to buy some kitchen utensils. I entered IKEA in Riga, Latvia. I was there for the first time. The first astonishment was the unnecessarily complicated configuration and entry-exit of the parking lot, where the designers are confused in their craftsmanship. Okay, I went into the store to look for the product I needed. An unpleasant surprise was that, in order to find the item, I was driven zigzag along some unnecessary long route like a ram. With a sore leg, I wandered a long way, but then I realized that I felt like I was in the Minotaur's labyrinth (ancient Greek mythology) and I didn't want to stay in this ram's lair, but there was no way out. The placement of the product is not transparent, and the sales concept is chasing the buyer along a certain trajectory in the hope that he will buy something - on the basis of impulsive action. I find such a concept humiliating. It should be noted that I didn't buy anything because I wanted to get out of this maze as soon as possible, and also with a firm commitment never to shop at IKEA under any circumstances, because I don't want to feel like a ram in a trap, driven where the seller wants, not where the buyer needs. I was at IKEA twice at the same time - the first and also the last. I went to the supermarket, where everything is transparent and easy to buy. I was informed that IKEA is a store for young people who are starting to arrange their lives, but the concept of au laidar surprised me very unpleasantly - it is a humiliation. I read reviews about IKEA - just sad!

articleTitle: We placed a large online order to IKEA…
articleText: We placed a large online order to IKEA Greece. The delivery arrived but a double mattress costing €300 didn’t arrive. The local delivery company organised by ikea said they didn’t have it. IKEA did an investigation and said we were lying and must have the mattress because we had signed the delivery form even though we raised the missing mattress at the time,They refuse to refund or deliver a new mattress in breach of their terms and conditions. Customer service very poor and unhelpful. Unbelievable that a large company would behave this way

VERY BAD EXPERIENCEIkea did not return my money after I canceled my order. They had my money for 2 months and finally after 100 emails and telephone and personal contact, I was able to get the money back.But now my kitchen will be also 2 months delayed and Ikea is not supporting me and I have no refrigerator or oven or washing machine for more than 4 months…When it comes to customer support, Ikea has nothing to say.That’s why I give them a BIG Zero for their efforts to solve their customers problems. They even did not try to reach out to me to solve my problem. I have already talked to my lawyer, so it will be a big relief for me to open a case with Ikea and then maybe they understand the value of the customer who called them 10 times per day to solve the issue instead of calling lawyer in advance.VERY BAD EXPERIENCE

articleTitle: I love the design and quality for my money
articleText: I love the design and quality for my money. The products are accessible, and the building instructions are very easy to follow. I enjoy going to their website to browse for ideas and products. The website is easy to use, and it is effortless to find what I am looking for. One of my favorite products is the Kallax because it is very versatile and has so many uses.

I ordered a cabinet from Ikea's website and Ikea sent me the incorrect item. After a week of trying to contact customer service I was finally able to arrange a return and sent the package back. The customer service agent said I would be refunded in 1-2 weeks.After two and a half weeks and no refund I contacted customer service again. Apparently my package is "lost." The shipping company has photo and signature proof that Ikea had received the package a week before. Because Ikea lost the package after it was delivered to their warehouse my refund was delayed. After almost a month, I still have not gotten my money back.Ikea claims to have a robust 365 day return policy - don't believe it!

@IKEAVery disappointed with@IKEAMaroc. Made a 25000 DHS purchase, received delivery 14 days ago, but still no installation. Reached out 4 times, no response. Poor service for such a significant purchase. Reconsider before buying here. #CustomerServiceFail ⭐️☆☆☆☆

Bought a IKEA bed a few years ago went to replace the mattress only to be told IKEA don't stock  the size mattress anymore only discovered this after bringing the mattress home so basically the bed is only fit for the skip know so much for IKEA support the environment I would say there are lots of  beds going into skips also there customer service is awful rude staff at the returns desk

articleTitle: Products quality isn’t the best also…
articleText: Products quality isn’t the best also dealing with ikano bank is hell, I don’t recommend!

On 15th March we ordered 4 large IKEA Pax wardrobes with internal drawers, shelf's rails, just normal stuff but the first delivery available was 28th April. Long story short: the delivery did not arrive on April 28th, 4th May, or 11th May. It finally arrived 18th May with 10 damaged parts! Each time I called I was disconnected at least once as I was on hold so long, the total call times took 1 to 2 hours. I now have to wait until 27th May for the replacements and 5th of June for collection! I am sick of people telling me that they are sorry, if IKEA truly was "sorry" they would 1) get replacements to you within a few days, 2) allow staff to call you back if you get disconnected, 3) give you the earliest delivery date available without trying to get away with some dates two or more weeks away!The only reason I have not asked for total refund is I can't afford to pay to have it cousom built.
the sofa is soft. good price too. hope it will last long
Cheap quality stuff.My center table surface started peeling off in just 2 months. Wood used is not water resistant.

articleTitle: "You will be eligible for a collection…
articleText: "You will be eligible for a collection charge unless the product is faulty or not as described, in which case IKEA will cover the cost of return." This is quoted directly on their site. Despite providing evidence that the measurements provided on their materials was incorrect, they would not waive the collection fee. Terrible customer service, very frustrating to deal with, and not worth the hassle if there is a dispute.

My order was delivered today. This order includes 2 large wardrobes and some other items like table and chair. I paid £40 for the large items deliveries and your website said the large items can be delivered to the room.However the driver didn’t even deliver the furniture to my house but only put them next to the skip in the driveway.I have to pay extra and ask my builder to bring all these furnitures from the driveway into my home.I am so disappointed to your delivery service.

articleTitle: DONT BUY PAX! it's paper foil!
articleText: I have never experienced such poor quality closet...it's covered with paper foils all over, shelf, frame, draws... only paper foils over the chipboard NOTHING else, I'm so dissapointed. The closet now have scratches from just the assembling!, I will never buy PAX again.

articleTitle: Long term customer, almost all good
articleText: I've been shopping with Ikea for the last 20 plus years, mostly instore.  I had one issue back in April, and took more contacts to customer service that i hoped but overall they have been fantastic.

articleTitle: IKEA made it so easy for the customers…
articleText: IKEA made it so easy for the customers to cruise within their store maze. Super great prices and neat. The restaurant is always the top of their brilliance.

Ordered and paid for 3 items, paid for assembly, timing was good but one of the drawers had a broken piece, so unable to be assembled, assembler organise the part, waiting 4 weeks and no joy, ring Ikea wanting refund but told that I have to pack item up that they pulled a part before providing refund, spent about $10,000 at this place last 12 months, never buy here again, buyer beware after purchase customer service is useless, try amazon.

articleTitle: My daughter and i went to Ikea in Logan…
articleText: My daughter and i went to Ikea in Logan yesterday. We were interested in comparing a quote we had for a big walk in wardrobe we are building ($6000).  We tried to use the computer to design and get a price.  We found it abit confusing and as we were about to give up and walk away we were greeted by a young woman who worked there named Caitlin.  She was such an incredible help.  Spent as much time as she could with us and even jumped on the computer and added the things we needed.  We walked away cutting our quote in half 👍🏻 so often these customer service staff are hard to find or just not interested to go the extra mile to help you.  Caitlin was so lovely and extremely helpful that we wanted to give her a special mention 👍🏻
Horrible stain on new $1200.00 sectional. No response from company. What a waste.

Unfortunately I do like Ikea products, and the prices are good.  But I’ve had enough, the customer service is so poor.  The on-line ordering issues we’ve had several times now, are ridiculous. I’m not a huge Amazon fan, but when it comes to delivery and returns, you Ikea could take a few lessons from them. So farewell Ikea, I just can’t deal with you anymore.

We ordered at Ikea for the first time/had never used them before. The reason I am giving two stars instead of one is because the quality of the products is top notch and the price is good as well.We ordered several bulky items and one of the delivery men was visibly aggressive (probably because we had stairs), and yelled at me, a woman, for moving the items he delivered, after he told me he did not want to move them himself. They also delivered an additional itemwe had not ordered (probably meant for another customer). I was honest enough to call Ikea to say that we did not order this and she wanted to transfer me to payments! I am still waiting for the item to be picked up if someone reads this. I am shocked that Ikea's customer service is so bad. We paid 60 Euros in delivery fees to be yelled at because the delivery man does not like women or his job

Very bad customer service. Was in the Provost Dr location today. Asked a guy for help and he was so absorbed with his task of organizing the tea towels he got pissed at me for asking for help. I get it, you are into doing something and don’t like people but then realize this is not your calling and find something else where you don’t have to deal with any people?

Poor customer service. Very much upset & disappointed. They gave us the date & time that the kitchen we ordered will be delivered & set up on April 20. Sadly they delivered so late & wasn’t able to set up the kitchen. A lot of follow up talks happened before they gave us schedule again to finish their work. 20 days living in a house without a kitchen. Sad!

articleTitle: Ikea/ Do not open project card
articleText: Purchased a couch online. Opened project card. Returned it. Have to pay $99 return fee. Paid fee. Made one payment while waiting over a month to find out was not correctly returned. Ikea does not refund your 99$ delivery fee. I will not recieve my payment and have now paid $200 to buy and return a couch. Do not buy anything or open a card with them unless your absolutely sure you will keep it. While I'm waiting in this, my credit was and is being effected. I've called 20 times to get this figured out. And today they say it's up to our "discrepancy" we're not giving you the delivery fee back even if it was charged initially to a "bank loan" aka project card. Pay out of your own pocket.

Totally incompetent Customer Services. They were unable to answer a simple question about the availability of replacement sofa cushions. When they eventually did so, they provided me with inaccurate and misleading information. They failed to satisfactorily respond to my complaint ... they did not have the courtesy to give me their final response which, as my crystal ball failed, I had to chase. Their Customer Services really do let down the company.

articleTitle: Cheap furniture with ZERO after sales help.
articleText: I used to love IKEA but I've had nothing but issues with them recently. I bought a Kitchen which arrived damaged in some parts and had to be returned. For whatever reason, they thought it was a good idea to permanently print the door serial number and product name directly on the inside of each kitchen door so, I have to look at this single every day. Whoever thought this was a good idea should have a word with themselves. The assembly instructions are infuriating to navigate. I'm a designer and I spent most of my time correcting how they should have communicated steps in my head. Besides all of this; there is ZERO after sales care to speak of. If you ask to speak with someone in Dublin directly - you're told no. If you call the English phone number for IKEA to ask a question; they don't have a clue what you're talking about. I finally got through to a manager from the Kitchen dept in Dublin and, besides generally speaking over me; she said that they're too busy to deal with after sales on an individual basis. IKEA make more than enough money to change this.Their Buyback and Resell programme is an absolute scam. I went to the Dublin branch on Saturday with over €1000 worth of BESTA furniture. The furniture has been through two house moves so, it had light scratching throughout. I did an online estimate through the IKEA website and should have received about €400 for everything. I had to arrange for a van to transport everything to the branch, only to be told that they wouldn't give me anything for any of it, because the units had screw holes in the sides. THIS IT LITERALLY HOW THE PIECES ASSEMBLE TO ONE ANOTHER. This is how the instructions state they be assembled. If resold altogether; no holes would be visible once assembled???? If this is actually the case, IKEA should not accept any BESTA combinations back, as this is how all BESTA furniture is assembled. At the very least, they could mention that items with screw holes cannot be accepted online, so customers like me don't waste their time going to trouble bringing furniture back. I had to leave €1000 worth of BESTA furniture behind to be 'recycled'. I do not believe for a second that this will actually happen. They gave me a pitiful 'waver' to sign which at no point stated that they will not sell the items I left to be 'recycled'. I have no doubt that they will sell these items on, without compensating me for it.I bought another unit while in the store on Saturday and brought it home. Not only have the prices gone up but the quality of the materials have also gone down. We put the base of the unit together and it felt so flimsy to handle. Like the slightest knock would cause serious damage. There are also a couple of flaws throughout that just shouldn't be there. I am dreading putting the doors on and if there's a single scratch on anything else, it will be going straight back.

articleTitle: We went to the store to buy a bookcase
articleText: We went to the store to buy a bookcase.  After wandering about the maze, we finally found the department and selected what we wanted.  Then we couldn't find any employees to complete out purchase.  We finally found some one in another part of the store willing to help us.  Then we were directed to another part of the store where we were to pick up the product.  After another long wayward trek around the maze we finally found the furniture pickup area.  Here there were over 30 people waiting in line and a single harried employee trying her best.  If I could have canceled the order at that point, I would have but there was no place to do so.  The board on the wall said our order was ready but we were forcibly enjoined from going into the storeroom to get it ourselves.  So we had to wait a couple of hours before finally getting our purchase.  I will never darken their door again and I would caution anyone against doing so.

The worst ever !!! The costumer service couldn’t handle the situation and she hang up the phone call ? I have had book a slot for today to deliver my furniture at my new house and they didn’t come . They didn’t inform me about that until the moment that I gave them a call. Today I will sleep on the floor ! Thank you IKEA .!! SCAAAAAAMMMMMM. It’s a big shame that an international company is not reliable . I was expecting to treat me like a costumer not like a s ___t!!

articleTitle: Ikea Assembling - The Worst Experience Ever
articleText: Last April, I spent thousands of euros buying IKEA Items and expended extra money to assemble them by IKEA Team, thinking this would be the safest choice to avoid problems.The experience was completely the opposite.One of the assemblers was very good and polite, but the other was not professional at all. Beyond the fact that this assembler stepped in dog feces and walked all around the house, and didn't clean the floor (even after him what he had done), my neighbours asked why they were not invited to the Open House party (???) because they thought that the loud music during assembling was a party.Finally, they were oriented by their manager, who refused to assemble the BESTA TV Frame, informing them that it didn't have rails. To understand that, considering the project was made by the group team in the store, I went back to IKEA Delft in person to talk with the IKEA BESTA department, and they guaranteed me that the BESTA TV already had in the Kit four Ls to support for the hanging. The information was also in the BESTA TV Document!The customer service who attended to my complaint on the first floor confirmed the information.After six days, the department responsible for replying to the complaint in the store sent me an e-mail, asking how I cleared the dog feces, and I informed that I handle with it own myself.Beyond that and the worst part, apparently the team who answered the complaint probably consulted only the assembling company and said that it is not possible to hang the frame on the wall, but let's go deeper into this:1) The BESTA TV Frame DOCUMENTS show how you should hang it on the wall2) The BESTA Department in Delft Store CONFIRMED that it is possible to hang it on the walls because the BESTA TV Frame already have the items necessary for it in the Kit3) Two areas of the IKEA Delft Store CONFIRMED that the item could be hangTo finalize the e-mail they just sent the problem to me and said I should hire an assembler to do the work I had already paid for.After a week, because a new order for other assembling, even after postpone the new assembling they the finally decided to read the manual and hang the BESTA TV. Althoght, they blocked the energy socket, so I requested then to open hole in the back so I could reach the socket, but they informed that they couldn't do it and I should hire a handyman to open a hole in the back part of it, or I should do it by myself.After cutting myself trying t do it and after spent more than 7 thousand euros in the store for items and assembly, the minimum that I expected was RESPECT.So, let me summarize:1) Show minimum respect for your consumers2) Prepare and train your partners and customer service employees to be at least well-informed about your products3) You can hire teams that can spread feces in my house, but don’t put the hot potato in your customers hands otherwise no one will respect Ikea as a brand that they can trust on.

articleTitle: First time visiting the new mumbai ikea…
articleText: First time visiting the new mumbai ikea storeAmazing customer service and help. Decent quality that's why 4 stars

articleTitle: Order a delivery you’ll never receive.
articleText: It took some time to order everything for our twins to have their own room rather than 3 sharing in cramped conditions.The order didn’t arrive 28/04 nor today despite the many polite and patient phonecalls I’ve made in between.More phone calls today and I’ve finally cancelled my delivery though I really didn’t want to but what’s the point of a delivery that never arrives?No apologies, no callback, no emails. Nothing. Just me calling them each time.My twins upset/disappointed as am I.It would seem their intention is to never deliver at all.I’d give 0 stars if I could.

Bought worktops for kitchen Delivery was within 2 days Kept up to date with delivery time Arrived spot on time Very friendly delivery drivers Would absolutely recommend No issues whatsoever Happy customer ☺️

I am writing to express my deep disappointment and frustration with the unacceptable behavior of one of your customer service representatives at the Ikea Halifax store. I visited the store today morning at 10:40 am to return an item with the original receipt and the item in its original package. I had my credit card, which I used when I first purchased the item.However, the customer service representative, Cindy, who was conducting the transaction, treated me and my wife with discrimination because my wife was wearing a hijab veil. Cindy started the conversation by accusing me of returning the item before, even though I had the original receipt and the item number on the original package matched that on the receipt. When I explained that I had done a different return two days ago and showed her the return receipt, she asked to check my credit card physically, which was suspicious to me. This was the first time that a representative had wanted to hold my card to check it.When I asked Cindy what was wrong with the return and even suggested that she could still process the return even if my card had a different number, she became more aggressive and called me rude. She refused to proceed with the transaction and left the counter, leaving myself and my wife stranded.When I went to look for a manager on the floor, I could not find one. Eventually, someone named Conor showed up and introduced himself as the manager. However, when I asked to meet with the store manager or deputy, Conor told me that both were unavailable and refused to arrange a meeting.When I went back to the counter, I found that Cindy had returned and thrown the item back in my wife's face and refused to serve us, calling me rude again. Her coworkers, Valiyn and Courtney, and even Conor, refused to give us her name. When I insisted on speaking with a manager, Conor finally gave me her first name only after speaking with the Deputy Store Manager, Geraldine, who also refused to meet with us.I am deeply disappointed with the behavior of your employees, who not only discriminated against my wife but also insulted and disrespected me as a customer. I was appalled by the lack of management on the floor, the absence of titles on name tags, and the fact that your employees introduce themselves as managers when they are not. This behavior is completely unacceptable, and it is unacceptable for a customer to leave with their dignity on the floor.I demand an immediate and thorough investigation of this incident, including disciplinary action against Cindy and any other employees involved in this unacceptable behavior. I also demand a formal apology and compensation for the humiliation and distress caused to myself and my wife.I have received a complaint reference number (Ref# 2798284), which I have no idea what was written in it. I expect the after-sales manager to contact me promptly to discuss this matter and to take appropriate action.I hope that you will take this matter seriously and take the necessary steps to ensure that this type of behavior does not occur again in the future.

articleTitle: Very bad quality and worse customer support
articleText: **** Watch Out****I have always been a loyal customer of IKEA up until the last incident. I bought a wardrobe and as usual, I was trying to assemble it with my boyfriend following all the instructions in the manual.At first, we felt the item lacked quality but we were oblivious considering we had always gotten stuff from IKEA.All the items felt weak and half way through assembly, the wardrobe snapped and fell on my foot.We tried to reach out to IKEA support, and after 8 days, their reply was that it is our problem and they cannot do anything about it.IKEA quality has deteriorated, and their support proved to be as bad as the quality. Never again!

articleTitle: Ingvar Kamprad would roll over in his…
articleText: Ingvar Kamprad would roll over in his grave.Spain once again showed how completely incompetent and disorganized a country it is. We ordered a few items from IKEA, bed, sofa bed and a Parasol to be delivered today - the 3 of may between 3 and 9 PM. We are here in spain only for 4 days primarily to receive our new furniture from IKEA. I call them 15 minutes past 9, I press 5 for English only to get a a non english speaker, I manage to make my self understood and get a call minutes later and that person reveal that the order has been postponed to next monday!!!!! Really. No information, no mail, nothing. Should I have guessed it? I am appalled and shocked and I repeat - Ingvar Kamprad would be devasted and probably pulled out of Spain.

articleTitle: What an awful store to shop in.
articleText: What an awful store and shopping experience. unhelpful staff sent me in all directions before I was told they did not have the product I wanted. I purchased a white wardrobe but when I got home and unpacked it I discovered the door was a light blue colour. I don't have the time or enthusaism to drive a 350Km round trip to change the door and have no faith that the will collect the item and deliver the correct one. This has been a lesson for me....never shop in IKEA again.

articleTitle: I had purchased 2 products from Ikea
articleText: I had purchased 2 products from Ikea, day bed and wall Mirror large. I had paid for both of them to be assemble as there was an option under each item on the website.after waiting few days when someone came to assembly the product, they told me that they actually don't do the mirrors at all. It its very frustrating that tis option is available for clients on the website but in fact its not in real life.

articleTitle: If I could give zero stars I would
articleText: If I could give zero stars I wouldI ordered a mattress and paid $90For expedited shipping next dayThey delivered and after undoing the mattress it was a cheap mattress that I didn’t orderI called immediately and after almost 2 hours got nowhereCalled 4’times requesting a call from a manager or supervisor because they are not available to be transferred.I still after 3 days and 4 calls never heard back and I still don’tHave the right mattressWORST CUSTOMER SERVICE WORST COMPANYDo not make the mistake of shopping here!!!!!

Ordered a small item on-line, just £15 plus £4 delivery.A complete an utter waste of time.Apparently ‘out for delivery’ three days later….so far so good.Tracked the order which remained ‘out for delivery’ from 17th to 30th April with DPD. Then somewhat miraculously the order was backdated to ‘Delivered’ on 25th April.  Of course no delivery took place and I’ve no idea where the package is now.Just try contacting IKEA and if you’re lucky enough to find a number and actually speak to a human you’ll be disappointed.You’ll be put on hold and hear nothing more from the agent and will be cut off after 30 or so minutes.Absolutely dreadful service from this lot.

articleTitle: Terrible delivery and ikea will do nothing about it
articleText: Paid for the evening after-work delivery of some furnishing, 2 relatively heavy boxes were delivered to the pick-up point half a week later. No solution from Ikea's side besides waiting even if you inform them that you can not collect the parcel at a different time.

Read the reviews concerning delivery so decided to opt for the CLICK & COLLECT service (bristol ikea ) have to say it was seamless. Gave the confirmation email etc and goods were brought out on a trolley, so off we went to our car saying "gosh that was easy " to then be stopped by a man in a high viz jacket saying you cannot leave the store with that yellow bag ! So as we looked at our trolley yes indeed part of our order had been put in the said yellow bag. So I asked " why put them in this bag if you cannot leave the store with them "...he didn't reply. So we emptied the bits and gave him the bag, before we could take one step he stopped us again "where was our receipt for the goods ? So got it out he looked at it and said ok. I haven't used IKEA in over 10 years but must say we found this chap very confrontational and certainly clouded our original thoughts.

shame!!!! this company is sinking due to poor  level of service… i have visited in the lakeside yesterday poor level of service in everywhere. Shame i have been shopping this company in last 15 years or more with my kids and enjoyed but not anymore…staffs behaviours are ridiculous..

Today its the 29th of April and I still haven’t received anything. Anyone would loose their patience over this. Absolutely ridiculous and frustrating. This could have been a good experience if they had sent it on time. But they lost a customer. Not that Ikea cares anyway.

There was no notification from Ikea to inform me that it was delayed. When i spoke to customer service they could not give me a date for when i will actually receive the order. I explained to them that i had fitters booked etc and they were just not bothered. Will not be using them again. I am considering cancelling my entire order and buying from somewhere else even if it is more expensive. Ikea is cheap but they also don't value their customers!!! DISAPPOINTED

We are from Louisiana. We don't have an IKEA warehouse here. We've been looking for a bed for our teenager and we liked FLEKKE with IKEA. Since we were planning our vacation in Florida, it was decided to go to the local IKEA at Jacksonville and purchase the bed. So we did. On arriving back home in Louisiana we found out that the box was damaged by a forklift together with the items inside (and the damages were masked/concealed from the outside, so it was impossible to see them in store). We called to replace two items - one was sent to us. Called again - another was sent. All this takes time, and we needed the bed to sleep on. On receiving the second replacement item we started to put together the bed. Unfortunately, we found out that one more part is also damaged. The Jacksonville store refused to supply us with the last damaged item, suggesting to bring the bed back (550 miles trip). We think the customer service for the international company could be much better if they think to establish a good business in the US. Suggest to never ever purchase any item unless you have a opportunity to come back and dump it in the store!

Missing delivery, promised to deliver next day just to find out they don't do next day and have to wait one week for the missing package. They promised several things and each time I rang back I was told they don't know why I was told this as they don't offer calls back etc.

Item arrived damaged, parts we didn't order came with it, and parts we did order did not come with it.After contacting Ikea "customer service" we were not even offered an apology.  They offered that they could send us replacement parts for the damaged ones, but we would have to dispose of the damaged ones ourselves!?Absolutely outrageous service, will never shop in Ikea again.

articleTitle: I paid for an item to be delivered
