My daughter made the huge mistake of buying a Malm 6 Drawer “Particle Board” Dresser from IKEA.Big Mistake !!!!It’s amazing how this company has the nerve to charge over $400 for a dresser that’s made of 150% sawdust & glue that is pressed together.All my daughter did was simply close a drawer and a “particle cross board” snaps on her.When you assemble junk like this, make sure that your are satisfied where you put it because if you dare move it in the future, it will easily come apart and snap on you. Your beverage rings will also be well noticed too…..so lay a towel down 1st. (thats what sawdust will do.)I even went to IKEA’s website to get replacement parts. Their website is useless. You cannot order replacement particle boards.When the day finally comes to launch this junk out on your lawn, be sure to cover it up. If it gets wet, it will swell and become 50 times heavier and your garbage men will be mad at you.What happened to the good old days when furniture was made of this thing called “real wood”?If you are looking for a furniture sawdust & glue mill….IKEA is the perfect place to go !!!If you want to see what real wood furniture once looked like…..visit a history museum.

articleTitle: Ikea Egypt is a very bad experience
articleText: Ikea Egypt is a very bad experience! I have ordered a book shelf from Ikea.eg, I have paid almost 17000 LE. I have scheduled the delivery for Thursday, but someone called me and said we can delivered two days earlier. I said no as nobody was at home. On Thursday (the planned delivery day), we have waited until 16:00 clock and no delivery, until we contacted IKEA via the chat option on IKEA.eg and informed the central delivery station. An unidentified car park in front of my home and three persons wearing normal cloths (Usually, they come with IKEA official wearing) bought and assembled the box. They have tried several time and failed. Again contacted IKEA chat, nothing happen. We refused to accept the box and did not sign the delivery notice (this was a wise decission). After several complaints, I have finally received a phone call with the customer service, who was convincing me to take the cabinet as it is with the defect (what a shame!). He also informed me that IKEA has an agreement with a subcontractor, who did this mistake. I told him it is none of my business, I ordered the stuff from IKEA, not a subcontractor. Thanks for the online Egyptian law, I told him come take your stuff as per online purchase law. Finally, they came and pick up the cabinet. Now started the session two of the story, when I bought the cabinet, they have charged my master card on the same moment. When it comes to refund, I never heard from them so far, It is almost one week. I send several Email and contacted IKEA via the chat option, every time, we will contact you within 48 hours, within one day and almost a week and nothing. No confirmation of a refund. As the story has no end, I have contacted my bank to take an action with them. Usually, IKEA is a very good store with a great service, but this time was horrible. This let me think twice, by next time I order anything from. Still hope that I will get my 17000 LE back!!!!!!
Shocking customer service, cannot deal with a small typo in delivery address. Causing multiple contacts, even there own driver said they were rubbish

articleTitle: Domsjo Sink Cracked 10 or 25 year Guarentee means Nothing
articleText: I had a Domsjo Sink crack which was not caused by any impact to the sink. The sink has a 10 or 25 year guarantee however this does not seem to cover anything. I got in contact with Ikea and they initially seemed to be very helpful with the matter. I uploaded 4 images of the cracks and from that they decided that it was "assessed by our specialists and no manufacturing fault identified and this was assessed as wear and tear". This sink has only been installed for 5-6 years, minimally used as a dishwasher is used for any washing, and cannot be replaced by the same sink as it is discontinued and no other sinks will fit in its place so countertops, cabinets, taps all have to be replaced. I followed up enquiring how it was assessed by specialists through 4 images and what wear and tear equates to and what a 25 year guarantee actually covers however there was no follow up.

The quality of IKEA products is not what it used to be. I bought the SANELA Room darkening curtains and the colors started fading after a year.This is not the first time this happens. The carpet I bought faded color as well and the Korken Jars I bought did not close properly. IKEA claims to offer democratic and sustainable design, but what I have seen is the opposite.Customer service could not help me because I did not have my receipt anymore.
Stay away, there are more reputable companies, with much better customer service

articleTitle: NEVER shopping with IKEA ever again
articleText: NEVER shopping with IKEA ever again. Bought the wrong piece of furniture online by accident and needed to send it back. Ikea seemingly offers a pickup service to send back furniture and get refunded (*that they charge 39 euros for already). Organised a pick-up time for last week, for which they give a 4 hour window. I stayed home waiting patiently during the whole 4-hour window only to find out nobody showed up. So I had to organise *another* pickup time one week later, another 4 hour window I spend at home and by the phone. Again nobody shows up. The pick up service couldn't figure out how an interphone worked so decided to leave. I am not spending a 3rd day waiting like an idiot for this, IKEA should stop promising services it clearly cannot offer or maybe fire the geniuses it has hired for deliveries (who don't know how to ring a doorbell or use a phone). Customer service on the phone today was "very sorry" but couldn't offer any compensation for the trouble or any solution other than waiting again for this magical pickup service to maybe show up on another day. I guess that's a goodbye forever to IKEA furniture, shame since I've been shopping with them for 10 years.
They had a sponsored ad on Google for an item but refused to honor the price as advertised. First time shopper, last time shopper. Bye Felicia

articleText: Even when you try to put it together it breaks. Horrible customer service, spent 4 hours in their branch in Oslo to get a refund.

articleText: I recently put through an order online for 2 dressing tables 2 mirrored wardrobe doors and 2 grimo wardrobe doors. I have since tried to call spent hours on the phone and have yet to hear back from a manager whom I've been  told are the only ones that can assist in resolving the delivery time! this is a terrible service no body has a clue what's going on , no one seems to want to help or resolve any issues and over a 6 week waiting period for apparently 2 doors is ludicrous and extremely unrealistic especially when all items are in your local store in stock!

Even you don't deserve 1 star but I had to choose! The problem which I've had, IKEA sells the product(Friheten/Klagshamn skiftebo blue) but they say the part of items aren't available when the delivery time's arrived. I've bought sofa, £764, on 28.03.2023 and the estimated delivery time was 01.04.2023. (If I knew that you don't deliver it on time, I wouldn't buy it!) Then, I had a chat with customer service via website around 2 hrs because I believe that their system is so slow.. Customer service, Deepak, firstly told me the item isn't available, and they can produce and deliver it to me in 1 month. Of course I didn't accept it. We've started to discuss about it. Then, suddenly the item was available in Milton Keynes. I've confirmed and told them please send it to me immediately. Then, he asked me again when I should receive it. I've told him if you work on 7th April, please deliver it by 11am. He took 5-10 mins again to book it for me, but he told me that he can't see delivery slot! How come, it wasn't available again after 5 mins and Deepak told me that 'we'll refund missing items'. So? I have one part of the sofa, and the other part is missing. What's the point? Do I put this sofa to my living room as a half?? After 2 hrs discussion, I have nothing. I've offered IKEA to refund full, and deliver it to me asap, then if they send the missing part, they should charge me again. However, they didn't accept it. Deepak opened the case for me. Then, we finished the conversation after 2 hrs! Later on, I've checked IKEA website again and they still sell the same sofa which costs £764 for their customer. I have a video as a proof. It means that IKEA collects £764 from the customer but when it's the delivery time, they tell that the part of items are missing! it's a shame on you!

articleTitle: Customer Services are incompetent do not order anything online from IKIA
articleText: We ordered a Mattress on 30th Dec 2022 which was delivered on the 6th Jan but on inspection this was found to be damaged.  We contacted Customer Services by phone the same day and was promised a replacement to be delivered the following Friday 13th Jan, and this was confirmed by Email.We did not get confirmation of this delivery so phoned Customer Services on 12th Jan and was told it would be delivered as scheduled on the 13th Jan, it did not arrive. Phoned Customer Services again and was told it would be delivered on Sat 14th Jan again it did not arrive.We phoned Customer Services again and was given another delivery date for Fri 20th Jan and after phoning again to confirm this delivery it still did not arrive.After spending hours on the phone and receiving many apologies we still do not have the Mattress we ordered on the 30th Dec 2022 and therefor requested a full refund.After threating to charge IKIA for storing this mattress it was eventually collected on 02/02/23, and have received a refund for the cost of the mattress. What is still outstanding is the refund of the £40 delivery charge and compensation for all the stress IKIA has put us through.

Later on we wanted to complete other missing stuf with online shopping but I'd never do that again. They blame the strike in post but they are the only store who delayed my package. All other deliveries from other suppliers was on time. I wanted to order furniture from IKEA for delivery to NYC.Problem 1:The delivery was split into three batches when trying to checkout. I was only able to select delivery dates for two of them. The third one was always scheduled for two or three days in the future. So I had to wait until the right day to order and to adapt the shopping cart since availability was different on the day of the order.Problem 2:On the day of scheduled delivery, not all items were delivered. I was on the phone with the hotline for 2 hrs. They said it's my problem and I would have to call the delivery company. The delivery company told me they could not pickup the items at the local IKEA store. I called the hotline again and they could not help me. They offered to either refund the missing items or they could reorder them and they would be arriving earliest one week later. However one item was not available and they could not tell me if it would be available again at all. They also said that I would have to pay for the delivery again. Even though it was not my fault that IKEA messed up the delivery. I was on the phone for another hour since I could not believe what I was offered.Problem 3:The next day I decided to go to the local store. They understood my complaint and since the one item that could not be delivered was not going to be restocked I chose a different item in the store. The item was oversold which was the reason that the delivery that included this item could not be delivered. The reason I went to the store was that the missing items included bed and sofa so I had nothing to sleep on. The IKEA employees in the store were helpful and processed my purchase and told me to get a same day delivery with lugg which would of course be reimbursed. I purchased the same day delivery in the store and the employee took all the information for generating my refund.After two weeks I still did not get a refund so I had to call the hotline again. They told me I would not get a refund. After another 20 minutes they stated the reason, that there would be a wrong amount on the lugg receipt. I should go to the store to clarify that.This is the worst customer service I ever experienced.

articleTitle: I left a one star review on IKEA's…
articleText: I left a one star review on IKEA's website for their LURÖY slatted bed base. Reviews apparently have to be reviewed by them first before posting to the website. They never approved it, probably because it was one star. I know because I left a review on another product the same day, this time three stars, and they let that one post. So I'll just give the review here:The LURÖY slatted bed base has a very poor design because these slats (that are incredibly flimsy) just lay on the bedframe and center piece once it's put together. They don't latch into place or anything, so it's very easy for them to move around, especially after your mattress is sat on them. They fell off the frame and onto the floor underneath my bed not a week into owning the bed. Useless! I had to drill some holes through the slats and into the bedframe to hold them in place with screws. Do not recommend.

I’d much rather buy from a U.S. based manufacturer with far superior quality furniture. I know my furniture will last 20 times longer than anything you buy from IKEA. articleTitle: Case not resolved after 2 months and asked not to contact their customer service for updates
articleText: They opened a case for me on January 12. Said it would take a week at the most to resolve. Here we are two months later, and the case is still not resolved. Their customer service contacted through FB asked me to STOP contacting them to get an update, saying they will contact me if there is any news. If there is no news for another year or never, I am asked to patiently wait.
New order system, loads of people hanging around and very frustrated. Not enough staff and poor organisation.

articleTitle: Very negative impression about IKEA service and customer support. My money was stolen
articleText: I ordered 4 wardrobes in IKEA shop with delivery to my apartment (3rd floor of the building). IKEA hotline confirmed that the order will be delivered to my 3rd floor.Unfortunately, when IKEA delivery track arrived IKEA delivery staff said that they are very busy and they left everything on the ground floor. And there was rainy on this day.I am old and am not able to bring all these heavy boxes into my apartment on the 3rd floor.So I paid 130 euros to one of my neighbors to deliver all these boxes to my third floor. And he spent half of the day doing this. There was no other way to solve this problem created by IKEA staff.Last month I sent already 3 e-mails to the customer support of IKEA  with a request to return my money back to my bank account (because I paid for the delivery of these wardrobes to my apartment) and as a result, there are only their automatic answers "We have received your email and will respond to your query within 24 hours" and nothing more   :-).  They never replied to me. So my money was just stolen by IKEA.I was an IKEA client for many years and now I am very dissatisfied with the low level of service and customer support presented by IKEA. And, of course, stealing the money of clients is absolutely terrible story for the reputation of the company.
Ikea are in deep decline. Now instead of using a single piece of wood, they are splicing offcuts together. My bed collapsed in the night when the splice failed. NOT FIT FOR PURPOSE.

articleTitle: delivery delayed for a kitchen worktop…
articleText: delivery delayed for a kitchen worktop lost a day of work and now a second one! always excuse don't say this is the snow i just got an ups delivery u dealing with lazy cheaper carrier even you charging us 60 euros! no compensation excepting a 8.50 euros gift card I refused you lost a business and individual client today enough is enough 1 delivery on 2 got a problem NEVER MORE IKEA

articleTitle: Spoke with Mark at customer solutions…
articleText: Spoke with Mark at customer solutions regarding some gift cards purchased.Extremely friendly and helpful.Said he would email me and true to his word he did.
Beware!Ordered online a trash bin , arrived damaged and was never replaced after reported?!?Waste of time, money and effort.Go somewhere else!

I ordered a storage unit that cost over $600. It was supposed to be delivered on the 3, but then changed to the 6. I gave up waiting for it and started getting ready for bed when the delivery people finally showed and left it on my porch. That bugger is heavy! I’m 61 and had to push it inside. I will never order anything from them again. That’s just ridiculous.

articleTitle: IKEA DOES NOT CARE ABOUT PEOPLE WITH…
articleText: IKEA DOES NOT CARE ABOUT PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES! I was delivered a table that was missing the package with the legs. So I contacted customer service and they said they would send the legs back to me in 2 days delivery; then 3 days later told me I would be delivered by Fedex in 7 days; then 3 days after that they were not delivering the missing pieces anymore (!!!!), that you had to go to the store or make an exchange; then 3 days after that there was no possibility of an exchange, you have to either go to the store or accept a $29 gift card (1 hour long phone call). I told them twice by email that I was on disability (back problem) and could not drive and go into a store. I have had no response from them. This is shameful on two counts: not taking responsibility for mistakes and responsibilities. Not caring about the difficulties of people with disabilities. I would like to point out that I got a 1st gift card for the error on the 1st delivery (legs missing), but that has nothing to do with the fact that they promised me a new delivery with the missing part (I have all the chat conversion excerpts in screen prints).

I purchased from IKEA in 2017 on July 31st for $600. To my disappointment, the sofa bed completely broke down after only 7 years of use. The main structure of the sofa bed broke, even though I didn't use it as a bed every day, only a few times, and mainly used it as a sofa. Despite contacting customer service at least 10 times over the course of 2 months, I was still told that my sofa bed was not covered by warranty, and they would not offer any compensation or discount coupons. I believe a sofa is not a small item, and a $600 sofa should last for many years, not just 7 years before it completely breaks down. This has made me concerned about the quality of IKEA's products.

Beware IKEA checkout price switcheroo.The Omar shelf was advertised on their website today for $49. And when I collected it from the NorthYork IKEA today, the price posted said $49.When I scanned it at the check out they charged me $59.When I spoke to the manager she told me that, unlike virtually every other large (reputable) store in Canada, IKEA doesn't follow the UPC code policy of giving the customer the item for free.IKEA have contempt for customers. I dont know why anyone buys from them. I won't again.

articleTitle: Order not delivered and horrible chat…
articleText: Order not delivered and horrible chat supportI placed an order with the Netherlands Ikea to be picked up at a collection point:- the collection point was one of the options suggested at checkout- the working hours for the collection point are actually much different to the ones displayed by ikea when I was selecting the location (reality - closes at 18:00, ikea displays that it closes at 22:00)- the order was canceled for some reason unknown to me and I received an email late in the evening for the cancelation- opened a chat with customer support in the morning to check why this happened and they said it's not clear but it's ok and I can still pick up my order at that location during the day. My response was that I would indeed pick up the order by the end of the day- I came to the pick up point and my order is not there- Client support chat again, again they don't know what happened and suggest to create a new order. W Is it fine to treat the customer this way? Should I wait again and hope it will be delivered this time (the reason for the first failed delivery being unclear) ?

Terribly incompetent, very nice, but don't do what they promise. We placed an order on the phone, we were sent a confirmation email with a link to pay, but the order doesn't exit. Tried many different ways but no luck, and not in our order history, can't track it all even though we have a purchase order number. Hours on the phone.

ROSENSKARM PILLOWI bought it for its ergonomic shape since I am operated on the cervical.  I only used it for less than 8 hours to feel the discomfort of this one, I went to Ikea since it is not a cheap pillow and I wanted to ask if it could be returned.  The answer was that they did not accept the return of these types of items due to hygiene regulations.  But the most curious thing is that they can accept mattresses and other items that are in contact with the whole body.  In conclusion, don't waste money like I did!!!

SCREW IKEA!Made a purchase and almost immediately went to cancel it because I realized the sizing wouldn’t work. Was not allowed to cancel because I was told that it was already on a truck to be shipped. Literally 5 minutes after ordering. So, they send me a return slip. After reading, I realize that I have to go online, find the closest store to me, package everything up, and pay to ship it back. Absolutely not. I’ll sell them on Facebook Marketplace and will NEVER purchase from there again.

articleTitle: I bought 2 EKET white book shelves…IKEA IS BAD NEWS!
articleText: I bought 2 EKET white book shelves ....I got one 80% complete then called the store for help ...no one would help  me.....they recommended a $40/hr third party contractor to assemble my book shelves ...I don't want people with criminal backgrounds in my home ...only alternative is to bring both products back to store for a refund.....how stupid! Dont go to this store!  ...waste of time! 🙃

articleTitle: Do not order from them online
articleText: I ordered several items as gifts for a family member. I chose to have the items delivered. When the delivery arrived, only some of the items were included. (and one thing I did not order was included). I called customer service, I waited 45 minutes to speak to someone, they took down the information and promised to call back in 72 hours. they never called back. it is now 7 days after i first reported the missing items. after chatting with customer support, I have been informed that it may take another 3-4 days to "investigate" the issue before a replacement can be shipped. further, the agent refused to refund the delivery fee despite not having anything delivered on time and not having a resolution or even a timeline for the resolution. it is taking ikea longer to "investigate" their mistake than it took them to ship me the mistake in the first place. The customer service response for an alarmingly simple matter is totally embarassing for an orginization of your size. Does it really take 15 days to figure out if you screwed up shipping items worth $40?! Amazon would have replaced and shipped new iteams by now. Target would have immediately rectified the issue and refunded the delivery fee.

The service is really bad. You need to wait months for a couch. They don't even have good laundry baskets. Or dining table lamps. It's mostly made for the trashcan. Most of the stuff is just fancy and overpriced. They even rip of on some articles charging 1000% more when you don't have a members card.In store experience is also very bad. You get the employees almost screaming at you. If you order food, they just throw it on a plate like in prison. Also the drinks are really bad. Almost everything is in plastic. The self serving area is like designed to keep you walking more than chilling and eating. The tables aren't stable. The illumination is bad. Actually in the whole warehouse the illumination is close to a depot. There also is a lot of broken stuff in the shelves. Broken lamps... Etc.This store is literally a store for poor people who like to scroll TikTok all day. Ikea is like scrolling.Ohh look a chair.What's next. Ohh What The Heck 😒 they even sell seafood.Poor people definitely will buy stuff they don't need. And that's why I call.AVOID! Even the coffee is a rip off and tastes terrible.Buy quality. And only things that you really want or need.

articleTitle: The displayed prices are not the prices…
articleText: The displayed prices are not the prices of the product, be careful at the checkout.
Worst Retail customer service. Great products until something goes wrong and IKEA just don't want to know, they don't care.I wouldn't shop with them again

AVOID AT ALL COST. I ordered 2 tables and 12 chairs for an event space. They sent one table with a brown top instead of white. I called customer service and was told they will immediately send the new white top. It never arrived. It’s been 2 months now. Delivery has been rescheduled 4 times. They move it back a month at a time and don’t even contact me to communicate the change. They will not refund until they pick up the old tables, but don’t show up for scheduled pickups. After HOURS speaking with customer service, I have a useless $800 set of tables and chairs that don’t match and they have my money. Criminal company.

After having the kitchen planned, we had to chase Ikea numerous times to get any kind of service from them. They then tried to overcharge us on payment. Once payment had been made they decided to tell us that half the things we'd planned and paid for were out of stock with no information as to when they might be available. Unfortunately we lost the will to carry on and cancelled the whole thing. We are now fighting to get a refund from them which is also proving to be harder than you'd think

Kitchen reference 900400922I am very disappointed by the very poor service provided by IKEA in respect to the fitting service.The fitter came last week but failed to fit the kitchen as arranged. He told me that he was not able to fix the kitchen units to the wall because of the type of brick construction.This is unacceptable. There was a kitchen fitted to the wall previously, I enclose a photo of this.There are 200 houses on my urbanization of Mosa Trajectum, all of which have fitted kitchens, including IKEA kitchens.I am now without a kitchen and I am unable to arrange an alternative kitchen fitter for many weeks causing so much inconvenience.I request that you provide a competent alternative kitchen fitter as a matter of the utmost urgency.I am very annoyed and extremely disappointed by my first experience using IKEA.I await your rapid response.Keith Postlethwaite

Ordered pieces from IKEA website.  The closest IKEA is 2 hours away, so online is my best option.  Ordered 2 shelves that I've been trying to get for months.  Received them today, both are damaged due to terrible packing.  They were just loosely flopping around the box.  Tried to find support online, difficult to find.  Finally found a phone number, called it, but I've been on hold for 20 minutes now.  While holding, I tried to do the live chat, which is still on hold there.  So, customer service is currently non-existent, and their packing department is terrible.  I love going in the store, but this is unacceptable for such a big name.

I bought a set of Nattsvärmare bedding, as it stated 100% cotton on the label. But, at home, after a wash, ironing it, it became so static that the pillowcase attached to my hand. No way this is 100% cotton. A company with no ethics, deceiving and lying to customers.

Delivered missing article 6 month ago, require 7 or 8 contacts to get my money back 6 month later and never took responsibility on the freight cost (I paid for a full Basket and later delivered with missing article )

IKEA are a shambles. We have ordered and paid for kitchen units and installation and heard nothing regarding when they will be installed. I have had to chase and chase many times with no success. It seems that they now have my money and don’t care

Honestly ikea are terrible I cba to go in to it AGAIN.....FULL STOP

articleTitle: Wrong screw damages my bed drawer and IKEA ignores my complaints
articleText: My bed came with a wrong screw that damaged the wall of one of its drawers and IKEA won't give me any response after 2 weeks. I complained a second time today and the agent response was that IKEA receives a lot complaints and that I should send the same complaint again (why? are they so disorganized they lost complaint?)As far as I am concerned dealing with consumer complaints is the company's reponsibility not mine. Especially a company this size.

Woeful. Let me order something the other day and went to pick it up today (shop is 15 miles away), and the incredibly uninterested member of staff said it's not here and the order has been cancelled. Had I been notified of this? No. Apparently the item isn't back in stock until 15TH MARCH!!!! Thanks for completely wasting my time. Dreadful customer service! An awful company.

articleTitle: The offer seems good but the products and services are not
articleText: I have always had bad experience with IKEA.- The first time a sofa could not be delivered, I would need to pick it up, which is absurd.- The blinders I bought was tilted and no one exchanged it, later it broke, to show the low quality of the product.- Smaller things works better, but the delivery is delayed and it does not show reliable status, I don't know when to expect, the chat does not work, and there is no phone number to contact.In the end, I'll travel and I worry it will arrive and I will need to pick it up somewhere else, which is another hassle.
Ikea could you please right down on the tag together with the  size of the mattress, duvet or pillow sheet cuz its so annoying that i have to remember it when i purchased it

I love IKEA products, but sadly, I am sharing this feedback with you because I had an awful experience in the IKEA store yesterday. We visited the Dublin Ballymun store yesterday, and when we reached the billing counter, the cashier (girl- I couldn't see her name) was extremely rude and acted racist. When I tried to ask a question, she made weird faces, rolled her eyes at us, like she couldn't understand what we were saying. And when I tried to explain to her, she told me: " You don't have to act smart with me, do you get it ?" I mean, I was shocked and got immediately upset. Then while giving us our bill back, she said "Thank you" and "welcome" to me, as if she was trying to teach manners to us.Our overall experience could have been better, and it was my first IKEA visit.

articleTitle: IKEA YOU DON´T DESERVE ANY STAR
articleText: Super pissed about Ikea. I ordered a Billie with the order number 1332949601 long time ago and chose 31.1. as my wish delivery date. The confirmation mail told me, that I will receive the exact delivery time soon. Beside getting the invoice I heard nothing until the 31th, no call, no email, nothing. I called the customer service, but it was an automated circle and you could not get anyone on the phone.. I tried it several times and they always leaded you back to the beginning. I could only reach someone with putting in wrong information. Then the woman told me there is something wrong with my order and she does not unterstand it, but they will call me back soon and clarify. Today is the 8. February and still no answer, no email, no call. I called again. Again a woman and she told me something is wrong and you will here from us. I asked if I can get the number of the specific Ikea to call and ask, but no, thats not possible.It is a joke. Ikea is such a famous company and the customer service is really a joke! I will never ever order anything again! You don´t know if you get the order, you can´t even get information and I have no idea if I get my money back.. I am super angry! IKEA THAT SUCKS!

articleTitle: I placed my fourth order with IKEA
articleText: I placed my fourth order with IKEA. Again there was an issue with the order. This time they shipped the wrong components. They told me they could refund me the price of the six doors which were part of a larger order but would not be able to refund the shipping fee. This was on January 20th. I still have not received the doors and when I called to check where the items are I was told the case was not updated. IKEA has my money and my merchandise.

articleTitle: I placed my first order with IKEA 2…
articleText: I placed my first order with IKEA 2 days ago, my anticipated delivery date was 2/5/23. After waiting hours for my delivery I decided to track my order and it was revealed my delivery changed to Monday 2/6/2023. I'm upset because for this Inconvenience, I could've utilized my Amazon prime account and would've received my order today. NEVER EVER ORDERING FROM IKEA, POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE AND A BUNCH OF APOLOGIES.

Had a PAX wardrobe delivered. Delivery drivers stacked the very heavy boxes for me (far too heavy for me to lift or move on my own) then they drove away quickly. Now that I have help to move and assemble I know why. One box is ripped on one side and the wardrobe panel totally smashed in. They must have known and stacked it so I couldn’t see and said nothing. After looking at the reviews of customer service I can’t even be bothered trying to get this fixed. I’ll just have to line the wardrobe with wallpaper.
Why cant we talk to a customer service person. Do we want to talk to a robot? No....that is what is lacking. No human connection. Hate the way our world is going.uncommunicative cold people.

Terrible service! I purchased over £1300.00 of products to be delivered to my home. 1st delivery date, nobody arrived, and no one from Ikea contacted me. 2nd delivery, not all products arrived. No explanation and no follow up call. The delivery men also smashed two light fittings in the hallway when delivering. I contacted IKEA to find out what was happening, to be told some items where out of stock but what was available would be delivered and a confirmation email sent. No email arrived and no delivery date confirmed. Contacted IKEA again waited 15 mins to be connected, and promptly the call was ended 2 mins into a conversation. Again no return call or email even though the caller took all of my details and order number. IKEA have my contact details but make no effort to contact me. Resorted to "live chat" guess what the message reads that no person is available to deal with my concerns please call the customer service number! What a joke. IKEA very happy to take my money when taking my order but want to try and disappear when they fail to deliver goods paid for. I will continue to beg for my goods, if they continue to fail, my only option will be Trading Standards! What a sad state of affairs, all I wanted was some bedroom furniture.

On Dec 5, 2022 I purchased an item online with option for click and collect at Gentofte on Dec 9. Bare in min that at IKEA you will have to pay for click and collect upfront. The day before, I received an email telling me that the product I had purchased was sold out, and therefore I could not pick it up. The reserved amount on my card did not get released until 30 days later when it was automatically cancelled. So I thought that maybe it would be easier to purchase this item and have it shipped. I made a new online purchase on Jan 24, 2023 and could not pick an earlier delivery date than Feb 2 between 17-21. Feb 2 comes and there's no delivery, nor any information or message from IKEA telling me the status of the delivery for the day. So I called them today, Feb 3 and found out that it would be delivered on Monday Feb 6 instead. As I spoke with the customer representative, I asked him what the point was to chose specific delivery date and time, if as he was stating, it was only a rough estimate. He couldn't answer me. When I asked if it's not normal to receive status updates on your order, he talked about something else. Couldn't really get through to him on how unsatisfactory my experience had been.

articleTitle: It's cheap and the quality matches the price.
articleText: I shop through IKEA a lot because it's cheap and the quality matches the price. Suitable for people who like to decorate their homes often.

articleTitle: Awful customer service, wild goose chase for missing pieces
articleText: I ordered a unit that was supposed to have four shelves. It didn't come with any. We had to call 2-3 times over the course of a month before they refunded us for the money for the shelves. 4 months later and a few more calls, still no shelves. We were sent in circles and eventually we were finally able to get an order placed and with all this hassle, all they could give us was a very small gift card covering the price of shipping and the increase in the item price since our original order. Better than nothing but extremely frustrating after 4 months of endless calling and not being able to use our unit as we intended.

Wish I could have given them a lower review. I purchased fabric blinds for my living room. I have a uv filtering window. These blinds FADED!As I am over two hours away from their closest store, I called customer support. I got nothing from them except if the product was open, I only have 6 months to return.  THE PRODUCT WAS DEFECTIVE!  Also you cannot speak directly to the store. The

Ordered worktops in November, delivered before Christmas but were the wrong size so advised we would have to wait 4 weeks for replacement. Delivery date was yesterday but had no correspondence from IKEA so called at midday to confirm delivery and was advised we were the next delivery and would be about an hour. 5pm called again as they had not arrived and were advised the worktops were never on the van for delivery and they cannot locate them. Unable to reach anyone in the kitchen team so advised I would get a call back in the morning. 11am I call back but again unable to reach anyone in the kitchen team. I haven’t had a kitchen for 8 weeks and have paid for fitters to be here today. Web chat never able to connect you to anyone, call centre staff unable to help as they can’t contact anyone with any information, the worst experience I have had with any company and I will never go to IKEA again.

I love IKEA products - but was "forced" to order kitchen  on-line because , for whatever reason they do not carry kitchen cabinet in store !!. (freaking annoying) - anyway product shipped on days as listed but no counter tops  - I spend several hrswith terrible customer service and  NOBODY can tell me when I will receive them "it is on backorder"!!! - no supply chain visibility - DO NOT ORDER ONLINE !!!

I used to look forward to my many trips to IKEA, but yesterday’s trip left me fuming. I was in the queue with my partner and the restaurant was super busy and there were two long queues of shoppers waiting to purchase food etc, apart from a couple behind us that is.A lady and man behind us decided that they didn’t want to wait in the queue as they were only buying tea and cakes, so the lady decided to approach a staff member and ask if he could give her two cakes which he did and they left the long queue behind them to get their drinks.What would happen if we all had that mentality to queue jump??Must admit I wasn’t happy, and complaining to staff would have made no difference

articleTitle: Wasted a complete day trying to order &…
articleText: Wasted a complete day trying to order & pay for a desk both online & by phone.After numerous attempts & phone calls I thought Is finally been successful. Paid for it, recieved confirmation & receipt by email.But next day it was ground hog day!Yet another IKEA text telling me to complete my transactionForget it IKEA! Ill get my desk & any other products elsewhere!!!

articleTitle: Krista saw our confused faces and…
articleText: Krista saw our confused faces and approached us asking if we needed any help. She was polite and kind.  So glad we ran into her.   Canton. Mi store.

articleTitle: The worker at the Cafeteria underpaid me
articleText: I LOVE IKEA THE IDEAS AND THE CUTE DECORATIONS, but today I went to get 5 hotdogs which were 75p each. I paid with a 20 pound note and I only received 5.50 back. I counted and thought and I knew she underpaid me and I tried to ask for the receipt but the worker went to serve someone else and then went into the kitchen as I was saying excuse me she kinda exploited a kid you know i saw on the machine that there was a bigger amount due but she was typing so fast that. Anyways I’m disappointed I did not get the money back I went to my family told them and we went to go talk to her but then the cafeteria closed. This IKEA is the one in Warrington I could not complain because the store closed.

articleTitle: I love IKEA plain designs and love to…
articleText: I love IKEA plain designs and love to craft them into my own chairs, tables, shelves. Normally I shop offline as there is a store nearby. I decided to make an online account because I wanted to shop again and for the moment not able to get outside of the house.It didn't allow me to create an account! something is wrong, something is wrong. So I wonder, what is wrong with you, IKEA?

articleTitle: Ordered items for my kid room in nov…
articleText: Ordered items for my kid room in nov 2022, scheduled for delivery on 4th Jan. Rescheduled without informing me to 27th Jan. Called ikea n then was informed that it has been rescheduled and promised that will be delivered on 27 th Jan. Again one day before delivery got call that probably will be delivered on 12 feb, but can’t promise. Cancelled the order as not assured that whether for sure it will be delivered. Really no empathy or assurance given. Is this the way ikea works. Waiting for 2 months and just one day before it decides to cancel or reschedule. Me and my hubby had to take unpaid off because of this. Never order from here

articleTitle: I Ordered online for wardrobe lights
articleText: I Ordered online for wardrobe lights, it let me by it online, i made a payment for next day collection with a time slot, i went to pick it up for them to tell me they have not got it in stock. I wasted 3hours of my day going to Wembley to pick it up.What a joke company.......These lot need to sort out there computer infrastructure for online sales.The lady i spoke to at customer services was helpful but what waste of time.After i decided to see if i can by it online again and the still didn't update it to say its not in stock.......what a joke.....

I'm am utterly astonished at the incompetence of the process Ikea have put me through to buy a wardrobe flat pack!I checked stock on line.I called IKEAI drove to my nearest store (Reading) 23 miles away.I spoke to information point at the wardrobe area and my order was taken.A sheet with location and items needed to pick up was printed off.Went to location and it was empty.Had to drive home, another 23 miles.Went on line and ordered to collect from nearest collection point, Kingston. 31 miles from my home.Collected as instructed, 62 mile round trip.Got home to find NO hinges with order, which were on paper work.Contact customer service and have to order the hinges to arrive Saturday!So another journey for your product.I get offered £30 evocher, to be spent in your store, another 46 mile round trip.But hey at least I could pick up hinges have some food and get wardrobe doors on before missing hinges arrive Saturday. That a total of 7 days to buy and erect a wardrobe. A massive dent in your environmental credentials and a massive dent in your credibility as an efficient retailer.

Tried to order some wardrobes from their website - truly awful experience. Went around in circles for ages as whenever I clicked on delivery it told me 'some' items were out of stock - but didn't say which! Looked at each individual item several times and each showed that it was available for delivery. What a waste of my time - if it was down to me I would NEVER shop in Ikea again. This is far from the first time I have had issues with their lamentable systems. And they want to charge £40 for delivery.....

articleTitle: IKEA solar panel (via Wolmann), experience first 18 months.
articleText: Update October/November 2024:For now I have moved a one star experience to a three star - based on what has happened the last month.  They may go away depending on how this proceeds:- was contacted again in August/September 2024 (!)- a technician visited in October, the inspection was a bit so and so, but he was very happy with the roof and the space for installing 18 solar panels (8 kW) and the accumulators.- Two weeks later I get an offer, here one have to be careful as the offer was not what I had initially asked for but for a 4.5kW system (11 panels) with 10kWh batteries (everything half of my first quote, except for the cost that was marginally less for an inferior system)- I have informed the company that I would like the system described in the initial quote, and they are working on it. The first excuse was that I did not have a 3phase system and therefore was limited to 4.5 kW.  This is wrong - no extra cables or permission is required up to ca 6.8 kW. They came back with a new proposal with 16 panels (I estimate around 6.5kW - Great!).  However they say I have no space for 20kWh batteries.Let's see how it goes, as I have a whole room free for batteries.  Should they provide what I asked for 18 months ago - I would be very happy and increase the number of stars again.---Old, First impression:This is a first impression trying to get a solar panel installation through IKEAs website.The reason for going with IKEA is that they have good products at competitive prices and as they sell in quantity their quality control is generally very good.Not so with the solar panel project.IKEA does this together with a German sounding company Wolmann. The first impression is great, go to the IKEA site, click photo voltaic (PV) and you get a web site where you indicate your house and draw the area of your roof on the image of your neighborhood.Based on the size and your requirement you get a written offer with the cost with ITA state subsidies already removed (sconto fattura). Yes, we went for the full package - max PV, 20kWh batteries - after discount the 34 k€ price became 17k€. Just what we wanted… but before going into pension that is.You pay 200€ to have a technician inspect your property - and you wait.And you wait, and you contact the German sounding company that likely is less German than you would like.Since the offer we have waited 8 months - and I have still not had a technician come for an inspection.I also recommended IKEA to a colleague of me,  but he was smarter than me as he looked online for customer feedback first and then decided to find a local company.His system was installed a month later…IKEA - you need to be careful as to who you cooperate with, as experiences like this unfortunately taints your excellent track record.—Update 1/2/2023:Eventually my wife got angry and called the IKEA subcontractor. After eight months and almost monthly solicitations they were surprised nothing had happened, and suggested to call back (they did not) and eventually refund the money (we would rather have what we ordered).If they are not able to send a technician but refunds the money we will have lost about 17k€ in subsidies from the Italian government…That is likely more money that we have saved with IKEA in our whole life. When we have a final solution with Wolmann I’ll make sure they get a glowing review too.Be careful and DO NOT TRUST IKEAs collaborating companies.Reduced from three to two star as we seem to have lost 17k€ subsidies (50%) that other companies also had offered.Update 10 February:After several solicitations and a process that has lasted close to 9 months - the IKEA collaborator Wolmann informs us that there are no technicians available in our area.  We live in a town with 300k people, 1 hour from Genova and Pisa.Please draw your own conclusions - but if I were you -stay away from collaborators selling their products on the IKEA site.  I have lowered to one star - as it is not possible to put negative tarts.

articleTitle: I bought the REGNSKUR 50cm ceiling lamp…
articleText: I bought the REGNSKUR 50cm ceiling lamp shade. When fitting I notice the fittings is 3x the size of a standard UK ceiling lamp fixture. There is no mention of the size on the packaging, nothing in the instructions and not even the suggestion of an adapter to upsell. Poor product, cheaply made with a shockingly bad description and customer instructions. Don’t buy it.

articleTitle: So bad lol about to ask for my money back…
articleText: So bad lol about to ask for my money back. Only got 4/5 boxes of the bed frame I ordered. Customer service can’t seem to figure out how to get the parts out to us after we paid the delivery fee.

I ordered from IKEA.dk home delivery - never came, just delivered to a parcel shop. On the chat with IKEA they said that the Bring wrote that noone was at the address!!! been waiting the whole day. I paid for home delivery but they delivered to a parcel shop. They don’t know if the recipient has mobility issues! If the home delivery has been paid it should have been delivered to a home address. I was not contacted by a phone, email, noone buzzed (and I received another parcel today, buzzer works, and since I was at home I signed for it!). I am also not happy with the support I received on chat. I was advised to call Bring myself, which was unacceptable. I did everything according to the arrangement and Bring is a company that IKEA.dk choose to subcontract. Then this person wanted me to come back tomorrow in order to arrange a redelivery... also unacceptable. Also, the feedback function was disabled (the error said an invalid address!). I will pick up my order, but I won’t be making any future orders.

Shocking arrogance!!!!Another company with poor customer service, to be specific non existing service, If you get your product damaged in post, the only way to claim it is walk in store with receipt, the Ikea is in Dublin, I live in Cork, the item was deep frame for 15 Euro and I'm supposed to drive all the way up in Dublin to get it refunded or replace it, because as customer I didn't det any chance to return it by post, no return label, no support other than chat boot which may have more IQ than all who create this offending system no email where I could send a photo documentation of damage, the system of reporting damage said that is unable to solve the claim and I have to contact them, I tried chat which never worked and I have spend there all morning waiting for answer of life person since I were disconnected and chat was ended by Ikea side. Nice product I like the Ikea range but driven by primitive people without any interest make this busines A class. Why in Ireland there is no company with business mark of good service Ikea will never grow up and this approach is their brand mark NO SERVICE ,JUST PAY ,GET WANISHED IN SILENCE AND DO NOT BOTHER ANY MORE

Careful with Delivery! Having paid £50 for the express delivery (because the order size would never have gone in the car!), I'd say I'm disappointed on two counts:- Having worked from home specifically to take delivery, I was informed on the order confirmation email that I'd be called an hour before they were due to arrive. This didn't happen, and the delivery has caught me in the middle of a work meeting that I'd have otherwise moved/rearranged.- The service states that they'll take the delivery to any chosen room in the house, which whilst technically true, can only be done if the delivery team keep their shoes on. Considering we've got brand new carpets and don't really fancy crud being walked through them on a wet winter's day, I've asked the delivery team to slip them off before going upstairs, only to be told that is a Health & Safety breach. Guess what, I now have a fairly significant amount of furniture on the lounge floor that I'm going to have to move myself.Granted, these issues aren't exactly "end of the World" stuff, but frustrating nonetheless when paying for a delivery service that a lot of companies offer for free...

articleTitle: If it was possible I’ll give 0 star to…
articleText: If it was possible I’ll give 0 star to IKEA. I bought some furniture online for my daughter who was moving to DC for her las College year. The page ask me when I wanted the delivery and if I wanted the assembly with their partner task rabbit, I thought that was wonderful, but guess what… my delivery never arrived and after talking to many people in customer service that were polite but didn’t have a clue on how to help o resolve issues, someone suggested that I should cancel the order and re-purchase at the store to get a next day delivery. So I did it, but guess what… when I went to the stand to schedule the next day delivery and assembly..,, they didn’t have the truck size I needed. Si at the end I had ti hire another company that charged me almost 2000 to make the delivery and assemble the furniture. So the cheap and low quality Ikea Products that I bought at the end cost me more than a regular store with more quality and better service.

Ikea is the devil. They have no customer service and don't care about you at all. When I initially placed my order (thousands of $$ of kitchen cabinets for use in a medical office) I was told I would have everything in 2 weeks.Come delivery time 3 weeks after I place my order (and without notice), I only received part of my order. I call them and get the run around and was told the remainder of my order will be delivered in another week. Well, that remainder of the order was then split into 3 other shipments, then they call me saying I need to pay separate deliveries fees of $80 for each delivery!!I receive another delivery 2 weeks later, and still missing part of the order. Then after another 2 weeks I'm told the final part of my shipment will arrive.I post up in our new office and only 6 drawers get delivered. I still don't have the base of the cabinets. I call Ikea and they tell me they're on the truck and will be delivered that day. I wait and I wait, nothing.I call Ikea the next day, and they said the truck had mechanical problems. I called the contracted shipping company (Select Express) and they said they never received anything from Ikea's warehouse. I call Ikea back and got a different person who confirmed they didn't leave the warehouse yet. So they lied right to my face.Here I am 2 months after placing my order and still don't have the base cabinets. I have a new office to open up and can't cause it is filled with cabinet parts and boxes that I can't even begin to start assembling until I have the cabinet bases. Every day we're not open we lose $10k and Ikea doesn't care one bit. They got their money.Ohh by the way, I asked if I can just go to the local warehouse and pick up the items from there. They told me I would have to purchase them separately and send everything else that I received back for a refund + restocking fee because my initial order was from Ikea Business Division and not the local warehouse.Well never give Ikea another penny, and if anyone out there is thinking about ordering their cabinets from Ikea I would highly recommend you go elsewhere.

Literally ikea Matoshinhos has no service idea. Ordered full kitchen . Weeks earlier. Only because it was in stock . And had very tight delivery and installation time line. Day before her told 25-30 items damaged and they can’t deliver !!!! Really ?  Oh next delivery more than 8 days later
expensive, low quality

articleTitle: "Chiquitita tell me what's wrong" - The Fallacious Nature of IKEA Customer Services
articleText: I purchased a double bed within the last *three months* and it has broke. Customer service employees are highly condescending and arrogant, with little to no empathy, and they seem void of any human emotion at all. I have read the 365 day return and exchange policy but was being told something completely different over the phone. It is almost as if they want to make it more difficult for you to resolve your issue in the hopes that you either give up and admit defeat (loss of over 400 pounds) or spend a painstakingly long amount of time on hold listening to ABBA tunes. I have been laughed at, ridiculed, hung up on and told false information by customer service employees just because they did not want me to take the matter any further. This is absolutely shocking form such a large company, but I guess I am the fool for deciding to build a bedframe from a company who use the most substandard materials there is. I chose IKEA as I am a uni student who cannot afford to buy anything from high-end competitors but now I will probably have to fork out some cash for a new bed (from somewhere else) so I am not sleeping on the floor whilst I wait *4-5 weeks* for a RESPONSE to my enquiry for an exchange or new parts.TL;DR- IKEA is a hit or miss, more like finding a needle in a haystack of misses. My advice is to not buy anything bigger than a small set of drawers as you are bound to be met with faults which means having to talk to the *awful* customer service reps. 400 pounds down the drain! Shame Shame Shame on you IKEA!!

articleTitle: Think before you pay for the delivery services
articleText: Placed the order in Manchester and paid £40 for the delivery service. Agreed to receive the goods on 4th Jan. Unfortunately, I only got partial items only. Reported to IKEA and being told that have to wait 72 hours for the warehouse to do a search for missing items. I have no luck as I am still waiting as of this moment and no idea when can I get the missing items. Customer service told me that I have No other option unless waiting.

articleTitle: We used to shop there often but recently it's a no go for us now.  The quality of their goods have gone downhill and their prices have gone up. I have heard a few of my friends say the same.
articleText: Quality gone downhill. Prices have gone uphill.

We paid £50 for early delivery. They took the cash but only delivered the chest with no drawers. Drawers will be 10 days and they will offer no refund for the delivery fee. The complaints procedure is internal so no feedback or any way to speak to a higher authority other than Customer Service. Offered a £30 goodwill voucher that is yet to arrive...Disgraceful.

articleTitle: Quality overall has gone down a lot, while prices increased.
articleText: Ikea used to be a great place to shop and spend time, but lately the quality of their products has really gone down, and the prices have gone up. Even the size of some of the things they sell has gotten smaller, but the prices are still higher.The customer service is really bad too - the staff is rude and doesn't seem to care about helping customers. The store itself is also not as clean as it used to be - I saw dirty cutlery and cups in the restaurant. And the food at the restaurant isn't as good as it used to be either.I'd rather pay a little more and go somewhere else where the products are better and the customer service is good. I rarely write negative reviews, but I has also rarely have been more disappointed than today. So, goodbye Ikea.

articleTitle: Website and online service doesnt work, failed orders
articleText: Incompetent website and online serviceReally are incompetent online. Should invest more in tech for such a large profitable company. I would have sympathy if inventory is out of stock and correctly displayed as such due to supply chain challenges but their stock availability displays are constantly wrong or not accurate leading to cancelled orders, delays and wrong product deliveries. They show fully in stock and available at point of order, so purchased in good faith then get messed around for weeks after. I give up...

So there's a screw missing from my new sofa. That's the last screw needed to put all the sofa modules together. I went to IKEA Århus and they don't have the screw.I've ordered it online but that takes 10-14 working days. That's many days with an unfinished sofa in my living room.At the same time for the purchase of that sofa they've both charged my card the amount and reserved the equivalent amount. So that'd be amount x2 minus from my card.Chat says nothing we can do about it. My bank says they can release the amount if they get a confirmation from IKEA. There is though no email address to contact them. Just going around in circles in the "help" pages.

articleTitle: I ordered a rug  via click to pick up…
articleText: I ordered a rug  via click to pick up online. It defaults to any store that has it in stock not the store you have selected as your primary store. I therefore accidentally selected a store too far from me. I used chat to see if it could be changed. The chat agent did not speak my language and was rather rude about sharing the policy that they could not help me and I would not be able to have my money returned for up to 15 days! When I said this was unacceptable, I was give a customer service number. After a 10 minute hold. I was told I could be transferred to another return department. I was transferred and hung up on after I listened to a message saying they could not help me...I find this inconvenient and unjust. I want my money back today or tomorrow without a hassle. I’m not a bank and you cannot borrow my money for 15 days!! Until now I enjoyed IKEA for years...This is awful.

i bought furnitures; A sofa bed, a queen size bed, garden table set and none of it even lasted 10 months. The sofa’s upper cloth wore off within the first month of usage. The bed’s undercovered cloth started ripping off, the garden table was so flimsy that it broke right off from the center. IKEA; you must not sell items of such cheap quality that people start wondering if their money goes down the drain. We expect furniturea to atleast last 10 years, such much be the durability. Please don’t cheat customers and compromise on quality.

Had to create case reference 42062770 due to multiple errors on IKEA.co.uk resulting in unnecessary journeys to store, mistakes on website, no stocking information and errors with order. No resolution provided.

articleTitle: even no ideas why failed for online…
articleText: even no ideas why failed for online purchase, eventually we went to shop for the process. Delivery was great , punctual, products are as good per expected (Glasgow Ikea)

articleTitle: IKEA Germany online shopping is an absolute joke!
articleText: I made over €1000 order and it supposes to be delivered in 3 parts, it was not possible to set the 1st delivery date, it was automatically arranged by IKEA system. The date for the first two deliveries was set for tomorrow, 31 December - the New Years Eve, timeslot 9am-5pm! all day waiting for IKEA. I came back home just for that reason, to receive the delivery. Today in the morning, at 8:15am I received an email that the delivery will be made today! 30 Dec, a day before teche schedule date and it will be at my door at 9:30am! so in one hour! of course I was not home, so the delivery was sent to some store where I suppose to pick it up and bring it home myslef, although I paid 89 euros for the delivery. If I don't pick it up, it will stay there for 2 weeks and that will be send back to IKEA... and the we will start all over again... Avoid IKEA delivery! it is an absolute joke

Horrible customer service.  Ordered online  product took too long to arrive I called they could not locate order. I said cancel it and issue me a refund.  4 days later it arrives.  Product was horrible.  I called and said I wanted to return.  After 6 calls and a week later finally got someone to send a return label. I sent it back fed ex 9 days later I’m still waiting for refund.  I called and was told I sent it back in 12/26. My fed ex receipt shows 12/19 when I said that she hung up on me horrible company and cheap products.

articleTitle: So tired of trying to get my refund
articleText: So tired of trying to get my refund . It’s been a month of dealing with this horrible company . Don’t do it

Please, save yourself and your money and never buy anything from ikea Richmond seriously. Don't buy their malm products. Is a total waste of time and money and they don't refund also...The material for the malm bed frame are fake and wrong products and it doesn't last long after 24hrs....go to a competitor and save your money please

Ordered a IKEA desk for Christmas gift for my partner on November 25th and scheduled the delivery for December 20th…plenty of time right? Well the 20th came and went with ZERO contact from North American Logistics. I call Ikea and they tell me that my desk arrived at the NAL warehouse on the 18th and there are no notes as to why it wasn’t delivered, so I instead reschedule for the 23rd. Okay no problem, at least it’s before Christmas right?! Welp, here I am on the 23rd with still zero contact from NAL (even though I’ve tried to call twice and each time I’m actually hung up on) and now my Christmas gift isn’t going to be delivered until the 27th. Maybe I’m dumb, but I’m pretty sure that’s after Christmas. Anyway, I cannot recommend a company that can’t delivery a parcel on time when it was ordered a month in advance. I am absolutely appalled at the lack of communication and will never order from IKEA again so long as NAL is in charge of delivery.UPDATE:They once again failed to deliver the package (12/27 due to a light dusting of snow) and wanted to reschedule for another week out (1/03). At this rate, we’re looking at a Christmas in July situation. I call IKEA support and some old hag who’s name I can’t remember, let’s call her Ethel, didn’t want to reimburse my delivery fee ($300) and basically said I was at the mercy of NAL. I informed her if she could just reimburse me for the delivery fee, I’ll wait until 1/03 for the table, makes sense to me considering the situation NAL has put their customer in. She then informed me that she’d rather cancel the order than give me the $300. In short Ethel costed her company a $200 sale on top of the $300 delivery fee they’ve already paid to NAL. Good job Ethel, Wayfair should hire you as a rep, cause I just got a $600 table from them thanks to you and your lack of deescalation skills… AND IT WILL STILL BE HERE BEFORE 1/3. articleTitle: I recently purchased a LAGKAPTEN / ALEX…
articleText: I recently purchased a LAGKAPTEN / ALEX from the IKEA store in St. Louis, MO which is 2 hours from my home.   When we went to assemble it we noticed that we were missing an entire hardware kit for one of the cabinet units.  I contacted IKEA customer support, they said the only thing that i could do was drive the 2 hours back to the store and pick up the missing hardware kit which is very inconvienient, or they could order the parts and have them shipped which would take 7 to 10 days because the parts would come from the factory overseas, also inconvienient as I bought this item as a Christmas gift.  Customer service when I asked them to connect me to the store to see if the store could ship the parts I needed which would have taken less time I was told they didn't have direct contact with the local store.  So after going round and round I decided to let them ship me the parts from the factory.  Here it is 7 to 10 days later I receive the package with said parts and low and behold I am still missing 18 pieces of the needed hardware to assemble this product.  Now I'm beyond pissed which leads me to have a bad taste in my mouth for IKEA, IF I EVER DECIDE TO BUY ANOTHER THING FROM IKEA I WILL MAKE SURE TO UNPACK THE THING IN THE STORE BEFORE IT COMES HOME TO MAKE SURE ALL THE PARTS ARE IN THE BOX.  POOR QUALITY CONTROL ON IKEAS PART AND THE CUSTOMER SERVICE WASN'T MUCH HELLP EITHER.  IKEA YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED  LISTEN TO YOUR CUSTOMERS AND DO BETTER TO FIX THEIR ISSUES IN A TIMELY MANNER 7 TO 10 DAYS IS NOT A TIMELY MANNER .

I will tell everyone I know and anyone that will listen that IKEA is too lazy and set in their ways to help a customer not to mention that IKEA trains staff to lie to try to make the business look better.I placed an order on 12/19 at about 7pm for a $200 gift card for my nephew. We then surprisingly received $30 in gift cards as part of their promotion. We decided that if we were going to get gift cards that we would buy my nephew a little something to go with the gift card. After much searching online, we found something that we thought would be perfect to use the $30. We placed the order at about 8:30pm. We then get an email notifying me of the scheduled time slot for pick up that I had no say in. We will be able to drive to Grand Prairie but not at their chosen time. I go ahead and drive there at and arrive at about 10:45. Upon our arrival, I am told by an employee that has the time to walk out to my car and talk about it that they are short handed and can not do it because it is not ready. I decided to go in and help with their short handedness by grabbing the items myself and taking them to the customer returns desk. At which time I am told once again that they are short handed and that I had to stick to their chosen schedule and that we cannot use the items that we brought (exact match) to complete our online request. After going round and round with her and the "manager" she contacted that came to the counter, we are told that it is just their policy and that they are not willing to work with customers. The customer would have to cancel the online order, thus requesting a refund which will take 1-3 business days, and make a new purchase by going through the normal check out. I am given similar disservice when I called the 888 number that the manager provided. What kind of customer service is this? Is it let's lie about why we don't allow customers to come at different times (short handed) until they call us out on it thus changing our story (based on assigned scheduled times)? Is it our schedule over customer needs? Don't even get me started on how many employees I saw standing around doing nothing, talking to other employees, or playing on their phones while I was navigating the store that I am sure has at least 100 signs in order to direct customers to the different areas. That's a great way to add salt in the wound of your customers as you lie to their faces with the same rehearsed story of being short handed. I've never encountered a business with such poor customer service and a lazy attitude! I would recommend that everyone in your leadership read Moments of Magic Be a Star With Your Customers and Keep Them Forever. Perhaps then you may take a look at some of the policies that lost you this first time customer and earned you many a bad review. I will NEVER shop IKEA again and I will never gift or buy new or pre-used IKEA products. I will tell everyone I know and anyone that will listen that IKEA is too lazy and set in their ways to help a customer not to mention that IKEA trains staff to lie to try to make the business look better. I have already processed a request to cancel the $200 gift card for my nephew and I am ready to dispute it with my credit card company. I have no desire to have monetary compensation for this ridiculous event. My hope is that someone actually reads this and acts upon it.

articleTitle: Don't bother ordering from the online website... Go in-store instead!
articleText: Ordered a few large items (200cm tall) with express delivery as my old MALM drawers broke and needed to store my stuff as soon as possible. I was decorating my room so I had about a week wriggle room until all the stuff needed to come.The delivery came next day but by look of the back of the van, the boxes had been thrown in. When the delivery men were taking the box's out, they landed every single box straight into mud whilst the corner of the boxes were damaged therefore damaging the items even further...I refused delivery as it was an expensive order and they told me I had to send everything back (even the stuff that wasn't damaged) so I did.I was later told my IKEA that I could've sent just the damaged item back...I then called IKEA to explain what had happened to get a replacement sent out but the delivery men hadn't put down that the items were returned to sender so I needed to wait until they received confirmation.Fine... So I waiting another day and called back up. They issued me a replacement and said it would be here the latest Thursday. I said this was fine as I needed them by Friday the latest (having ordered on the Sunday before).Wednesday night, I get a text saying "Your order will be delivered between 7am - 11pm". The next day I don't get a tracking link like I did previously and the order didn't arrive.I called up IKEA once again and asked if it was definitely arriving today, they said "There's been a delay, it will be there between 4pm and 7pm". I said okay and waited...5:30pm on Thursday... Still no tracking link so I highly doubted it would arrive. I called again and they said it wasn't loaded on to the delivery van so the earliest they could get it to me was Saturday, nearly a week after my initial order.So I asked IKEA to cancel the order and I'll just go pick it up myself (I noticed they missed off a few shelves on the replacement anyway!). This is obviously a huge inconvenience as IKEA is a 40 minute drive away...They said it was cancelled and I'd receive my refund in 14 days.A week later, I randomly get a text saying "Your items will be collected tomorrow between 7am - 11pm". So I called up again and told them I don't have any items as they were returned back to IKEA and no replacement items were sent. They assured me it was just a mistake and it was probably sent to the wrong number.The next day I get a phone call from the delivery company asking if I needed any items collecting as they could see my initial delivery was refused. I said no, I do not need a collection as I don't have any items.11am that day, the delivery company still arrives and I tell them I have no items and sorry their time was wasted! Even though it wasn't my fault...Fast forward to 2 weeks after my cancellation, no sign of a refund...So I patiently call the IKEA customer service team once again and ask if they can please issue the refund. I was apologised to and told it would be in my bank no later than Monday the 12th Dec.Now Tuesday 13th Dec, I still have no refund, £300 right near Christmas, after having to spend a further £300 to get my items in-store and my original order was placed on 20th November.I'm tired of having the call the IKEA CS team over and over again and absolutely nothing being done.I do not recommend ordering from their online store and god forbid you have any issues, good luck!

My thoughts about IKEA are mixed. A combination of very negative aspects and very positive ones, made me decide to give 3 stars. I'm somewhere in the middle of being satisfied and disappointed as a customer.Negative:- EXTREMELY bad product availability especially about PAX wardrobes. They discontinued the black frames for PAX sliding doors and I've been waiting for the new model in a loooooong time. Wouldn't it be better if they discontinue something when the replacement is ready to be available?- EXTREMELY long waiting when you call for help (always AT LEAST half an hour and up).- The employees at the phone customer service are very polite and cute but it seems to me that they are not competent. From the 5 or 6 times that I had to call them, only once I got to talk to someone who had actual answers. All the rest didn't know about this, had no idea about that, they weren't sure about the other, and so on..I do not blame them though. I believe that it's a problem of leadership from IKEA's high ranked employees/partners. How can a phone customer service employee answer your questions if they don't give THEM first the information?Example: "When are the new dark coloured PAX panels gonna be released?". No one ever knew..- IKEA partners with Bring for product deliveries to homes, which is a really unreliable and full of hassle company (based on my personal experience and the dozens of bad reviews here on Trustpilot).- The PAX wardrobe designing tool would get stuck and reset, resulting in losing all of my editing and going back to the beginning. Tested both on phone and laptop.- The quality of most of their products is a joke but that's nothing new..- Quite expensive delivery but I'm soft about that because IKEA's main concept is "you get it by yourself, you build it by yourself, it's therefore cheaper".- The website is slow and often problematic.- An utterly exhausting experience to stroll around the physical store since one has to walk through the whoooooole thing in order to reach to what they're looking for.- Parts from the interior of PAX wardrobes are not discontinued but never back in stock. One plans for a wardrobe as he dreamed of it and then has to change way many things and compromise due to problematic availability.Positive:- Relatively affordable prices for the average hard working person who still doesn't earn much, the student and any other customer on a low budget. It gives chance to people to furnish their homes that they could not otherwise have.- Some really nice designs in both furniture and interior accessories.- Tasty food at their restaurant and I also love their simple ice cream.- One can book a cost free video appointment to get advice and help about the planing of a PAX wardrobe, a bed, kitchen renovation etc. I found it helpful.- Decent approach to a customer's complaint. I had problem with Bring who didn't deliver my order on time and the day was wasted. Then I was told that I had to wait for weeks before I could receive it! IKEA, expressing their regret for the inconvenience, managed to shortened the waiting time to one week and most impressively, compensated me with the full amount of the shipping cost (1999 kr). VERY APPRECIATED INDEED.- Smaller convenience (but if you think about it quite important): you can store your bags in a box with a key so you don't carry them around and have weight on your back or hands.- I haven't personally used it for my child but I give a plus for the existing playground so that the child/children don't have to tolerate the boredom of shopping and the parent/parents can shop without distractions.- Lovely furniture presentations at the physical store and some good inspiration online. Kudos to their decorators.All in all, I think that IKEA's results are a combination of talented designers and decorators as well as polite customer service employees and a team of people not competent enough in leadership and time & stock management.
