This was unacceptable!14 attempts with your Customer Service team to organise what should of been a simple replacement of two damaged side panels.For over 20 years we have been shopping with IKEA, purchasing many items. In the unlikely situation that there has been a problem, Ikea has always resolved the issue swiftly.We visited the Wembley store on Saturday 5th November and purchased various items including two IDANAS units. We put the first one together with no problems but unfortunately when it came to the second unit we were unable to build it due to these damaged panels.We called customer services,  waiting 40 minutes to finally speak to Aaron at 1pm on Monday the 7th November. He was very apologetic and assured us the replacement panels would come from Reading as this was the nearest store with stock.  We did not get confirmation of this but trusted all would be well.After not receiving any emails from Ikea or Parcel Force, I rang customer services on Thursday the 10th November waiting 30 minutes until 12.15 when I spoke with Sebastian who again was very apologetic and informed me that the order had been "stuck in the system ". She called the duty manager at Reading to authorise the order and said it would be picked on Friday the 11th and requested for it to be delivered on Monday the14th November.  I asked for email confirmation of this which she kindly did.Monday arrived and no delivery and no communication from either Ikea or Parcel Force.I called customer service on that Monday the 14th, waiting 30 minutes before speaking with Rachel at 12.40pm who was very short in her manner, not allowing me to finnish a sentence. I was trying to explain that we were expecting a delivery on that day and that we had heard nothing. Her response was to blame the other agent and that she had given us the wrong information! The parts had not even been picked yet and now they were coming from Wembley and would take 7 days to be delivered after being picked.when I asked to speak to a Manager, her response was that they would not be able to help. I asked again to speak with a Manager and was told it would be 72 hours and they would only call if they could help, which they couldn't.This was extremely disappointing to hear as there was most definitely a problem that needed to be resolved.On the 17th November I called customer services and spoke with Sebastian at 9.15am as no communication from Ikea or Parcel Force. Sebastian was as baffled as me. she informed me that the parts had not been collected and that Wembley didn't even have stock.Yet again we were waiting for a delivery that would never arrive!She booked it with Croydon.After not receiving any communication from Parcel Force again i called customer services and spoke with Josh Also on the 17th November at 5.53pm waiting about 20 minutes.I just needed a clarification it was picked and Parcel Force had it and also wanted an email address i could send a complaint to as the one supplied by Sebastian was not working. He asked me to send the email to him and he would forward it on.I called after hearing nothing on Monday the 21st of November and spoke with Rida at 12.29pm after a 30 minute wait.She informed me it was picked and Parcel Force would deliver that day. She confirmed this in an email to me.After no delivery I called the customer service team on the 22nd November and spoke with Muhammad at 9.45am after a 25 minute wait and he informed me Parcel Force now had the panels and it would take up to 4 days. I asked to speak with a Manager but he was unable to do this. He did however say he would forward it to his manager.  I asked if the Manager would contact me and for a email of our conversation.I waited until the 25th of November and this time my girlfriend called andspoke with 2 different  Customer service agents as the first Nabil dropped the call after 30 minutes,  didn't call back.  The second Shake basically said there was nothing she could do without pictures!I then called and spoke with Remi and after 30 minutes the call dropped, he never called back. Then I spoke with Darren. He informed me that the order was stuck in the system.  Seriously nearly 4 weeks.. I had to ask him to call Wembley Ikea and check stock and that I would go there myself. After a total of nearly 3 more hours ( 8 hours in total) I got permission to go and pick up the replacements for the damaged pannels myself!At no point did a Manager want to resolve this situation,  or was there any way I could escalate this.It was a totally unacceptable and avoidable situation.

articleTitle: Problems with quality, ordering, delivery and customer service
articleText: I wanted to write something a couple of months ago, but unfortunately my list of issues with Ikea just keeps increasing. We've spent €€€€ on Ikea furniture since September and had a staggering number of issues with ordering, delivery, product quality and customer support:- The iOS app has a permanent error message at the top and it is frequently unable to load my order history- We spent €1000 on a PAX unit and were told the day before delivery that two drawers were indefinitely out of stock, despite the fact that we designed the unit specifically with items that were in stock. After the out of stock message, there was no option to choose alternative items - just a take it or leave it option.- If you choose the option to have the missing items delivered later, it's converted into a separate order which is not added to your account, has no ability to track the status, and for which you will receive no automatic updates.- The above items are now available in-store for new customers but still not shipping to those who have already paid.- Most of the furniture we did receive was filthy inside the boxes. Not on the outside, literally inside. Covered in dust and in some places dirt that needed to be scrubbed off: PAX, Besta, Kallax and Lommarp units. €€€€ and you have to clean it all first.- Our Lommarp unit came with the wrong wooden parts (one was duplicated), meaning we couldn't assemble it. The entire unit needed to be replaced and we waited over a week for a collection and replacement.- Many Ikea items have stickers that don't come off easily. They crumble and leave glue residue underneath them. This means you need to spend time peeling them off in pieces and then googling how to clean glue off before spending time scrubbing.- Many parts have cosmetic issues in places: scratches, crumbling paint and in the case of our Vimle sofa, burns around one of the holes that made it extremely difficult to attach the bolts.- The functional design from product to product is inconsistent. Some units have adapters for skirting boards (Besta) and some don't (PAX). The adapters are, however, poorly designed because even at their smallest size, they're too big for many skirting boards.- The delivery tracking links don't work on mobile, which is terrible when you're expecting a 7am delivery. You should be able to check the link from bed, but instead need to use a laptop or desktop computer.- Some tracking links don't work on any devices because the URLs are broken. Since none of their tracking links are available in the apps, there is nowhere else to check. So a delivery window from 7am-2pm is a complete lottery.- The delivery is unreliable as the delivery windows aren't always respected by the logistics companies. They show up outside of the delivery/collection window without calling beforehand. In our case we weren't home, and had planned our day around the collection window.- The delivery company is supposed to phone an hour beforehand, which never happens. In some instances we received less than 10 minutes notice.- Important information is sent by email by customer support but there is never the option to reply to them.- The chat button on their website doesn't work at all on Safari on macOS- The chat tool often disconnects and you need to start completely from scratch, sometimes after 20+ minutes of chatting.- You cannot upload images to the chat tool, meaning if you're reporting a fault or damaged parts, you need to try to describe it rather than simply sending a photo- They will collect unwanted items within 14 days, but this isn't mentioned anywhere when filling out the returns forms. We missed it and had to pay for a 3rd party.I regret using Ikea and given the chance to buy this much furniture again, I would buy everything elsewhere.

This is regarding the abysmal delivery service on an online order, with delivery booked for 5:00 to 9:00 PM, Friday November 11.Our apartment building requires us to book the service elevator for deliveries like this due to the size of the parcels and the potential for damage inside the elevators. I had booked it for 6:00 to 9:00 PM accordingly.At 8:07 AM, I received a text from the delivery movers saying: "Hey its your ikea delivery for today,i was wondering if someone can be at the delivery address around 10-11we will be in your area around that if you can be there it will save us alot of time, if so it will be very appreciated Thanx for your time .please reply to confirm.st josesph".No one was going to be available from 10-11 AM because my partner and I were at work. We had booked the 5-9PM slot because that is when we were available to be home to receive the delivery. I did not see this message until around 10:30 AM. This was the only message received from the delivery contractors that day.My partner and I received a call from our building's concierge at 10:20 AM letting us know that some IKEA delivery contractors showed up with all the packages and told him that I gave them permission to come at that time to do the delivery. I absolutely had not given permission. They proceeded to come up to our floor and dump all the parcels in the apartment hallway outside our unit.This was not our first IKEA delivery, we knew that the delivery movers often come outside of the given window. But this was a 7 whole hours outside the booked delivery window. This was absurd.The movers did not use the service elevator, which is padded and inspected before and after moves, which meant that we, as the registered unit tenants would be liable for any damages that may have happened (more likely in the smaller, unpadded elevators). The big parcels blocking up the hallway were also fire hazards, which we could have been fined for had our building concierge not informed us immediately. My partner and I had to rush home from work to move the packages inside.Every part of this experience was infuriating and not what I expect from an IKEA furniture delivery.I reached out to customer service on their website but the only options were to call in or chat with a bot. I hate this trend of corporations being greedy and cheap by trying to force you to talk to a useless bot instead of an actual person via email. They refused to refund the delivery fee ($60) because "the service already happened" and upon pressing further, offered a $50 IKEA gift card which I refused. What an absolutely horrible customer service policies and experience.

Delivery set for today; email confirmation item out for delivery. THEN.. over 5 hours later get a call that truck broke down (after waiting 1 week anyways). Called/transferred to Resolution desk/Ken, says cannot refund delivery charge only if item not delivered.(hadn’t) He could offer a $25 gift card to IKEA. Told him NO! He didn’t try to do anything to make the customer feel better. Keep your dang gift card! He didn’t even try to apologize! Giving 1 star is too much! Now waiting 4 more days…..

Did this and the Ikea gift card would not work for 3 weeks. Finally got sorted then had the misfortune of talking to Luciana via online chat who cancelled my order!!Tried to fix it but then told me my postcode was not recognized (even though we bought from the store before with the same details so that's a lie) and will take 2 weeks for them to update their system. Zero effort to try and resolve anything!!! Told me it was tough luckI've cancelled the lot, it's a month of absolute torture I'll never get back)

This is the first time I've ever ordered from IKEA and it will most certainly be the last. I ordered a sectional couch and the night before it was scheduled to arrive, I received an email that said half of it was out of stock. I was refunded for the out of stock piece, but the other half of the couch was still sent. What am I supposed to do with half of a couch? Why send it at all? My wife and I spent over 2 hours putting together the half that arrived before realizing that something was wrong. This is when I checked my email and saw what had been sent the night prior. I then called customer service for a refund and to have the useless half couch picked up. I was told to take all of the pieces apart that we had spent hours putting together and to try to get it back into the boxes. Everything took up so much space in my house that it prevented me from ordering another couch from a more reputable company. It took days before someone finally came and picked everything up. Once they did, I thought the saga was over until a month later I discovered that I had STILL not been refunded for the useless half couch that should never have been sent in the first place. I called customer service once again to inquire about my refund and was told the systems were down and to try again later. The next day I called again and was told that I could finally expect my refund in 5-10 business days. Well, today I checked my credit card statement and it appears while I was refunded a portion, I am still missing over $250 dollars. I just had to call customer service AGAIN to ask where the rest of my money is and they have been unable to figure it out. They had to open up a case to have it looked into. Who knows when that will be? At this point I've paid IKEA a few hundred dollars for doing nothing except wasting my time. While I continue waiting for this to be handled properly, I'm letting everyone I know to NEVER buy from IKEA.

articleText: I purchased a table with chairs ahead of time to have for Thanksgiving.  The first delivery never arrived.  I called ikea and they had no answers for me. articleTitle: IKEA Birmingham. Like 3/4 of the reviews... Appalling Customer Service
articleText: Like 3/4 of the reviews, customer service is appalling. I purchased 2 cellular blinds knowing I had to trim to fit the width of the recess in the window. I used a Stanley knife to carefully cut the tape used to seal the box it came in.The instructions were hiding the mechanism so it wasn't until I could see it, that I didn't have enough space left to cut the blind. I sealed the blind back and made my way back to IKEA.The customer service lady took both blinds off me and in front of me, used a biro pen to open the box, she damaged the box in the process and then said she would need to check if it could go back in the store for resale. She came back and said, as it had been opened, it can't go back in store. I was offered a voucher or 70% refund for BOTH blinds. I asked to speak to her manager who promptly came. He said that both blinds were opened? Clearly, the customer service lady opened up the sealed blind and I argued this point, all I got was the same 70% or vouchers! I asked to see the returns policy for opened items, the manager showed me the policy for unopened items but the policy for opened items was "still being drafted". So I said, so there's no policy in force then! After several arguments the manager agreed to give me a voucher and a full refund for the blind that was damaged by the biro. Still not happy and I could have got trading standards involved etc but for £30 I couldn't be bothered. I won't ever shop at IKEA again, obviously these reviews are not having any impact on IKEA's customer service so be aware before you buy.

articleTitle: Bought 2 sofas minus armrests as they…
articleText: Bought 2 sofas minus armrests as they were not in stock on 19th July from Perth. Told armrests would be in in a few days. Rang up the stock check line every day to be told it was arriving the following day for 2 weeks. Spent over 10 hours on the phone chasing up. Got told this morning that shipment is not sure to arrive for another 4 weeks! stock in all other stores, but will not send. Can send from Sydney warehouse but will now arrive for 4 weeks anyway! Lachlan the manager would not contact anyone else to speed up delivery. Crazy system that you cannot order out of stock items or even be told an accurate date for when they would be in stock again! Will not be purchasing anything else from Ikea again.

articleTitle: I ordered a shelf unit and 5 inserts…
articleText: I ordered a shelf unit and 5 inserts delivered. The inserts were delivered, but the shelf unit was not. I called Ikea to be told that the item was backordered. It will take 2 weeks to get my money back. BEWARE - when you order online, it does not come from your local store, even though the order process makes it seem like it does. Just because it is available in your store does not mean it is available in the distribution center. What a waste of time.

If I could add minus stars, I would!Absolutely appalling customer service.Their Chat option is useless, tried 6 times in 2 days, & every time it says: “Billie has left the conversation” which hadn’t even started in the first place! & then, it says “we are all busy, please phone Ikea direct” Which I have done, 2 days running kept on hold for absolutely ages, pasts on from pillar to post, & “oh my system is down” or “my system has crashed pls call back tomorrow” And the assistant sounds so incompetent, she kept putting me on hold, and in the end concluded absolutely nothing, zero!!I am fuming! I’m so disappointed and shocked, at the appalling lack of professionalism that the IKEA customer service provides. I have lost all respect for the IKEA organisation, I used to be under the impression, that IKEA was a meticulously organised organisation, but how wrong I’ve been in thinking this.
Wrongly delivered item; hotline not reachable; don't respond to emails.
Horrible service please don’t buy … uncaring rude staff and customer support

Horrible customer service, someone has to train this people so everyone tells the same information. I have been transferred 15 times today just to get simple information. Thanks for wasting my time. Ikea credit card system is the worst.

articleTitle: Ikea Spain has the worst service they…
articleText: Ikea Spain has the worst service they first made us wait 1 month for fabric in sofa with the sofa unmounted in the house after 1 month they cancelled the order , we reordered another sofa supposedly in stock gave us delivery and they did not deliver it on delivery date

Disgusting service from IKEA customer service. First cot delivered and faulty, returned to the store and was promised to have the faulty pieces placed on hold in store to exchange. In the meantime the pieces were sold after driving 1.5hours. They sent me another cot for it to also be faulty. They picked up and promised a refund in 2-3 days. 1 month later and numerous phone calls later I have no cot and no refund of $800. oh and Ive also been hung up on twice because Im guessing they dont want to deal with it. Just dont know what else to do..

Order no 3B7828FBFD17 in Greece. My things arrived but the delivery service would not bring them up even though we have an elevator and had paid for delivery at  appartment level. we refused to accept delivery if not delivered in the manner agreed. My 7 packages have been missing ever since and 5 calls to ikea e-shop and 2 visits at the local store have not retrieved them yet. No mention of money return either. Tragic!

This is about the worst Customer Service I had the displeasure to experience. I arranged for the service to put together the items bought. On Thursday they show up but leave work unfinished. They promised to return the next day. Of course they did not. I reach out to them and they told me they had to leave due to severe pet allergies. I have two dogs and two cats. However none of the workers displayed any symptoms and we have an air purifier running 24/7. it is now almost a week later and four attempts to get reach a resolution. Customer Service has promised me twice now to call back and hasn't. This is absolutely ridiculous and does not even deserve one star

articleTitle: More than 70 minutes to get an issue solved? Terrible Customer Service
articleText: I called IKEA's customer service to ask about wrong order (already upsetting experience).But what happened then was a an unparalleled level of terrible customer service i have ever experienced. I had waited for about 25 minutes on the phone, with the most annoying on-hold music ever, then when it was my turn it rang only once and they disconnected me then without answering. They never called back. If i have to call again it would be another useless 25 minutes. Terrible.It gets even worse since this has happened also with their customer service chat. When it was my turn the agent closed the chat before i wrote my question.Finally, after getting hold on the chat with them, it took literally about 70 minutes to get the issue solved. Just incredible!.This company's customer service quality level is terribly terrible, not even mentioning the wrong orders they send or their deteriorating product quality or the puzzling instructions.

Ordered 10 items (Order 1312119743)  for delivery (which costs £40)Only 5 items arrived, the other 5 were missing. 1 item on inspection was damaged but the website won't let me raise the issue and asks me to call Ikea. When I called Ikea an automated service said they were too busy, pointed me back to the website to raise the issue and hung up. I cant spend all my time going around in circles so will have to take the 90 mile round trip to ikea. What was the point of paying Ikea £40 for delivery when they cant even get it right. Really poor service and I will be asking for a divorce from the so called Ikea family.

articleTitle: I cannot open my shopping bag online
articleText: I cannot open my shopping bag onlineto order but before that they changed a delivery day with out my permission and it was the day I was moving to a new apt. I had to deal with them and the delivery people they never coordinate anything together. I tried in vain to explaine the delivery system at my new place and finally had to cancel the whole order. Trying to avoid going to store because of Covid, I am old and cannot even open my shopping cart to place order and terrified of having to spend hours on phone explaining everything to both Ikea and the delivery people. who never communicate anyway. They made promiese and never kept them, am missing mattress to bed I ordered, they refunded me for matress , oh I just give up I hate them passionately!

If you need to return something, don't expect it to be an easy experience. I purchased blinds and when I opened them up at home, they were damaged. When I went to the return section, I had to wait nearly 45 minutes to speak to a rude person who said they couldn't accept it. I said that was ridiculous so they talked to their manager. After an additional 30 minutes, they finally gave me a refund.

articleTitle: It is getting one of the worst company…
articleText: It is getting one of the worst company in United States. Products without other parts and making people to  wait four months. The system doesn't let any information for the customers to protect themselves. They are getting terrible

articleTitle: We bought bedroom set in August but…
articleText: We bought bedroom set in August but didn’t get slatted bed base.The sales lady told us that it will available in two weeks but since then it two months and the set is used without bed base. It’s a shame that they cheat people to sale whatever they have wrong promise for matching parts. NOT WORTH SHOPPING. IF YOU WANT LOTS OF HASSLE AND MAKE YOURSELF MISERABLE 😖

I made some deliveries to drop at my home long time ago. I understand there aren’t free drivers and some stuff will come later. But if they are change schedule suddenly is so burdensome. I specifically asked to be off those days at work…
Driver was rude and unprofessional.never making  a delivery order from Ikea again.bad experience.

articleTitle: I would leave minus 10 rating but…
articleText: I would leave minus 10 rating but unfortunately this is not an option. IKEA customer service in Croydon is the worst service ever. I experienced this yesterday when tried to ask for a discount, which wasn't applied at the checkout. First of all I was waiting 35 mins in the queue. Just to mention, that the staff there wasn't busy with customers at all, as there was not many people waiting there. They were basically walking around, slowly of course, and having chats and one of them were sitting behind computer starring at the screen. When eventually I was called with the number, the woman there said that these type queries are not done here, but in another customer service  point. LOL but the problem is that there is no other point in Croydon branch, so she said that needed to ask her colleague for an advice. After another 10 mins of waiting for her colleague to finish his chat with the other representative, he confirmed, that I can apply for a refund! I tried to be helpful and speed up the process a bit, so I shown her photo I have taken on the shop floor to prove the discount. Surprisingly she rolled her eyes and laughed - this is unacceptable and I took that as really intentional and racist behavior as I am white. This customer service is poor and unacceptable. When I gave her my receipt to process the refund after 5 mins of having it in her hands she managed do tear it into 2 parts and then started to staple it! WHY?!!!!! now if i wanted to return any other of the products i bought this receipt wont be accepted i think! Lazy, unprofessional and racist customer service representatives -  IKEA Croydon -  please give your staff a proper training on manners and work etiquette as your reputation goes down!!! Horrible and beyond the joke!!!

articleTitle: Great day at IKEA Dublin yesterday with…
articleText: Great day at IKEA Dublin yesterday with adult son and daughter . Started with a lovely coffee in Swedish coffee shop  and headed up for browse through showrooms.   Met with really helpful team to advise and help design PAX fitted wardrobe providing printouts of our shopping list and our design summary. Headed for lovely lunch then in the busy cafe to re energise before  collecting our wardrobe requirements and proceeding to checkout .   Checkout team very cheerful and helpful and directed us to delivery dept .   Couldn’t believe our purchase would be delivered to Co Kilkenny the next morning (Sun) .   Received text giving approx delivery time and able to track the expected arrival time which was incredibly precise at 10.04am thanks to André and Obi (sorry if we misspelt  your names 😟) .  Thank you to all Ikea team for great shopping experience. Everyone so helpful and friendly 👏👏. All completed and delivered well within 24 hrs of us leaving home on Sat.  Well done to all !! 👍👍

Ordered an expensive corner sofa in store, it was to come in 2 deliveries, the woman spent some time getting the deliveries on the same day. The deliveries came and the drivers checked every box off carefully. The next morning we took our old sofa to the dump and got started opening boxes to find that the corner piece is missing, rendering the whole sofa useless. I spent an hour and 10 minutes waiting for ikea to answer the phone to be told by an offensively cheerful youth that oops, sorry, we should have sent you an email and the corner unit would be with you in 10 days - he maintained his sunny and cheerful disposition throughout, even when I explained that I'm disabled, exhausted from moving house and in a great deal of pain, and I desperately need a comfortable place to rest, he didn't seem bothered at all. I burst into tears. My husband would have driven anywhere to get that corner unit for me but no it's not in any store, no you can't collect it from the warehouse, no it can't be delivered from the warehouse to a store, no exceptions can be made, you cannot have the one piece that makes your very expensive sofa useable, you must sit in your wheelchair for 10 long days with no break, with your bones shifting further out of place, trapping your nerves so your legs feel scalded with boiling water. Oopsie, it'll take you months to recover will it? Oh dear, can't have your visitors who were going to help you unpack, because there's nowhere to sit and you can't ask folks in their 70s to sit on the floor? Not to worry, the corner piece will be with you in 10 days, have a lovely day and here's a £20 voucher, don't spend it all at once. Ikea just don't give a ****.

articleTitle: Ikea kungens kurva under a remodeling chaos!
articleText: IKEA!! What is going on with your staff under a reconstruction chaos!!Just in and out to pickup items took over 1 hour because of all the mess inside the store and definitely the worst staff experience you could have during this time.Make sure your staff is on top of their game, willing to help an English speaker!It seems like all of the remodeling is pushing your staff to the breaking point!More organization is definitely needed if that is what you are selling as your slogan.

Horrible. I had a pick-up order and they gave me the wrong item. I called them and they started a case on it and asked them to deliver the right product to me since it was their mistake. After 45 days I called them again and they said that the only way to remedy it would be to physically go into the store myself which was going to be a pain since I didn’t have a car. And, they said that I couldn’t speak to anyone about it so that was their final decision. They are horrible with customers. Once you buy something, make sure it’s the right thing because otherwise you’re screwed.

I am a 99% online shopper. I have frequently made purchase and returned items to other stores with no problem. However, that is not true with Ikea. First off, they do not provide free return shipping. After paying $17.00 to return the items to the closet store near me, and waiting 2 weeks, I called customer service, waiting 10 minutes to talk to representative. I was then informed, that even though my package was delivered 2 weeks earlier, it wasn't processed until 2 days ago because they had "other returns. Now I have to wait up to another 14 days from now for my refund. All in all , it will take about a month when other sites take days. My advice, only order from Ikea if you're positive you are going to keep it. Very disappointed and will not be ordering from them again!

articleTitle: Customer service - dealing with queries and complaints is atrocious
articleText: I have always held Ikea brand in high esteem. However, what has just happened is an instance of shocking incompetence and downright rudeness! I received an Ikea Credit contract, on which is clearly reads that I can submit it in Ikea Store. As a person residing in Germany, without a German ID, I was required to present a confirmation of residency, however, the contract also outlined documents like, mobile plan contract, salary receipt, etc. Upon arrival it was first confirmed by a friendly employee but a second later another one declined my contract and told me to obtain the confirmation of residency first.I contacted Ikea customer service subsequently, and the lady in chat said I didn't need proof of residency after all. She still sounded unsure and asked me to get in touch with the bank (IKANO) and abruptly ended the chat, without waiting to hear from me at all!!! I was stunned! This is incredibly disrespectful and downright rude! I filed a complaint through Ikea Online contact form and received a phone call from them. Again, the person on the other end was not sure as to whether I needed the damn proof of residency or not!!! I can't believe that a brand like Ikea can have such incompetent customer service, especially that it was a simple yes/no question.I have wasted a few hours to no avail. Worst customer service experience ever!!!!!

articleTitle: Don't advertise services that won't get done!
articleText: I ordered 5 bookshelves online to be delivered and taken to the third floor, when the delivery driver got here he did not buzz the security door (as instructed) and when I heard him banging on the door I went down and he said in a rude tone, you never answered your phone and walked away. I was working so I left my daughter to direct them where to take the boxes but when she asked them to take them to the 3rd floor as requested he said No, IKEA does not let us do that (even though it was given to me as an option). The long boxes are now all sitting in the main kitchen area and since I am not allowed to lift anything I can not move them for 6 weeks and it is very awkward getting around them. I think I should get a refund on at least the delivery fee and have someone take them to where they were supposed to go in the first place.

articleTitle: Farah was the worst customer service…
articleText: Farah was the worst customer service agent I’ve ever encountered. She just did not want to help at all and instead told me to call the customer service. What kind of employee is that?It was for the Dutch ikea. Worst experience I ever had.

articleTitle: Do NOT order online from IKEA Malaga…
articleText: Do NOT order online from IKEA Malaga unless you have plenty of time to wait. We were promised delivery Saturday after ordering three weeks ago. After waiting all day, they changed it to Tuesday. Now I get a message saying they had to cancel my order and make a new one, and postponed again to Friday. But Friday is a holiday, so no way they will deliver then either. Also I cannot even access the new order. Meanwhile we are literally sitting on the floor eating. Thank God we ordered the beds from a serious company and not IKEA.PS... in Sweden there are never any problems with IKEA, which was the main reason I chose them.

articleTitle: Came into today and ran into Sorell she…
articleText: Came into today and ran into Sorell she was awesome. She was able to help me find some led lights that I’ve been searching for. She was spectacular with math and measurements. I’m so happy she was here to help. This store is so big but running into her was delightful, you guys are lucky to have an employee like her. Very good customer service skills.

articleTitle: We purchased a dresser from the Long…
articleText: We purchased a dresser from the Long Island  IKEA this summer. It was for an apartment four hours from the store.  On trying to assemble it, the drawers would not stay on track.  When we spoke with customer service, they told us we had to return it to the store.  To be fair, this is stated on their website.   So we were going to have to disassemble the dresser and take a four hour drive to return it?  It wasn’t feasible.  Then they said they would review a refund, we even sent pictures. We never heard from them.  Lesson learned, if you are not near a store, returning is not easy to do. Read reviews on each item!

For months they have not had products in stock that we’ve been waiting for. Every time I’ve either went to the store or called they say “they’ll be in next month”. They’re liars, and this company has gone downhill fast in terms of reliability, stocking, and customer service. It’s a shame to see this, because IKEA in the US is giving this organization a bad reputation. This is NOT how they’re run overseas…speaking from firsthand experience.

The whole company appears to be a disaster right now. I don’t know what’s going on but I’ve spent hours on the phone today and from what I can see, it’s a total mess!! Two women that I spoke to were AMAZING, but the New Haven store red flagged first woman’s work so it didn’t go through, and second woman got disconnected. I’ve been on the phone for over 3 hrs today. I’m taking this one to the top. I’ve been trying to speak to a supervisor for over an hour, and I’m pretty sure the “supervisor” was “chatting” via messenger with my latest associate, IKEA can’t even get the Supervisor on the line for the call-in associate??! I want full refund at this point for all purchases placed on 9/5 and I want my items. This has been worse than dealing with Optimum internet. I’m a reasonable person and I’m fuming. You’ll be hearing more if I don’t get this resolved tonight. The latest guy promised I wouldn’t need to re-explain myself, I did have to! Going on 2 hrs... IKEA Look up all my case numbers. Again latest call with Resolution was dropped and now I’m on hold again.

articleTitle: Delay between buying and building our…
articleText: Delay between buying and building our kitchen went from 4 weeks to 10 weeks because the sink stopper was missing causing the delivery to be postponed of 3 days! Do you really need the sink stopper to build the kitchen! What a joke!

articleTitle: Chaos for Online Status of Products
articleText: The online status of the products in individual shop of Ikea in Canada is very chaotic.  In the morning, we found the Bed Canopy Lova has 23 in stock in the North York shop, so we went to the shop in the afternoon, but we found nothing in kids showroom.  Then we checked with the staff there, they also found 23 in stock, but they said I should try click and collect.  Fine, when I got home in the evening, the website showed out of stock.  It is a mess completely, wasting my time, and such an unpleasant experience.  Hope that I can find another better company that I can shop furniture.

Today I contacted customer service, on the one occasion I have asked for help in countless years of purchases from furniture to storage and  market place items.  I made a large investment over several years in Korken, kitchen storage jars.  These are displayed on the sales page with preserves in them.  I think as preserving jars they are fabulous and take the strain of water bathing for safe canning.  They are easily checkable after for the perfect seal.  I have never broken on in the several years of using them.You might wonder why only one star review!Packs of 5 rubber replacement seals vanished from the shelves about 18 months ago.  I was fobbed off in store with the idea they were probably in one of those shipping containers.  Last time I visited (6 months ago) I asked another real, live person ---- not they weren't in stock.  Today, in the busy months of preserving, I asked online.First I dealt with Billie Bot --- going in silly circles.  Finally even Billie Bot quit in favour of a person and Philippe came online.  Philippe was courteous and polite, but unable to offer any customer service whatsoever.  Like Billie Bot there were quotations of the company policy - it is discontinued, products become unavailable, Ikea holds the right to withdraw products.  An apology only when I explained how much I have invested in this glassware (plus all the other preserving materials like canning pans etc) and a promise to pass my complaint on.  I ask how this will work and when a response is expected.  Basically the response could be translated ' that the item is discontinued so i will just tell someone you are disgruntled and they will ignore you'.  What a company, that can't offer real customer service or offer resolution.  Ikea has lost my custom totally now -- no more purchases at all.  Beware if you think they look good and cheaper than Kilner...that's where it stops, maybe Kilner have a better customer service.  I haven't yet sourced rubber or something akin to the thickness of these seals (I have been looking since the last in person visit to store).  I think it must be rubbish to have a customer service role if you can't offer customer service, but I guess the initial purchases are the only interest...sad.

articleTitle: Ordered a bed frame from ikea
articleText: Ordered a bed frame from ikea, had to pick it up in Vaughan north York.. an boy let me tell you what a hassle that was. GPS sends you to the 4700 address which is the whole school property. No signs or nothing I spent 1 hour looking for penguin pick up… ikea tells me nothing.. after finally finding penguin pickup. They hand me all my boxes on a trolly at which I have to push all the way to my car with no help.. of course my items don’t fit into the elevator so I have so roll it up the parking lot ramps round and round as I’m at the top… worst experience of my life. Will never order from ikea pickup at penguin again..

articleTitle: I ordered a rug for delivery
articleText: I ordered a rug for delivery. I stayed home and was tracking my rug. As soon as it said that my rug was delivered I contacted IKEA because it had not been delivered. After 1&1/2 hours of being on the phone Ikea said that they would resend the rug the next Tuesday. I again stay home no rug. I call again. Oh sorry that request was never sent through. Let us give you a $25 gift card. Well that was not what I wanted but fine. I only mention it because it never came either. So they then say that I will get my rug on Friday. The next day I get a text saying that my rug will be delivered between 12 &4. I’m at work! Ya know so that I can buy rugs! I’m done with all of this so I call and waste more time canceling my order. I want a refund. I’m done. So she says 3-5 days for my refund. Well guess what? That request was never sent through so after 8 days I call. I’m told that it takes 10 days. WHAT? After 11 days I call again I’m told that the request was never sent through. I ordered the item on August 24th it’s September 20th and I have nothing. I was told yesterday that I will have my $ within 3 days. I believe that IKEA does this as a practice knowing that most people won’t put in the effort to get the $ back. This is a $200 item. Awful

Horrendous is an understatement.  I've spent 6.5 hours on the phone with their incompetent, rude, and careless customer service, riddled with people that don't know what they're doing.  Ikea used to be great, and that greatness died along with its founder.  Aside from the fact that they are wasting my time, and company time, by causing so much time to go down into the dregs of the toilet, they are also wasting their own resources, which I could care less about, by having their delivery partners drive all the way to my house on multiple occasions (3 companies, twice each, amounting to 6 trips), only for me to turn them away, because Ikea dropped the ball and didn't cancel/reschedule themselves, as discussed.  I'm providing these delivery partners with reference numbers, names, and dates, so they can be compensated for their wasted time that Ikea couldn't care less about. I messaged Ikea on instagram (at Ikea's public request in the comments), and they have gone unanswered; emails to customer service have gone unanswered, chat reps pass the buck and transfer you around until you give up---two weeks of this with no resolution in sight.  My best option is to file a charge back with my bank.  I would have been better off splurging on expensive furniture from Crate and Barrel and CB2, with all of the time I wasted with Ikea---their cheap, flat-box, formaldehyde off-gassing furniture just isn't worth it.

articleTitle: Welcome to Dante's Ninth Level of Hell
articleText: If you MUST buy IKEA, go to their stores. Online is pure torture. Website ordering has flaws that will bite you. Customer service has minimal information and knowledge. Delivery dates are meaningless. Details: Moved daughter into off-campus apartment. Found two HAVSTRA products she wanted. They are "real wood", not the typical compressed sawdust. Wood is mediocre quality. Not the clear grade wood in quality furniture. However, knots and such are fairly well hidden since they use paint, not stain, to color the wood. If you get dark color, any dings, etc. will be very visible. They also do not paint the back side so you have to place against a wall or have raw wood visible. Instructions are pictures only so no way to communicate any warnings beyond one or two basics. The "quicklock" screws MUST go in exactly straight. Remove and retry if they start going crooked, otherwise you will split the wood. Pre-drilled holes are inconsistent in size. One dowel will be completely loose and another will be a struggle to get in. Alignment was accurate enough to assemble joints but some needed some real effort. Either save money and buy self-assemble furniture at Walmart or buy real furniture from a real furniture store. Decided to order online and have shipped because items came in boxes weighing 60+ pounds according to their website. You enter delivery instructions in a box. There is actually a character limit but if you exceed it, the box turns red and you get "information entered not in expected format" message. Customer service was clueless and while on extended hold while they tried to find out what that meant, I managed to figure it out. After submitting order, you never see your delivery instructions again in any IKEA emails. Had specified Sept. 9 delivery date on order placed twelve days earlier. Sept. 5 email said order had shipped with Sept. 9 delivery. On Sept. 7, delivery confirmation received with delivery date field blank. Why send email saying delivery is confirmed then? Turned out blank meant not being delivered. Did not receive call on Sept. 8 with delivery time window that I was told to expect. Called delivery vendor (GoBolt in my area) on Sept. 9 and found myself in heaven. They are polar opposite of IKEA. They were the ones that told me nothing was being delivered that day. They only know they have an IKEA delivery to make when the motor freight truck delivers it to them. They get no notification from IKEA. They explained the entire process and answered every question. Prior call that morning to IKEA customer service was useless and hung up after being put on hold for 3-4 times. Also, you MUST have exact order number for IKEA to ATTEMPT to help. They have no way to look it up. On the evening of 9th, noticed I had another delivery confirmation email from that aternoon and the delivery date was NOT blank. Had Sept 13. First thing following Monday, called GoBolt again. They confirmed they did have my order to deliver the next day. Gave me a four hour delivery window and my place in the delivery queue. Confirmed that they actually received my delivery instructions from IKEA too. On morning of 13th, received a link from GoBolt that let me track the delivery truck. After completing delivery prior to me, driver texted me that they were on the way to me. Delivery was fast, courteous and very professional. GoBolt was wonderful but I will never buy from IKEA ever again for the rest of my life.

articleTitle: The worst customer service I have ever…
articleText: The worst customer service I have ever experienced. I don't say this lightly they have been totally useless other than one employee who helped us design our kitchen and even then we are a year down the line with no kitchen and he is powerless to help.Contact with them is non existent have spoken to a Manager after over an hours wait on the line on a couple of occasions and then nothing comes from it with no follow up contact. I have sent numerous emails with details that get ignored and have received nothing back from my email of complaint what's so ever. One would think communication would be key to a trusted company. To say we are frustrated is an understatement.

Had bad experience with their bed Idanäs in size 160x200, in dark brown color.Bed itself is very well thought of regarding assembly and function,  but finish quality is on low level. And bed is not that cheap. There are lot of marks and spots on wood, differences in wood coloration, bad assembled nuts. Usually this is not the case with Ikea.What prompted me to write here is lack of wilingness from their side to publish my recension on their official Web page.

articleTitle: Why does Ikea even bother offering…
articleText: Why does Ikea even bother offering delivery services when they are that utterly useless. After 4 failed attempts to receive the shipment I canceled my order. I wasted 4 afternoons / mornings waiting for the delivery. All the customer service had to say is sorry. I feel sorry for the people who work in this company. Certainly the last time I ordered or tried to buy anything from IKEA

I placed a large order, so large that at checkout many of the items were not in stock, so I reduced the order to all of the items they showed as in stock.  I wasn't happy reducing my order as they charge for delivery no matter how much you spend so I prefer to get my money's worth.   On delivery day they only bring 2/3 of the stuff I ordered and the rest doesn't show up, several hours later I get an email from Ikea saying my items weren't available at the time they were loading the truck so they are refunding me and I can re-order again.  They won't offer free shipping for the parts they missed, I should also mention the parts still show as in stock on the site so it's not as though they aren't in stock and it was an inventory glitch, the only glitch was the lazy effers who did not load the truck right.  No reply to customer service emails.    The pandemic has clearly shaken what was once a half decent place to shop.
Bought in store some furniture for my living room. Easy to put up, looks good - not the best quality but great for the price, value spot on.

Ordered a feeding chair for my baby. It came without the safety belt. No matter how many phone calls, or emails I cannot reach them, they always say someone will call me back to offer a replacement. So now I have a chair that's is pretty much useless, I won't put my child up there unattended.

articleTitle: If you order something online for…
articleText: If you order something online for pick-up, they can cancel it without notifying you. A trip to the store for nothing. About 50% chance of pleasant customer support.
If you order something online for pick-up, they can cancel it without notifying you. A trip to the store for nothing. About 50% chance of pleasant customer support.

articleTitle: Over an hour on hold, £14.62 phone bill for this call.
articleText: I ordered something that was £5 by post, I made a small mistake and tried to cancel.  But the website said I couldn't cancel at this time, so I tried webchat and nobody connected.  So I tried to use returns, web form said I couldn't return at this time.  So I tried online chat again, nobody responded for 1 hour.  There was no email address, so I phoned and eventually somebody answered after an hour of listening to Abba.The phone call lasted 63 minutes, I was charged £14.62 for that phone call.  Their phone number is charged different rates for different providers.  I have just got my phone bill today.  No warning of phone charges on their website.

articleTitle: We are extremely dissatisfied with service
articleText: We are extremely dissatisfied with the company IKEA Cyprus which offers a subcontracting company for kitchen assembly.We had an understanding that we would get good quality service ordering via brand IKEA but it happened vice versa. The kitchen was assembled with a lot of issues and we have been waiting for 2 weeks since then to get this company workers for rectifying. Presently there is nothing done.The quality of their service is below the worst expectations. We are of opinion that this subcontracting company was chosen by IKEA Cyprus managing stuff not on a basis of quality of service
Horrific delivery standards once again. And it costs 60$ for this disservice.
Terrible. Paid 1k for cabinets. 5 weeks on no delivery no cabinets no money. Worse customer service impossible to get a hold of.

articleTitle: I ordered a shelf unit and 5 inserts…
articleText: I ordered a shelf unit and 5 inserts delivered. The inserts were delivered, but the shelf unit was not. I called Ikea to be told that the item was backordered. No one called or emailed to tell me this. The rep told me they don't notify customers anymore. They don't know when it will be in stock. Obviously the inserts are useless without the shelf. It will take 2 weeks to get my money back. BEWARE - when you order online, it does not come from your local store, even though the order process makes it seem like it does. Just because it is available in your store does not mean it is available in the distribution center. What a waste of time.

articleTitle: Ikea has not been able to track a…
articleText: Ikea has not been able to track a simple order either they have no clue of delivery and the customr care is simply rude , they are not even in a position to listen to the customer , they simple hang up saying we cant help

I really am too lazy to write reviews, which should speak volumes to just how poor IKEA's customer service is.I was supposed to have a new sofa and some other furniture delivered 10 days ago. I was told the driver was in hospital and wouldn't be able to deliver that day,  of course I was completely okay with that. I was told the drivers are always in the area and my items would be with me soon.I've tried to contact IKEA through their customer service Twitter page, where I've been steadfastly ignored, through their chat bot, which constantly promises a human to talk to who never appears, and have tried to email the contact address they text to you with your delivery date (it got sent back as a mailer daemon). I can't phone as I'm ill and have lost my voice, and I imagine many more people are unable to phone for a variety of reasons.Today, 10 days later, I have received in the evening a text and email with a twelve hour delivery period for "tomorrow" September the 2nd, that date was 10 days ago.Now I get to go to sleep worrying that they'll turn up to my house tomorrow, where I am ill, with a huge amount of furniture and no warning. And if they don't, they've just disappeared with almost £1500 worth of furniture.

The website shipping availability is very deceiving. It will show items are available for shipping to my zip code while adding to the cart, but at checkout, it will suddenly say not available to ship. This is after wasting lots of time choosing and shopping.This seems to be intentional so you don't leave the site and it is very wrong.

articleTitle: Absolutely horrendous from start to not…
articleText: Absolutely horrendous from start to not yet finished..Ordered and collected a Malm desk.When home and unpacked, the desk was damaged, so spent an hour on hold to resolve. I was then told they would ship a new part in 5 days. However nothing arrived…Phoned again and another hour on hold, to be told again that they will ship the piece in 5 days.After 5 days the wrong piece arrived, so yet another hour on hold and a 2 hour discussion to get a new part sent to me on express delivery..Guess what? - no delivery and I’m currently on hold trying to get this resolved.I’m asking to speak with a customer services manager but been told that they work from home and is in a meeting on a Sunday, which I questioned and was then told “That’s if he’ll speak to you”All I want is the correct undamaged piece but this is totally beyond their capabilities.I will NEVER shop here again…

articleTitle: Beware of buying IKEA Floor Models
articleText: I left IKEA Renton with a functioning clock today. But first I was told by 3 IKEA employees that I had to go home with a totally broken, unusable item that cost $50.99. The reason? The item was sold As-Is.I interacted with 2 IKEA employees when I purchased this item. The website was reporting that there were 4 of these clocks in stock, but there were none. I asked a salesperson about this and she asked if I wanted to buy the floor model and I said Yes. She directed me to another part of the store where another employee took the clock, then gave it back to me, without a word. He gave me a tag that said in huge black letters on a yellow background: $50.99. The original price was $59.99. I didn’t think this was much of a discount, but I didn’t say anything.When I got home, I printed the instructions from the IKEA website, and I inserted new batteries. According to the instructions, the numbers were supposed to start flashing, but they didn’t. I tried to insert a USB cable, but it would not go in. The instructions did not say what kind of cable to use and it didn’t come with a cable. The clock did not work at all.I prepared to return the item. I got the tag and receipt. Now that I had my glasses on, I could see that the tag said in very small letters, under the price, “ASIS Non-Refundable.” I didn’t think that would be a problem. I wasn’t planning to ask for a refund. I just wanted a store credit. I assumed that a reputable company like IKEA would issue a store credit for an item that was totally broken. I never imagined that a company like IKEA would expect me to pay $50.99 for merchandise that was unusable. But I was mistaken.I went to the Returns area 2 weeks later and told the IKEA employee that called my name that I would like a store credit for an item that was broken. She said it was As-Is so she could not take it back. I explained that no one told me it was As-Is and As-Is was printed in tiny letters that I didn’t see because I did not have my glasses on. She called a manager in Recovery and when she hung up, she handed the clock back to me and said they would not give me a store credit.I said that was unacceptable, and that I wanted to talk to the Recovery manager.The Recovery manager came out and was insulting. She reiterated that the item was As-Is and said several times that I had waited “a month” to return it. I bought it exactly 2 weeks prior. She said I could put on my glasses, turn over the receipt, and read the As-Is policy which is printed on the back. She said they would not give me a refund. I said I didn’t ask for a refund, that I wanted a store credit. She said no. I said that is unacceptable, I want to talk to your manager.Soon a third IKEA employee came over to talk to me. She pointed out that the area I went to to get the tag 2 weeks ago, had a sign that says As-Is.1. I didn’t notice the sign2. Even if I did, I would not know that it applied to me because no one said As-Is to me, only Floor Model.3. Even if I was told the clock was As-Is, I would still expect a store credit if the item turned out to be totally broken and unusable.She said IKEA’s As-Is policy is very strict. I said, if that’s your policy, and you are going to enforce it with no exceptions, you need to train your employees to explain that to customers. She said I had waited “over a month” to return it. It was, in fact, exactly 2 weeks. She also referenced the fact that the clock had been “deeply discounted.” The clock was discounted less than 10%. Since it didn’t come with the cable included with new clocks, I would have to purchase one, which really makes the discount closer to 5%. That is not a deep discount. Eventually she took the clock in the back, and returned with it in about 2 minutes. It was working. I asked what they did and she said they just put batteries in it. I put new batteries in it and it did not work, so I don’t know what happened.IKEA clearly puts time and effort into training it’s employees to enforce its As-Is policy even when circumstances make it unethical to do so, as they were in my case today. It may be legal. It is not ethical.IKEA needs to redirect some of the energy it puts into training employees to enforce the As-Is policy, into training employees to make the As-Is policy clear to customers before they buy one of these items. For example, “This is a floor model which means it is sold As-Is which means it cannot be returned, even for store credit, even if you find it doesn’t work at all.”I couldn’t even throw it in the trash because it requires special disposal.I wanted to put this in writing and submit it to IKEA, but when I called customer service I was told that there is no email or physical mailing address for IKEA.I do like my clock very much.

articleTitle: They don't know the difference between…
articleText: They don't know the difference between the colors green and yellow.What a joke.

Absolute garbage. The call service will never actually connect you with a person, the chat box disconnects when you request to connect to a person and they don’t have a help desk email option. Your only option when they mess up is to go in person because they already took your money. Go to hell Ikea

Product discoloured after a month , there is not way of accessing their customer service as their website forces you to use a chat bot, when it finally determines that a human is needed none are available and you are told to call. The phone number just plays Abba , causing grievous damage to my ears and mental state and to top it off the call is never answered .

articleTitle: I ordered few stuff 2 different sizes…
articleText: I ordered few stuff 2 different sizes Pax wardrobe and when I was almost finish building it ( this is the the 100cm length ), then I saw the the right under part and other things is broken so it can effect the wardrobe it’s self to stand. I called the call center right away to complain about it and they agreed to change the whole package. Then I opened the second package from Pax wardrobe 50cm length and check it right away then I found out exactly the same broken part. It was funny because the broken part it’s on the same place but from the packaging doesn’t have hole. It means the didn’t check it right before the did the packaging and send it to the customers. Then I called the call center again that I want to cancel so they can take the stuff back and the want me to pay for pick up arrangement. It’s not my fault that this happens, it’s their faults not to check the the goods before they sending it. What kind of service is that? I paid the delivery service it’s self already 89,99 euros and now they want me to pay for pick up even though it’s not my mistake???? Pleas IKEA, if you don’t want to get any complain do the quality control correctly. I will not complain if I’m satisfied with the goods but because this is not the first it’s happened to me that’s why I’m very disappointed and angry. Please be professional taking care of problems from customer. By the way this one is for IKEA GERMANY!

articleTitle: It took three times for them to deliver…
articleText: It took three times for them to deliver my order. The first guys were brilliant brought it up to my flat and were so nice. The second lot I never saw. The guys who finally brought the second half of my delivery were worse than useless. Complained about everything and left it to us to bring up. We paid £40 for delivery and did not receive a good service. Spent hours (literally) on the phone sorting the deliveries out only for this. Frankly I am pretty angry and would think twice before using ikea again

articleTitle: Bad service and after purchase experience !
articleText: First they changed my sofa delivery twice and then they put 2 weeks between the delivery date and the installation (??) And how come suddenly I have a standard delivery when I specifically asked for in home delivery. Bad service and after purchase experience.

articleTitle: If I can convice just one person not to…
articleText: If I can convice just one person not to buy an Ikea kitchen, I feel that I would have done the world a good service.Ikea kitchens are well rated on Which.com, which is why I purchased one. But be warned - ikea do not manufacture any of their appliances. Their relationship with the manufacturers is basically the same as my relationship with them - they don't speak to eachother, they don't like eachother, and they certainly won't be helping you if things go wrong. I have had issues with both the fridge and the freezer and I have been bounced between 4 different departments over a week long period. DO NOT BUY IKEA KITCHENS IF YOU WANT TO MAINTAIN YOUR SANITY.

articleTitle: Just got off the phone processing a…
articleText: Just got off the phone processing a return.  Made already three phone calls, chatted online - all required, and we are still not finished. I am amazed that any company could complicate a return process to such degree. It is beyond a joke, bad, bad, bad service! Will never ever buy from ikea or even any ikea product elsewhere.

Customer Care have failed to contact me on multiple occasions that the order will not be delivered and that they are having issues on their end with the supply. I have been waiting on my delivery for over 2 weeks. They paid 60 euro for a tailored delivery service - this has not been achieved and in fact has broken all their own terms of service.Awful experience, company is in a shambles taking money from consumers but failing to deliver the service because they cannot manage their own suppliers. I will be hounding Ikea until this is resolved.

articleTitle: I should have read these reviews before…
articleText: I should have read these reviews before ordering and then I wouldn’t have bothered.I ordered a few things including an iron rest which when it arrived was too narrow for the iron to fit in.  Simply return it to a collection point and they will give you a receipt it said so I followed the instructions.  You get a receipt by email I’m told so I waited but nothing came.What I didn’t realise was that customer service is non existent so with no receipt, no help available I have to write off the money as wasted.Beware don’t bother ordering.

Worst experience in my life buying furniture from this place.  its not bad enough they make you walk through a maze when you go to the store.  i bought a pax system last october 2021 and its sept 2022 and i am still waiting on parts.  The glass drawers took forever to get and then i still dont have the mirrors for my door so i have no door on my pax system for almost a year.  support is no help at all.  stay away this company lost the formula and doenst compare to others.  plus they make you pay for delivery so i have to drive an hour to get there just to pick stuff up.

articleTitle: You'll be waiting a very long time....
articleText: Ordered and paid online. They have changed delivery 3 times.This is not big furniture, this is box sized, lamps, bulbs etc.It will be at least a month now from payment to delivery.A WHOLE MONTH!They also have the most expensive delivery for this 'service'.Next time I'll stick to very well known brand that delivers same day and no longer releases a catalogue every other week.

articleTitle: The Ikea support line is disappointing...
articleText: I don't usually bother writing reviews, but calling the Ikea customer support line has just been so frustrating regarding my replacement delivery, I really wanted to say something. Especially when I finally got my store's direct number, and realized that calling the store is like unbelievably less painful and stressful?? Like the difference was astonishing, my brain could not even fully process in the moment how easily my issue was resolved, compared to the call agents that almost seemed like they have no idea what to do. Then also, why has none of the 10+ call agents I talked to considered giving me the store's direct phone number? Or tell me to consider going to the store directly? Instead, I was trying so hard to work with them, telling them the same issue over and over again, only to get hung up on, left on hold, or ending up with no solutions or answers.The issue was my replacement delivery didn't happen in the time frame, or day that NGL (their delivery company) gave me, which was supposed to be 8am to 12pm. I even called at around 11:30am to double check, and they said it would arrive within 15 minutes. Then it was past 12pm and it still didn't arrive...I had to leave, so I called my apartment office to check again at around 2pm, and it STILL didn't arrive. On top of that, nobody called or emailed me to inform me. I had to call NGL again to know that they wouldn't be able to make the delivery that day. Then they told me to call again to ask about the new delivery date, but when I called again, they said that it got cancelled. So I had to try figuring out what happened from the support line, and like I said earlier, was very frustrating and not very helpful.Overall, just very disappointing considering all the hype and good things I hear about Ikea.

Paid for delivery and professional services, yet receive unprofessional services. Doors for cabinet not aligned and there are gaps between doors and frame and between doors. Assembly guy din even ask me how I want the shelves to be places. Will never buy furniture from IKEA again.

articleTitle: We bought an IVAR cabinet on the 18th…
articleText: We bought an IVAR cabinet on the 18th of August. We were supposed to receive the parcel on the 29th of August.On the 28th of September, we receive an SMS saying that they had arranged the delivery on the 3rd of September and like half an hour later on, it was rearranged to the 5th of September. After complaining on the phone, we were told that it will be delivered finally on the 2nd of September. Yesterday, we received an SMS confirming that it will arrive today. After waiting to receive it, my partner called to be told that it was a problem and could not be delivered today...we received a 20 GBP voucher as compensation (a totally joke!).As we are leaving on holidays, we are not going to get the cabinet delivered until the 17th of September (if what they say it is right... I totally do not believe it). If by the. 1st of October, I do not have it at home, I will ask for a refund and I will not bother to buy from them any longer!!!!Worst customer and delivery service that I have seen in my life so far!!!!

articleTitle: Unable to get a replacement part
articleText: Ordered an Alex unit a month ago and it came with a broken side panel.Been on the phone 3 times with customer service and promised a delivery of the broken part 3 times already, still haven't got the part nor a tracking number confirmation.Not sure why it wouldn't be possible to handle a replacement of a broken part directly through the website, nor why it would take more than a week to deliver it, given that if I ordered a new Alex unit it would be here already.

articleTitle: First time ordering and I will never…
articleText: First time ordering and I will never use them again. Ordered the sofa day bed for my son, went to build it and the runners for the drawers were missing, rang and was on hold 30 minutes, woman very nice and ordered me some runners, they arrived 1 week later, started to build the bed and realised half of the items were missing. Spoke to someone on chat who said they would send the missing parts but another 2 days wait. IKEA delivery driver came today and was very rude, demanded I move my car as he had a big van. Said he could not deliver items unless he collected items - I didn’t request a collection or know a collection was supposed to take place. My dad had to persuade him to leave the items, he left them in the garden not the house! Hopefully all the parts are now here so my son actually has a bed to sleep in. Avoid at all costs.

Worst costumer and delivery service!As I live in the center of the city, it is not allowed to deliver product within the day but after 19 pm. I have chosen the delivery time btw 2pm and 21 pm and made a note that it is not possible before 19 pm.I received an email that the delivery will take place between 13 and 16 pm. Contacted with ikea and got no support only defense saying that I had to write down “pedestrian zone” instead “ delivery not allowed before 19 pm”.There is no specific drop-down list or whatsoever. How they can define such words to be acceptable and nothing else is excused. The delivery company will not deliver the product.This is the 3rd time I have experienced such weak costumer service. Highly disappointed as a costumer. Very bad impression on the brand itself due to poor costumer service of the country.

articleTitle: Charged £25 from ikea when not my fault
articleText: Purchase no 1303612233. On bank holiday Monday myself and my wife visited ikea wendnesbury branch. I purchased a wardrobe with the help of an assistant working in store all parts was checked and confirmed that they was in stock all parts complete nothing missing and in the warehouse put aside for my delivery for the next day. The next day Tuesday I Arrange to finish work early to be home in time for the delivery. I received a text to say my order has been cancelled and a refund is been processed . then i had tex from the same number said ikea delivery is on its way I was confused. The driver call and delivered part of my order 21 items out of 25 items. I called ikea to make sense of what has happened. After calling and waiting for 50min ikea said the 3 doors and a clothes rail was not in stock and didn't know when the would be available again I told them that's no good to Me as I have half a product and not a complete one so I would like a refund. Ikea said there will be a £25 charge to collect the rest of the package up because I have changed my mind and don't want them anymore, I became upset and said I never changed my mind I ordered a completed wardrobe in store checked that all parts was available and set aside for delivery before making payment in store. Ikea changed there mind not me by sending a text on the day of delivery to Me saying my order has been cancelled. So ikea changed there mind not me. im been charged £25 very bad customer service ikea. Its actually not my fault and should not be charged as I never cancelled part of the order ikea did.

Horrible, worst service ever!The delivery date was changed ON THE DAY of the delivery and when calling support, the person was extremely rude, insulted, and hung out the phone.Never ever delivering anything again from Bordeaux Lac IKEA, crappy service!
Awesome shop, saved me couple of times when I needed stuff when I moved. Also great place where you can get presents when someone moves
Moved to a new apartment recently, and ikea became our life-saver! Their affordable furniture helped us not to sleep, eat, literaly EXIST on the floor for several months :)

The most horrible shopping experience that i have had is from IKEA .the company who doeant help their clients when they are delivered with broken and damaged products.Most horrible shopping experience and you have lost a customer so congratulationsIKEA is the worst to shop from as after shopping you get no customer service as they take the money and give no serviceHorrible experience will never buy from you guys online or offlineNo one from the team helps the customer and 1 month return time is not over yet they refused to help most horrible shopping experience will never never again buy from IKEA

articleTitle: We ordered a desk for our kid
articleText: We ordered a desk for our kid. Good packaging, arrived on time. We are so sad that we don’t have one close to us, so we can go for a lunch on the Swedish bistro.

articleTitle: We ordered a new bed frame from IKEA…
articleText: We ordered a new bed frame from IKEA website, it arrived in proper condition and everything was in the package. The only downside was the delivery timeframe, it was a few days above what they promised in the beginning. Anyway, we are happy with the product. Thanks a lot!

articleTitle: IKEA sydney has worst customer service
articleText: IKEA sydney has worst customer service. I see so many similar complaints. $800 cooktop broke after 3 months. Every time I enquire with customer service up to 2 hour wait just to get through. Online chat no better.I went through the 3 month delayed time for someone to look at the Cooktop and that process alone was absurdNow the service centre has approved the repair but I have waited almost 2 weeks for ikea to approve and not heard back. I’ve chased IKEA twice and can’t wait 2 hours for them to get through.So I’m still stuck with a broken cooktop. Customer service is so bad and like no other!!

So pathetically poor. Told delivery will be here between 1130 and 330. I stay in all day. Its almost 7pm and still no sign. Got through to a customer service rep in UK who could only dodge my queries with text book jargon about data protection  etc. So bad it was funny in the end.a pathetic service.

Disgraceful company with the worst Customer service. Poorly educated assistants that simply do not care!!Struggling to return items, bar codes don't work 5 attempts, 5 phone calls, and nothing?!! Complain on Twitter = Nothing!!Write to Head Office = Nothing!I will never shop at IKEA again!! They just want your money - God helps you if there are any problems with your purchases!!
