articleTitle: lack of service required for warranty
articleText: We purchased a cooktop from IKEA which broke after 2/5 years. Our cooktop had a 5 years guarantee. Unfortunately IKEA made us go through their subcontractor for the repairs that took over 3 months. That means for over 3 months we could not to cook also we went to IKEA to talk customer service and supervisor several times to ask them to do their job (to repair) or replace the cooktop, but nothing happened. This kind of service from IKEA is disappointing and certainly not in their standards, lack of professionalism and customer service is evident, so we will not recommend it to anyone!!
Very bad customer service. Waited more than 2 hours on the phone for nothing. Online Customer service can hang up a phone on you any time.

I ordered kitchen set, table and 6 chairs,  for delivery. 2 days before delivery they said they would only deliver two chairs and the table. Called customer service and was told I would have to get the other chairs on my own. no help with getting the complete set.

articleTitle: My experience with IKEA Romania from Bucharest
articleText: I ordered from IKEA physically in the store a wardrobe for a bedroom with home delivery and assembly. Paid at the casserie all good and beautiful so far. On the order confirmation I have the last delivery date as well as the assembly date. I mention the fact that the IKEA employee in the store asked me repeatedly if the date set for delivery and the time are ok, which gave me the impression that they are very prop, which in fact did not happen. On the day the delivery was due, no one contacted me and since then I started making phone calls with the call center (customer service). to find out that nothing is known about my order and that the logistics department is not responding to any requests from them. In the meantime I said to call the courier company PRO NATUR where I talked to a lady and she told me that they do not have a pick-up order from IKEA. And so IKEA has been walking for more than a few days with the fact that nothing is known about the order, where it is or what happened to it. In addition to this, after I placed the order and paid it a week away, I am called to be told that some products are no longer in stock, as I when I ordered them (i expected that since you order to be booked at that time).....Honestly, after this experience, this is the last time I call on their services. My experience is 0 with them and their services for which they boast are 0. L.E.I was yesterday on 22.08.2022 in the IKEA Baneasa store to report that the furniture is not delivered and I would like to know what is happening. Customer relations was nice and helped me and explained that a mess happened and that the next day on 23.08.2022 the order will be delivered between 10-12, 100%. The money for the transport was returned to me. They probably felt ei...in fine. Today the surprise did not arrive the order, Fact that made me go again to IKEA Baneasa to find out that you can not deliver the order and that it is a problem that I do not know what product disappeared from stock and I can not livra...in the conditions in which yesterday it was on stock..anyway I had to go again convincing work with them to get that order once... they told me they'd arrive today, i'm curious if it would happen. I come back with the final experience. It seems to me a purely Romanian comedy as only we know how to make...... (that is, how to make a better fool of the client :) ).L.E.-2: The order was finally delivered and from the discussion with the delivery guys we learned that it happens extremely often at least in the last year that the orders are late. The transport guys were at IKEA Baneasa this morning and they were waiting to pick up the shipment just that I could not because of a product that said it was not in stock only that suddenly they found it by magic...anyway I hope you will figure out what you are dealing with if you want to order. It is possible that the same thing will happen to you and I honestly do not know how they behave with customers who are outside Bucharest. I live 5km from IKEA Baneasa and I had such an experience. I encourage other buyers to report these issues and make as many complaints as possible because otherwise nothing changes.
Good services, i bought a bed with frame and it is excellent! Easy to build and it looks like it is going to last for a long time.

Very bad! Made an online purchase and paid 50€ for delivery and selected my date. Spent all day at home waiting and waiting for my furniture to arrive so I could start setting up my baby’s room…they never showed up!! On the confirmation emails they are very explicit and mention the delivery date + 10h delivery slot (!!) which I respected in hopes that at least I would get the things!!Once we call costumer service - English line is never picked up! Had to have my husband interrupt his work and call so he could speak with someone in German…only to learn that they pass they delivery to DPD and then it’s not their problem anymore! What??! So disappointed!!

articleTitle: Absolutely the worst place ever to…
articleText: Absolutely the worst place ever to order anything they can’t even deliver on time, the employees are unsympathetic and incredibly unfriendly

I tried to buy furnitures at Ikea Memphis. At the furniture in the showroom, there was no storage location posted, and the self service computers kept crashing. The employees at the store were only telling me to try again, which I attempted multiple time. So I left the store and ordered the furnitures online. Delivery was supposed to be a few days ago on Monday. The evening before that, I received an email that the delivery was postponed till today. However, today I still have not received a delivery window, and it's also appearantly not out for delivery either. The customer service forwarded me to the resolution center, at which I spoke with someone who apparantly had zero interest in helping me apart from "call again if you don't hear anything today". I'm extremly disappointment in Ikea.

articleTitle: Do not order online, they try to scam you by putting a wrong date and making it impossible to change. After they charge you additional return costs.
articleText: Worst customer support I have ever received. When ordering online, they randomly split my order in two deliveries and changed the delivery date for one of the deliveries to an earlier date when I was not in town.When opening a chat they tell you to reach out to customer support via phone. After waiting for 30 minutes, you get someone who does not speak english. They will transfer you to an English speaking agent. After waiting another 15 minutes they simply hang up the phone. After going through this 5 times you finally talk to someone. (We're 2h after the first call now.) They say they will change the delivery date to the one from the other delivery. All looks fixed.Next day checking for the estimated delivery time and part of the delivery is still set for the wrong date. Going through the above again before getting someone on the phone. This agents tells us nothing is changed in the system but he will do it for us. All looks fixed, again. However, next day still nothing changed in the account and we're the day before the estimated delivery day. Again going through the above, this person promising us to change the date. All looks fixed, again x2.Off course, they try to deliver the parcels on the wrong date even though we've been told 3 times the date was changed. After the delivery attempt they write you an email saying you'll have to pay for the return cost because nobody was at home.Absolute joke of customer support and feels like an absolute scam and waste of time. This is the first review I ever write because I normally don't do this but people please be aware, IKEA is cheap so they look for all other ways to scam you and take money out of your pocket.

IKEA has really gone down hill since opening, I found the staff rude and I don't care attitude. I saw quite a number of the items had no reference to price. I think it will be my last visit to IKEA Dublin. Rude checkout staff, long queues and the icing on the cake a notice at the check out to place your items with the bar scan facing the cashier. What a disappointing experience, crap service, poor display of prices.

Bought 2x PRODUKT milk frothers, both not working at the point of being new. Being sold broken equipment (no QA at all?). Not worth going back to return it, as TFL tickets cost way more than this. The reason I want delivery is because I can no longer drive.I didn't get the call, so I used  IKEA phone number on the receipt called.  They forwarded to the Conshohocken PA store where I got it from.  I explained everything, was put on hold and hung up after a few minutes.I called back an hour later forwarded me again and was told that I would get a call the next morning, which was the 29th.  That didn't happen and called Again, got forwarded, put me on hold.  They wanted talk to someone and find out what's going on.  They didn't answer, left a voicemail with all my info including my phone number.I got a call back on Monday August 1st and had to reschedule.  The soonest date was August 15th.  Before getting off the phone, I asked if can just pick it up before the delivery date.  She said yes and call before the delivery.I called back August 11th and was told to cancel it and reorder due to the delivery payment.  I didn't want to start over so they forwarded to the movers about what was going on.  Of course they told me to contact IKEA.The delivery process and information needed is Unacceptable. We have started to plan our kitchen in March 2021 our kitchen been finished April 2022.We do understand it been tricky couple of years with many sets back. However, the service which we have received was beyond poor. Once we have planned our kitchen, we had preinstallation person come in to take measurements. After the installer guy came to have a look at the kitchen and take measurements. I believe it was June 2021 . We were happy to go ahead book installation (at that point was supposed to be September October) Unfortunately we were not able to do so as parts of the kitchen were not available. Once parts become available we were able to book installation date. We been given installation date for January.At that point we were frustrated as it been taken months so we wanted to cancelled the whole order. I called in and asked to cancelled the order the person said they will see what they can do and if they can bring the date forward. When she got back to me she said the order ( whole of the kitchen will be deliver 29th  August ) and the installation will happen first week in September . Days to go to September nobody got back to be so I tried to chase up. I got answer it  was a mistake and the installation is still happening in January .So I called again to cancelled.  Again I was told they will bring the installation forward. So they did to December. The installer guy came . Checked the measurements and said its wrong.  How frustrating.  Me again trying to contact ikea to sort out the issue. It  took several emails once I got an answer. At that stage part of the order was already delivered which wasn't convenient to have a desk top in the small house with a crawling baby .The installation was story on its on.Our breakfast bar was not existing. The long door on one of the cupboard were four half's. Parts of the kitchen and the water tap been poorly fitted. One of the electrical socket is not in working order since the installation. I am not mentioning parts of the order were missing or haven't been added to our order. I contacted customer service several times just to be told they will deal with everything once is finished. Once everything been finished I called up again just to be told I need to fill up feedback form. I filled up feed back form twice, nobody got back to us. I went to the IKEA store two months ago, hoping they be able to help me. Two months later still no answer no sorry for the bad service or money off from the service provided. Which we been told it will happen once everything is finished.If IKEA customer service reading this email I would appreciate if they get in touch with us.

articleTitle: I rated one star just because I could…
articleText: I rated one star just because I could not rate zero.Placed an order in mid July.The first set of things should have arrived on 16 July. No one showed up. I discovered the order would have been failed by contacting the customer service myself.Second set of things including everything was scheduled for 25 July, which I asked to move being my first day of work in NY. It was moved to the first available Saturday but two days before I was informed no one would have come as they were not able to deliver when promised.They rescheduled the order on August 4 (a weekday again).I called the customer service to point out that it could not work from me but in order not to postpone this again I asked that at least the delivery be planned in the window between 5 and 9 pm. Ikea confirmed they could.On August 4, I received another email at 12.30, while in the office, to say that the delivery had been failed as I was not at home.I called the customer service again, complaining about it and asking that it be rescheduled the following day.They gave me August 12 as first available date (again a week day) and told me they had raised a complaint to see if it was possible to have them before.On 5 August I received an email saying that the order would be delivered on that day. I stayed home all day to receive a tea spoon. The bed, the couch, all the kitchen stuff basically everything else was missing (so 2 days wasted at home nothing at this point).On August 12 I decided to work remotely to make sure the delivery was not failed again.No one showed up, no one rang the bell, no one tried to call me. I received an email saying the delivery was delayed and another one saying it was failed.I called the customer service number again and apparently there was nothing they could do to get in touch with the NAL group.Generally the NAL Group handling deliveries for IKEA does not pick up the phone, does not respond on the website chat and does not get back to emails. It is practically unreachable.Ikea and NAL group do not pass information coming from customer.I will never ever buy anything at IKEA again and I strongly discourage anyone from doing it.Not only you don’t get the furniture, but you waste money and a lot time.They ended up causing damages to me.I slept on an inflatable mattress for one month because every week I was told the delivery would have come. I wasted three full days at home for nothing.I need to buy all the furniture again.It’s pure nightmare.

articleTitle: Well I used to be a fan but now I am…
articleText: Well I used to be a fan but now I am not. This store is a mess and no management in place at all for customer service and company policy. I went online and ordered my daughter a dresser. We go the store to shop and pick it up. When I went to pick up the dresser we are told “ it will take a while because I was unlucky and it just tastes a little while to get it.” I wait with my wife and two little children, 8 and 5 for over an hour. Without telling me any updates I watch everyone behind me get their items and I was left as the only person after closing hours to still never receive my product. They tell me the dresser is in a restricted area and I had to wait until all the customers in the store leave the building before I can get my dresser. No apologies, no offer of anything to try to make a bad situation better. They tell me it’s just bad luck. I speak to 2 managers and one says he can offer me 20 bucks for the inconvenience. Lol.    My kids are tired and hungry and I send my family to go to dinner while I stay behind waiting for the entire store to close while they finally bring me my dresser. I am now to wait outside with no lights with my product and they say sorry again we just can’t do anything to earn your business back and can’t offer anything for our mistake and apologies and I’m told 4 times they did nothing wrong and that’s just how the company works. Again out of watching many people get their product brought to them I was the only one who could not get mine during store ours as I waited to be the very last customer. Where in the wild does this happen? Who’s company policy states that that is ok? How you staff from IKEA appreciate being treated the way my family and I were. This in embarrassing and a disgrace of a company. Do not shop here!

articleTitle: I ordered a SONGESAND King-Size Bed…
articleText: I ordered a SONGESAND King-Size Bed Frame, a VESTMARKA Sprung Mattress, LURÖY Slatted Bed Base, SKORVA Midbeam and some LAPPTÅTEL Pillows.All of this totalled £434.00. I ordered it on 25th July and paid an additional £50 for "express" delivery for which I was given an option of delivery the following day, 26th July, which was ideal because we were expecting an elderly couple visiting us to arrive on 27th July. How pleased we were that Ikea were providing us "the wonderful everyday".The following day, I checked a few times on my tracker, the progress of my order. When we got to around 2pm and the items were still shown as "packing your order" I began to suspect all was not well. I called Ikea and the lady I spoke to called the local store from where the order was coming from (Wembley store) to find out what was wrong. Having hung on the phone for a considerable time whilst being at work (yes, some of us have to so we can pay for Ikea purchases), I was told that the order had been prepared but the delivery company had not collected the items. No one, either the lady I was speaking with, nor anyone at the store, could provide any explanation as to why they had not been collected.However, the lady I was speaking to re-processed my order, sending me an email verification, to say that the order would be delivered the following day, 27th July. I received the confirmation and eagerly awaited delivery. I took time off work so that the bed could be fully assembled before our visitors arrived. Whilst all these arrangements were being made, I received another email for my order, this time stating I had not paid for the items and changing the order number. I phoned again and spoke to a different lady. We examined both orders and she went away to gain an explanation from the store as to why this order had been amended. After 30 minutes, I was told that no one at the store could provide any explanation, the named person on the order was not available and that now, my order was not going to be delivered today (27th) but would "definitely" be delivered tomorrow (28th). I explained the difficulties this was causing me but was told that nothing could be done. It was at this point that I was offered the opportunity to have a full refund which I declined as it would leave me in the lurch as to obtaining the new bed and probably more practical difficulties in finding a replacement. I stated I would be in touch when I was in possession of the goods, understandably sceptical that the bed would arrive.That evening, our elderly visitors had to sleep on the couch (an ikea couch, ok for sitting, atrocious for sleeping). Because of the nature of our son's disability, it was not possible for them to have our bed.On 28th, the bed finally arrived.I have called Ikea today. The person I was speaking to offered me a £30 gift voucher as compensation. I felt I was entitled to a little more, given the rubbish nature of the "express" delivery. He went off to consult with his team leader and after 15 minutes, I was told that nothing further would be offered. I declined the £30 gift voucher as I do not intend to use Ikea again for anything.Clearly, I should have used Trustpilot before ordering but I have to say, I was genuinely taken aback by the rating and sheer number of poor reviews on here for Ikea. So, we've had all this inconvenience, my extended time on the phone dealing with these matters (2.5 hours total) and an elderly couple complaining of back pain and Ikea won't even consider giving me back my £50 for the delivery.I'm sorry Ikea, perhaps with the sheer weight of poor reviews, you are swamped, overwhelmed and concerned about profits being eaten into if you were to make proper, decent offers to your customers and have given up trying to even maintain a semblance of customer service. Yes, I expect there might be some conditions buried within delivery arrangements which absolve you of responsibility. Having read other reviews, my experience is not as huge compared to others. But, really? "The Wonderful Every Day" honestly? Am I so naïve to have expected so much more?David Martell

She went back & forth between me and a “higher-up”, who apparently refused to speak to me.I sent her the URL with the policy printed (clear as day) I was quoting. In order, she and the “higher-up”;1. tried to convince me I was on the wrong website;2. told me I misunderstood the sentence;3. told me to ignore that part and read a different part of the page, which was unrelated to both my order & my request, and finally;4. told me to ignore the page entirely and instead read another.She finally said she wasn’t going to escalate it further and nobody in the company would talk to me about it any more. Disgraceful.IKEA is a massive company and I’m sure managing a big website is complex. But public information is a promise, and I made a purchase based on that info. The right thing to do would be accept the refund and to update the page.TLDR: Big company fobs off customer hoping I’ll just take it. They can deal with the chargeback now.

We’ve had four attempted repair visits from Electrolux’s regional representatives each resulting in no fix and now are stuck with a defective unit. The last engineer allowed me to photograph his report form saying the fridge freezer cannot be economically repaired, which was sent to Electrolux. IKEA say all we can do is raise an internal complaint which so far is getting us nowhere, so I want to warn all potential electrical item purchasers to avoid IKEA as they do not honour their guarantees any more. You don’t want to be without a fridge freezer when the UK reaches 40 degrees C, as we have been.

articleText: Do people only post bad reviews here?I have always been very impressed with how well the products are designed and manufactured.

articleTitle: One Item damaged - but great customer service
articleText: I ordered three large picture frames online on Friday, to be delivered Sunday. They came when I was at work and were left with a neighbour with a card through my door, by DPD.I opened the box and two of them were fine. The third had a "spider" crack in the middle of the perspex. I called their customer service straight away (1 minute wait it said - was actually 8m 30 seconds) and the man I dealt with (poss French from accent) was very helpful. Checked my order, checked the stock and was able to create another order to be sent out and delivered on Tuesday. I asked if he was providing a label for returns and said that it wasnt neccessary I could safely destroy it.I havent had the replacement yet, but Ive had the new order schedule on the email, so no reason to think it wont arrive.  The two that were Ok, are very good value.The loss of 1 star is because there was no damage to the box, and there was nothing IN the box what could have caused that type of damage, so the order pickers couldnt have been checking items properly before packing. Despite the mishap, definitely will use again, very eager to put the problem right so I wasnt at a loss.

The delivery service was terrible. Usually, Ikea delivers the order the next day. And at the particular time of the delivery, the employee from the delivery service of Ikea called me and said that the address was incorrect. I'm sure it was 100% correct because I saw the correct one in the order. And he was already on the way, just in case I sent my address to his phone number from which he was calling. Still, he just canceled the delivery, and that's all. as a result, I spent my Saturday evening waiting for delivery and didn't receive anything. "Thanks" for such a nice service, Ikea!My order number was 1295219095

I'm buying furniture for my flat and like the style and construction of IKEA furnishings. (Not the kitchens because the construction doesn't allow for pipes or conduits at the back -it's a Swedish thing?)The staff at my nearest IKEA at Straiton are really helpful but I'm taking a star off (above) because the company doesn't appear to encourage its employees to take pride in the 'Swedishness' of the products. They aren't shown how to pronounce the names and they aren't given incentives to learn about Sweden or visit. If I'm wrong, I'll happily rewrite this review.

articleTitle: Full prepaid order now 2 months - no delivery or follow through!!
articleText: I am writing hoping to resolve an ongoing issue with Ikea Indonesia.I do not know if Ikea is closing in Indonesia, if they are having financial problems or what however I am getting no where with an order that was placed and paid in full on May 24, 2022.I have ordered over $10,000 worth of products online from Ikea Indonesia with no problems and great delivery until recently.I placed 3 large orders within days of each other 2 orders have arrived and 1 is now almost two months without delivery or further updates.This is both frustrating as the products are specified for projects now being held up because they are not delivered but more frustrating is the absolutely useless, horrible, chaotic, unresponsive customer service in Ikea Indonesia.I contacted customer service after 3 weeks - it took a week to respond -then they were checking - 6 weeks after the order a customer service rep called and said they were missing 1 item from a large order and thus nothing had been shipped.I asked why I was being informed of this after 6 weeks of waiting for the order - why they didn’t ship the items that were in stock, why I wasn’t offered choice to change the items and why no one was following up on the shipment of the order.I was sent an option to replace the one missing item which I accepted and was told the shipment should arrive shortly.  It is now another 10 days - no shipment- no response - nothing.Please assist before I am forced to take legal action and publish my unbelievable problems dealing with Ikea here.

Worst customer service ever. I ordered products online, waited for a week. The delivery failed, never came to my house which I was waiting outside my apartment building. Did not get a call from the delivery company and I had to rearrange the delivery for a week after that. Also I had to wait for one and a half hours on the phone just for somebody to pick up. When I rearranged the delivery the customer service agent did not put the information that I already paid for the for the delivery and for the products resulting that they canceled again my order. Then I had to go to the shop explain them everything had to wait for another week to get my things. Meanwhile i had no bed to sleep on because they couldn't get their programming right. Got a refund but they charged me twice for the delivery. The customer service is just awful , and i takes to long to talk to an employee, especially on the phone.! Did not expect such thing in Sweden.

articleTitle: Worst defective merchandise policy in the world
articleText: I don't live near an IKEA store (nearest is 2.5 hours away), but I purchased four of the highly-touted FRAKTA bags that moms of college students rave about for packing clothes and linens for easy moving in and out of student housing. I bought them the first week of July, they were delivered on July 7, and I opened one of the four that day just to see how it works. We moved our son on July 18, and one of the 3 unopened bags had a seam that was not completely stitched on the bottom of the bag. When he put his clothing into that bag, he saw there was a hole right away. I did a live chat with IKEA that evening to see if it was possible to get a replacement or refund. They said in order for that to happen, I had to notify them of the defect within 48 hours of delivery. FORTY-EIGHT HOURS. Officially the shortest defective product warranty in history. I told them next time I'll buy the Amazon knock-offs. At least they have a decent refund/return policy. Never again, IKEA!

articleTitle: Just another of thousands of bad reviews
articleText: Just another of thousands of bad reviews I see. Purchased a bed frame which I traveled 300 hundred kilometers to do. I was shown a complete frame that would hold a foam mattress, mattress sold separately which is expected. At home assembled the bed frame but half the parts were missing. Absolutely no customer service, no phone numbers but they have a fictional billi bot which did no work 5 days in a row hence the fictional not comment. So I drove another 300 kilometers and was told the the other half of the bed frame was sold separately. This is like selling a dresser without drawers or a coach without cushions. So I drove a total of 1200 kilometers and paid for a useless frame and the WORST purchasing experience of my life (63 years). Horrible company don't waste your time or money, it should be illegal maybe a lawyer can way in on this.

articleTitle: Delivery issue (€60 delivery for a very poor service)
articleText: Ordered two ( large / medium) items for home delivery (€60). Received a delivery date and spent the day at home to ensure we were there for the delivery ( really needed the furniture)  Kept an eye on the delivery tracker all day. About 6pm the delivery van was on our street. We were at the door and saw the van down the street. He was a good bit down so we were waiting for him to come, and while waiting we cleared some space at the door - did not leave the area. Then got a messaged saying delivery attempt failed. We immediately called customer service and noted with them that the delivery man was down the street- he must have tried the wrong house but he never called us and we had our eircode on the delivery address. We asked that they call the delivery driver and get him to come back - he couldn’t have been but 5 mins away. He refused. I was pretty annoyed as i feel it should be standard to check the eircode and also ring the customer. Having paid €60 for delivery i felt like a better service was to be expected. I asked for a refund of my delivery payment. This was refused. Another delivery date was set up for Saturday - bit of a pain having to be stuck in the house on Saturday for the whole day. But lucky we were home as delivery said 2pm-6pm and was actually delivered at 1pm.

articleTitle: I purchased a King comforter yesterday…
articleText: I purchased a King comforter yesterday evening (7/17/22) and  returned it the very next day because I washed it before using and the seams fell apart.They refused to accept my return even though I have not used it, just washed it before using. iKEA says one you wash it , it can't be returned.In this day of COVID and pandemic, do they actually think consumers would purchase a comforter and use it without washing it first? Absolutely ridiculous and unacceptable.Do better than this to stop the COVID spread, IKEA! You owe this to your customers and community.You have lost me as a customer, not to mention family,  friends, and those who may read this review and think twice about purchasing.Do Better IKEA

articleTitle: I bought some bookshelf a year ago
articleText: Im writing this fir my husband(I'm Stephanie) I bought some bookshelfs a year ago. We moved. Somehow the screws got misplaced. articleTitle: Price on shelf not always price you are charged at checkout.
articleText: Went to IKEA Exeter today. Wanted to buy curtains and found one clearly marked at £70 on the shelf. Got to checkout and they charged me £75, I had actually taken a photo of the product on the shelf with the £70 price, but was refused purchase of it at this price. So disappointed as I have spent lots of money at IKEA over the years and thought they were reputable and trustworthy. My advice is to check your receipts carefully!

I have recently made a large order through IKEA in Norway. I did not receive several of the products that I ordered as the website does not accurately describe why the products are not actually available, so you do not know until you call customer service, why each item it not available and if you can even get it or not.More importantly, the customer service is some of the worst I have ever experienced. I actually have saved a conversation with a customer service representative who left the conversation, mid conversation because I asked to speak to someone who could provide me with more help as she said my request was "impossible". I was simply requesting to change a delivery date to a later date. She refused to do anything to help me or explain why she could not move my delivery date further back. She told me she would send me an email and never did.I next, talked with another representative on the phone who said he would help me with trying to change the shipping date of the order and would call me back later in the day. I received a very cold SMS later that day only stating my request was not possible with no way for me to send a message back.I then got ahold of a 3rd representative who finally explained the issue to me, but again did nothing to help and by this point, my shipment had already been shipped. This was a couple days after making my order and I had been trying since day one to change the shipment. The representative told me that we could try to get the shipment shipped to somewhere nearby but there were no promises and I had to wait just before the items left the warehouse.The problem is that we have not moved into the place yet and there is no way for us to receive the order at that location until mid July (over a week after the shipment will arrive). I am 6 months pregnant, taking care of a 2 year old alone and my husband works at sea. We now have to hire a car and helpers to receive the shipment and bring it to another location, only to have to hire people once again to bring the items to our new place when we move in, in mid July.I would have canceled the order, but the problem there was that we are having to fully furnish the apartment and if we did not receive these items, I would have to be sleeping and eating on the floor until I found a new bed table etc... somewhere else.I will never order form IKEA again and will continue to make sure others I know don't either.

Reviewed at IKEA Glasgow + Edinburgh. Similar experience encountered.Price of Product was incorrect in the showrooms. Information kiosk staff recommended to check with [stressed and rude] Till Staff which was unhelpful.The cafe is great and deserves 1 star.Please improve internal communication - perhaps workflow guidance + training would help.

articleTitle: Is there any way to actually get my purchase delivered
articleText: I made an online order in IKEA UK on Sunday 26/6. I paid delivery for Thursday 30/6. Ever since 29/6 the IKEA online tracking has showed "Order received - Packing your order - Getting ready to dispatch" (still today on 8/7).The delivery was not made so I called customer service on Tuesday 5/7. I was promised a new delivery on Thursday 7/7. According to the IKEA online tracking this delivery never even entered "packing" stage. Obviously no delivery was made.I called the IKEA customer service again on Friday 8/7 (today). Somebody answered immediately (unexpected as previous time I had to wait over 10 minutes before anybody answered). The person mumbled very quietly, but I managed to tell what had happened and he took my order number. He put me on a hold. I waited for 18 minutes and then he hung up the call.Update a week later (on 14/7). Yet another call to IKEA. Yet another wait. Yet another person. This one listened, was polite, acted, corrected the earlier mistakes, and rescheduled (again) the delivery. The delivery actually did come. Unlike IKEA claims, no prior text message or a call came, just the driver ringing the doorbell. However, I was home and received every item I had ordered. I am happy this ordeal is finally over, and increase my rating from one to three stars. However, it takes more trust building before I am happy with IKEA again.
Horrible service! Don’t buy online and have them deliver. If it’s damage they will charge you for picking it up even when it’s their fault.

THE WORST!!!!!!!!!!! I canceled an order 5/27 and it is now 7/7 and they still have not released $150 of my money to me. 4 calls and 3 case numbers later, nothing has been done. NO ONE CAN HELP.....they just give you another case number!!! So frustrating!! I have waster piles of time on the phone with them!!

articleTitle: First time I purchased from IKEA online. Terrible experience!
articleText: First time I purchased from IKEA online. Bought 3 duvets. Quality was awful. Return policy even worse. IKEA doesn’t provide free return labels so you have to pay to ship your items back. I paid $9.99 to have the items shipped to me and will also have to pay to ship back to the store. This policy isn’t clearly displayed when you purchase online and should be front and centre. And the process to return isn’t customer friendly. You have to call IKEA (wait in the que) then get a file number then call them back once you’ve shipped the package back to give them the tracking number. So disappointed!

articleTitle: IKEA Kitchen - 6 months and still waiting...
articleText: I love IKEA and have bought loads from them over the years, so didn't think twice when ordering a kitchen from them. We ordered our kitchen in October 2021 and was told there were some stock issues but as we're not ordering anything crazily bespoke, it will more than likely be in by the time we get our kitchen installed.Our kitchen was installed in January 2022, and we had several doors missing, a splash back measured incorrectly (despite us using their measurement service) and a dodgy bent tap. The fitters were great and did all the could but obviously couldn't complete the installation because not everything was present.Roll on 6 months later, and after basically having rung IKEA every week since the installation, I now have all the doors, they have refunded us for the tap but I am yet to receive a splash back - which they measured incorrectly from the off!! They did send me an alternative splash back last week, but the difference in quality was a joke despite previously being reassured that it was like-for-like (just to put it in context, it was like comparing one sheet of paper to some thick cupboard in quality) it was just disappointing.I'm bored and sick of having to call IKEA now every other day rather than weekly, as I just want to get it sorted. Some of the customer care team are helpful, some are just not interested. There is no communication, no reassurance at all. I appreciate stock issues are happening everywhere at the moment, but to be left in the dark with no update nor communication is just disappointing and disrespectful. As a customer (and having worked in customer service too), I am frustrated and annoyed it is still not resolved. My new kitchen experience has been totally ruined and thoroughly stressful.

articleTitle: Horrible customer service - avoid anything from Ikea
articleText: I literally can not believe that a company of such a magnitude has this kind of customer service. This is an embarrassment and I promise that I will never step my foot inside that store or purchase any product from them. They treat the customers horribly and you need to wait 2 hours to get an answer from the operator. At the end they tell you we cant do anything about it, your order will be delivered 3 months later...

I love IKEA, but my most recent experience ordering online has been horrible. I ordered a table for delivery and it was cancelled about a week before it was supposed to be delivered because it was out of stock. This table is almost always unavailable or out of stock, so when it was available, I jumped on the opportunity. I talked to customer service through their chat service and they were awful and so unprofessional--I've never experienced worse customer service. At the end of it all, they told me to order it again (it had become available online again), so I did. A week later, I got another message saying it was delayed by a week, fine. 3 days before my already a week delayed delivery date I got another message saying it's out of stock and I would be refunded. Talked to customer service and they told me to reorder it AGAIN and that it would be available this time! And that the reason it was cancelled was because my card was declined, even though it was already processed and posted weeks ago, AND I got a message saying it was because it was out of stock. So now I've waited about a month for this same table, been refunded twice already, and I don't have a dining table for an event I'm hosting next weekend. He kept trying to prematurely end the conversation by saying "Is there anything else I can help you with?" even though I clearly wasn't done...the last time he sent that message, then after literally 15 seconds of no response from me he disconnected the chat because of no response. This is probably the 5th person I've talked to via IKEA's customer service chat and they've all been so terrible. One of the people asked probably 10 times throughout the chat "Well, how are you today?" when I was clearly frustrated about my order, which is so frustrating it's almost comical. Mind you, this wasn't that long of a conversation and it was asked at random times.

articleTitle: Be careful Ikea kitchen offers, because they are cheating on final price/offer!
articleText: We bought kitchen from you (without white goods). We talked with two different sellers at the time and we finalized the price for 22 468 dkk (in that price delivery is included) and we made an order.At the end it looked like this;You basically sold us a kitchen for 22 000 dkk indeed, but without cabinet fronts (front doors) on FEW of them, so the price for your offer wasnt real. Nice trick Ikea. Price of 22 000 for that kitchen wasnt real because we stayed without half of items (very relevant ones), and gave us unfinished kitchen for which we believed in that time when we were sitting there for two hours with your seller that he is selling us (like any other normal person would think) the WHOLE product for that price. Offer for 22 000, but actually for 25 000 (3000dkk more for buying afterwards the things which HAD to be included. Tell me. Who is buying such a mess? So we bought few fronts for cabinets, but decided to leave few of them without. Are you serious? Such a unfinished kitchen? It simply cannot be more clear than what it is that you tried (and you did unfortunatey) to do. Sell us a kitchen for 22 000, from your side fully aware that for that price we will not get what we HAD to have so that we can accept the offer as soon as possible so you are finished with us. You sold us a kitchen, because we fell for the trick of 22 000. Because if it were 25 000 we wouldnt accept it? Nicely done Ikea. Why did our drawing has every cabinet, has every front doors on those cabinets, why then that kitchen drawing looks so finished? Why we recieved and bought few fronts, but decided to leave few of them without? Widely open and “beautiful”? P.S. Very important. Ikea still sold and brought to me all the hingens for doors. You could do that ha?🙄 Terrible.It is also sad that you are trying so hard to justify your doings, but every normal functioning person can understand and see what was your first intention, and can understand the game behind it.Long story short, kitchen is beautiful, but definitely do not buy it at Ikea!

articleTitle: Been trying to return a faulty item
articleText: Been trying to return a faulty item. Run around from shop to customer service. Takes weeks to answer any emails then they don't read them. Despite me giving full details they insisted I had a fault on a different items. Been back to the shop now been advised I need to replumb the item, (my expense) take more pictures send them to customer service, or I can measure the pipe and send customer service the dimensions, who will make a decision. Me thinks another 6 months of run around. No they can't get the part from stock and they don't have size information on file.However after sitting in returns I can tell you if have opened a box and no longer require and customer service advisor advises you can't return, just tell them you ordered the wrong colour the management will glue the box back together and reorder the correct colour, you then have an unopened box and a new receipt to return for full credit. All done by management.

I reluctantly agree because I’m a normal person who works and has to ask for half a day off again thanks to their mistake.I get a confirmation that it will be delivered on Wednesday instead of Tuesday as I we agreed.I again have to call for them to fix the error and they WOULD NOT change the date to Tuesday as we agreed! They have ZERO respect for customers and their lives. NEVER AGAIN will I buy from IKEA.

Well here we are again. I would love to update you and say Ikea have resolved my problem but far from a resolution its actually getting worse.From saying they will swap my table via a too and fro of numerous emails with about 10 different customer service staff {herein lies the problem me thinks} I am now further rather than closer to any form of satisfaction.The last operative tells me the table is out of stock and they dont know when its coming back in. THATS NOT NEWS. This was established a month ago.So her suggestion, choose a new table and pay more if it costs more.I chose my table and paid for matching chairs and now her frankly stupid suggestion to chose another is, I repeat, quite stupid, for two reasons.1 Pretty much every other table they have is OUT OF STOCK that might in some way be considered even partially close to mine.And2 I chose that table and the matching chairs because they MATCH.Its like going into a tailors and asking for a suit and choosing shall we say a rather nice tweed and then when you go to pick it up they say we have no tweed trousers but we do have corduroy.Some how Ikea customer service are having a bit of difficulty grasping this obvious problem.And to add insult to injury they made this suggestion of picking a different table 7 days ago and they have still not replied to my email in response to their suggestion.I will keep you posted

articleTitle: Return Policy Watch Out! Falsely advertised on website
articleText: Ikea lost yet another customer. We went there to return curtains that we washed once in cold water and hung to dry. They had shrink way more than the 4% shrinkage said on the package and did not fit our windows anymore. After having read the return policy on their website, we decided to return the curtains. At the return section, I was shamed for having washed the curtains and trying to return them. The lady that worked that there day was vile. I’ve never seen someone so angry at customers for no valid reason. We were shocked when she threw my stuff on the side and told me « Ugh, it smells like soap and you want us to take it back? » and went on to shame us and show attitude. We stayed polite and in shock and left. After that incident, I decided to chat with their customer service and I was told that the return policy is decided by each store and each person at the counter basically so they override the official policy. I’m never returning there and will file a customer protection complaint to the authorities. Their stuff is expensive and really really poor quality. Save yourself the time and money and choose any other home goods store around you. It’ll also save you from the cheap cardboard cookie cutter home decor we’ve seen around for way too long.

articleText: Check your receipts very carefully during the sale. I was charged the full amount for two items, and when I called to complain, all they would say repeatedly was go back to the store.
