I have doubled checked what I bought was in the sale and that this is their error.

articleTitle: Unbelievably bad service from beginning to end
articleText: I just spent £1713 in-store on eight different storage cabinets on 10th June. The sales person writing up the order on the sales floor was not very knowledgeable about the products and had a "could care less" attitude. The Order Confirmation I received by email had 22 items listed; impossible for the untrained eye to make any sense of it or to identify the 8 pieces of furniture. After the check out I went to the "TaskRabbit" desk to book a "specialist" to come and assemble the 8 pieces the following week. They had no clue how to read the Order Confirmation and thus how to interpret my purchase and how to identify the 8 finished pieces in order to price the job. I gave up and made my own arrangements for the assembly.I made it very clear that the delivery had to be made to a church which is open only from 11am to 4pm Mon to Fri. Surprise: the delivery van arrived at 9am and of course could not unload. I phoned customer service but was told they could not contact the driver!! "It's all done electronically" they told me. So much for 'personal' service.In the end we got delivery the following day however one of the pieces (value £279) was badly damaged. I phoned customer service and was told that the piece could not be exchanged because there was no stock anywhere in the country to replace the damaged piece. We therefore agreed on a collection and full refund.I then was told that the first available collection date is 16th July with a refund to be made 7-10 working days thereafter. This means they will have my money for 43 days before I see the refund of £279.Bad experience all around!

Delivery "lost in space". Promised deliver 6 days ago is still nowhere to find. Service team don't know where is my delivery or when it might arrive. Ikea collaboration with a sedition company seems to be a joke.

Once IKEA has your money, they can careless wether you receive those items!Do not bother trying to call customer service, they will lie telling you they will get a supervisor and when a so called inept person had absolutely No what she was even doing!Do Not Purchase from IKEA!!

Review on IKEA Nagasandra Bengaluru. The facility invited all members on 19th June, Sunday before official launch. We visited with excitement and discovered its a complete mismanaged and unlike professional staff in Hyderabad.1. After we entered the escalator stopped suddenly with jerk and my 3 year old kid fall down with injury. The staff saw and said sorry for the inconvenience caused rather than addressing the electrical fault or flagging the same (although she was holding a walkietalkie). We shared the concern to address the electrical fix so that other people dnt face the same but she was not bothered. Luckily we were moving up, if the escalator would have been stopped whilst moving down it would have been a big accident.2. We were invited on a particular time slot, but when we checked with other visitors it seems no one followed the time all dropped-in as per their time which created a chaos.3. Went to the food counter and the supervisor responsible to manage the que was continiously busy on his cell phone and chatting with another staff. Once entered the kitchen staff were also slow in serving and wondering how to cater. Few went inside to bring plates and returned after 10 mins by the time there were a long que linedup.4. Once we got the seat, looked for a microwave to warm the soup whic was been served almost cold, when asked the staff they replied the microwave is not working and to manage with the same soup.5. When went to coffee m/c the machine went off and no one bothered to address and was directed to another machine. None of the staff responds politely and all were so busy interacting among them self as of its a first job they got.6. While having food we discovered someone took away the trolley to keep back the plates, went to another staff and asked to share a trolley, and the staff responded in local language asking me to go and stand back into the que with anger.7. Went to furniture section to customise the wardrobe, there were 3 staff on table and all struggling with computer. After 15 min of wait to understand one person asked us to come back after 15 more min as the actual counter operator went on break.8. Improper sinages to exits. When checked with few security folks standing near fire exit as help showing the direction to exit, the security directed us to wrong direction showing entry inside. Finally few like minded other customer with family we came together and figured to exit outside.9. There are no mobile network found inside so if you leave behind your family member you cant reach them over phone.The complete setup and facility seemed messed up and unorganised with fresher non trained, non professional staffs. Only few overseas supervisor / management staff were roaming around and all were busy impressing them which was very clearly visible by all other customers as well.Its a complete mismanagement and bitter experience. Hyderabad and Mumbai IKEA is very nicely managed with professional staff. Electrical safety is also a concern where we observed many open cables laid down.Best wishes to IKEA bangalore with such non professional staff and mismanaged crowd.

8 months ago, my sofa arrived with mouldy back cushions. I contacted IKEA multiple times via phone, email and chat; they assured me they are sending out new ones. First, they sent the replacement to the wrong address, then it turned out they were the wrong ones anyway. Now, they are saying the cushions are not in stock and the only way I can find out if they get back into stock is to continue to phone them. Two-thirds of my sofa is unusable because of this issue, and it has been 8 months. Why is on the customer to keep calling and wasting their time to sort out a known issue??

Recently purchased a Brimnes wardrobe - started constructing to find a couple of the small fixing nuts are missing. Apparently it will take 7-10 working days for these to be sent out or a 40 min drive each way to collect these. Spoke to customer services who advised this isn't 'faulty' but just missing parts. Regardless we are left with a part completed wardrobe taking up a room for the foreseeable.
horrible. Will never recommend to anyone

Huge name, terrible service. Will never use Ikea again or the company TASKRABBIT that they recommend. TaskRabbit broke both my items and none of them would take responsibility leaving me to have to buy new furniture but from somewhere else!Ikea didn't even have the correct contact details as all the numbers they provided were out of service.AVOID

articleTitle: If there was a negative number, They got it!
articleText: Back and forth for over a month with their customer service reps who insisted I'd get a replacement cover for my sofa which after 1 1/2 yrs and minimal usage is unraveling with holes. I was told that this is the quality today at IKEA> BEWARE - all is made in C H I N A. They keep reversing their decisions and now deny me the cover 3 reps said I should get in a week. They got my money and that's about it. BTW - They prefer gender identification over quality and customer service. IKEA WENT TO THE DOGS.

articleTitle: An amusing tale from a 3rd world country ikea store :)
articleText: As you can guess from the title I'm an extremely happy customer, who needs to share with you the unbelievable  experience of buying a kitchen from your franchise in Bulgaria.I've been Ikea's happy customer for over 10 years, so I endured patiently 30 days till the first available date at the store to order my dream kitchen. The big smile on my face disappeared when the kitchen department employee told me the kitchen design I created in your online tool (great app by the way) can't be ordered as the doors are discontinued, despite they appear on the site... So he made a new design for me but warned me I can order it only after I make another appointment after (you guessed it) 30 days :)So 60 days into my life with 2 toddlers and no kitchen, I headed to the store with a sense of relief. Only to find out that the new design uses doors that are not currently available and nobody can tell me when they'll be available... But luckily (I thought so at the time) I asked about my previous design with the discontinued doors and a miracle happened - they somehow had them in store despite staff told me they were long gone and discontinued a month ago :) All with a bit of a catch dough - few other bits and pieces were missing, but i was assured this is quite temporary and i should have it all in no time. So I took all that was available and filled my living room with boxes.So life goes on without a kitchen but with lots of boxes. My kids were quite thrilled by the situation. Turns out they are quite inventive and able to think out-of-the-box (and in- and around-the-box)  :) Downside - found out my medical insurance is not so comprehensive as I thought...2 months later I start getting nervous as my 60 days return guarantee runs out and I still don't have the kitchen I could return and get full refund for :) I start calling customer service asking for at least some probable delivery date - no luck.Another 2 weeks and my phone beeps joyfully - customer service notification to go to the store and collect my order. Yupeeee!!! Going there, giving my order documents and almost kissing the lady at order collection. But she is not smiling - "hm, there must be some kind of mistake, your order is not here, you got wrong notification... We still have no idea when we'll have it". Dreams of home-cooked meals shuttered, plastic plate home deliveries continued (hey, I already know all the delivery guys in the neighbourhood by name)!Another week goes by and another notification comes - half-tired, half-excited I go to the store. Guess what - my order is not there, it's wrong message! Seriously?!?Few days and notification again. Hmm... Another message in 1 hour - "don't come, we probably sent you wrong message"?!? Huh? I go online and check the items in the online store - they are now available there! They should have mine delivered if they sell them online now. I go there of course, can't stand the sight of my half-build, half-boxed kitchen anymore! The mistake is a mistake - my order is still in Neverland and the items in the online store are not really available,  just says so on the site. I'm depressed and decide to do some shoppong therapy - hey, this is genius, you treat your clients like s*#t and maximizer your profits at the same time :)After a nervous breakdown I decide to dismantle it all and bring it back to the store. But my conscience stops me - I'm a sustainability activist and can't scrap half-a-forest worth of material... Damn!I decide to be reasonable - calling once a week to check status of order and carry on with pizza and Chinese. Until I got a call from customer service last week - "Hello, you ordered something a while ago and collected it, but we never formally closed the order. I just call to see if all is OK." NO, IT'S NOT OK!!! NOTHING IS OK!!! Lady on the phone is very sympathetic and promises she'll fix it all, I'll get most of the remaining bits in 6 days the latest and the rest - in 10.Right. Should have known better. A week later, my phone is silent. I call again - "we actually have 10 of those in the store, so you can come and collect your 4 items". Excited? Relieved? Happy? Of course not - my order is not ready and they don't have the items in the store as customer service told me :p I NEED TO SPEAK TO A MANAGER, PLEASE! Frowning lady comes over, no "Hello, I'm...", no "Terribly sorry for the inconvenience", just "We can't guarantee you a delivery, it's logistics you know. Other people are also waiting. Check in 3 days." Right... Amazing customer service!Shopping therapy doesn't help anymore, I need professional help. Turns out my medical insurance doesn't cover "nervous breakdown after shopping in Ikea"... So I do what I can - going online and start writing to save some other poor souls from slow painfull kitchen dream death.True story!

articleTitle: Worst ever E-Commerce Service, don’t buy anything from them
articleText: Worst ever E-Commerce Service. Have Order product on 7th and not received it till date. Have written to customer care, called them tweeted them, written to CEO. All efforts wasted. Just getting one response that some issues with delivery and they are trying to sort it out

articleTitle: Never sign a contract with ikea again
articleText: I signed the contract for kitchen cabinet on Jan,08,2022    90 percent of the items was delivered in a few days but the rest was scheduled for end of the may and start of june  when the installation co. start to work found out that the upper cabinet above the refreg.  should be 36" but the item was sent was 30" also lots of the other item which was needed was not between the delivered items  ,I  took the new lit to Sophie and after paying the items the installation co. delivered most of the items ane one item was scheduled for 06/11/2022 and the last item on 06/12/2022 the first one came ontime but the second order #414220318 was not delivered when I called Ikea customer service 1 (888) 888-4532 the gentleman said it will be delivered on 06/20/2022 , My house has been a mass for 5 months and with this experience I do not know to who I should have my complaint?

articleTitle: I'd give minus stars if I could.
articleText: Very bad customer service - nonexistent.Have ordered out kitchen in February 2022 and we're now in June, still waiting for a part of the products to be delivered. We've now postponed the installation from May to end June, but as we're still missing a part of the kitchen, we'll most likely have to move the date again.As the missing products haven't been on stock since the ordering time, we've been often in touch with Ikea's """customer service""" trying to get this issue fixed or at least an answer to all of this unexpected waiting time, but all we get told is that "It's not IKEA's problem" and that "There is nothing that IKEA can do about this"... well, thanks Ikea.Thanks for taking hours of our time for meeting with you in order to make sure that we order the right kitchen, in a correct way...and then being left all alone with your delivery and production issues - thank you for putting this burden on your customers instead of taking charge and being responsible.

articleTitle: I haven’t been in IKEA in over 3 years…
articleText: I haven’t been in IKEA in over 3 years and boy has it changed. Most of the items we wanted were not in stock and I understand there have been supply issues, however it wasn’t a good start. Once we were able to figure out a few options there were some items that could not be picked up but had to be delivered. Of course there is a delivery fee to have the pleasure of picking it up. The real in convenience is after you go through that entire store, make the mental gymnastics to figure out what you can actually buy, you have to wait another 45minutes - 1 hours for the employees to gather your order. Such a pain. It wasn’t efficient and didn’t save us or the store any time. My days of shopping at IKEA are over.

I ventured yesterday for the first time to IKEA´s new branch in Hammersmith, as it is local to me, where I ordered and paid for a white dining chair as a birthday treat to myself, to go with my office desk. I wanted it in Mustard Yellow, as it was on display at their store, but they said it was no longer in stock for delivery to their Hammersmith branch (in that case, I am not sure why they have it on display as some stores still appear to have it online and after all, Hammersmith is more of a collection store). But to get back to the point, I bought the Broringe white underframe and the Leifarne seat shell and was told to go the next day, which is today, first thing in the morning to collect it, as it would be delivered to their store overnight. I was there on the dot but when I went to the collection desk I was told that only the underframe had arrived and not the seat shell, but that I would be receiving a text later in the day and should then return to the branch to collect.  Instead I got a call towards the close of business, only to be told there had been a mix-up and that it was not going to be available for pick-up ever at the Hammersmith Branch, so instead they had arranged to have it delivered as a favour to my home address on Tuesday 14th, without first checking to see if the day and time were suitable. It turns out I will not be around that day,  I will be away on work, they should have checked with me first, I would have preferred that an effort had been made to have it delivered to their store, but that was not an option for them. So, I asked if I could go to the Hammersmith store for a refund, they said NO, as they had arranged to have it delivered and that I needed to call customer service for that.  I rang customer service and asked them for a refund, after which I received an email from IKEA to confirm that my order was successfully cancelled and that I would receive a refund within 14 days, but as the order number in their email was different to that on my receipt, I had to call again to verify. This has been time consuming for me and not dealt with professionally by IKEA, they should have found a solution to compensate for their mix-up and have taken more of an interest. Generally, I do not feel they were remotely bothered, let alone concerned with customer satisfaction. So, my personal experience with IKEA's new branch at  Hammersmith, is one of unreliability.  I now have to wait for my refund, before ordering from another store and then I am not sure what I will be charged for the delivery of just one chair, when there is a branch so close to me. Moreover, I will not receive it in time for my birthday.  Overall a disapointment, let's hope I do not have to chase up the refund.

articleTitle: Bought an ikea kithen price is great…
articleText: Bought an ikea kithen price is great but trying to get to the right person to get an employee to come to install it is a nightmare. So my kitchen is sitting in boxes. Disappointing

Apparently I'm not allowed to review products on the IKEA website, so just in case I can help out anyone else here is my review of the KARLBY worktop:DON'T BUY IT! It's a cool idea and it looks great, but the veneer is so soft it is impossible to avoid scratches and dents. Worst of all, the strips provided to cover the edges when the worktop is cut to size were all the wrong colour and were unfinished wood. We spent 5 months trying to get adequate replacements before giving up and getting a refund.

Buying a kitchen from IKEA has been a tortuous process. Firstly, there was the difficult to use planning tool on the website. Then there was the long waiting time for an appointment at the store. The assistant was very helpful but the after sales service has been dreadful. It has taken them over two months to respond to a query about a crack in the new sink. The issue is still not resolved.

articleTitle: The worst customer service I have ever…
articleText: The worst customer service I have ever seen!!! I tried to call twice about items no delivered on promised date and staff couldn’t deal with the questions. The second one just hanged up on me! Very rude for a “customer service”. Pretty rubbish!
Coulden't help me to get a copy of the receipt. Should be a basic service.

articleTitle: The IKEA assembly team did not take the…
articleText: The IKEA assembly team did not take the empty boxes away with them. Cheers for putting them together but they told me it was against IKEA policy to remove the rubbish even though they had a huge truck. Disappointed!

Delivery is a complete disaster. No commitment with delivery and they do not care. Do not buy there if you can not take the items with you. They will discourage you and I will never buy a penny there!

Ikea’s online ordering process creates problems. In my case, I ordered a bookcase. I had to complete sale before I could learn when the delivery date was. When their delivery date didn’t work for me, I followed links to reschedule. For some reason, no matter how quickly I type and click, the Rescheduler keeps saying Session Timed Out. How can it time out after 12-13 seconds? The web process IS dysfunctional and creates problems which you then have to spend time trying to solve.

Follow up.  On 5th June, Ikea emailed and admitted they had made a mistake and would process a full refund.On 6th June, said again, they would not refund,This has been happening for a month.  They will, they won't.  They are dreadful, and refuse to answer questions.
Hi, delivery on time, polite, quick & efficacy.Thanks a lot

Ordering online was moderately easy. Delivery has been a nightmare. My delivery was split to a parcel order and a delivery but truck order. Parcel delivery by FedEx as on time except left on the step and it rained. The truck delivery was not on time. First rescheduled to the following day notification by text. No, is this convenient for you, no just that we don't care about your schedule, you don't matter. Then on the new scheduled day they don't show up again. Just another text after waiting all day that it had been rescheduled. A call to ikea netted first, can't find the order by name and order number have to give them the delivery address, delivery city, delivery state, delivery zip code then my email then my phone number all just to waste time. I asked to talk to a supervisor and go thru the same thing all over. Its a very disjointed calls, give an answer the person is silent long enough that you think the call is disconnected, constantly thinking are you there? Told me they would send an email to the delivery to come the next day. Waited all day, again no show. Then get an email that i had to contact ikea for redelivery (wait on hold waste time again) or my order would be cancelled. They are the worst of the worst, we should be billing them for our time they waste. They would be bankrupt within a week.

articleTitle: Best pricepoint for the quality you're…
articleText: Best pricepoint for the quality you're getting, the only issue i've run into while buying from ikea is the maze-like stores and the complexity of getting a refund

articleTitle: Failed to deliver on booked date, no notification received, order arrived the next day minus 2 items that were damaged in transit!!
articleText: 57My large IKEA order was booked for delivery yesterday June 4th, to Cork in Ireland.I waited at home for 12 hours, from the text advisory notice directions, from 7am until 7pm. Goods not received. No notification received or any communication whatsoever from IKEA.I obviously rang Customer Services at 7pm, who advised me that all deliveries were delayed and all customers were informed. I most definitely was not, otherwise I would not have wasted a day of my life just waiting!!As a goodwill gesture the CS agent offered me a voucher and was very professional and empathetic. Here I am still waiting for my ikea delivery, day 2.Absolutely unacceptable that customers were not simply informed of the delivery delays, there is no excuse for this,  a simple text would suffice!UPDATE... my products arrived but two items were missing, which apparently had been damaged in transit from Dublin to Cork.Delivery of these items is now Friday and I will not be informed of the delivery slot until the actual day, which means another wasted day and having to cancel important commitments. So my delivery from ikea has evolved into 3 days of my precious time spent waiting.Absolutely appalling customer service from IKEA. I'm a very dissatisfied customer right now ikea. I should also add that I was cut off via telephone by 2 customer service agents in separate incidents. I was polite and pleasant. Perhaps once they realise its a complaint they hit the cut off button!!Extremely poor service in general

articleTitle: I’ve never had a bad experience at IKEA…
articleText: I’ve never had a bad experience at IKEA and feel like I should say that as they get a bashing on here

articleTitle: The worst customer service experience I…
articleText: The worst customer service experience I ever had, when I called them!!! So rude and unprofessional, the representative was giving me an attitude!

articleTitle: So disappointed in IKEA delivery My…
articleText: So disappointed in IKEA delivery My $6000 order was canceled without any information they didn’t bother to contact me through phone or email. We had to order everything again,and then they go ahead and cancel my delivery twice!!! We’ve been trying to get a delivery since Wednesday it is now Saturday and they keep canceling.Now there saying they won’t be here till tomorrow Sunday!!!!…I will never order anything from the Orlando Store again!!!!Nor ikea in general
Really good serviceIt had everything I needed and had a very quick delivery

So I bought a house , and the house had ikea kitchen appliances installed already . I call today customer service to get info on the appliance Schott Ceran Induction cooktop, So my complain is that I was told by one of the ikeas representatives that they won’t be able to help me because I was not the one who bought the appliances, poor customer service

I have guests, so I order mattresses, sheets, pillows and stuff. I check that everything is there at the local store that has to do the delivery. Delivery within 5 days they say. Right on time, so I click on order. After a week I only had some pillows, so called and complained that the delivery was partial and late. After two weeks, the order has still not been delivered and people are sleeping on loose pillows on the floor. Never again Ikea.

articleTitle: Had a bed delivered that was missing…
articleText: Had a bed delivered that was missing one crucial part and the tools required to put it together. They insisted I should take a photo and send it to them then said they would not deliver the missing parts, I'd have to go collect them! FRUSTRATING!

articleTitle: Dont waste your money on IKEA
articleText: Dont waste your money on IKEA, it's designed to make it impossible to return faulty items, it charged a fortune on delivery, a complete disgrace. Items are usually hard to assembled, i recently had to throw away something that just didnt work, it's not worth it. Buy locally or in business that actually will respond to customer service queries.

We purchased a pair of EKET 2 drawer wall cabinets along with a number of other items.  The in-store pricing indicated $50 each.  Unfortunately, I did not check my receipt until we returned home - nearly 2 hours away.  Was charged $65 each.  Online Chat was a joke - automated system.  When customer service was contacted they did not ask for the photo I had taken of the price tag along with the self serve pick up location.  They opened a 'case' and said they would look into it.  Received an email response saying "Bring the info back to the store".  As mentioned that is nearly two hours one way.  With todays fuel prices - it's not worth the four hour round trip.  It sure would have been nice to speak with someone at the location vs customer service located remotely.

articleTitle: XPO/Ikea got to be the worst of all
articleText: XPO/Ikea got to be the worst of all! 5th time reschedule and they send window 4-8pm when after minimum 10 phone calls and endless amount of emails i have explain that my building ONLY allow delivery 10-3pm. I so sick of this! The delivery of the sofa is over 2 weeks now. Sad sad sad!! XPO SUCKS!!

articleTitle: Worst customer service in the world
articleText: Worst customer service in the world. Designed and ordered a closet in February, have only received half the order end of May. The assembly service came in with wrong manuals, and left without doing any work, but customer service blames it on the store (and vice versa).

articleTitle: Bad service. Ikea needs to take accountability.
articleText: I ordered a high chair a few days ago. It was better pricing than Amazon, or so I thought. $25 plus shipping and tax came out to about $32. The estimated delivery date was today, may 30, Monday. I got an email saying it will be here today by 5pm, and then a text saying it would be here today by 9pm. (?) When I checked the tracking from my original email thanking me for my purchase, it said it won't be here for another 2 days! I called the customer service line and the first lady was apologetic, saying it was coming from FedEx, and she's not sure why, but the order was only just completed today. I asked her the reason and she didn't know. I asked her if I can get a discount for the wait and inconvenience and she transferred me to someone else, saying it was possible to get a discount. The second lady I spoke to was unapologetic and condescending, saying they don't offer discounts for delivery issues, even though it's their fault that the order was only just completed today, on the estimated delivery date. They took no accountability and I am still waiting for my highchair. Amazon would have refunded me my order right now even if I still got the highchair because it is past the expected delivery date. Ikea needs to take accountability.

I wish I hadn't bothered.If you really must buy an ikea kitchen,make sure all the parts are available before you order and fit it yourself.Their fitters are rubbish and so is the customer service department.They expect you to source parts yourself and take ages to respond to and deal with any issues Kitchen was fitted over 3 months ago and still not fully finished.

articleTitle: Although problems with delivery, still five stars
articleText: I made a very large purchase through IKEA. However, when it arrived, the mattress was missing.I am still giving IKEA five stars because I found that on contacting customer services, the problem was quickly resolved.On visiting my local Leeds branch, I found staff attentive and helpful, particularly in the ‘returns’ department and checkout.I find shopping at IKEA extremely stressful, but it is made all the better by warm and friendly staff.The hot chocolate and doughnut were also delicious!
Just absolutely terrible. Good luck with any kind of support. Buy items from wayfair for a better experience

I went to the Aberdeen store to pick up a large wardrobe. I travelled over 20 miles to get there. The assistant checked me in and I waited 15 minutes to be told they didnt have my item. There was no proper explanation or apology. They just said the email that I got was automated and was incorrect, very odd even although their email said it was ready to pick up and timebound. I was told by the customer support that I would recieve another email. I then spent all day in Aberdeen and no email arrived and the tracking showed that it had been picked up already. I went back to the store again before closing time and the assistant re-checked and said that It may have arrived in the afternoon but was unsure. I waited again and then eventually the item rolled out, but no email ever informed me or they acknowledged issues. All I can say is very poor logistics tracking and inefficient customer support. I was not happy as I wasted a lot of time with this run around fiasco. Customer service was non existant. The single assistant on duty simply said this happens sometimes and we don't know what is going on. Not acceptable, the opposite of efficient and curteous !

The product quality and customer service are abysmal, if you can find the product or something close to it any other place purchase it there.They severely reduced the quality of materials used for example: the plastics are less dense, lack durability and are prone to break.The furniture is great if you are 4'5"  the sofas skim the ground with  4-5 inches of height, the pressed wood of the laminated products are thinner, less dense and the laminate is thinner and  easily damaged, the metal tables have just enough strength  to hold a bowl of fruit and enough space for bread plates, the material of the sofa covers is thinner and sewn sloppily.Everywhere the could cut corners they have, it's become a really nice Dollar Store.Customer service is anemic and slower than a 1 inch snail going down a deserted country road. The agents are curt, and repeatedly ask for a receipt after you've explained you lost it. All items defective or not require a receipt. And if you produce a receipt they insist on a comprehensive backstory explain a damaged product even when you found the damage after you left the store.A far cry from the first 5 years of Ikea.... go to Target.

articleTitle: Superb prices for the quality of items…
articleText: Superb prices for the quality of items sold.  Way to go!!

articleTitle: Giving one star just because they…
articleText: Giving one star just because they ordered my stuff through  supplier ”Nerostein”. They asked  me to order Stone for kitchen from Nerostein and it would take Max 15 days , it has gone over One month and still no product . Ikea Doesnt wanna deal With this because its between me and Nerostein now . It has been a nightmare dealing With nerostein, never ever again . Both parties lied to me

articleTitle: The quality of your furniture is…
articleText: The quality of your furniture is disgusting. I purchased a settee 12-months ago for over 1000 euros and it has basically fallen apart. The materials you use are super low quality with a lot of the panels (made from cheap mdf) stapled together with tiny staples. Are screws really that expensive? I will never purchase anything from Ikea ever again. Shocking!

articleTitle: Their customer service is surprisingly horrible.
articleText: I found the customer service horrible. I received a product with a defect (large visible stains on a mattress) and the customer support agent explained on a phone call, "mam of course YOU have to pay for another delivery fee (about 60 bucks) to have it exchanged." On their website, they made it look like they are generous with exchange or refund. In my case, the product coming with stains is not even my fault.Never expected to experience this from such a large and reliable company.

Absolutely horrendous customer service. I bought a shoe rack (BISSA). One of the panels had a decay on the screw hole rendering the whole shoe rack useless. I called ikea and they wanted me to get the whole unassembled panels back to them as they won’t consider the only decayed panel. When asked that I cannot repack the whole things and get the whole thing back to you for your poor and terrible quality product, they just told me that they can’t do anything about it. Infact the customer service guy was so obnoxious and rude that he said had it been him he would have done it. Never going to ikea ever again.

articleTitle: Ordered a closet to an address in…
articleText: Ordered a closet to an address in Germany. Sealed the deal and they we're supposed to deliver it on 17/05. On 17/05 I receive an email that they could not reach me because the phone-number does not work. They aren't allowed to call a non-german phone number (My number is from the Netherlands). Rescheduled to today at 24/05 to deliver it WITHOUT the necessary phone call. Received an email that they could not deliver it on 24/05, because the name on the address was different from the name of the person who paid. Did not ring the doorbell at all and drove off with the closet. Customer service angrily hung up the phone after I call for an explanation. IKEA does not want to deliver the closet anymore and refunds the money. 2 weeks of waiting because these people cannot think for themselves. The problem is that I already have one of these closets and I need a second one, this one in Germany was the last one available. Thanks for your terrible service and I hope I never have to deal with you again.
I always enjoy shopping here, and bargain food. There iss a budget for everyones pocket

Just spent a small fortune over the last month or so on numerous visits to Ikea. Have just sat for over an hour on the M6 in traffic to get to Wednesbury Ikea, to obtain a refund or credit note on a few items and to buy more in store. Unfortunately, the receipts I had taken did not have one of the items I was returning on them it (my mistake, but they are almost indecipherable...) and the store refused to even give me a credit note, even though they could see I had been a good customer recently and spending healthy amounts in store. I was asked if I had an Ikea family card as they may be able to identify the purchase. I gave them my card and they said they could not see the item on the listed sales. I asked to speak to a manager and instead got a completely bored youth who flat out refused to give me a credit note, even given the fact I will have spent more in petrol getting to and from the store than the £12 it cost for the  drawer organiser I was returning. I had to walk away with no return note, and I didn't bother shopping in the store I was so furious.I set off on the long journey home, and when I got back I identified the various purchase from my bank account but as one of the purchases was in excess of £240 it wasn't clear how they could attribute the sale to a total amount. I rang customer services who was able to pull up the receipt on her computer and email me a copy. On the receipt was the item I had taken back for a refund, and, my Ikea family card number. So, the bored sales assistant and rubbish 'manager' had failed to spot it when they allegedly looked up my spending history today, wasting my time and money as this will now necessitate a return trip which will take another 2 hrs out of my precious weekend. What AWFUL service! I certainly will not be giving them my business again. People lose receipts sometimes or mistakenly bring along the wrong one. A little helpful flexibility would be good, most stores operate a credit note policy, but not the mighty Ikea. You certainly wouldn't have been out of pocket, but you have now lost a good customer.

I’ve cancelled an order of just over £700, still waiting for a refund 12 days later. When I called they told me the order had only been cancelled the day before and I’d have to wait for a refund!!When I said they’d need to expedite the refund they cut me off… needless to say I won’t be shopping with them again.

articleTitle: IKEA in Malaysia: A lifelong long queues and no-stock problem
articleText: I can't believe that it's been a month now, and I still can't checkout my wardrobe because you won't restock the elementary items like the pull-out drawers or the doors' handlers" Very annoying!!I can't understand what's your lifetime problem with the restocking and the long queues?!It takes forever each time I need to buy anything from IKEA!!I can't remember any time that any of my unlimited calls to your customer service has been answered!But you still charge the highest rates you can!!Ethically incorrect.I can't believe this is IKEA.

We visited the IKEA Hammersmith store to buy some sofas and were treated to excellent customer service. Thank you, Neha, for being knowledgeable and friendly. We look forward to receiving our new sofas!

Bought 4 bar stools online. assembled one and realised it's not suitable. repacked properly, returned 4 stools to EXETER store. only refunded for 3.Apparently you shouldn't buy this online, because if you assembled it, desembled it, packed it neatly and properly back with the other 3 unopened stools, return it, its no longer new. ha ha ha... why is there not a big read warning under the product photo saying: you won't get a refund for this if you assemble it and don't buy it online. two different customer service advisers spinned me different stories, one even said I need to drive back from Plymouth to Exeter (102 miles) and go speak to the store about not having received my full refund. the other person slammed the phone down. what a joke of a company. WARNING - DON'T BUY ONLINE. and if you don't have a store in your city tough luck. buy somewhere else.

articleTitle: I brought a new kitchen a few years…
articleText: I brought a new kitchen a few years ago,I have several problems when it’s was fitted, my dishwasher not sitting under the unit right could not open the door, got fixed but it’s still the same and only been able to use the dishwasher about 7 time , the work surface had gone white and dis coloured , fridge door different shades . Reported and the covid hit us so I had to wait, then last year tried to get someone out and to no avail, but hey 7 months later I get a reply my work surface is damaged due to water , how they work that out when no one has been out and nearly 3 years later from when it was reported . What a joke I’m not at fault that some off the company’s ikea was using have gone under due to covid. But I fine ikea is copping out. They are a joke and I would never recommend,Pauline Leadbeatter

Ikea Danmark - Aarhus - WOW, as I was on-hold for over 30 minutes, I was writing a 1 - Star experience, finally Customer Service answerd, talk to Karim, EXCELLENT service, from him, it changed my rating from a 1 to a 5.  I will not go into detail about this case because it is long but Karim should be commended for his customer support.  Sincerly, Tim

Customer service is literally terrible.  I ordered a mattress with delivery mainly because they offered to take your old mattress for free. Well, the driver got there, didn’t know what I was talking about and wouldn’t take it. Then we called CS and they said they would email and schedule to come get it. They CALLED, while I was working and couldn’t pick up the phone. No email. They cancelled the pick up because I missed that one call, and then CS would not come pick it up without us paying an additional $25. I already paid $70 for delivery AND pickup. CS agents were rude and unhelpful, giving me different information, and refusing to even give me $25 store credit.

APPALLING SERVICE! IKEA was supposed to fit our kitchen today (organised and paid for in February)- fitters to arrive between 8am and 10am...nothing, we organised our day to suit them. ZILCH, no communications, nothing. We are left with a kitchen with no cooker, no sink and fitting could be in another week..month,,year?!! What are we supposed to cook on? We had to ring to complain-no one bothered to contact us or apologise. Only giving one star as the poor chap and the end of the phone was so professional and calm. Seriously...AVOID!

I ordered a chair and footstool and paid for delivery, I was told that an hour before delivery they would call me. I live in Burton and the delivery was 15 miles away so an hour would give me time to drive over. I had a text to say they were nearly there, I called the driver and explained it would take me an hour to get there and he said he would rearrange his calls. About 10 minutes later he called back to say he was there so I asked him to leave my order in the garage, this he said he would do. This was Thursday 12/05, I hadn’t any need to go over to my property. On Saturday 14/05 I drove over and my order was left in the garden. I am 75 and had to ask for help to get it inside. Not happy.

articleTitle: I understand that IKEA is cheap and…
articleText: I understand that IKEA is cheap and easy to assemble but their service is probably one of the worsts. If things happen to go wrong and you need to deal with their support service I wish you all the best luck of the world.I prefer now to pay a bit more and go to other services. Never again IKEA.

articleTitle: Boycott IKEA because of lying about Russia
articleText: Boycott IKEA because they ignored the embargo on Russia. They have, despite saying otherwise, bought timber from Russia. They have also done other things. It promises one thing, but does another! Do not buy their stuff, there are better competitors.

articleTitle: I am in shock how bad Ikea customer…
articleText: I am in shock how bad Ikea customer service is. I ordered 2 sets of Malm drawers and instead of receiving 6 boxes I received 2. I did not realise the shortage of boxes / parts until I was part way through putting it together. This mistake by IKEA is just too much for them to handle. They cannot seem to sort out the delivery of missing boxes. It’s beyond their capability . I have spent 3 days on the phone for an hour at a time trying to solve this and am still nowhere . Cannot believe how bad they are at serving customers

articleTitle: Used to love trips to IKEA
articleText: Used to love trips to IKEA, but they have seriously gone downhill at an increased rate of knots. Broken sofa (16 months old) had to wait 6 weeks for it to be seen by an engineer, who after all that time confirmed that it had broken in half. Would they replace it, they couldn't, they don't make it anymore. They would give us a refund only after it was collected and returned to their office to confirm it was broken. So after speaking to 3 different customer service representatives, none of whom offered any solutions, we decided to pay a carpenter out of our own pockets to get it repaired. Will we ever buy a piece of furniture again form IKEA, I think you know the answer ...... NOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO

articleTitle: If I could give negative stars I would
articleText: If I could give negative stars I would. Angela in customer support was terrible she did not address my concerns and would not let me speak to her supervisor.  Shipments arrived broken in the package and they will not send a replacement part.  Awful experience.

articleTitle: Delivery is not going to happen. Waste of time
articleText: After confirming delivery with Ikea day prior, delivery is not happening. When you call support, they move your delivery date with no explanation to week or few weeks further and then it happens again. So you pay money. But never get your furniture.

Bought a rug a week ago, it sheds like crazy, took it back to IKEA ashton for an exchange and a young lad Deacon who was apparently the quality assurance expert tells me there is nothing wrong with it and refuses an exchange or refund.The duty manager tells me he has to go with the expert tells himI'm now stuck with a faulty item that I dont want to use for fear of a child pulling out a tuff and choking on it.Ikea has the worst returns policy going.I asked Deacon to see a copy of the quality assurance policy but he tells me there isn't one but he has been on a training course.Avoid IKEA as if its faulty you will get nowhere

I ordered my kitchen in January. In March it was partially installed as some pieces were out of stock. We are in May now, and Ikea still does not know when the supply will be available again. I was offered no options, no help or alternatives. Really unfair and unprofessional! I would never advise anyone to engage with them. On top of that, the prices of funitures are sky-high and there is absolutely room for Ikea's competitors.

articleTitle: I purchased a wardrobe on 8th April- where is it!?
articleText: I purchased a wardrobe on 8th April. You then cancelled my order. Your customer service have lied over and over about my order which I still have not received almost a month later. What will you be doing about this??
very convenient price and availability but very hard to assemble the furniture

Absolutely horrible experience!!!  NO phone numbers to the stores, you can not call a local store, only the home office.  They WILL NOT deliver to our area and WILL NOT let you pay for an item over the phone and then go pick it up.  They touted "first come first served" which is bologna!!!  So, we called the home office, asked if we could pay online - NO was their answer.  You have to go there in person.  I told them it was a 4 hour round trip and I would gladly pay over the phone to assure it was there when we went.  They refused.  Fast forward, drive all the way down there, Paramus, and were told "No, we have none!"  even though I was told they did.  They looked on their computer and told us there were 8 available in Elizabeth store.  Drove ANOTHER 25 minutes away, only to be told once again, nope, none in stock!!!  A waste of 5 hours, a lot of gas and frustrated as hell.  I have never heard of not being able to call the local stores, what the heck???? So, we are out time, money and patience.  Save the aggravation and shop elsewhere.  This company has no idea what "customer service" is nor do they have the common sense to practice retail store etiquette by having their ducks in a row!

We had a kitchen planning appointment with Louise at Milton Keynes, she could not have been more helpful, she listened and made suggestions.  The delivery arrived on time with no items missing (it was a big order).  It has taken us a while to fit it but we are delighted with the outcome.

articleTitle: I bought a Sofa by Ikea Denmark
articleText: I bought a Sofa by Ikea Denmark. After normal use of the sofa 1-2 years a plastic part under the sofa suddenly fell off. We called IKEA. After 100 days going forth and back and a visit from an inspector, who concluded that the sofa had been used as it should, we were turned down, because this had not happened to other users.I have never experienced such bad service before. The inspector says all is fine, it can only be a defect on the sofa. IKEA says, it is your own fault. We off cause expect that the sofa is to be used for sitting in, without breaking, which is what we have done.The customer support at IKEA is so bad. It is unbelievable. They just give you a decline with no documentation and if you want to complain again, you have to wait another 2-3 weeks for an answer.I am done with IKEA.

My experience with delivery and customer service provided by Bianca was extremely appalling and unprofessional. They delivered me the wrong item - quite an annoying one, a long metal tube - and while they are presumably fixing the delivery of the correct item they would not take this tube back! Bianca's suggestion was literally " you can do anything you want with it"... Seriously? It takes up a lot of space, and disposing of it means driving to the recycling center since it's metal. They would not take it back, nor even consider a partial refund for the total disservice and nuisance caused to the customer. I strongly recommend to go physically to shops and to refrain from using their delivery service, which is extremely poor. And it saves you from having a rather unpleasant experience with the customer service.

ExasperatingGood marketing - Excellent design team-excellent advice and recommendations - Excellent assembly team and the here comes the snapDefects after rejects - the number of boxes opened only to reveal faulty products begins to get unbearable.  No solution  2 months down the line with no kitchen. Finally offered an alternate - but hold on no stock and what guarantee is there that this stock would be fault free. Are we getting inferior products into the UAE as these same products in Canada and the Netherlands have no flaws.  Let's keep the kitchen counters aside. I just bought a make shift table and chairs till the  matter is settled and lo and behold on opening the box it looked as if a wood worm had had a feast along one of the panels.I have had an IKEA home for the past 25 years and the change for new furniture seems to be a disaster. A poor image from what it used to be.

articleTitle: The worst customer support experience of my life.
articleText: A week after ordering my items online, I got an email to say that one part of the set was out of stock. This meant that I'd have to cancel the whole order because my decoration plan required all the pieces. I contacted a chat agent for help. She said I'd have to call Fed Ex for them to cancel my delivery in order for me to receive a refund. I called Fed Ex and they said that they had not yet received the package, so I would have to call back Ikea to cancel it. I wrote to another chat agent who also did not resolve my issue and ended the conversation too early. I then phoned the customer service line. They explained that I would have to wait further until Fed Ex posted my order before they could issue my refund. I was very frustrated at this point that I was still being asked by Ikea to do more administrative work for Ikea's mistake, just to get my refund. Ikea really should have asked my permission before processing my order without a key component. The worst part is, that in my third attempt to try to get Ikea to issue my refund and to handle the delivery return with Fed Ex on their end instead of mine, the phone agent actually hung up on me! Never in my life have I experienced such treatment from a customer service agent. Shocked and very disappointed with Ikea.
het is een grap. gemaakt van papier. verschrikkelijk voor het milieu. en vreselijke verzendservice.

articleTitle: My only issue is that you have to look…
articleText: My only issue is that you have to look through a lot of stuff before finding the thing that you actually want. It is a fun place to kill a couple of hours, and they do have sooo much stuff to look at. The kitchen storage is really clever and you can't forget about the restaurants.

articleTitle: Yet another very bad experience with this company...
articleText: We last evening ordered x2 shelving units on line from IKEA Dublin.The order was confirmed by email, but a second email arrived a few minutes later which said 'we are unable to process your order. Please contact your bank for more information.'This despite the account being in good order.Presuming a technical glitch we immediately phoned IKEA service hoping to sort the problem out.They advised putting a repeat order through and sent a payment link. We paid a second time using the second card on the account only for the same to happen.Checking afterwards (service was by then closed) we found that despite the cancellation of both orders our account had been debited for them. (x2 @ €150 = €300)The account is still down this amount as of now. (the late afternoon of the following day)We phoned service this morning to request assistance only to unacceptably be told that it was a matter between ourselves and the bank.'Computer it say....'The agent insisted that they had not received the money, and that it would likely be refunded by the bank within 24 - 48hrs.The former may well be the case - and our bank could well have been at fault in the first instance but the fact is that we placed the orders with IKEA and our account was as a result debited for both payments.They consequently had and have a clear responsibility to engage with the bank to ensure that the matter is promptly sorted out.Also to with the bank resolve whatever systems glitch it was that permitted the debit to our account before the transactions were cleared. (if indeed it was a glitch - these systems seem always to be set up to benefit the businesses concerned)It's a significant matter. Even presuming its rapid sorting out somebody took the use of our money.What about the case of the person on a tight budget with e.g. standing orders to be met?The icing on the cake came when she (the agent) dropped the phone on us while we were (firmly but politely) explaining that her refusal to help was unacceptable....UPDATE x3 DAYS LATER. IKEA 'service' has since twice admitted that the problem was technical and on their side, and that it had been around for some days.Why then if they knew this did the agent trigger a second debit of our account by advising that she put the order through a second time?The bank meanwhile says that they can't refund without an instruction from IKEA quoting a code the bank gave us. IKEA say they don't do that, that it's automatic - and that it won't be sorted until their systems problem is resolved.They meanwhile sent duplicate email stock order cancellation confirmations  - this time suggesting that it could take up to 14 days for the refund to be processed. (?????)The agent when tackled on the 14 days claimed that it was only a stock message, that it should be sorted in days.What a mess...UPDATE X4 DAYS Later. The €300 was back in the bank account this morning which is a relief given a previous experience where it took months to get a refund paid.This doesn't detract from the reality of the uhelpful, ineffective and inappropriate handling of the matter by support - and the fact that the account should never have been debited in the first place....

Worst customer service for kitchen planning, after our consultation call we will never opt for renovation of our kitchen with ikea. Our rep was not willing to listen and wanted us to just make a decision. She got mad when we asked to remove one of the cabinets in the virtual planning session. What a waste of time!

During a visit to the Croydon Store on 30 April 2022, after completing a purchase of over £700 accompanied by my sister, we took our paid for goods (some in trolleys and used two baskets) and went to sit by the area of collection for a chair we were waiting for. We had a lot of items and put some items in 2 baskets to help us move the items to the sitting area whilst we waited. A security guard came over and "told us" we had to take our items out of the baskets and that we could not take the shopping baskets out of the store. I advised him that was fine and that we were not leaving the store and would return the shopping baskets to the designated area (we had spent almost 5 hours instore finding our purchases and were extremely tired). I front of other shoppers sitting in the area, he stated no we could not and should do it right away. When we advised him again that we would take the baskets back before leaving he started to raise his voice saying "no you must take your things out of the bag now and return them" I reiterated that we were not in any way leaving the store as we had to wait for our chair to be brought out to us and were also awaiting a taxi we had ordered. This infuriated him and followed a barrage of arguing with us loudly in front of other shoppers. He then proceeded to leave and returned with another store employee who began to shout at us for not returning the baskets as we had been told. Again we reiterated that we were not intending to leave the store and would return the baskets. The store employee became verbally aggressive shouting at us loudly in front of the other customers which then led to us feeling really embarrassed at how were being treated, especially as were had spent several hours in the store and were extremely exhausted and the thought that the security guard and store employee were both treating us as if we had committed an offence. This caused us great distress on a day that had so far gone well and we were excited with our new purchases, this made what was supposed to be an enjoyable trip to IKEA one of our worst experiences. I have never had this type of treatment when I have visited IKEA before and am still appalled at our treatment. My sister who had accompanied me so I could buy my items was also horrified especially after I had been praising IKEA. This behaviour from staff should not be allowed or encouraged. Treating customers in this manner is totally unacceptable, I will not recommend anyone to visit the Croydon store and will be leaving a strong message on google and trusted websites to make other customers aware of this disgusting treatment of customers. I hope you will look into this incident seriously and look forward to your feedback.
Horrible customer service. Don't order online. You can't even use coupons they send you to order online with either.

We ordered a wardrobe for delivery, organised a task rabbit to fit it, they sent text to say it was to be delivered on day expected, then on date sent a text, saying unable to deliver, implying we weren't at home. Poor service, as this has really inconvenienced us

I’m giving only two stars because the helpful people were really helpful (I’m talking 3 out of 6) but the other customer service people either didn’t know how to do their job or couldn’t care less.ONE STAR for delivery. Got an email for arrival date Saturday 9am-9pm, happily stayed home all day waiting to sign for it, never showed. NO UPDATE. They tried to deliver Sunday but weren’t home to sign for it, so it couldn’t be deliver. STAYED HOME the next day waiting from 9am-9pm for something that never showed!!!  Still no update. Finally called Monday night and no one knew where the package was. Called Tuesday morning and finally (by 12 noon) was a able to locate package and reschedule delivery for Wednesday.Wednesday stayed home from 9am-5pm cuz they said 9-9pm was the possible time span. At 5pm the shipping company called TO RESCHEDULE because they never deliver to our area on Wednesdays!!!!!!!!!!!! My husband and I were furious. End of story, I got my shipping refunded…. And now have to pick it up myself (Thursday) from a nearby hub.Absolutely the worst headache of an experience ever!!!!!!!But I actually like the furniture so can’t complain there.

I just had a double mastectomy and need a sheepskin pad for my bed. My husband has a defective knee. I tried to order the pad to pick up. The webpage said it was available for pick-up or delivery. When I tried to order it, neither option came up when I pulled up cart to pay. I called customer service and they said "just go to the store someone will go and pull it for you if you explain the circumstances". They (at College Park Maryland) refused, even after explaining our medical emergencies. They would not offer any reasonable accommodations.I will never ever ever go to that store again.

I go online to contact Ikea about my order & the auto online chat is so rubbish ! It’s doesn’t understand anything.There’s no email & nowhere to log complaints!There’s a phone number which if you press 2 for stock then 2 that your not a business you get back to press 2 for stock… I wanted to throw my phone out the window at that point. When I got through to someone her system didn’t work and I had to call back ..thanks for nothing Ikea !
terrible company, long delivery time and low quality products.

It is Zero star. IKEA UK is incompetent.  Maybe they don't need any more customers cos most people are still gonna keep buying their stuffs.I believe their delivery team is the one to blame. Their delivery team is "state within a state". They can do whatever they want. I guess the boss at IKEA has no bargaining power to deal with their delivery team.Originally I bought nine products at IKEA Manchester in store on April 19th and I scheduled the delivery due on April 20th.On April 20th, nobody came. No one called me either. Then they shoot me a SMS, it says my postcode has an issue. (No, it isn't. I had other companies delivered sofa and furniture to my address successfully using my postcode.) They made up this excuse and rescheduled the delivery date to April 23th.On April 23th morning at 9ish, I used their online chat and asked my delivery status. They said they were due by 17:30. Again at around 13:30, I enquired my delivery status again. They said the delivery was received at nearest hub. The hub had not put it on route yet. They contacted the hub and had not received any feedback and had to leave them a message to contact me. At the end, no one called and came at all.At this point I am going to get a refund and cancel the whole order. I don't wanna tangle with them and I just won't be their customer anymore.

Absolute joke Ikea. I have been shopping with you now for many years and after the experience I have just had about a replacement of 2 baskets as they were badly soldered and dangerous is unbelievable. 3 phone calls dohhhhhh I don't know what to do can you ring back. 1 phone call arranged replacements, stayed in ALL day, no didn't come, rang again oh I think they went somewhere else, re-ordered. Same happened again. NOW RE-ARRANGED AGAIN waited in all day again only to be told they cancelled it!!!!!!!!!!!! . They didnt have enough information dohhhhhhhh. Now re-arranged for next Tuesday WHAT A JOKE. Disappointed, annoyed and to be honest IKEA never again. Watch this space will they call????????? get it right IKEA.

articleTitle: Ordered sofa from ikea on Tuesday
articleText: Ordered sofa from ikea on Tuesday.  Express delivery today . Absolutely  great . Lovely guys .did a great job . Also great customer service at ikea as well. Ordered within a few minutes . Fast and efficient.  Sorry to see you all go from edmonton at end of August.  Was always a great day out. Thankyou so much

I placed an order online on 13th December 2021 and received notification that the product would be delivered on the 18th December.  However, not only did my item not show up, I was unable to chase it via customer services as the phone lines were not being answered and the online help said it couldn't help!  4 months later and no contact from Ikea whatsoever to explain the delay, I still had no item but they still had my money.  I managed to finally speak to a human being on the phone to cancel the order and get my money back, but was told their systems were down and to try again another time!  The online help "bot" stated it couldn't help me either, but at least it did eventually get me through to a human being.  She managed to cancel the order and I received a refund a couple of days later.  Shocking service all round from Ikea and I will never use them again - either online or instore.

articleTitle: Buy back rip off from IKEA dublin instead of fair return
articleText: Have discovered the new "Buy Back" scheme they have introduced without honestly informing their customers.  Bought walk in wardrobe shelving compilation 29 January and was delayed in install until 04 April due to builder delay in completion.  When I return a small part of the multi buy items they told me I had used it.  It was only partially assembled with no inner shelves as it became clear at that point it would not fit.  But they insisted I had "used" it and only paid me 40% of its value as a buy back.  So the 365 return policy no longer exists really- No signs advising - really atrocious behaviour of staff on the day when I queried it.  I could take it back if I did not like it.  Wrote to manager of store and did not even get a response.  Buyers beware - policy change with no fair notification.
