Never once received an apology.

Purchased a Hemnes chest of drawers in June, we had an absolute nightmare from the moment we tried to assemble it with holes not being drilled properly through to drawers not fitting together properly. After a week I noticed the top was denting and chipping ridiculously easily (bear in mind, its in a bedroom, I have no children and I am very careful with my furniture) and I also have one drawer which for no clear reason does not open or close correctly without catching, a relative who is a carpenter has looked at it and says the wood has not been seasoned correctly and cannot understand why the one drawer does not open or shut properly. I tried contacting Ikea various times to get this issue resolved, I recieved a reply via Facebook messenger but after I replied, silence. I left a comment on Ikea's facebook page and recieved a reply, but only after I left a comment which is very funny, is it not?I eventually got a resolution and a partial refund however I am totally dissatisfied with my chest of drawers and am left bitterly dissapointed with Ikea's idea of what customer service is, and I strongly urge anyone looking at the Hemnes chest of 8 drawers to just not bother full stop.Such a shame!

articleTitle: I’ve shopped at IKEA several times…
articleText: I’ve shopped at IKEA several times since they opened a store in my city!I like the store in my city, it’s nice, large and the personnel is nice and friendly.Though, I missed a couple of items to put together a shelf I had purchased there and when I ordered replacement items from the site I never got any of them…

I placed an order received the delivery  apart from a missing item, and a damaged item this was on 30/11/21, I telephoned them the same day and they placed another order sent an email with missing and damaged item, and it would be on the 5/12/21 for delivery  I checked online and saw that it had  beencancelled, I was not informed  so the delivery never happened I had to speak to 2 different people. I was told that it was reordered and they would email me with delivery dates, this also did not happen as they cancelled the order without my knowledge and issued a £10.00 gift refund which is not working. On the 7/12/21  at 8pm I spoke to a customer service person and I was told that he did not know why it was cancelled, and told that the gift card should work in 24 hours but it didn't work, as I tried again

called customer service.  was explained that the delivery info on a product page is useless (you need to add product to basket and go to check out to see if it actually is in stock or not!) but the dude just hung up on me.  It's not hard being polite and friendly, this guy was the total opposite.And Ikea, please sort out how you relay stock info for delivery on product pages please as in it's current format it's plain sh*te and not fit for purpose.

articleTitle: IKEA should been re named ikcrap.
articleText: This lot could not arrange a knees up in a brewery. It’s is run and managed by people of the lowest intelligence, visiting this place can affect you mental health and even cause you a heart attack. I have tried to sort out the items not been delivered by going back to the store and hand picking the items missing from my order, only to find on the day of the promised delivery it has been lost and is now out of stock.
By telephone it is completely impossible to get contact. After hours I managed. They asked me to send an email with the details. By now three weeks have passed and I still have no answer.

I paid for my delivery and they chose Fedex to deliver it which made an attempt to a commercial building at 4:43 AM on a Saturday morning! I called the customer service to nicely update the business hours and this girl with a sassy attitude told me I should take care of that on my own and HANG UP ON ME!Ikea should properly train they representatives and also do their mental evaluation before hiring…

articleTitle: My online order was delivered just on…
articleText: My online order was delivered just on the estimated delivery date. Brilliant service.

articleTitle: Wednesbury Store,  vehicle damaged, tools stolen
articleText: Wednesbury Store, Truck broken into, lock forced and a window smashed, power tools and dashcam taken. Other tech items not taken. Security staff were helpful and cleaned up the broken glass, but indicated that there may not be cctv coverage of that part of the carpark. Was asked to phone IKEA to ask about cctv.Reported to police.There is no store number, only London number for orders, deliveries etc but no customer service you can talk to. Rang this number, operator was polite but unhelpful. Could not say if there was cctv coverage or not, unwilling to check if any existed unless requested by police to do so. Asked to speak with someone at the store, but in this era of advanced communication, this is not possible.I understand that parking is at my own risk. The only recognition that this was not the ideal IKEA shopping experience was an apology from security staff at the time, and then a reminder that parking is at my own risk from their central number.Shop at IKEA if you want to, but guard your vehicle. Corporate IKEA not really interested, staff on the "gound" are, but very limited in what they can do.

articleTitle: IKEA Christmas tree offer for £9 is just not true .
articleText: Don't be fooled by the Ikea Christmas tree offer because it is not true. If as I did you use your voucher and find the item you purchased with it is not suitable and you return the item you do not get a refunded credit note. So the tree costs £29 not £9. There was no mention of this on the offer details last year and the terms and conditions this year again do not make this clear. Also don't bother to complain as Ikea take weeks to reply and then just give mixed messages and do not take take any responsibility for their own terms and conditions.

articleTitle: This review only applies to ikea…
articleText: This review only applies to ikea online, as the staff in-store (Greenwich) are pleasant and helpful.Online order which I paid for a delivery for the 2nd of December. Abusive but ok. Best part comes that there are parts missing rendering the item useless. Offered to go to store, no spare. Called customer service, first person decided to hang up. Second one, said he would call me back (never called). Third one, said I was unreasonable (while asking me to pay 25£ if I wanted to return the item).

They charged me twice for the same delivery because they claim I was at home. In fact they delivered me a different order on the same day, so clearly I was at home.Very bad customer service - would not listen to reason.

Just been too the IKEA in Sheffield and was having some issues in the store having troubles finding where a product, I asked a staff member who still had issues and made great use of his radio to communicate with an employee who guided him to where he needed to be. Excellent service would recommend definitely.
Ikea store is a maze , there are no signs guide to you to what you looking for , and it's so hard to catch an employee to help you .

articleTitle: I had beds delivered by IKEA on…
articleText: I had beds delivered by IKEA on Saturday to my new apartment in preparation for my families arrival in the Netherlands. The website states "Een bestelling die je thuis laat leveren, wordt tot over de drempel bij je bezorgd. Woon je in een flat? Dan kan je ook op een etage laten bezorgen. Het is belangrijk om dit direct op moment van bestellen door te geven. Als er geen lift aanwezig is, wordt er tot en met de vierde etage bezorgd. Wel een lift? Dan komen onze transporteurs gewoon bij jou voor de deur. Woon je op een studentenkamer? " When I asked that they deliver to the 2nd floor they refused, dumped everything in the hall and left. I had to move the boxes myself as I was alone. Terrible service from IKEA's delivery guys.

articleTitle: Ordered two chairs and a table
articleText: Ordered two chairs and a table.  Missing one cover and hardware  . Hardware showed up  10 days later. Still waiting for my cover been more than three weeks

articleTitle: Items not arrived and its my fault!!!
articleText: Terrible customer service! Avoid like the plaque. One of my items wasn't delivered, and because I didn't call to complain within 10 days (I was waiting for the room to be painted) its my fault... No understanding because these are their rules!

articleTitle: Online purchases, limited pick up time.
articleText: I ordered items for my daughter paid for them with my credit card but she was not able to get there within 2 days to pick them up. So they automatically put everything back and said they were going to issue a credit. Its been 4 days and I still have not seen the refund on my credit card.. Just don't understand why, when something has actually been paid for, they don't hold on to it until it's picked up . My daughter had to drive 2 hours to get to the store.

articleTitle: Don’t bother with delivery they don’t deliver
articleText: What a complete waste of time.  I took a full day off to wait for a delivery and no one called no one rang my doorbell nothing. I called ikea kundeservice and apparently someone tried to deliver to me but I wasn’t home. Super weird because I didn’t leave my house for the whole day. So they must have had to deliver to someone else cause no one even attempted to deliver to me. I can’t help but think it’s cause I live on the 4th floor of an old building which has no lift. I paid 700kr for this awesome experience of wasting an entire day of my life and of work for this complete farce. Never again!! I will purchase more expensive furniture in future from a company that actually delivers what you order as agreed. Ikea seem to think they have a monopoly so can do whatever they like. This cheap furniture has cost me a fortune in lost work time. Lesson learnt, pay peanuts and you get this monkey service

articleTitle: Ikea business practices is sending the company to the grave
articleText: There are no IKEAS within three hours from where I live.  I went to the web site to order a wardrobe system.  For some reason, they are unable to ship it so I have to pick it up.  There is a pick up center one hour from my house.  But they want to charge 40$ to pick up.  What?  You want to charge me to drive to your location and pick up a product I ordered and provide no shipping options?  ORDER CANCELLED.  What kind of business is this?  Not only are IKEA products TERRIBLE and Cheap, but their business practices are equally as bad. "IKEA - Swedish for idiotic!"

Shocking returns policyWe bought a tv unit and coffee table from IKEA Birstall Leeds £400 faulty unit as we have no boxCould not return is Shocking.Now the truly shocking bit the coffee table comes in2 box’s both unopened but the store claimed that both had been opened and so could not re-sellThe items were in brand new condition the returns manager made every excuse on the planet not to refund .The sellotape was not Ikeas sealing the box he saidAbsolutely Rubbish , I opened the boxes in front of the manager to show the contents was untouchedIKEA still made excuses I wasted 3hoursI asked them to re-seal the boxes so I could leave it took 3 members of staff to reseal the box so how the hell was this opened prior to returning.People be very very aware that even unopenedItems are not returnable IKEAI have been a IKEA customer for 20 yearsBut no more

Ordered two 3 seater setters for friday without first reading reviews on Wednesday. Got a text first thing Friday advising me of the delivery slot time, had a courtesy call advising that they were about 10 minutes away and turned up perfectly and on the time they stated. Cannot fault the service we recieved.

articleTitle: The customer service is just a mess
articleText: The customer service is just a mess, I purchased some items to receive these within a week, and then they modified the delivery date after one month.Absolute waste of time

2 years ago I bought a parasol at Ikea Israel. The fabric got torn after one year; I somehow used it at the second year. I asked to BUY a new fabric but was told that they do not sell that model anymore, so I have to throw all other parts of the parasol, and contaminate our earth.

articleTitle: "You don't have to shop here" is the store mgr's approach to taking care of customers and families
articleText: My husband, my two toddlers and myself went to Ikea tonight. Not busy at all and tons of workers standing around. We were at check out and they told us we couldn't buy 2 storage bins because we didn't have the lids. 1) we didn't know they came with lids 2) we didn't want them. Not only would they NOT allow us to buy them but 2 mgrs, Billy and Sarah, and loss prevention came to us and told us that we would have to go get them. Now we were tired, Ikea is a HUGE store, and they never once asked if they could quickly go get them for us. No lines at check out. 4 people telling us we couldn't buy something. Sooo we had to put everything back in our cart, go back through the store, find the lids and we were so upset. The little tiny sign that says we should get both parts was covered by one of the other advertised containers. When we finally got back up to check out, I went back to the mgr Sarah and said that I was so disappointed with their customer service approach which was, "you either want it or you don't" and "that is our policy" which were both solutions to our problems apparently, and she could only muster the effort to say "Have a nice day". My kids are hungry, mommy is so crushed. 4 people standing around could have saved our day and made our Thanksgiving one of gratitude. But instead I am writing this review hoping that America changes the way they "take our money". I will be reaching out to Keith, who I was told was the store mgr and for Billy?....You are a mature man who I hope would understand that having a family walk all the way back through the store for a lid when you have workers standing around is a straight up "I don't really care" attitude and it shows. Please tell me someone else has had a similar experience and it is making me question my faith in humanity.

articleTitle: Horrible experience at the IKEA Orlando…
articleText: Horrible experience at the IKEA Orlando store! We went to exchange a piece of glass that was the WRONG SIZE and came in the original box. Vanessa the manager in the return and exchange department took care of us. We didn’t have the receipt but we did provided the bank statement with all the details so they can search it. They couldn’t find any trace of the receipt. She rolled her eyes and she told us with a ( I don’t care attitude) that since we were in a hurry after waiting 2 hours and showing the bank statement That she will have to look it in the system over the week! really IKEA? For a piece of glass? Never again!!! I will also advice friends and family to not shop there! Better of going to Rooms to go, Ashley’s furniture or any other store.

articleTitle: Terrible delivery, assembly and customer service
articleText: After my most recent experience with IKEA’s delivery and assembly service, I will never shop at IKEA again. IKEA only sent half the product and didn’t respond to my multiple emails and phone requests. I then asked to have the product picked up and three times they failed to send someone. I don't know how a company that is so huge worldwide can have such a poor delivery, assembly and customer service system.

After buying a whole kitchen at Ikea the experience of getting the stuff delivered was absolutely terrifying.My kitchen supposed to arrive in 6 different batches, the first 3 to be delivered in the same day.After my first delivery I feel like I make a capital mistake trusting the delivery of my kitchen to Ikea services.The delivery is not actually done by Ikea but in my case by CDS. The guys who came to deliver told me they had to deliver 82 boxes but in fact I received only 69. The delivery guys would lie to me, not show me any invoice or confirm the number of boxes, but instead pass me to their boss and disappear. The CDS customer support was extremely aggressive and threatening and eventually all they said was that they are not responsible of anything. I was left after speaking with the Ikea customer support to check myself all 69 boxes and see what is missing.And this is only the beginning, still have 2 more deliveries to come and two other orders to eventually arrive in stores someplace, sometime.I could not believe that Ikea would contract such unprofessional and threatening companies such as CDS.I will avoid all together to ever get in an Ikea store just thinking about the awful delivery service.

I am incredibly disappointed. My order home delivery was only partially fulfilled for the second time now from Ikea.ie. This is after my order was canceled without any reason and I had to reorder. I waited for more than 50 minutes to get a response in the chat room and only had their very unattentive support reorder it 90 minutes from when my chat started. Extremely delayed responses from the support staff. The person who helped me was good but I could tell he was chatting to many customers at the same time.Terrible service from Ikea.ie.

articleTitle: TRIED TO BUY A BOOK CASE ALONG WITH…
articleText: TRIED TO BUY A BOOK CASE ALONG WITH LIGHTING AND THE CABLE CONNECTIONS. STATED DELIVERY AVAILABLE FROM MY CHOOSEN STORE. THIS WAS BASICALLY A LIE, I THEN PUT IN SEVERAL POST CODES AND DIFFERENT STORES NOTTINGHAM, MILTON KEYNES, BIRMINGHAM ALL STATED DELIVERY WHEN TRYING TO COMPLETE MY ORDER NO DELIVERY WAS AVAILABLE, YET PUT IN ANY LONDON POST CODE WITHIN OR JUST OUTSIDE THE M25 LIKE CHELMSFORD AND DELIVERY WAS AVAILABLE. IKEA IS NOT INTERESTED IN PEOPLE OUTSIDE THE M25 AND WILL NOT BE INTERESTED IN CORRECTING THIS. BOYCOTT THE COMPANY

This has been a nightmare. I  had an Ikea kitchen designer help me design my kitchen before my major remodel on October 4. 2021.  wWe finalized the plan. I spent $8200.00 on my cabinets including parts, I paid extra to have all items delivered to my home. My shipment was to be delivered on November 17th, 2021. Of course it didn't arrive until the 18th. Once all items we inventoried many items were missing cabinets, doors, parts, and lighting. Several cabinets were damaged as well. Trying to reach someone that gives a damn is impossible, long wait times, disconnected calls, no return calls or emails. Now they are telling me that I have to pick up some items in Kansas, I live 3 hours from Ikea and other items will be shipped to the store and they will ship them FedEx to my home. This just keeps costing me money with the delays and the labor. Ikea offered me a 10% credit. No thanks to their offer. Ikea needs to be accountable for selling items to a customer that they don't have stock, this is fraud. I will be turning them into the District Attorney's office and let them explain to them. I am exhausted dealing with them. Beware buy your cabinets elsewhere.

Recently we did quite big online order and paid more $200 for shipping. A lot of items came broken or extremely dirty. We spent more than 2h on a call with support. Two people from support put us on hold after more 30 minute call and never came back to us. Not only we had to spend so much time to get the refund, but there was not even option to get those items send again. Very poor and frustrating experience.

articleTitle: A large order not delivered on 3…
articleText: A large order not delivered on 3 occasions as planned with no reasonable explanation as to why not. I had to chase each time a delivery did not turn up and was rescheduled multiple times and still no items. Poor service. Have attempted to make a formal complaint but no accessible Avenue to do so.

articleTitle: I order quite frequently usually very good service definitely gone down
articleText: I received my delivery in July but I injured my thigh and could not do a lot so when I started to put the hinges on a wardrobe door, 2 out of the 3 were totally rubbish and would not screw in or out. I now have to go to Ikea and replace these, I have another 6 hinges which I will now check to make sure they will be okay, I have used these before on 2 Platsa Cupboards that come with the doors and not a problem.I received another delivery a day early  and missing an item I navigated to the page where you order but nothing on there so I ordered the actual item, 45 minutes later or even later, the item turned up and was delivered, I then had a navigating problem of finding the telephone number, got through quite quick  and had to cancel the order. Later when I was looking at another item ordered the parts were missing so then I had to order the parts and cannot fix this together until they arrive, they were never online to order for quite a while, also not available in store either probably why. SKADIS CONNECTORS They are posting the screws to me.

articleTitle: I have given up on the appalling…
articleText: I have given up on the appalling customer service, I have sent no fewer than 7 emails about missing items.I am wholly sick of it.And to top it off I don't think that they care about negative reviews and it's just business as usual.

articleTitle: Really wish I'd read the reviews!!
articleText: Like so many others on this page I have sadly found IKEA's customer service simply appalling. Having spent literally hours both on the phone and on ( the completely soul destroying!) 'Chat', this utterly time wasting experience has been one of 'the' most frustrating shopping debacles I have ever encountered.  From an hours long wait to speak to a customer service representative, to the joy of dealing with the passive aggressive, rude attitude of the  'Chat' staff who obviously believe that it is their moral duty to remind us that we are living in 'unprecedented times' ....hence why IKEA's Customer Service can now be rubbish and, we the paying customers, should obviously be far more understanding of their failings and lack of training.                                                                         Telling customers they are wrong ( over & over again ) must also be part of 'Chat' training only for them to finally realise (30mins later) that actually ... the customer (me!) was in fact correct.  No apology needed obviously.                      The thought of having to deal with Customer Service again fills me with complete dread ...however sadly I know this whole sorry saga is not over yet ...... My advice to all would be to perhaps steer clear of IKEA if you can, or at least until they can find a customer focused business model to help them  navigate their way through these (in their words) ..... 'unprecedented times' !!

So dissapionted with the customer service team. My kitchen that they help me plan has started to blister on all the doors near to electrical appliances ie cooker microwave and fridge and dishwasher( normal  kitchen appliances)The result tofay after 6 weeks of emails  photos &. Many calls to be told the kitchen doors are too close to the appliances steam and heat have caused this. My kitchen is 12 meters long by 4 meters wide one large window, 3 doors and balcony lots of air. Large steam extractor. My husband and myself ( pensioners) we cook for 2. Why didnt you tell us not to put appliances next to kitchen units ! Unreal of all the reasonsNow i have to buy a new kitchenThey told me 25 years  ! No apology my fault

articleTitle: I see a lot of negative reviews
articleText: I see a lot of negative reviews, but fortunately I didn’t have any issues.They were on time and quick.

Where do I start?!?!Customer service is terrible, transferred, disconnected, no answer, employees have no knowledge of products.Manager was suppose to call me back, never did. Cabinets out of stock and no idea if or when they will be in stock, Website planner is terrible, paid $360 for delivery and cabinet missing from the order. Have spent several hours on the phone and computer dealing with IKEA, absolutely miserable experience!!

articleTitle: My first time in an Ikea….Waited almost…
articleText: My first time in an Ikea….Waited almost one hour to return an item for my daughter. I had the receipt and they would not credit it back to her credit card or give me cash back. Had to get a store credit which will be useless! Had my  90 year old Mother with me,  No seating, freezing cold in there and employees move like snails. There were 15 people in line behind me and 10 in front of me. Customers would walk up and stat talking to the employees while they were in the middle of a transaction and the employees would stop helping the person who waited forever in line, and they would help the rude customers who did not want to wait. I will NEVER go back there!

Ikea has lost its way. I am shocked.1. They mis sold my 83 year old an item, bumping up the cost of a simple tv unit by nearly £200 and making installation impossible2. They have shut email and chat customer services “due to demand”3. The customer services phone number has computer voice recognition that will not work whatever you say4. Forced to visit a store in person I waited one hour5. We still await collection and replacement of the mis sold item.6.Even the free wifi while waiting was impossible to get to work7. Oh yes, and I nearly got run over by a dumper truck crossing the pavement outside the entrance at speed as Ikea Wembley is undergoing works.  Manifestly unsafe.8. Final addendum the aggressive man on the customer service desk never actually charged me for the exchange (despite saying he had) so after several days we have no delivery and had to go back to Ikea to sort out and, it turns out, pay.Hours and hours of wasted time trying to buy a simple TV cabinet.  I would describe Ikea as unuseable.

Very unprofessional customer service! Workers have no clue about products if you’re able to find one! They don’t want to be bothered and will not help even upon request. When they gave me the wrong hinges to my product that even messed up my cabinets and doors they now won’t exchange them. They ask to come back to the store and discuss plus purchase new hinges at original price. It’s a 2.5 hour drive for me! I do NOT recommend IKEA US!!!

articleTitle: I am extremely frustrated because I…
articleText: I am extremely frustrated because I have bought ikea rubber floor tiles online, and they have arrived water damaged and mouldy. It is impossible to reach Ikea either by email, phone or text. What do I do now?

Delivery short of items again!This happens to me every time I order from IKEA…..out of stocks already mean I’m not actually getting what I’d like……but I placed a compromised order and after swallowing the lengthy delivery time……guess what?….true to form items are missing…..so I call them….wait for 10 minutes…explain issue…get cut off….call again…wait for another 10 mins…..and then get a hollow promise of redelivery……in summary…great product….shocking availability….shocking delivery lead time…..shocking accuracy in delivery…..shocking customer service line. NEVER AGAIN!

articleTitle: IKEA Online service and shipping are useless
articleText: IKEA Online service and shipping are complete garbage in the Montréal area. Choosing a product online is hassle, only to get to you cart to get to know that some of your items cannot be delivered. Yeah, IKEA, sure I want my TV stand without door, Drawers without handles or Curtains without rods. Why are items available for pick up and not for delivery? Aren't we paying extra for delivery? Avoid it at all costs, if you need something to be delivered to your place, you have to go yourself to the store, buy the item and then have it delivered. Awful costumer experience.

I made an order which cost over €700 and then on the day when my stuff was supposed to be delivered IKEA returned all my items without telling me, I was waiting all day for the delivery, we had received texts and emails stating the delivery was coming, but it never did and when I checked my account online I saw it had all been returned. My husband rang customer service and was speaking to a very ignorant English woman who would not help at all and told my husband the only thing she could do was give us a refund so I lost the plot and took the phone where I demand the stuff I ordered and paid for as I am not in the business of giving interest-free loans to foreign companies like IKEA, when I demanded they be sent out and eventually got this woman to reorder my stuff (missing a few items that were now not in stock) I had to wait ages again, and it wasn't everything I originally ordered and then after all this hassle IKEA give me a refund short €39 and when I contacted them about this I got a response that I feel implied I was lying, but I proved I wasn't, and I should not have had to do that!! I have not received this refund and I have contacted them twice, but they have not responded. I feel robbed!! I am so annoyed over this whole thing. IKEA is a disgrace!

articleTitle: Bought my bedroom furniture at IKEA
articleText: Bought my bedroom furniture at IKEA, everything is amazing!

ABSOLUTELY DISGUSTING CUSTOMER SERVICE AND TOTALLY ROGUE REFUND POLICY.I ordered a sofa, together with the TaskRabbit assembly as I am 70 years old and could never manage to do it myself.At first I was rather pleased that the sofa was to be delivered the day after I ordered it. I proceeded with booking the TaskRabbit which said they would match me with a tasker at least 24 hours before the job was to be done. I waited and nothing happened, so, I called TaskRabbit and apparently there was no TaskRabbit tasker in my area.As the sofa was going to be delivered that day (yesterday) and was already on the way, I could not cancel the order. I then had to get in touch with IKEA . The website said they were not answering emails nor operating the chat line. I clicked on the “call us” option and got... nothing. I eventually found their phone number on a Google search. I was told to refuse delivery and call back the next day (today). Which I did. I was then told that I would have to wait 14 days for a refund. I explained that I certainly would understand the delay if I had simply changed my mind either because I didn’t like the colour or I had found another sofa somewhere else. This was not the case. I had to return it because the service IKEA got me to use and book to assemble the sofa does not have anyone in my area. There is no warning about this on the IKEA website. I asked to talk to a supervisor, waited and got to talk to the most unhelpful, abrupt to the point of being almost rude person. She just kept on repeating that this 14 days was their policy and that was that. I asked how to make a formal complaint and could not believe the answer. She told me to write a review on their website! WOW that is the strangest form of formal complaint I have ever come across. I then asked to talk to someone higher or to be given the email of whoever was in charge and she just blurted out the customer service email so fast that I had to ask her to repeat it, which seemed to annoy her and she told me that they were the only people I could email. Yeah sure i would then perhaps get her workmate to answer my email in a few weeks with the same answer. In the end she just kept on asking me, robot fashion and quite abruptly, if there was anything else she could help me with.I am now stuck. 70 years old and through no fault of my own I cannot afford to order a sofa from somewhere else until I get a refund.The impression I got from this conversation is that I was just a nuisance, she could not care less and tough but I'd just have to put up with itFunny how they can process a payment in a day but it takes 14 days for a refund!Trustpilot is committed to transparency.Find out how

Had to return 2 items worth $75 from a $7,000 kitchen purchase. Arrived at 1:00 p.m. on a Wednesday and waited 90 minutes to be served. And 30 minutes of that time was a line-up outside in the 5 degree C temperature. Imagine when winter really comes. Total disregard for your clients. Never again, Ikea.

I am extremely disappointed for a very silly reason. So I ordered this product ikea-365-voorraadpot-met-deksel-rechthoekig-glas-kunststof-s89269071/ which seems to be just one item. Then to my suprise you only deliver the lid, and tell me the container is out of stock. But you still charge me for the lid! Why do I want a lid if I do not have the container? The least you should do in these cases is to ask the customer when you run out of stock of 1 item in compound products, then customer can decide whether he's still interested or not.

My IKEA nightmareThe worst shopping experience I’ve ever had in my entire life I have not received the items which  where addressed to offical IKEA pickup Hobart that is at Green Banks  Rd Bridgewater  Hobart. On arrival to collect from this destination I was told by staff the goods where not there they had never laid eyes on this order turned out the goods addressed to IKEA Hobart depot  had been despatched through toll freight Toll transport does not deliver on  behalf of IKEA to this destination therefore my items were returned by Toll back to IKEALinden K  Smith

Everything is out of stock.Delivery isnt available for who knows what reason.Customer service is rude and writes you off without giving you any information.Id rather pay for good high end furniture than get my things from here!

articleTitle: I'm a proud Metis Canadian citizen
articleText: I'm a proud Metis Canadian citizen, I love the products. I only have one complaint is about the new commercial that is out why isn't the new or any of the commercials with first Nation aboriginal  peoples  in them. As we see alot of them here in Canada 🇨🇦  and this is there land before anyone else's land. Just want to know when something like this would come of.

articleTitle: Missed delivery date, missing parts no refund, rude
articleText: Missed delivery date twice. Both times I took off work to be here. The driver even called and said he would be here in 20 minutes then I get a text saying toReschedule!I sat on the phone for 30 minutes, 2 days of sittings and waiting a weekend I could have spent with my grandchildren.I spent $1200 on table and chairs, when it finally arrived, the legs and extension for table were missing. I Called 3 service representatives. I was told it will take 14 business days forIKEA to decide whether or not to give me a refund or replace the table. I had to send pictures and email and explain to people with very low intelligence. IWas told if they decide to give me a refund it would take 14 days andThey will not deliver another table although I had paid $70 for delivery of the first one, and that I would have to return damaged table top to the store. I don’t own a truck!I won’t have a dining room set for family holidays. I have a damaged table to missing the legs and extension… and no promise of a refund. NEVER AGAIN! the chairs are junk. Don’t shop here. It’s not worth the hassle and aggravation. Get a nice AMERICAN set that last. Not Swedish junk that’s full of chemicals and poor quality. I learned my lesson.Going to Gardner white tomorrow.I only hope I can return all this junk and get a full refund.

articleTitle: I will never order from Ikea again
articleText: I will never order from Ikea again. This was my first and last order from Ikea.  I ordered was given a delivery date, not here yet. Emailed 4 times and called multiple times - no solution. Was hung up on with no proper help. We have a broken sofa leg which they don't make anymore & cannot use the sofa. Clearly a faulty leg as the break is very tidy and only after 4 months. It happened after 2 people were just sitting on it. We sent pictures after opening a file. Now told to wait another 1.5 week at least and was hung up on by customer service when I asked if there was any other solution. Cannot go to the store either because they no longer make this so the only choice I have is to email and call which they don't respond to... Beyond laughable at this point.

The absolute worst buying experience I have experienced. They have the most difficult policies. Tried to buy a shelf kit only to get half of the parts. Web site shows in stock but can't order online so go to the store, told can't find product. After a couple of weeks trying still in stock can't buy on line so back to the store. Finally get a person to confirm and actually correct the status. so now I go to the website to get on the wait list to be notified when product is in. next day get email in stock. go to store nope still no shelf. still says in stock. by the way it's all ways 6 in stock in the beginning and later.... So 3 weeks later there's 50 in stock. still can't order on-line so off to the store again it's there, i purchase start assembly find the leg kit missing cross brace. since it was bought at the store... have to go to the store again they can't send it to me. I'm forced to make my own brace won't be going to that store or web site ever again. should have bought from one of the big box or amazon stores

articleTitle: Please, never buy a kitchen from IKEA, you will regret it
articleText: The worst service ever.This is unacceptable. We have an incomplete kitchen since August because of the poor job of IKEA, and now IKEA doesn't contact us for already 20 days, even if we have been asking them to contact us through multiple channels.We should have had our kitchen counter top delivered at the of August, IKEA messed up on the measurements (yes, IKEA, not the contractor, because the contractor drawing was correct) and we notified them. They didn't hear and we had to get the contractor to come to our house again to tell us "the measurement in the drawing are correct" and once again IKEA made the mistake of understanding the drawing wrong and we had to tell them the order measurements wrong. We had the contractor saying to us to order it and if it happen to be wrong we would start this process again. For a company that says it is sustainable, this is the least sustainable thing you can do: order wrong measurements when we know for a fact that those are wrong and more material will be needed to do a second order. After 3 weeks, we finally fixed the miscommunication and the right order with measurements was made. This delayed the order.This was only the beginning. Then, IKEA called us telling us that the back splash measurements were too short, all was fixed quickly but as a result the order was even more delayed.But wait, there is (sadly) more: since then we had at least 2 more times the date of delivery postponed without a detailed explanation. The contractor showed at our door one day to install it and no countertop had been delivered, telling us "IKEA didn't notify us the delivery date was postponed".And now here we are: we got an email 20 days ago postponing our order delivery date again (keep in mind we paid in advanced) and had been asking to be contacted via email and Facebook messenger and we have had no contact from IKEA yet. Facebook messenger tell us they moved my file to the right department and that I will be contacted, and nothing happens, no call, no email, nothing.Today we got another email saying they expect us to contact the assembly partner to plan a date of instalation when they should be the ones doing it. And once again I am not getting any answer from IKEA Barendrecht, and IKEA customer service just tells me there is nothing they can do. What about delivering a service I already paid for 2 months ago?!This is unacceptable, and all this could be avoided if IKEA just called us to discuss this topic.

terrible customer service. They don’t give you refund all they do just tell you wait wait wait. NEVER NEVER SHOP with Ikea online. Paid $70 for delivery and ended up still need to travel 1 hours to pick up the hardwares they missed to sent!!!!! Wasted my whole 1 month time and never solve ur problem

articleTitle: Wondering if/when the delivery will happen or if I'll cancel first
articleText: Ordered some things online from Ikea. Shocked at the delivery cost, but decided to go ahead anyway. Was given a delivery time with no options as to alternates. Rang the next working day to change delivery time, had to ring as Ikea don't like the idea of traceability (email or chat that could be recorded), and got the new delivery day, time to be advised 1 to 2 days beforehand.Except when I asked for the delivery day to be moved to the next Monday, which they said was no problem, they instead shifted that to the next Monday a week after!Rang up, gave the order number and they demanded every other piece of information. Got fed up and hung up, telling them if I'm not in when stuff arrives that is their problem not mine, as my patience with this nonsense is now exhausted.They don't care though, like every other major retailer the attitude is 'what are you going to do'.

So I spent days picking out my room furniture and it acted like everything was available until I went to check out- then it says “no available shipping options” like huh? I live in Washington state, the US. And your telling me you can’t deliver it to me? Plus I’m pretty sure it’s just sold out. The bed set and the dresser, sold out. If it’s sold out why doesn’t it say that right away and why is it even on the website??? So lame.

articleTitle: They try everything for you NOT to reach them
articleText: Ordered two Billy bookcases. They arrived severely damaged, probably they suffered the damages during the transport. So I looked for my return options. The only thing they offer in the return online section is a drop-off at a collect station, even though I paid for the delivery (so you would expect them to also pick the faulty parts up). However, for the drop-off, the maximum size of the item is 60x50x50 cm. So how do you return a Billy bookcase which is 237cm high and 120cm wide? Exactly... you can't.Now try to get in touch. No chance. The "contact us" section only contains FAQ. No e-mail, no phone, nothing. They even say "our chat channel is closed due to high demand". And: "Our e-mail channel is closed due to high to demand". What a customer service, worse impossible. I am buying from IKEA since years, as never anything went wrong. But once something goes wrong, you are lost. I will never buy there again.

Ordered sofa in store. Took payment and gave me delivery date.Delivery date comes, no sign or communication. Ring up and they have no idea where it is or what has happened. A little digging and some more phone calls it looks like somebody in store has mixed up my receipt and attached it to a different order so my order never got beyond processing!6 weeks without a sofa and now I have to try find another somehow. No compensation, no rectification, nothing.Terrible.

There are some rogue thieves. I recently wanted to order 3 small products whose transport was 169 RON, while on emag, the same weight with the same surface was 39 RON. So the price of transport is 4-5 times higher than normal. Even the transport time is huge, one week (according to their estimates). If I'm lucky, I'll get a product from China sooner than that. Another stupidity was the way they answered my questions. I tried to contact them shortly after 18:00 by phone, but I could only contact them by chat. Therefore I had to make an account on their s_hitty site and after I wrote a question respectfully I waited for half an hour but without receiving an answer. As soon as I wrote to him in chat what work schedule he should have, according to their page, he started to answer me in a secretive way. The payment is another annoying thing. These returns have no refund. I would have paid with the card but it doesn't give me any security.

Spent hours using the wardrobe builder tool only to be told at the very last step of the checkout process that none of the items selected by the wardrobe builder tool are actually in stock for collection or delivery (when the builder tool said they were in stock).  Thanks for wasting my time.

Terrible. I have a mirror that arrived *broken* that I bought with a $100 gift card. A customer service rep told me that I could return my mirror and get a replacement $100 gift card. This never showed up after 14 business days and now customer service says I can't get the money back at all.This is absolutely unacceptable customer service, especially from such a well-known and trusted brand. How was a broken mirror shipped to me? Why was I originally assured that I could get a proper refund? Why is your policy that I now cannot get a gift card/any form of money back at all? Why did I have to have 5 follow-up conversations to get this information?As it stands, Ikea basically scammed me $100 and took hours of my time...

articleTitle: They sold me a broken couch
articleText: I bought a couch from an Ikea store (in Germany, Köln-Am Butzweilerhof). When I came home, while the package was intact, the bottom of the couch had two big holes. They were so big that not only the fabric was broken but also the wood layer (you could see the mattress underneath). I tried to compile the form for the reclame for them to take the broken couch and bring me a new one. I couldn't put the receipe number, the website wanted me to put the order number (that i didn't have because I bought it in a store). So I call that call center and first they tell me to put a made up number for the order (that doesn't work, of course), then they told me that if I bought it in store, they can't pick the couch up and bring me a new one. Why? I don't know. I explained that I don't have a car and I already rent a car the day before just to go to Ikea, but they kept saying that I had to bring them the couch back in order to have a new one. So they sold me a broken couch (mind you, it wasn't in the offers, it was new) and then they told me that I'm on my own.

articleTitle: Product, customer careLESS and stock availability
articleText: this is about the product, customer service and stocking.I've been waiting for almost a year for an item to come into stock. it's actually a regularly carried item, yet it's never in stock. ever. well, at least not at a store I can drive to within a 4 hour radius (which are pretty much ALL the Ontario, Canada stores). it's shown up at 2 British Columbia stores, but never anywhere else. will Ikea ship between stores? no. do they know when it will be in stock? no. so between the customer careLESS department and the lack of stock availability, it's looking like I'll have to start looking elsewhere for a similar book case.the tv stand (that finally came into stock) I purchased is very nice. the finish is great, it assembles so easily and smoothly. instructions are clear and easy to follow. and it looks great in the living room. picking it up was extremely easy and the young man who helped me load it was great. would love to have the shelf I'd decided on that would match it, but Ikea doesn't seem to care about stock availability. hey, why should they? people are still shopping there. why bring anything else in stock if it's not currently in the store?maybe Ikea shouldn't be outsourcing to China.....

articleTitle: Giving a more positive review to…
articleText: Giving a more positive review to balance the one star reviews out!I made an online order for some magazine files and archive boxes to sort out my paperwork, but didn't realise that I had to wait over a month for delivery.Given the current situation with lorry drivers, Covid, blah blah, and the fact I didn't need them immediately, I decided to wait it out.In the mean time, I had a look at the reviews for IKEA and it didn't fill me with confidence about whether I'd get my delivery but the date came and my items were delivered in two installments.I am reasonably happy with the service and the items are good value for money. They lose a star for using a box probably 8 times the size to pack just one of my boxes and another because two of the magazine files had a crease in it.Overall, I would use IKEA online again but only if I am not in a rush to get things immediately.

articleTitle: Never get installations services through IKEA
articleText: We bought an Ikea kitchen including assembly of Montera in January, it is now October and the kitchen is still not installed.In the months since our purchase, IKEAs sub-contractor Montera has proven to be incapable of executing the what ought to be a simple commission. They do not arrive at appointments, they don’t know what parts they need, they do not respond on correspondence and they make short cuts that - if not detected-would have led to water damages. Just to give two of the most disheartening examples on Monteras capabilities. I myself have a past as an interior designer and in all my years working with various craftsmen and construction companies, I have never come across anything worse than Montera.When the problems are to be sorted out, both Montera and IKEA refer to each other. What is particularly distressing is that Montera has divided the company into sub sections where e.g. electrical installations are carried out by Montera-electricity - i.e. their own subcontractor. This makes it even more difficult for the customer to possibly complain and claim responsibility.To further add to examples of abandonment of responsibilities IKEA's customer service often has waiting times of one hour or more. Once you finally are put through customer service just replies that they unfortunately are not acquainted with the case and that they therefore cannot help or respond to anything. The message will all be the same: I'll take a closer look at this and I'll call you back. However, IKEA never calls backIn conclusion - do yourselves a favor and never buy installation services from IKEA and especially not their sub-contractor Montera. It seems that they both have grown so large that they do not think they have to care about their customers - show them that they are wrong!

The Ikea's new Tradfri GU10 bulbs are suddenly incompatible with their own Tradfri dimmer purchased a couple of years ago. So now I have to throw the otherwise perfectly working dimmer away and buy the new one in order to keep things working.The fact of incompatibility is not mentioned anywhere in the Ikea website or item specs. The support service is non-existent and did not reply to me in more than a week.Such a wasteful approach to products is a complete disgrace. I won't buy any electronics or "smart" things from Ikea again.

articleTitle: Do not ever sign a contract with Ikea…
articleText: Do not ever sign a contract with Ikea regarding Kitchen cabinets and countertop. You will be sorry if you did. With help of ARAG (legal firm) I am in process of taking legal action against Ikea for all the workmanship issues and also wage loss due to not showing up or postponing the installation. It has been more than 8 months that I decided to remodel my kitchen and I still don’t have a kitchen. I don’t know about other services Ikea offers their customers but regarding kitchen remodeling, do NOT go with Ikea. Period.

articleTitle: This is my VERY FIRST & LAST time purchasing anything from IKEA
articleText: I purchased a glass cylinder vase from IKEA & it arrived to my home TOTALLY SHATTERED. furniture of terrible quality! I do not recommend it to anyone!

I purchased two bedside tables costing me 160.00 in July 2021. Once I got them home there was a lot of damage on the products, including, scuffs, dent, discolouration and oil damage inside. I contacted IKEA - they could only offer me 8.00 per item as a gesture? I stated the damage was not 8.00 and it was a lot more and I travelled far to collect these. She asked me to email pictures across which I did assuming with common sense IKEA would recognise the faults.I had no response for many weeks - chasing this up. Once they picked up my email on the 24/08/21 they stated they could not see any attachments or my receipt and to email them again in the correct format.Again I emailed. Stated it was in the correct format. But again no response. They then responded again saying incorrect format! No other response.I then rang on the 14/09/21. The First Lady was unhelpful offering me a collection - advised her that the items were a surprise makeover so we had to make do and I travelled far to get this done for my Mum and that I was chasing this up from last month. Rang again, spoke to a Lady called Sarah who sounded super helpful and asked me to email her directly and magically she saw the same pictures in the format IKEA were claiming they could not see (they were in the right format) but on her return she only offered me 15% damage on each item?!I find it shocking that IKEA are happy to sell damaged goods and get away with reimbursement of 8.00 for an 80.00 item? I mean it would have been way cheaper in the bargain basement. The customer service is extremely poor and slow. IKEA are happy to take your money for items that are not as described. I have pictures to prove all of this.Receipt Number 9900186006300149310721

articleTitle: I had the worse experience buying whole…
articleText: I had the worse experience buying whole kitchen cabinets at IKEA. They offer a good service to design your project but start buying is the real adventure. There is no one to help, the person that helped me with the design did not answer my emails anymore. I was never told I would not find everything I needed on the first order. So I ended up doing about 8 orders, going to different stores to pick up parts that were too cheap or could not be delivered for whatever reason, I never understood it. My project cost 6000 and my main reason to buy it there was to use the 24 months financing with the credit card. But because my first order was 4920,00 it did not fall on the 24-month bracket witch is 5000. The customer service of the store and of the bank is a joke. I have contacted them over 10 times and I can write lots on the absurd responses I got.  As a result of this confusion, my contractor had to rearrange his schedule to finish my renovation and work with me on a much later date than I expected. But If you don't have a big job as I do, hire them.  I will never ever get close to an Ikea store yet.

articleTitle: The worst and awful customer service…
articleText: The worst and awful customer service ever!!!! Scheduled to delivery on 1s of October, and they have delivered only two parts of my big list, 8 different furnitures that I ordered. articleTitle: Closed the kitchen at 6:15 with no…
articleText: Closed the kitchen at 6:15 with no warning on website. Turned up at 6:20 with it all closed. Should be more information on when the kitchen actually opens and closes.

articleTitle: This company is a complete mess and...
articleText: This company is a complete mess and chaos. The customer service of Ikea is completely unprepared and not well trained for their jobs. In February I have reported a problem with the PAX wardrobe and I was trying to find a possible solution for myself as compensation. The whole case took 8 months. Ikea is not willing to pick up the phones neither to respond to emails. I literally had to spend hours on my phone to be finally connected with somebody from customer service. Every time when I called and asked about the status of our case I was redirected to different people who had no clue what is it about (although we already had our dossier number). Ikea ignored our emails and eventually just 2 weeks ago somebody offers us a “solution” of bringing PAX wardrobe back to Ikea (at this point I would like to mention that there was a problem with the steadiness, quality and manufacture issues of the PAX), how come could I bring back 5 meters of PAX back in the pieces - here I need to mention that:- in that case we would have to pay ourselves for transport- we wouldn’t get a compensation if the pieces are too damaged (everyone who forks for Ikea or who has PAX knows very well that it’s impossible to dismantle it without making further damage)- we would stay without a wardrobe and probably buy new one because according to Ikea the warranty does not cover up the things we reportedTo sum up, the solution that Ikea proposed was only favorable for Ikea.I never experienced more ignorant approach towards customer.I definitely won’t be a returning customer. This was my last experience with Ikea. Quality is worst and worst from year to year.

articleTitle: I wish I could give a 0 to their worst…
articleText: I wish I could give a 0 to their worst customer service and complaint department. We bought a söderham sofa late 2020 and in July 2021 the sofa just sunk in while sitting. It basically broke.  A guy from ikea came to check and now as per ikea complaint department the report mentions that we self inflicted the sofa. Haha as though we ourselves jumped on the sofa nor do we have kids in the house. How lame and stupid reason for not replacing the sofa nor giving refund. We have had ikea sofa before this for 4 years which was perfectly fine.  I will never buy a sofa from Ikea again. Worst customer service and worst complaint department ever. Ikea has lost 1 customer today. I regret buying other stuff from Ikea. Better buy from ILVA. Atleast there is a guarantee that the sofa will be replaced.

Placed an order in 5/21 to be delivered across the country in July for my daughter's first apartment. I planned the delivery with my flights so I could help her put together the furniture. A day before scheduled delivery, I get a call from the delivery driver that he is at her apartment for delivery. Of course, we are thousands of miles away. I guess they just decided to delivery a day early without confirming? We were lucky that my daughter's building management accepted the delivery for us. When we finally arrived the next day across the country, we noticed that the sofa we ordered was not delivered. After many calls to Ikea they finally delivered that two weeks later, without any sort of notification (the driver actually knocked on my daughter's door at 8am Sunday morning with the sofa unannounced). She obviously had to put the sofa together herself, but it worked out.Two months later, my son moved into his first apartment, also across the country. I was hesitant to order again from Ikea based on the first experience, but decided to try since many furniture manufacturers had long wait times due to Covid. Again, we scheduled the delivery based on my flight for his move in date so I could help him assemble. We got two calls the day before scheduled delivery, and two on the scheduled date saying all was good. We waited all day in anticipation of putting together over $2000 worth of furniture. Then we got an email at 4:30 saying delivery was cancelled since we werent home! Obviously we were waiting all day. I called Ikea..number says to call back another time. Call the delivery company..on hold for 90 minutes to speak to someone, then hung up on when someone answers. Finally get through to someone on facebook messenger and they reschedule delivery for 4 days later, which I was already back home and could not help with assembly. My 23 year old son learned how to deal with (his words) "assembly torture", putting together everything himself while starting a new job in a new city. Two weeks in, still assembling, he realizes the coffee table was never delivered. Now trying to get in touch with someone to help. The aggravation is never ending. Never again with Ikea.

articleTitle: Well gotta say I’m really disappoint

The agent was all but concilient or empathetic and starting talking louder than me. It ended up with me crying out of stress and anger as I felt "attacked" by the agent.I do work as a customer support agent and would never allow myself to give such a bad service and push my customers to break down.While being harsh, your agent provided no excuse nor solution and only suggested that I do everything myself which is definitely not acceptable.I did at the time request the cancellation and refind of the service I paid and never received with confirmation email.At this date I have received no communication following this discussion,I called several times again and messaged on Facebook. articleTitle: Bad delivery and had to call twice to cancel the order
articleText: The delivery company they used, Select Express, twice failed to deliver on the days they said they would. Select Express later called and reported they never received the order from IKEA.Having enough of getting the run-around, I called customer service and cancelled the order, and they were nice and offered a $40 gift card for my troubles. They were friendly, too, so why was this a bad call? Because they NEVER CANCELLED THE ORDER and NEVER REFUNDED THE PURCHASE. I was receiving calls from the delivery company about scheduling delivery a few days later.So I had to call again and wait again just to cancel the order again. The rep was friendly again, and I got emails this time confirming that the order was cancelled, and the refund would be administered within 2 weeks. I'll believe it when I see it.IKEA, your choice in delivery service for the Cincinnati area is awful, and having to call back a second time to cancel an order is unacceptable.

articleTitle: Shipping lies! DO NOT Order ANYTHING online!
articleText: While I love the look of IKEA merchandise, I’m scrapping all plans to purchase anything else from this company! Purchased a bunch of items to attach to my Skadis pegboard (that I had to buy elsewhere for more $$ because IKEA online won’t deliver) I received a thank you email and tracking link with estimated arrival. That day came and went. Finally broke down and started calling CS and had smoke blown up my #%*^ about how FedEx probably hasn’t scanned the parcel, though on their website it states the parcel is still getting ready to ship. Finally after 6 calls, I requested a tracking number.  FedEx states they have received the purchase order but not the package itself.I call the resolutions department and FINALLY someone tells me the truth:This shipping issue has been ongoing with IKEA and management is ignoring internal requests to address the issue!Furthermore, the agent admitted that FedEx has a 3 week backlog on orders from IKEA! I find it hard to blame the carrier because I ordered pretty much everything I needed for my renovation product on the same day and the only item I HAVEN’T received is my parcel from IKEA…4 of the 11 orders have been delivered by FED-freaking-Ex, BUT none of those items were purchased from this useless store! They KNOW that any order will take weeks, not days, and they still send out bs delivery dates and useless tracking links! IKEA needs to shut down their online order branch, address their order fulfillment issues and start talking to the carriers about better delivery options. You know why shipping is so cheap in the US? Probably because they negotiated the lowest tier of delivery service with a single carrier! Why is the customer not given an option for how they want their packages shipped? USPS and UPS should be an option! I send my son a care package in KUWAIT 2 days before I made my IKEA order… he’s received his package! Really IKEA?IKEA is raking in money hand over fist but don’t give half a damned about customer service! There is a store/maze 2.5 hours away and now I regret not taking a day trip to pick up my stuff! There are rumors of them building a warehouse here in Cleveland, I hope not…but if they do, I know of one person who won’t step foot in it! Shame on you IKEA!
