Ikea sells cheap stuff, you get what you pay for, and then their customer service is horrendous and disrespectful. To make someone hold for 45 minutes just to talk to someone is a freakin Crime. I will NEVER buy from Ikea again and if You are wise, NEVER buy from IKEA unless You want to be treated terribly and be insanely disappointed.

Bought my first home and was soooo excited for my Kitchen to arrive from IKEA. Little did I know that half of the kitchen would arrive damaged. 4 months later and the final replacement came, this was after 3 occasions I arranged delivery with them and then they told me they lost it. 4 days booked of work for nothing. The customer support was the worst I have ever known. I have had staff put me on hold and then end the call with no returning of my calls. On a whole they offered me a £150 voucher for the hassle caused - as you can imagine I declined this. If you are ever thinking of buying a kitchen from IKEA, please do yourself a favour and AVOID. The upset and stress is not worth it. Terrible company and do not look after their customers or give you any compensation for their mistakes.

I was waiting all day for my delivery not leaving home to see that my order has been canceled and returned to the store. Who cancelled, why and how only God knows. CS not responding, amazing job Ikea!

Customer service onlineIkea please invest in your online customer service!!!My delivery is missing an item, the delivery man told me ikea would contact me. They haven't and I can't get through to them online. They say on the website to go to the store - but I bought online because I couldn't go to the store. I rang and was on hold for 10 mins, when i was explaining the delivery was missing an item he hung up on me. So how do I contact them?

Hello, I need and hope after this review Ikea takes any action. By the end of August, I made an order at Ikea and scheduled delivery for Sept. 5. The day before the delivery, I didn't get any call to let me know the 4-hour time frame. On Sept. 5, I called Ikea customer service and was informed that my completely order was back up. I cancel the order right after knowing it, and had to run to buy everything I had bought at Ikea. Moreover, I had to pay one more week of hotel thanks to Ikea. I am really disappointed and Ikea lost a customer. Hope Ikea team takes any action to improve their services. The only thing Ikea did well was to give me my money back quickly.
Bought 17 items from their store in Barcelona. They only delivered 14 products and the refuse to refund the 40€ I paid for delivery but only refunded the 3 products

I bought a set of 4 pans in IKEA Glasgow. One of the pans has a broken handle but IKEA tell me they are unable to send a replacement handle by post, and I must return the pans to the store for an exchange. That's a 356 mile round trip from where we live.

Ikea delivered damaged items poorly wrapped that wre broken glass.  They will do NOTHING on line and Customer Service never actually takes your call.. I will stick to Amazon and Instacart in the future.

They delivered 11 other unordered items with my order. OK, mistakes can happen, but actually contacting them is extremely difficult, their website is an arrogantly designed mess, leading you to waste time, go round in circles etc. You can't reply to any email they send you, the telephone number is human-free and can't address problems like the above. I sent my phone number and they tried once to reach me, left no message, and demanded by email another telephone number. Their friendliness is utterly manufactured, cynical and false. A perfect representation of modern business in action.

articleTitle: Avg products with the worst logistic ever for delivering.
articleText: They sell you products that aren't even available, so they'll cancel your orders.

Love love love this place! Love the food and over all the whole experience here in miami I go to the one in Doral and I love it… love the cheap princess they be having sometimes… over all love the place.

articleTitle: I’ve been waiting 7 weeks for a refund
articleText: I’ve been waiting 7 weeks for a refund! Customer service is terrible.

We recently purchased a sizable order online.Immediately received an email confirming the order and our chosen delivery date via email. We were also advised that we would receive a message the day before delivery confirming a delivery timeslot for the day of delivery. This was received.On the day of delivery, we received a further message giving us a 1-hour timeslot.  Attached to this was tracking info that showed us exactly where the van was.The delivery turned up within the timeslot advised. The delivery men were polite and brought the packs into our house without issue. They took pictures to prove they had delivered and left. All items we ordered were delivered.

articleTitle: Cancellations of orders, breaking promises and terrible customer service
articleText: First of all, I order online to pick up the full RÄCKA / HUGAD double curtain rod combination as it was fully on stock and to make sure that all elements are combined, paying the extra price for this collection service. When I go to pick it up at IKEA Barendrecht at the appointed time and I am provided with "all" the elements, I noticed myself that the order was not complete as it was missing the 3 HUGAD (good to mention that as you can imagine these are a key element of this combination). The staff at the pick up point had to check multiple times to confirm me of this issue (because apparently it was out of stock in Barendrecht) and PROMISED me (expected from a proper service) that the missing pieces will be delivered to me free of cost at my place. Later that same day, I receive a cancellation email of these three missing pieces, without even asking me about it. Now you please tell me how am I going to mount the curtain combination without those pieces. To add to this terrible user experience, that same day I check online and those pieces were indeed available at IKEA in Barendrecht and I had to travel yet another time to pick those myself, leading to unnecessary hassle, effort and time.In all honesty I find this whole experience ridiculous and outrageous and I find it unacceptable how I have been treated, the service provided and how this issue has been handled.
It was impossible to put the Malam desk together! The instructions very unclear and hard to follow. it took me an entire day to put one draw together!!!!

Terrible quality, customer service and delivery !!! If you don’t want to have Out of HELL experience go somewhere else ! We are waiting for our kitchen for 1 year !!! Staff is so unhelpful and unprofessional!!! Terrible ! Left handed constructors who on top of everything make a hall in a pipe and didn’t want to fix itpeor empresa, calidad y servicio de empresa nunca !!! ¡NO HAGA SU PEDIDO

articleTitle: expected to drive 3 hr round trip, without preorder facility for large furniture
articleText: Disappointing. Unable to preorder . Next delivery to Perth  4weeks away, 30 Sept.Although they have my items  in store, stock low, unable to reserve or pay over the phone. 3 hour round trip to nearest store .No help from helpline ( appreciate they are only the messengers). Will look for non ikea equivalent in future.

I am writing this review about IKEA in Greece.  I purchased 750 euro order at the Athens Airport Store and was having it delivered to my apartment in Loutraki.  After 5 days I had heard nothing from IKEA or the delivery company.  So I started calling and emailing.  The delivery company apparently would not call my US phone number.  So I called IKEA to get this resolved. I made 8 calls and they said someone would call me back.  Never got a call back.  I email them 5 times and never received a reply.  Thank goodness I had an American friend that spoke Greek that talked to the delivery company.  My stuff had been in the area for 14 days???? I finally got my stuff, I will never buy from Ikea again.  Customer Service ???? none.  I will furnish my new apartment in Greece with a different company.

If i could put 0 stars I would. I’ve ordered from Ikea a total of 3 times now. The first time i ordered from Ikea, i ordered the Full Size Malm Bed Frame with a couple of other things. Well, when the delivery day came, I was told by the delivery men that “it seems we forgot two packages at the warehouse, we’ll be back with it in a few hours. They never came back. The same day i called Ikea customer service & explain to them that i was missing the third package for my bed frame as well as a shelf i ordered. She was very polite, & explained to me that the shelf was out of stock so i’d be refunded for it and that there “wasn’t a 3rd package for the bed frame.” Well a few days later when i go to assemble it I’m missing the middle support beam & the slated bed bases. So the following morning i call Ikea and inform them of this. They gave me a $50 gift card & told me they’d have it to me as soon as possible. Well apparently there’s no rush shipping so it still took nearly 4 weeks; 4 weeks sleeping on the floor.The second time i ordered from Ikea there were no issues, the missing items from my first order came at the same time my second order did.The 3rd and final time i ordered from them was just recently. I ordered the Hovet Mirror, two shelves, & a chair. A few weeks prior from the delivery date i was sent an email that the chair was out of stock and that i’d be refunded for it. The delivery date was set for September 1st. I live in Louisiana, a massive hurricane just hit us so i expected there to be a delay in my items being delivered which i was completely fine with. I got an email September 3rd saying that i’d be refunded my entire purchase because all of the items i ordered were “out of stock.” I was livid. As soon as i read the email i called Ikea and explained to them why i was frustrated since i waited 3 weeks for my items to be delivered & two days after they were supposed to be delivered i got an email saying i’d be refunded. The man i spoke to was very nice & explained why he didn’t understand that i received that email considering everything was in stock. He told me that i could replace my order using a link he sent to my email. They still had my money so i didn’t understand why they couldn’t use the money they already took from my account to put forth on this new order that wouldn’t come till the end of September.I didn’t place the order because i’m convinced Ikea is a scam. I wasn’t given a valid reason as to why my order was cancelled at the very last second, nor was i ever apologized to. When you see others ordering from this company with no issues you wonder “why me?”

After 3 weeks of waiting for the estimated delivery date, which is already a huge timeframe compared to almost every other store (even more so when paying such a huge delivery fee), and having no update, it was clear that our order wasn't going to arrive.I got in touch with Ikea only to find they don't have two of the items in stock. They're only minor items compared to the other stuff, so we're happy to remove and refund them. What we're not happy with is waiting 3 weeks for the delivery date, with absolutely no word from Ikea, to find that this could have been sorted much sooner if they had actually bothered to inform us of the stock issues. I dread to think how much longer we'd have been left waiting if I hadn't gotten in touch with them.At my request, they removed the two out of stock items and rescheduled the delivery, split over 3 different days. What they neglected to mention was that they had removed 2 additional items from the order.Quite frankly terrible service. I certainly won't be ordering from them again.

articleTitle: If I could give Ikea delivery a 0…
articleText: If I could give Ikea delivery a 0 rating I would.  Rescheduled 5 times with no notification of "no delivery" after confirmation email in the morning... wait home all day... no delivery... excuse after excuse.. Lies on top of lies...Worst experience ever

I was expecting a truck delivery from ikea today. The window being 7am to 7pm and as nothing had arrived nor did I receive any email, text or notification, I called to enquire where the delivery was. Only to be told that it got missed in pick up and therefore isn't on its way to me today. I was understanding and asked if it can be prioritised to be delivered tomorrow. I was told that the drivers only come out to the area once a week and therefore I have to wait another week for my order. For starters, the error was made, fair enough but nothing has been done to assure the customer that they are doing what they can to try and rectify the problem, instead I am being told I need to wait. Secondly, a whole week away? Surely with the amount charged for delivery fees, ikea can organise for a special delivery seeing as though the error was on their end. To make matters worse when asking if there is a way I can be notified on the delivery next week, I was told there is no way for me to be notified unless I call (and the wait time to speak to someone isn't a short one) and enquire on the day. The lack of communication and service is pathetic. I am a long time ikea shopper and am waiting on two orders. I assure you, these will be the last orders I will ever place for myself, my family and my friends.

articleTitle: I don’t even know where to start but…
articleText: I don’t even know where to start but this singlehandedly had to be the worst and most frustrating customer experience I have encountered during the pandemic.I wanted to get a shelf for my basement and a monitor stand for my desktop. Since we are still in a pandemic, I was hoping to be able to just pick online and have it delivered but already encountered the first issue there:1.	Online shopping unfriendly inventory management: Depending on what you are trying to order you may be eligible for online delivery or not. In my case the items I picked were only available for physical pickup at a store further away then 2 other Ikea stores. For those not wanting to go into the store physically (still in a pandemic) this led to the next problem:2.	Fee for curbside or locker pickup: I understand having to pay for delivery to my home (which again wasn’t even an option) but having to pay for driving down to a store further away seems weird in this day and age. I decided to opt for the “Locker pickup” option which led to again another problem:3.	Poor to no instructions for locker pickup: Once the order was ready for pickup I received a code to be used at the locker but no further instructions. No instructions can be found on the website either as to where to find those ominous lockers. No problem I though, I will figure it out once there. Guess what, next problem:4.	No instructions or signage for locker pickup on site: Arriving at the Vaughn location in Toronto there is signage to follow to the regular entrance and then there is signage to lead you to “click and collect” at the lower level of the parkade which I now know is the equivalent to curbside pickup (Keep in mind that Ikea locations and their associated parking lots are typically rather large layouts with multilevel parking). The email confirmation for the locker pickup confusingly uses the terminology “click and collect” as well so surely this would be the right way to go. After arriving at the spot and sending a text with my order number I am told after waiting for 15 minutes that I have to pickup my order upstairs at the lockers. Driving back out the parkade and upstairs in front of the store, lockers are nowhere to be seen. I get out of the car ask an employee. They tell me to go inside (Great, still pandemic). I go inside, can’t find anything, ask another employee who tells me they are outside on the other end of the building at the exit. Go figure. Finally, having located the lockers (again no signage there whatsoever even after I knew where to find them) I picked up my order and drove home, just to discover, you guessed it another problem:5.	Misleading product description: Turns out that what I thought where floating shelves are just boards for a shelf, requiring additional brackets to be bough. Upon closer inspection that piece of information is buried in the hidden fine print of the product description. Armed with this knowledge I now am interested in buying a proper floating shelf and returning the two useless boards that are called a shelf. At this point I am very curious about what the next problem may be:6.	Difficult return process: Unlike with other online shopping experience return information for a particular order are hard to find. They are not in the order confirmation email nor in the order summary of the website. You find them separately on the website and then manually add in your specific order information. At this point it would be boring if there weren’t further problems:7.	Returns in person only: Did I mention that we are in a pandemic? Having filled out my online return form it tells me that now I am good to return it in person at any physical store. Excellent, tried to do that today, drove to a closer store this time (Still 40 minutes drive) only to discover the final problem:8.	Returns require appointments or very long wait times: If you didn’t have an appointment for a return the wait time, I am told by an employee is 2 hours. How do you get an appointment you ask? Easy just another form, somewhere on the website, the employee couldn’t really tell me where. 2 forms not easily found to accomplish 1 simple thing.At this point I am beyond frustrated. What I bought isn’t even worth the gas and depreciation of driving to Ikea twice, nor are 2 hours of my live worth it. I secretly hope that somebody in HQ will have a bad tasting meatball for lunch....

articleTitle: The worst customer service and delivery
articleText: Ikeas products are great but their delivery and customer service are a disgrace and yes, I 100% mean a disgrace! We have waited in for 6 failed attempts for a 50cm carcass wardrobe which apparently keeps getting stuck in their system. No one in customer service helps to solve the problem and when you escalate it as a complaint they can't transfer you as they have to email someone. We even spoke to the warehouse yesterday and they said it was on the picking list for today....once again no call or message just another non-delivery for the sixth time. We honestly don't know how to stop this cycle of frustration and nonsense and after 4 weeks still have 3/4 of a wardrobe sitting upstairs. If you are reading this and considering buying something which requires delivery I honestly wouldn't....and never will again.

articleTitle: Hours on the phone only to be hung up on
articleText: The time to speak to anyone is ridiculous. Over an hour on hold with multiple people to get to someone who can possibly fix your issue. I was told I would receive a replacement part within 5-7 business days. On business day 10 I called again and after 48 minutes on the phone was told my case was cancelled and no part was being sent because I did not have my original receipt. This was AFTER being told the part was ordered and on the way to me. I asked to speak with a supervisor and the CSR kept telling me they would tell me the same thing. When I insisted they put me on hold another 20+ minutes telling me no supervisor was currently available and then strangely disconnected after over an hour on the phone. My first phone call was 1 hour and 32 minutes long. Their customer service is a joke. They take no ownership and give no solutions for replacement pieces for their broken parts. I will no longer be purchasing from them and advise you to only buy items you know will never need replacement...unlike the particle board drawer set that I paid way too much for.

articleTitle: IKEA biggest ever missed opportunity to nail delivery in the pandemic
articleText: How can IKEA spend the pandemic making a real hash of simple things like online delivery? They should have been all over this and had the opportunity to really nail this with great warehouse hubs located in ideal regional locations.Instead, deliveries are two weeks or longer (if they actually have the part in stock....anywhere), and then when boxes arrive, they immediately fall apart in the delivery guy's hands, because whoever packed it didn't use enough tape.Shambles.

Really appalling customer service. They don't care about you, or the product, or the service. Can't even send you a barcode that you need for returning their product which doesn't work. I have NEVER seen a more disaffected customer service team in my life

articleTitle: Ugly customer service during pandemia time.
articleText: Yesterday I went to Ikea Montreal since I needed couple of screws to be able to assembly my son’s changing table.  There was a line of about 40 people I had to pass before I was able to tell some one to provide me with 4 screws missing.  That is just ridiculous! We are all dealing with the pandemia and I havent seen a store like that.  They put everyone in a line before they are classified according to their needs.  Very bad management!. Yesterday I felt like I rather buy my stuff somewhere else, so scary to need to reach customer service there.  What was amazingly easy was to go inside and buy something.  All normal!  The message I got between lines was:  We sell you what you need to buy, just dont come back to bother us or we will give you an special treatment :(. I think Customer service management should do much better than that.  What a shame, i used to like Ikea’s products.Before they used to have screws in the liquidation section.  Now even that.  They moved everything to their amazing customer service.  I mean You change to improve, not to make the things even worse for people right?

Terrible Service. I've ordered a table on their website, delivery company came and brought the wrong items. So they took it back and told me someone would reach out to me. They NEVER did, so I call IKEA for a week trying to get a hold of someone, when I finally did, they made me wait 40 min on the phone to finally tell me I was gonna be issued a refund and if I wanted my items again, I would need to replace my order. BUT my money would only be available in 7 to 10 BUSINESS days..... That's why Amazon is dominating, these other business have TERRIBLE service....

articleTitle: WAS WEARY - ANXIOUS FOR NO REASON
articleText: I purchased a foam mattress from IKEA’s website. I didn’t do any research and after is when I began to look up reviews (my brain is backwards, we get it). I got myself so worked up reading review after review of horrible experiences; people claiming that they never received their item, it never even went out for delivery, the wrong product came, etc. I was actually debating on cancelling and contacting customer service before I even gave them a chance, and to just take my money elsewhere and invest in another company, even if the prices could be a bit more expensive.I got a call two days prior to my delivery date stating that my mattress was shipped and being brought to a closer facility, and was told that it was going to be delivered on Sep. 1st. The next day, the day before my delivery, I got the same call, but this time it notified me of a time frame, which was that the mattress would be delivered anywhere from 11am-3pm. Today, I got the call from a delivery driver at about noon stating that they were roughly five minutes away. Sure enough, they were! Smooth, perfect delivery. They placed the mattress in my garage where I told them and that was that. And my mattress is comfortable (although it still needs time to fluff up all the way)!

articleTitle: I bought slats for my king size bed and…
articleText: I bought slats for my king size bed and was told it would be ready in 4 days to pick up at a fedex location. I get there and it wasn’t even shipped there yet. Then after more than 10 days of waiting I wasn’t advised I needed the center piece that comes separate in order to make it work. I had spoken with two different agents and no one advised of this. When I called the piece that comes separate costs $15 and would cost to ship. I decided it was too much after it all so decided to return the slats. They advised I’d have to take it back to a store now. My main reason for having it shipped is bc I’m no where near an IKEA.  Now I have to travel far in order to return bc they don’t provide returns shipping. Terrible customer service.

articleTitle: IKEA delivery/logistics in UK are very poor, beware before you order.
articleText: Our furniture for the new flat was supposed to arrive today. IKEA was supposed to SMS me with the delivery slot 1-2 days prior to delivery. I got suspicious as this never happened. When I checked my order tracking online, it said "Waiting to be picked". When I checked what this meant, I saw that it meant the items needed to be picked up from a warehouse. At that moment I realized that there was an issue so I called them to learn that the delivery will not happen today and the next slot they can book for me is 28 days later, which is not only very late but also coincided with travel for me. So in the end I had to cancel the order and ask for a refund. Very disappointed with IKEA regarding this. They could at least notify me that there is a delay with my shipment which they did not. Poor logistics, poor communication, poor customer care.

articleTitle: If I could give 1/2 of star I would
articleText: If I could give 1/2 of star I would.  First and last time I will use IKEA for work.  I manage trade shows and events and we came up with cool idea for a booth and found a lot of cool ideas from IKEA so we were excited.  I placed the order and had a hard time because it would not let me input the full address so I had to call and do it over the phone (more time consuming).  Finally got the order placed.I days later get a text that they tried to deliver my order to the warehouse but couldn't please call.  I called and was told it wasn't open when they tried to deliver it.  Note that I told the rep that this was a warehouse it had to deliver during business hours and repeated this several times while on the phone.  They tried to deliver at 9PM  So went through everything again and the IKEA rep put me on hold to reach out to company they contracted to get this set up to deliver following day.  I was on hold forever and got disconnected.  Rep called me and left a message that it could deliver the next day to call her back.  I call her back and no one can get me connected with Jackie.  I said get a message to her that delivery next day was good and thank her.  Fast forward to today I realize I never got confirmation of delivery.  Call IKEA and it was never delivered and never attempted.  So did not make it in time for our show.  Yet no one bothered to call me at all or reach out.I asked for an explnation and the have no notes nothing from Jackie in the system she did not put anything in there from the day we spoke.  WHAT????? So ask them to do the "RIGHT" thing and I would now like for it to be shipped to my warehouse where I store our booth properties.  NOPE they told me I had to cancel the order and reorder.  I asked what they were going to do to help me since it was IKEA in the wrong....they literally told me NOTHING.  We can cancel the order.This company is not customer focused and really does not care about building a good relationship with its customers.Will NEVER do business with them and would caution you to shop and work with a company that respects its customers

articleTitle: Their site shows IKEA is a cheap…
articleText: Their site shows IKEA is a cheap company stuck in the 90s.Available in store, available for delivery, but when checking out nothing is available. Also, slow site, buggy, signed out all the time. Btw, there is no room planner. What?!

Rescheduled a delivery, the new delivery date was confirmed by a customer sales rep, and then they cancelled the order instead of delivering it on the date they confirmed they would send it. I called to have it reinstated and they said there was nothing they could do, I just needed to reorder again. What a BIG waste of my time!!

articleTitle: Why you should not buy a kitchen with IKEA
articleText: The customer service of IKEA is terrible. Every time you call, you reach a different person. You can never speak to anyone who takes responsibility. Even when customer service say they will call back, they do not. So you feel powerless. Our problem: IKEA was supposed to deliver our customized kitchen worktop this August (as part of an IKEA kitchen we had already had installed) but we still haven't received it! The worktop weighs 160 KGs and is 3 meters long. IKEA should have realized that this worktop could not be delivered to 3rd floor apartment. It was too heavy and too long. The delivery guys tried twice, second time with a lift but gave up. It was unrealistic from the start. Now IKEA wants us to organize a crane and pay for it. So we have to coordinate it and then contact IKEA about when we have it ready. So IKEA push all responsibility on customer when things go wrong. They say, they can deliver, but in reality you are on your own. No help, no empathy, no service. That is IKEA!
Shocking Customer Support.Lack of respect and completely useless.

articleTitle: Like throwing money into a black hole
articleText: When we moved to another state a month and a half ago our first stop was Ikea. We thought it would be easy and it has been awful. Everything we needed then was out of stock so we thought "no problem! we'll just order online."We ordered plates and bowls and almost all of it arrived shattered due to awful packaging on Ikea's end. We've been trying to deal with Ikea's customer service for weeks and have no luck at all. We spent hours on the phone and days on their chat trying to get someone to replace our order or issue a refund. They said in 2 weeks they will contact us again for our... case number!! The average company auto-generates case numbers. How on earth does it take this long?It's been much longer than 2 weeks and we've received no replacement items, no contact from Ikea, and of course no refund.We tried our luck at the store again and still, nothingggg is in stock. It's honestly unbelievable. And I am really afraid to drop a bunch of money via their website again because I don't trust them. I'm understanding that things might take time because of covid or whatever but this company is very unprofessional. The bare minimum is that you at least refund or replace the broken items.

Visited the Milton Keynes store yesterday what an awful experience. The IKEA website states on their Covid 19 guidance:Everyone’s health and wellbeing is our top priority, so we ask that you continue to follow the Government guidance in your local area and follow these simple rules: wear a face covering, use hand sanitiser and keep a safe distance from each other.Well we arrived at lunchtime and headed to the cafe for a sandwich, due to the layout they have with single queues snaking back on itself it it impossible to have any social distancing with other customers. We onyl wanted a sandwich and to be able to get on with our shopping we had to queue for 30 min with everyone else just to get a sandwich. The uptake of masks by IKEA employees was about 1/3 for the staff we saw around the store how surely they should be leading by example to the customers. The hand sanitiser by the toilets was empty which is next to some screens with an instruction to sanitise your hands before using them. Just an awful experience all round we will not be returning to IKEA any time soon if at all. If I could give no stars I would!

articleTitle: Stuff is always out of stock without…
articleText: Stuff is always out of stock without indicating future stock.

articleTitle: Do not ever deal with this dodgy…
articleText: Do not ever deal with this dodgy companyI have never ever had such an experience with any other companies like thisNo common sense no customer service no responsibility whatsoeverI received 2 text messages on the delivery date waiting on the arrival. It never arrived. When I called and stayed on the line for 52 minutes I was told that it was never booked for delivery on that day. The person who picked the phone up was not sorry at all and kept telling me that she was not responsible as if it’s her own company.I received some refund with no explanation and when I asked for the details, I was told that the frame for the sofa was not available and they canceled part of it without notifying me. So they were going to send me part of the sofa with no frame. They deserve zero stars.

articleTitle: I really like the design of your…
articleText: I really like the design of your furniture. But your delivery is awful. The time of arrival of the goods to my home is different from the promised time.

articleTitle: Ikea has a horrible process for orders
articleText: Ikea has a horrible process for orders.  I ordered a closet system months ago and they canceled my order days before delivery saying the items weren't in stock.  What!!  How could you not know the items weren't in stock when I first ordered and if they were at that time my order should have been put to the side until delivery.  I could have chosen to go with another company at that time.  Now I will have to wait months for any other company closet system.  Waste of my time!! Im now looking at at least half a year with  no closet system.  Ikea needs to update how they complete orders and take everything off their website that they do not have!
IKEA rubbish system emails tells you it’s in stock you go to store find it’s not and told by employee not to take notice of the email in stock notificationsWhat is the point

articleTitle: Still waiting for a draw after months…
articleText: Still waiting for a draw after months of Trying to sort out still no draw I spent nearly for grand for a poor quality kitchen witch is still missing a draw and trying to get hold off customer service is impossible and most off them just give you false promises I've called 25 times and still they carnt to sort it out  case reference is 3827901 will be going to a store and taking what I'm owed soon . Don't buy a kitchen it's not worth the hassle

articleTitle: Not recommended for Kitchen design Ireland
articleText: Second time around buying ikea kitchen, first time was great this time the whole process seemed amateur, with poor communication and rushed on designing, time restriction means two appointments were needed on a kitchen that was mostly designed already.  Designer will go off on there own and design the kitchen meaning there is little communication about what you need and want, in the end a cupboard was missed, and instead of it being replaced quickly another appointment needed to be scheduled.  This doesn't feel like a kitchen design service anymore, I wouldn't recommend or use them again.

articleTitle: Should be able to select 0 stars
articleText: Should be able to select 0 stars. They have the absolute worst customer service. No one is helpful AT ALL and they’ve all been very rude. It’s almost as if they are taught to be this bad. Shame on you IKEA. I am 7 weeks into an order that had an estimated delivery date 22 days ago at the time of this review. I just contacted them for 7th time and this time they told me “that just an estimate”. I ordered a single floating shelf that was supposed to be mailed. What could possibly take 7 weeks to ship? Why? I’ve finally cancelled my order (I was trying to be patient since I was replacing a damaged shelf and needed it to match). This company is a joke.

articleTitle: Newer seen shop that doesn't have…
articleText: Newer seen shop that doesn't have anything in stores. Trying to buy one thing not there trying to buy another not there. So what is there?

Ikea worst customer service rubish website rubish customer service worst I've ever experienced, says it's in stock get to Tottenham all the way travelled from Hertfordshire to tell me it is not in stock. why should they get away with this. I've also ordered 14 other items and they charge £50 for delivery, robbery comes to mind, then my delivery is being delivered in two parts on 2 separate days one day apart from each other. why wouldn'tthey think about saving the environment.

articleTitle: Poor customer service at IKEA of College…
articleText: This review is for IKEA at College Park, Maryland.We made 3 orders, got 2 delivered but not the 3rd one which was supposed to be delivered on last week 8/15/2021 (today is 8/23/2021). Nobody gave us any update about it before I called and waited 30 min and talked to 3 customer service reps. I was told:* Some items are out of stock. Ikea didn't know when would be in stock.* i'd have to call ikea everyday to check & request to put items aside for the order if an item is available. Ikea will not do it. Again, everytime i made a call, had to wait at least 30min before able to talk to a rep, and then transferred 2 more times (10 minutes waiting the between).I asked if I can return all items in previous orders because some components are in the 3rd order, and without the 3rd order those items are incomplete to use. I was told I can return, but ikea won't come to pick up due to pandemic and I'd have to transport items to the store by myself. I paid for delivery because I don't have a truck, so how can I carry the items back? They don't care.This whole thing is so weird and doesn't make sense to me at all. Why wouldn't the store check the order and put the items aside whenever available in the store to make it ready for delivery? How can ikea ask customers to check and call them to notify to make the order complete? i paid $40 for them to get the items from the isles; so they won't do it until i call and tell them to do so?

articleTitle: Would give 0 stars if I could
articleText: Would give 0 stars if I could! Placed order for kitchen cabinets, countertops, sink, etc. Today they were supposed to deliver the order. They did not deliver 11 items - including the base cabinets. When we called, they just refunded what was not delivered and told us to return the items we received to the store within 365 days for a refund. No other options or anything. Had they let us know in advance we would have canceled. DO NOT ORDER FROM THEM!!!!
Cancelled my order one day b4 the delivery, called me to re-order and then cancelled again. Terrible. No customer service.

articleTitle: Still waiting on my delivery  2 weeks…
articleText: Still waiting on my delivery  2 weeks after it was suppose to arrive. no correspondence from ikea and very difficult to contact them. The tracking system does not work. I also experienced problems in store when collecting as the system is really inefficient.

Do not ever buy something on line to pick up at IKEA- Click and Collect. They give you a certain time you have to show up to pick up your item. I have been waiting in my car (with the AC full blast because it is so hot) for 45 minutes and I am still the 5th in line. This has got to be the worst system ever for picking up a purchase. Forty years ago, Sears had a better system than this store. Figure it out IKEA!

articleTitle: IKEA block mobile phone coverage in stores
articleText: Do you use mobile phone signal blockers around checkout and self service collection areas, as out of the 8 stores I have visited in both the UK and Singapore, there is no mobile phone reception around these areas?I suspect you do this to prevent customers from accessing online IKEA services, such as checking product availability, signing up for IKEA Family membership to obtain a warranty or checking terms of services, or comparing with other furniture suppliers. Maybe you also want to make sure your staff aren't using mobile phones during working hours?Or is this just due to the stores construction. It would not be expensive for you to install signal boosters throughout stores.

articleTitle: WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE I HAVE EVER…
articleText: WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE I HAVE EVER EXPERIENCE!!!!after more than a month I did not receive the order. Phoned them and wait for half an hour. Only to hear that they were going to maybe deliver 10% of what I ordered. No previous communication at all.I cancelled and refund in 14 days.NEVER AGAIN!!!! Please AVOID!

articleTitle: the worst customer care I have ever…
articleText: the worst customer care I have ever recieved.

Worst company ever! hotline is awful chat is not working and if you get throug they promise you something the never fulfilljust to get rid of you!!never buy ikea aggain!!  i can only recomend to avoid buying therefor anybody.I bought a pax and parts of it were delivered broken. until now they promised me 4 times to call me back - 3 delivery dates from 08-14:00 where the never showed up or called to cancel. everytime i call the hotline i have to wait at least 40 minutes. I can not imagine how treating customers like this can be legal. i will spend al the time waiting in the hotline to get my money back training my writing skills and warn other people to decide carefully if and what to buy of ikea.

articleTitle: First time having to write a review:/
articleText: I literally bought three different sets of furnitures today at IKEA and it’s my first time shopping there but, I wished I had ordered them on Wayfair or maybe a different furniture store. So, after unpacking the furnitures, I was expecting each piece to be lettered or numbered but none was! Secondly , packaging is too hard to open and I also got my hands bruised several times just trying to take out these furnitures from the boxes. Another problem I had is one of the furnitures never came with the instruction paper. IKEA, how do you expect me to build a furniture without its instructions?! The furnitures are cute and nice though. That I like! But with lack of proper instructions and labeling, I almost spoiled the furnitures today. And I noticed on one of the instruction paper that came with its furniture shows that it’d be preferable to call IKEA for assistance over the phone, that’s great but I doubt it’d change anything.With this awful experience I’ve had shopping from IKEA for the first time, I don’t think it’s worth going back there.

articleTitle: Ordered a kitchen three months ago…
articleText: Ordered a kitchen three months ago. Still some parts missing I cannot start assembling. I get depression and they cannot estimate when the parts will be available again. I hate IKEA right now. They just say you will be called when the parts are available. They are not honest, they told me before it was there, but it was not. I feel like they will tell me one day that the things will not arrive when it’s too late to give everything back.
Not too bad, Often buy from Ikea. worth for the price

When visiting the Suzhou China branch of IKEA yesterday, I ordered a Cappuccino as I did lot times before. But this time the taste was awful. Something between paper and sludge. Finally I found out that IKEA is not using milk for making Cappuccino, but some kind of cornwater. How can they call it ongoing Cappuccino. This is not even a fake, it is a pure crime.

articleTitle: IKEA NOT GOING BACK TILL COVID GONE
articleText: just nowNEWWent here today expecting to buy some flat pack furniture. Terrible the way we were herded in thanks to Covid after 30 min delay in queue. Basically no time to stop and browse the rooms etc or buy anything. 30 mins and were out. Restaurants were full wont be going back till Covid gone.

articleTitle: Beware, IKEA says it shipped, FedEx says it didn't
articleText: Beware, something is wrong with IKEA's order process. Twice this year I have placed substantial orders that never actually ship. I carefully selected only items that show as being in stock. IKEA processed my orders and quickly sent a shipping confirmation at which point they charged my credit card. But when I click on the FedEx tracking number FedEx says that the number has been generated but that the order has not been received by FedEx yet. Then the wait begins. Months later I get an email saying my order has been delivered, but it hasn't. When I check with FedEx they say they never received the order from IKEA and confirm that no delivery was made. When I check with IKEA, (which is a very time-consuming process involving talking to multiple departments) I am told that indeed nothing has shipped and they do not know what is going on so they cancel the order and refund my money. Great, I have my money back but I'd really rather have gotten what I ordered or been told they can't process my order so I could go buy it someplace else without waiting months, tying up my money and wasting a lot of my time :(  PS I have all this documented if anybody from IKEA is interested and would like to review it.

Worst company ever! I installed the PAX closet system months ago and have been unable to complete it because the drawers I need are not in stock... for months. I was issued a $60 gift card for the trouble BUT  a week later, when I had not received the gift card, I called and sat on hold for 45 mins only to be told that it hadnt funded. A week after that, I called and sat on hold for 45 mins again and was told that it funded the day of my last call and would not be available to me for another potentially 14 days. Who the hell issues a gift card for inconvenience and then makes it EXTREMELY inconvenient to even get!??? Here is the kicker, the drawers I need might actually be in stock for me to purchase tomorrow at my local store...maybe but I wont be able to use my gift card! I am furious and will NEVER buy anything from IKEA ever again. This is literally the WORST customer service I have ever experienced.

Placed a large order of shelves.  Waited 3 months for the products.  Then the delivery company picked them up at IKEA and has a robot call me to tell me what 4 hour window the following day they will deliver.  There is no way to tell the robot or a human you will not be home at that time ON A SUNDAY.  So, the truck driver calls you from your door when you don't answer, but cannot reschedule.  IKEA then calls to reschedule, but again, can't tell you when the delivery will be, starting the entire ridiculous process all over again.  Astounding how amazingly stupid and useless this delivery process and coordination is in the era of Amazon!Oh yeah . . to add even more frustration, every call I've made to IKEA has been OVER AN HOUR on hold mostly.  The delivery company is called "NAL Group" . . they NEVER ANSWER and their website is useless!

articleTitle: I Regret buying bed from Ikea
articleText: I got Malm superking brd from Ikea in 2019 with lonset which makes it £310 for the bed and i am extremely dissatisfied with it. It is the most noisy bed i have ever seen. It My 2 year old likes to sleep with me in our bed and my little one wakes up everytime i even try to turn or move my hands it is badly squeaks and sways, its a nightmare. If my husband moves it trembles as if there is an earthquake. Sleeping on it is a terrible experience. I wish i have never purchased a bed from Ikea.

Terrible when ordering online. Bought a mirror - was smashed to pieces. Called for a new delivery date which was almost a week later. Told me to dispose of the old broken mirror myself - it's a huge mirror which won't go in the bin so I guess I'll have to take a trip to the tip. Or perhaps I should just drop it at the nearest IKEA.

articleTitle: Awful service when things go wrong
articleText: Awful service. They know they are cheap so people will go back and order from there again but they don’t care about their clients. I had an awful experience with my bed delivery - they delivered it without the bed frame. I also had pots in my order, which were delivered broken. Mistakes happen so i called them to let them know. They promised a delivery date, which I changed all my plans for but no one came. No one apologised for the inconvenience, their website says wrong opening times for their customer service,  I’ve had to call them 4 times to get this sorted and wait 20 mins minimum on the phone each time and have had to sleep on a tiny couch for almost 2 weeks and the most they could offer was a £30 voucher. I don’t want to buy anything from them again so I wanted to speak to a manager but I couldn’t because they considered the issue resolved even though i didn’t. Client experience is what helps you grow so please consider it when training your staff!

Horrible customer service and unwilling to budge. I bought a countertop that needed edging strips when we cut it into the shape we needed. The packaging A. Didn’t even come with the pieces as they were missing from the box. And B. When I let them know I needed more they wouldn’t give me the pieces. They are the only ones who carry this Karlby countertop. They manufacture this product and I can’t find it anywhere else but they refuse to give me 2 more strips because “there were only two included”? Never again. Send me my pieces as I now have just particle board exposed on the sides!

Extremely poor customer service and they are basically thieves. Drove 7 hours, only 1 piece of furniture out of 6 I planned to buy was in stock (said all were in stock on the website). Left, disappointed, but ok. The next day as I’m putting it together, 2 of the 4 hinges are missing. Then they gave me two left sides, no right side. So basically missing one ENTIRE side of a large piece of furniture. Customer service refuses to send a replacement, says my ONLY option is to drive all the way back and retrieve the pieces or return the whole thing (literally 100’s of pieces big and small, all unboxed). Refused to let me talk to another representative, refused to have item picked up. So I paid $300 for a pile of garbage because of a major, world renowned company refused to do the right thing tans correct THEIR mistake. Will never spend a single cent there again, nor will anyone I know. Absolutely abhorrent, have literally never had a worse experience with a major company.

articleTitle: Stock and delivery issues with multiple orders
articleText: Online shopping: Ikea sells products that are not available in stock, without informing customers.I had issues with the last four purchase I made, in which a lot of items were delivered a month later than the planned delivery date (which was already many weeks ahead the date of purchase).The website / app have different information about order status. Every single time I have to call Customer Service, staying on hold for around 20min before I'm able to reach a human, to inform something that could be already listed on the website

articleTitle: In 25 Years they’ve never figured out how to keep items in stock.
articleText: I’ve been there dozens of times over the years and there hasn’t been one time 75% of what I wanted wasn’t in stock. In store staff is totally unhelpful and says try online. For whatever reason it’s not available for deliver either. The customers don’t mean s#%t to this companyI guess I’ll have to spend my money at Amazon

I wish I could give Ikea 0 stars. I have never in my life had such a difficult time with them, but this will be the last time I ever purchase anything from them. I moved across the country, therefore, needed new furniture. I tried to order from Ikea. Everyday something would be out of stock. It would say it was in stock in my nearest store, but not in stock for delivery. It made no sense. Fast forward to 10 days ago, I am able to place my order (a desk chair, a bed, and a desk). I am forced to pay $200 for delivery. Whether this was for distance or not, I do not know, but they did not deserve $200. One of my boxes came wet, damaged, and half open. I put together the entire bed. I realize I am missing the wooden slats that are meant to support the mattress. I cannot use the bed. I go to put the chair together. I am missing THE ACTUAL SEAT OF THE CHAIR. THE USABLE PART OF THE CHAIR. I am furious. I call customer service. The woman says these items are on back order (I never got an email saying these items are on back order, she said there is no automated system to inform customers of such news). I will have to wait for another email to reschedule delivery. There is nothing she can do. She tells me the items will be back in stock on Wednesday (4 days after my requested, $200 delivery date). I call Tuesday to follow up. Somehow, this person knows even less than the previous person. Again, I am told there is nothing she can do. She doesn't know when the items are coming back in stock. All I have to do is wait and hope that I get an email to reschedule delivery. I check the website. The items are in stock in my nearest store (140 miles away, I have no car, hence why I paid for delivery). She says "oh, that's the stock for our store. Our online warehouse is different." Makes sense? Wednesday comes. I call again. This time, a more competent person answers the phone. She asks if I have a case number and if I made sure to call within the 48 reporting period for missing delivery items. I have called customer service 3 times now and was never told about either of these things. This woman creates a case number for me. She again cannot tell me when the items will be back in stock or when I can expect to have them. She says it's written somewhere on the website (I have yet to find it) that the delivery dates aren't guaranteed. Even though, you pay an obscene amount for delivery, they cannot even ensure you will have all your items on the day you choose. She says she tagged my case with "high priority" and someone will call within 24 hours. All three times, I asked for a refund considering I did not get what I paid for. I was told the only compensation they could provide would be store credit. As if after all this, I would shop there again. Today, no one called within the 24 hour period. I call again. I am told that yesterday's customer service agent refunded me for the two missing items. I said that I never asked to be refunded. Once I was told I could not be, I said never mind. I want/need the items. The lady says they are out of stock and they will be until September 11th although she sounds incredibly uncertain of this. There is nothing she can do, so I hang up. I was forced to buy the bed slats from Amazon for $80. That is $50 more than on Ikea's site. I called customer service 5 times, and no one was willing or able to remedy my situation or provide customer service. I am a student who just moved to a new state. I have been sleeping on the floor for a week and will probably do so for another week. Good customer service would have been having someone deliver my items from my closest store. Good customer service would have been informing me that the items were on back order, that I might not receive what I ordered, or informing me that I am being refunded and my order is being canceled. Good customer service would have been NOT SELLING THE ITEMS IF THEY DO NOT EXIST. IF SUPPLY CANNOT MEET DEMAND, DO NOT TRICK YOUR CUSTOMERS INTO THINKING THEY WILL HAVE YOUR ITEMS ON A CERTAIN DAY. To top it all off, I am unable to leave a review on Ikea's website as there is no option to do so. When contacting their agents via live chat, the agent left the chat after I said I was unable to leave a review. I am absolutely appalled that Ikea, a global brand, would treat their customers so poorly, would hire such clueless customer service reps, and would do absolutely nothing to fix this problem. I will never shop there again, and I will ensure no one I know does either.

Order cabinets & table 6 weeks ago. Delivery due 4 weeks later. Got a message saying delivery would be delayed. Because of COVID thought okay. Sent an email to their customer service a week later to enquire about delivery. No answer. Following week checked track order, only find out they cancelled my order and indicate they issued a refund. I didn't cancel the order. AND I did not get a refund!!!!!!  I am absolutely appalled that an major retailer has done this.

articleTitle: Great response from complaints department.  I’ve just used truspilot to complain…
articleText: I’ve just used truspilot to complain about a service from LV car insurance.  It reminded me of how well I was treated a couple of months ago by IKEA.  I’d come home with a damaged item, two instead of one of another item and charged twice for an item I’d only bought one of.  I wrote to them (with photos and of receipts).  I got back a very well expressed apology and money back.  It was extremely impressive as so often IKEA is complained about for a variety of issues.  I like the store very much but have had reservations on occasions - usually because I’m so tired by the time I’ve got round it - but I have to say that in this instance their customer service was second to none. So, well  done the complaints department at IKEA!  LV car  insurance could learn a lot from you!

articleTitle: Poor Customer support, poor online shopping
articleText: Customer support can not do anything, only cancel order. I wanted to sign up for email and phone notifications for a product 3 times, got 0 notifications.  Impossible to place order and then track it. waste of time. takes 3 weeks to pack up order for pickup. no inventory. i was a big fan of ikea, not anymore. shop somewhere else.

articleTitle: Poor Inventory Management, Impossible to Order Online!
articleText: Very poor inventory management. Items go out of stock at a very quick rate. There's more demand than supply, yet IKEA refuses to increase their supply for consumers.Placing an order online is a nightmare because items are always out of stock.IKEA should learn a thing or two from other online retailers. They're losing profit by failing to have stock available for sale.Yes, they have email/SNS restock notifications. But they aren't worth signing up for because when I go to order online, it goes out of stock (within minutes)!It's a waste of time to keep checking back for stock or making the drive out there.IKEA's catalog looks nice though. Just wish we could actually buy something on it lol..
