articleTitle: This lady was working for delivery
articleText: This lady was working for delivery - I called her and all she said is I don’t know how they deliver, when or why there are so many items. Didn’t apologize, got mad that I asked her so you can’t help me ? She shouldn’t be working in a field she knows nothing about. my delivery is supposed to come on the 20 and they changed the times to tomorrow (the 12) and all she said was I don’t know. Why do you work at ikea for delivery then ?!?

Very few items are eligible for shipping. When I was able to find 2 items that could ship, I tried to log in to the membership program 5 times to checkout, each time I was sent back to square one and couldn’t log in. Gave up on logging in, hoping to just check out. Was never able to because it would crash before processing order. Rarely, if ever, have I had an online shopping experience this bad.

articleTitle: Good furniture for a great price
articleText: Good furniture for a great price! I really recommend it!

articleTitle: Delivery service is bad, customer service is worse
articleText: I ordered a Friheten sectional with the room-of-choice-delivery because I do not have a car where I live.  The delivery service delivered the boxes quickly and efficiently, in and out in under a couple minutes.  After they left, I realized a box was damaged, the particle board on the inside was clearly busted without having to open the box.  I am quite confident they were aware of the damage because of how the boxes were positioned (They also had to navigate an elevator and hallway, so plenty of opportunities to see the damage).I contacted customer service, and after being on hold for 30 minutes, I was told the item was not in stock for delivery and could not be replaced.  There was no way to pre-order it, no way for them to call me back, etc.  My only options were to call back every day (and they have long hold times) to try to get a replacement or they could offer me a refund.  I went the refund route, and they said they would be in contact regarding a pickup.  It should have been a red flag that they couldn't schedule that on the initial call.Days go by, still no response from them, so I call again, and they are going to escalate the call. Due to the price, they cannot offer a refund until they have received the item back.  Keep in mind I have large sectional size boxes that are taking up apartment space.A week goes by, still no response.  I notice that the product is back in stock, so I call again to see what my options are for a replacement instead.  I am told I will need to purchase this out of pocket because they have to have the original box back.  They cannot pick up the box when they deliver the new one either.  I am also told that they are unable to do pickups at this time, but if I hold on to it for "a few months", they should be able to pick it up and refund me at that time.Ultimately I borrowed a car after 5 weeks, and spent the several hours returning the box.  Because the Ikea was in a different state, I also got back less sales tax on the refund.  They would not refund the delivery fee as promised on the phone calls because there were a couple of other small items on the initial order.  On top of that the replacement was still a little damaged, but not worth the hassle (which I believe is their goal in customer service).A few takeaways for me:1 - I was promised a call back after every call made, but have not received a single one.2 - Every Ikea customer service reps had a different interpretation of the situation.  For a company this well thought out and efficient, I have to assume that it is their goal to be as unhelpful as possible so that people give up on getting their refunds.3 - The reviews on their site are curated.  I usually receive an email to leave a review after a purchase, but when I had a problematic order, that email was conveniently not sent out.  I am seeing other recent reviews for this item though.  Maybe it is a coincidence, but I no longer trust them as a company.4 - Between calls, having to borrow a vehicle and return it on my own (while also still being out the cost of shipping and some sales tax) I have spent at least 8 hours dealing with them, still have a slightly damaged sectional, and an intense anger towards them as a company.

Visited IKEA Ballymun yesterday. Selected my items with the help of the wonderful Fiona in Children’s. Was offered delivery - which I took. 9am this morning all 12 packages have arrived. The delivery personnel were courteous and efficient and adhered to the company’s social distancing delivery promise. All round excellent service!

Poor customer service!I purchased a couch online and wanted delivery for a set day and organised this online.I hadn't received an update so I rang the customer service centre who said and I quote"Geez it's only 10am in the morning.  You will have to have more patience"Then promptly hung up. Incredible!IKEA, if you respect your customers you should train your employees because they reflect the true culture of your business.

As usual our two settees were delivered and one had parts missing (special bolts for assembly).Impossible to contact them by phone.So I drove a round trip of 50km to the IKEA store to retrieve the missing parts. Then I was told that the parts were “out of stock” and would have to be ordered. No apology was offered, and I got the impression that the customer service staff believed that this was normal.IKEA unfortunately have no comparable competition, but if they did, I wouldn’t go anywhere near them. They are inefficient, arrogant and complacent.

articleTitle: We did not receive our delivery
articleText: We did not receive our delivery, when promised, after taking the day off work and waiting around all day for it. When I called, I was told that the delivery company never received the merchandise form Ikea. After many calls, on my end with no follow up on Ikea's end, we found out that the deliver company did in fact have the merchandise the entire time. Even thought it was their error, they rescheduled a new delivery 3 more days out and then didn't show up for a 2nd time. When I called, they had no answers for me as to why both deliveries didn't show up, I will never order from Ikea again. This is a terrible company and they have a terrible delivery company.

The worst customer service experience ever!!! I spent almost 2 hours between people that have no idea what they are doing to add one item “available” in the Coquitlam location in to my order for home delivery and at the end they asked for 2 separate shipping fees because one comes from store and the other from distribution center. I returned more than two thousand dollars and walked out not because of the extra $70 just because they were confused and honestly rude. No one even said sorry for what they did. I never go there again.

articleTitle: We bought a beautiful sage green corner…
articleText: We bought a beautiful sage green corner settee.Happy but 2 days later the seams on 2 back cushions gave way.Went to customer service with the cushion covers.Seen by the operative but no solution.Apparently it has been discontinued so solution was take ALL the material covers off and they would give me a different colour of my choice.Not a solution as we bought it for the colour and we removed our old settee.We said there was a display on the shop floor ,same colour so we would take 2 of their cushion covers but no we could not do that.She could not contact uostairs so gave us a case no:.They would contact us in 48 hours.A week later no contact,they tried to phone Wembley but no answer so I was told to try later.Another week I telephoned and once again there was no answer from Wembley and I was told to dismantle the settee and they would collect and give me a refund!!So I would be left with no settee and have to do all this work for them .Where is the customer service.Why do they not think outside of the box.No solution so still on limbo and have to phone next week again.I love this settee and want to keep it !!!!

The reason IKEA Canada is getting one star is that a) I can't rank them lower and b) their freezing bags are durable and close well. Too bad their furniture doesn't meet the expectations any longer (fair price for fair quality).I bought two PAX wardrobes with sliding doors. Not only did IKEA not have all of the items ready for delivery at the time of order (bought online and paid for delivery in May 2021), but for the missing pieces, I had to place a separate order and go to the other side of the town to pick them up (why their ERP system doesn't create a back-order immediately and IKEA takes responsibility for delivery is beyond my ability to comprehend).Had I known that the side panels would come already scratched (they don't even recommend the touch up-paint for a given market), that the screws would be missing (who's gonna line-up in a hardly moving line-up for 4 screws?!) and above all, that some of the hardware would come loosely assembled (and of course, something like that we didn't notice until it was too late), I would have never bought these. I certainly overpaid for both the quality and experience.On the same token, I'm glad I had this experience now, prior to buying 2 sets of kitchen cabinets and other bedroom & office furniture. I have a feeling (corporate) Ikea doesn't care any longer about repeat business - I am surely taking mine elsewhere.

articleTitle: Abysmal Delivery, came day early when out
articleText: When is a contract not a contract when it’s IKEA - Arranged / Paid for a delivery on Monday 9th August, what happens we get a call from delivery man saying they are outside our empty house on Sunday 8th August thus we have to come home from a family party to bring the large package in from the torrential rain.  Absolutely abysmal organising on their behalf. £15 Wasted 😡

articleTitle: spend hours then no stock or options. Jokers
articleText: Spent hours building a kitchen on their tool, then built an order for thousands of euro and only when we went to checkout did it say 95% of what we needed wasn’t available for delivery or at the store near us, and despite seemingly available at a store much further away, we couldn’t book a slot; no reason. What a waste of time.
Horrible customer service, that declines the return policy and makes a mockery of their loyal clients. I will never support this business again.

articleTitle: We bought s couch from them and wanted…
articleText: We bought s couch from them and wanted to give it back and the customer service people knew the couch is bad and they said they have been pulling it out of the market. And they promised to pick it up. It has been months and months now and no one came to pick it up, and they're not answering our emails anymore and they don't wanna give the money back. They just stole it and are ignoring us for months on end

articleTitle: IKEA's online shopping is a horrible…
articleText: IKEA's online shopping is a horrible experience. The stock showing online is so not accurate, 2 of the furniture I wanted where both out of stock in store when they were showing available online. Then I tried to order online, but only a few PenguinPickUp locations were available, and they CAN NOT be shipped to the store for me for pick up. The nearest pick up location is in downtown area with NO PARKING available. What a joke for being a pickup location for furniture, do they expect me to hand carry my furniture or they they just don't care? I even called IKEA customer service and was being told that the pick up location doesn't even offer a dolly either, it is only for shipping and storing items, the rest is up to the customer.

IKEA could not deliver - so cancelled my order - promised refund (I even have a case number) - then still delivered (??) - we had moved (that is why the order was cancelled BY Ikea - not us) - now they will not refund (instead put it at the door at a house where no one lives) - What a shame. They make a mistake (deliver a self-cancelled order, and run off with the customers money)

articleTitle: IKEA you return policy is a scam as…
articleText: IKEA you return policy is a scam as well. Let people know first that they have to keep their furniture in packaging first then ADVERTISE YOURSELF AS 365 DAYS TO RETURN!I stuck with faulty sofa and Belfast store refuse to take it back after 7 months!!! Even after that same sofa was replaced once already because of the same fault. Now they say it’s all right that cushions are sinking!!!!!🤬😡because it’s been more then 6 months.Not even mentioning that all IKEA STORES were closed for a while and just opened in may!!!Lines were busy all the time, etc.Never again buy anything expensive at IKEA!!!! 🤬🤬🤬

articleTitle: The worst shopping experience of my adult life
articleText: I wish I could explain this nightmare without putting readers to sleep.IKEA must have some form of new policy that says that if a customer has an complaint they must ignore, lie, generally caused this customer as much stress and anxiety as humanly possible.I purchased a new sofa on the 06/07/2021, unfortunately the seating cushions appeared to small for the covers, there was excessive amounts of material.so I immediately rang IKEA for help.I was advised that someone would have to call and look at the issue and I would receive an email on the Friday confirming the appointment on the following Monday.Neither of these things happen.I again rang IKEA but was advised they had No record of this, which shocked me.I was then advised that they could replace the settee but unfortunately there were no stock in any of my local stores so I would have to wait for a replenishment.Sometime passed so again I rang and made a logical suggestion to a customer service representative.I suggested seeing that it’s only the seating cover and pads that are affected could they not just order replacement parts, the lady agreed and ordered a free set of new covers and two new seating pads apparently from your lakeside store, I thought great sorted so I thought.sometime later Royal Mail turned with ONE seating pad with the same reference number I was given by customer service it was also 18 centimeters smaller than my exiting sofa cushion, obviously from a completely different sofa.I was furious and rang IKEA again, the stupidity didn’t end there on that particular day, they also advised that the order for the free replacement covers had been canceled because it hadn’t been paid for.The person who I spoke to called Chris assured me that the replacement covers were still on order and the two seating pads still hadn’t been picked from the lakeside store.He had no idea what or why had been delivered to me that day.He said this was due to happen on the 02/08/2021.Today the 05/02/2021 I still haven’t received either.What I have received is an email on Response on Resolver informing me that the sofa and covers are discontinued I was absolutely incensed with anger at IKEA incompetence and lies.I have replied to the email and received a response from an idiot saying he couldn’t trace any previous case numbers or emails so I downloaded the entire case and forwarded that via Resolver.Your Company are not fit for purpose and shouldn’t be allowed to trade. I’ve also requested two manager call backs, both have never materialized one of the managers was called JAG which was Chris’s manager the customer care representative who advised the two item were still on order.

articleTitle: Shame I have to put a star
articleText: Shame I have to put a star, I would rather put none.The experience with IKEA customer service was dreadful. I bought a bed for my teenage son and just under 2 years, the slats kept on fallen off the bed. I was sent an expert to check if the bed was faulty and as I could not show the whole bed (my son has a diagnosis of autism and will let no one in his room) so I showed him the slats which most of them were not holding together due to the cheap fabric that are between them. The expert confirmed that he will get me some new slats and I would have settled for this, as I could not show the whole bed. IKEA were not understanding of the fact that my son has a disability and I wasn’t able to show the whole bed.They called me about 2 weeks ago, on a Sunday 25/07/2021 and never bothered to call me back even though today is the 05/08/2021. Therefore, I called them and even though they advertised 10 min wait, I waited 20 min. Then, I spoke to the customer service agent who put me on hold for another 10 min. She failed to ask me if I preferred a call back rather than waiting yet again. After this, she told me that the bed is not faulty, even though the slats won’t hold on the frame. The bed has a 25 years guarantee and it did not last 2 years. Very poor customer service and product quality. There is no care towards their customers, they do not value them I will never buy from this company again.

articleTitle: IKEA Delivery Not Turning Up Week After Week.
articleText: IKEA charged me £40 for delivery telling me they were splitting my order into 2 delivery dates: 2 and 3 weeks after ordering (the first containing smaller items to be delivered by parcel, second: large items by van).I waited in all day for the parcel delivery - nothing came. I received an email at 8:05pm telling me something went wrong and that it might be that an item isn't in stock. Why couldn't they have told me that the day before or even during the day?!They said my new delivery date would now be in another 2 weeks time.The website showed that the van delivery was still coming a week later alongside this new date for the parcel a week after that.A week later, I again waited in, the van delivery didn't arrive and no email received this time. I can only assume that everything will be delivered on the new delivery date for the parcel (which is over 4 weeks from the date I made the order).I cannot get through to IKEA to check. They have closed email, chat, don't answer the phone and don't answer DMs on Messenger.This is the absolute worst company I've ever bought from.Currently going against all trading standards.So far, I have moved into my new home and paid over £1294 for furniture and small things like a cafetiere and a baking tray and am wondering when I'm going to see it!

articleTitle: IKEA is no longer a cool and enjoyable place to shop
articleText: I have been shopping at ikea for over 15 years, and to me it was a day out and i always enjoyed going there, have some food and a nice coffee and just stroll around the shop browsing for cool stuff, but the last few trips to Ikea have been extremely disappointing, everything is basically a chore from going to the toilet, the restaurant/ cafe is often not available, it's absolutely packed with people there is a queue to get in and a massive queue at the till... the finance service to pay in instalments is absolutely dreadful and clunky. the staff is lovely and helpful at least but poor them my god!Anyway my husband and I detested it so much that we wont go back and sadly the cost of delivery at ikea is a joke in these days and age! £40!!! whereas everywhere else it's free over a certain amount.

Bought 2 sets of wardrobes with sliding doors. In store told delivery in 4 wks. By the time we got home text arrived to say it would be an extra 4 wks. In store asked if we would like the assembly service which we agreed to. Given price and told needed 2 people to assemble them. Sent link to choose date and time. 2 men who didn't know each other arrived via TaskRabbit. I guy completed 1 wardrobe and left after 2 hrs. The other guy arrived late and after 4 hrs told us he'd never assembled this type of wardrobe and  had to leave to go to another job! Incomplete wardrobe left with 1 door propped against the wall. Door fell over onto floor and broke. Grimo door made from cheap rubbish board. Ikea quality has plummeted.

articleTitle: If I had the option of 0 stars
articleText: If I had the option of 0 stars, that's what I would give. We talked to someone from ikea over the phone and were told to come to the shop and pick up the furniture piece we needed. No mention of changed times or anything. We checked on the internet and it said the store in Logan, Queensland, Australia closes at 7pm. We arrive and get told they close at 5pm as advertised? We drove a long way to get there to be brushed off like that with a different closing time to what's advertised? Not ok, especially in times like these!
It's ok. But I waited so long for my bed.

articleTitle: I bought my Table top and I love it
articleText: I bought my Table top and I love it. The only issue I have is I noticed that there's a slight damage. Unfortunately they won't exchange it

articleTitle: Bought 2 sofas minus armrests as they…
articleText: Bought 2 sofas minus armrests as they were not in stock on 19th July from Perth. Told armrests would be in in a few days. Rang up the stock check line every day to be told it was arriving the following day for 2 weeks. Spent over 10 hours on the phone chasing up. Got told this morning that shipment is not sure to arrive for another 4 weeks! stock in all other stores, but will not send. Can send from Sydney warehouse but will now arrive for 4 weeks anyway! Lachlan the manager would not contact anyone else to speed up delivery. Crazy system that you cannot order out of stock items or even be told an accurate date for when they would be in stock again! Will not be purchasing anything else from Ikea again.
Recently purchased an ottoman bed. It came on the named day delivery as expected and no parts were missing. I have built the bed and all seems good so far!

articleTitle: The worth customer service ever don’t…
articleText: The worth customer service ever don’t order delivery because you never get itAnd arik the supervisor need to quit and do something else just not customer service

I brought a changing table and waited a month for delivery..delivered fine on the Sunday.I’ve gone to put it together and there was pieces missing. Phoned up on the Monday and was told replacement parts would be sent out on Friday between 7am - 7pm.I waited all day rang up to find out what’s going on.. they had no Acknowledgement of my parts order and apologised and said throw away what you have we will send you a whole brand new unit monday. So again I waited I got a text the day before saying it would be delivered between 8am-12pm.No delivery, 5 phone calls to them being cut off every time! Apparently they couldn’t get hold of the driver and have no idea where the changing table is!I’m due a baby in a week have to wait two weeks for a refund and have no changing table no happy atall with the service!

articleTitle: At the ikea returns at their Schaumburg…
articleText: At the ikea returns at their Schaumburg store for 15 people waiting for returns there is only one person processing it taking in excess of 10 mts per return. While there are tons of people manning the checkout counter. Does that mean once you buy from ikea, they don't care about you any more? Bad customer service.

articleTitle: I like IKEA's practical designs and…
articleText: I like IKEA's practical designs and prices. The store is fine. But for anything delivered the service is appalling. You pay up front,  then are told you will have to wait weeks for some items which are out of stock. Then they fail to deliver on a date. For a kitchen this is serious when you have a plumber waiting round or you had other plans than wait 3 weeks for  delivery of the other half of the kitchen. Seems like under staffing and stressed staff at head office.

articleTitle: I paid £15 for delivery and it never arrived when they said!
articleText: I paid £15 for delivery of an item and was told that it would arrive yesterday between 7am and 7pm.  We waited ALL day and it never arrived!   I am NOT happy, my husband was unable to give me a lift to my 96 year old sick mother as someone had to stay in for the delivery . . . the taxi cost me £8.50 . . . that's £23.50 with nothing to show for it!  This is a disgrace!!!

articleTitle: Buying furniture from IKEA is fun in a…
articleText: Buying furniture from IKEA is fun in a way, the whole Family gathers to build the bought furniture and we are having lots of fun, and not only is it fun but its also great for children to learn how stuff is being built and the furniture also looks beautiful.

articleTitle: Sold my a broken chair that on getting…
articleText: Sold me a broken chair that on getting home and opening the box find is broken.  On returning they are now saying that I did this and won't refund!I resent being sold faulty items and resent even more being called a liar!Will be taking legal action as I am totally within my consumer rights to return the item as they'll find out!

articleTitle: I don't understand how this company is still in business
articleText: Get this: you place an order, you don't get a confirmation email, the money (nearly £1000) gets charged from your account, have to chase them about the order for about 3 weeks, got fobbed off at every opportunity, delivery window missed.I swear you would get a better service from online scammers, at least they pretend they care. Buyer beware on online orders: the items may be cheap but they are nowhere near worth the hassle of dealing with IKEA support should something go wrong. And something will go wrong if you check the reviews on this site.1 star, would rate them minus stars if I could.
BAD  BAD  BAD.   I don't have a receipt from 4 years ago, for a product that has decayed too too rapidly. Ikea acknowledges its their product but won't respond unless I can prove purchase.

articleTitle: I was very disappointed by the service…
articleText: I was very disappointed by the service and the lack of flexibility when it comes to ordering a kitchen for example. Most items were not available and I had to order them separately. Additionally, there had to be a separate meeting scheduled for every additional order which I needed to wait for more than one month. Even though it’s not expensive the service should me I should not buy there!

Terrible site.Randomly change product line for no reason so you can't easily add to your existing furniture.Good luck finding sets of furniture in matching colours. Many product lines arbitrarily exclude a certain colour. And I don't mean like "lime green", but common choices like oak... Maybe it's fine if you want white, plastic looking furniture?

articleTitle: They  charged me the wrong price on…
articleText: They  charged me the wrong price on something than had to go to customer service to return it waited for over an hour for a mistake only one register was open to return the product other employees were just walking around

Awful delivery service (and poor in-store customer service). Employees actively ignored me in-store, when I finally talked to an employee, they told me I would be placing an order for it to be shipped to me rather than be bought in-store.Ok no problem. I placed an order 2 months in advance before I was to move to my new apartment, which would give them ample time to coordinate logistically to deliver my furniture. The day before my delivery date, I checked online and they had mysteriously moved my delivery date back a few days without notifying me. When I inquired with customer service (after being on hold for an hour), they were unable to provide an explanation.So then I waited the extra 5 days only to find out they have now pushed my delivery date by another few days forward. No explanation was given.DO NOT SHOP HERE.

articleTitle: This product heiloom 3 door white dresser
articleText: This product. Heiloom 3 door dresser. Is the poorest quality.  Tried putting together and locks would not lock and wobbly construction ever on a dresser.   I will never buy another product from ikea cheap furniture ever again.  Cheap cheap cheap.

articleTitle: They made me wait for a month without…
articleText: They made me wait for a month without any notification and when I contacted them, they forced me to cancel the order saying that they can't resend the order that is damaged by fedex because of covid. Not sure how it relates in anyway.

I was given a gift token for Christmas so put it towards buying a "BondHolmen" outdoor sofa. It cost 249Euros so not cheap. It is not good. Every time you sit on it there is a loud cracking noise. I checked to see if I had assembled it correctly and I had, everything was in its right place. To be fair this is just a review about the product as I haven't contacted the company about this. But I would not use them again.   Me dieron una ficha de regalo para Navidad, así que apúntela a comprar un sofá de exterior "BondHolmen". Cuesta 249 euros, así que no es barato. No es bueno. Cada vez que te sientas sobre él, se oye un fuerte crujido. Revisé para ver si lo había ensamblado correctamente y lo tenía, todo estaba en su lugar correcto. Para ser justos, esto es solo una revisión sobre el producto, ya que no me he puesto en contacto con la empresa al respecto. Pero no los volvería a usar.

articleTitle: Extremely low quality appliances, unusable after 1 year
articleText: I bought a MATÄLSKARE extractor hood and in less than a year, the starting button broke and fell off. We could not use the hood anymore, and Ikea does not cover this issue in warranty! The warranty was for 5 years, but the hood is unusable after one year, no warranty offered for this. The worst product I have ever bought!

Very bad, ordered a kitchen in May they called for Delivery didn’t show up, delivered a few parts customer service by phone you can spend hours in the loop and listen how to fasten their cabinetFrustrating!!!☹️

Don't order!!! They give you delivery date but that don't mean anything, they deliver when they want...I'm waiting 2 weeks more by now and reading other reviews here I just hope all parts of my closet will be there.

The store was clean, however, the air conditioning was either very poor or not on at all. The items did not appear to be good quality. They have a traffic pattern that is very confusing as to how to get out of the store when you want to. It is very difficult to navigate , and when we asked several employees how to get out, they all had different answers. The layout is made to keep you there as long as possible.I wouldn’t go back. Always wanted go. Now I know

articleTitle: Would leave minus stars if I could.
articleText: Never dealt with such a bad company.Drove all the way to IKEA in Warrington to buy a wardrobe and a chest of drawers. We spent £260 on both and then realised the boxes were far too big to fit into my car. Our only option was to go to the home delivery desk and get them delivered to our home. IKEA claim to be able to send the products to your home the very same day. We were told this was not possible as they couldn’t even contact the people who deliver the products. They told us they could deliver the next day between 12pm-6pm. We paid £29 and then received a message later in that evening saying the delivery would actually be between 12pm-4pm. On the day we received no correspondence from the delivery company or IKEA and the products were not delivered between that time, despite calling them multiple times and they told us it would be delivered in that time. They then told us it would be delivered before 6pm. It did not show. We must have called 14 times that day to the customer service IKEA and we’re told blatant lies each time. We were told it would then 100% be delivered before 7pm and that the delivery man was actually on his way to ours. Still no show. We were eventually told it would not be arriving that day and we would receive a phone call the next day between 8am-10am. No call. After ringing twice again they then told us they had no idea where our products were and had no idea if or when they would be delivered. We were then that frustrated we wanted a full refund for the products and the delivery and were told we would have to drive all the way back to the Warrington store to get a refund. When we arrived at the Warrington store, to our amazement. Our wardrobe and chest of drawer boxes were on the trollies exactly where we left them in the store. They hadn’t even been moved from where we set them on the day of purchase. The refund assistant on till had once again, no idea what was going on noe did the manager, Chris. The assistant or Chris didn’t even greet us or apologise for the inconvenience this had caused us. Absolutely shocked by the service and will never ever be shopping with IKEA again, I will also be telling everyone I know of the shocking service they provide. Terrible company, do not waste your time.

articleTitle: All works as expected, some improvements could happen
articleText: IKEA Germany online orders and IKEA Heerlen in person: everything works 99% as expected, all OK.I have bought many pieces of furniture here in the last 1.5 years: 2xPAX for clothes, book shelves, coffee table, tv stand, sofa... actually I furnished my home fully from IKEA slowly, one by one, except for the kitchen as it was already there.Delivery for the bigger pieces is good, they called me before etc.Two things they could fix:Hemnes single bed makes a squeaky noise. The two stiffening rods (is that the correct word?!) installed in a V shape under the mattress. They were also hard to install as the rod where one must screw the screw did not have a proper screw thread. Anyway eventually it worked. The squeaking can be helped with a bit of insulating tape. Installation would be easier using screws with a counterpart.Another thing is now when I tried to order I got the "we can't deliver to your postal code" message _after_ I clicked the order button, which is strange. I hope IKEA can improve it. ("Im Moment können wir eine Lieferung an diese Postleitzahl nicht ermöglichen.")

I bought a new kitchen from Ikea and felt the service was poor.1.The drawings were pixelated and impossible for my fitter to interpret.2.Most of the stock was subsequently found to be out of stock causing delays. A shopping list was provided.3. The 2 staff members I dealt with both moved departments and I had to reexplain my spec.4. The digital link to the plans expires quickly so I had to keep requesting new ones.5. Cupboard doors were not delivered correctly.My fitter suggested that while the kitchen is cheap, the fitting requires a lot more work than other kitchens and the cost is deferred.

articleTitle: Change delivery dates with no contact
articleText: I ordered a lovely corner sofa bed on the 16/7/21 and the delivery slot I chose was the 20/7/21 which for IKEA I thought was super quick. All was confirmed via email and everything was fine, was told 7am - 7pm but I’d get a 4h time slot a day or so before and another text on the day so I can track it. Fast forward to today (day of delivery) I’ve had no emails, no texts, no contact. I just got off the phone with IKEA customer service who said that my delivery date had been changed to 24/7/21 as they didn’t have all the parts. I would have been totally ok with this and these things happen, however when I’d had no contact to say this and I had rearranged all my week so I could be in all day today for the delivery I think it’s outrageous. All I wanted was a text or email to say the date needed to be changed and there would be no issues. But now I have to cancel plans and re arrange my week once again. To make matters worse it’s my anniversary weekend and now we can’t do anything on the 24th as we’ve got to be in all day 🙄

articleTitle: Slow Delivery and & wanted Contactless Delivery & Toll took it to Post Office
articleText: I am in shutdown in Sydney at the moment so wanted contactless delivery.  after 2 weeks from my order (other companies have it to you within 2 or 3 days and I live about 20 mins from Tempe Ikea!!! I get a text yesterday saying its coming I was home ALLL day no one attempted to deliver it they took it straight to the Local Post Office .. its close but items will be heavy and not contactless.  I called IKEA yesterday and was on the phone for about 40 mins on HOLD and then had to hang up OMG.  Dont use them if you don't have to TERRIBLE customber service all round.

articleTitle: DPD left the delivered goods at concierge
articleText: Today I wait at home for DPD delivery according to the tracing route, no phone call was recived but DPD driver left all my 4 box stuff (the largest one as almost same as a moving box) at the concierge upon their arrival, of course no done notice after they gone.There has 200 meters far from my home's door andI need to borrow a goods trolley for picking up those stuff by myself and likely sharing the DPD's work! Their staff are lazy.Why need us pay the delivery charge, Ikea?
Pretty ugly but functional furniture. Good price.

articleTitle: Ikea Ireland - Advise - Do not order a kitchen here
articleText: Ordered a kitchen from Ikea.No delivery dockets with orders so 100 boxes approx arrived, no way of knowing if anything missing. all deliveries need a delivery docket for this purpose.We start building the kitchen, no counter top. 4 weeks of contacting IKEA and noone can find the item. No staff can let me talk to a manager. No person can return my call. 4 weeks after missing item was notified to Ikea and no move forward.Last night I receive a curt mail stating they can't find it and now have reordered.Was due June 19th, now due 16th August.When you build a kitchen, you take out the old. So there is no kitchen and no water, for 2 months.Not once did Ikea apologise.Had they have responded internally i wouldn't have lost 4 weeks before they reordered.So my advice is: Can you afford to live with half a kitchen for 2 months? If not, you might want consider shopping elsewhere.Ikea have good products but if it goes wrong, you will face a blank wall, and literally no way to get them to respond.Awful customer experience.

Received some bedding and bits and pieces I ordered online, they got here the day they said they would and I'm really happy with them. Great quality and great prices. I only wish there was a Ikea shop near me.

I drove almost 2 hours to attend the Ikea store in Nov Scotia to purchase all new covers for my Uppland 3 seat sofas (2) plus 2 ottoman covers. The lady in that department was friendly and reasonably helpful. I bought all the covers plus purchased a large carpet.When I removed the covers from the couch, I noticed a significant weight difference. They were not nearly the sturdy, covers that I took off. The fit was terrible! It looks awful. Not nearly the material or quality of the original, which I was led to belive was the same. Very disappointed!
IKEA is a very bad place to go!! I was gonna go to the restaurant they own but they said it was closed when it wasn’t !! This is very sad for me and my family. 1/10
No chat option, no help desk, no email, good option to go down the drain. Will think twice going there again.
Terrible customer service, my order was sent to wrong address and they refuse to send replacement

Since my apartment is small I went to Ikea  in Brooklyn, NY to by a love seat. At the store, I saw the right item which is MORABO Loveseat, Gunnared dark gray/woodsize 166 cm(65 3/8"). A worker proposed to help me by checking the availability of the item. After a quick look on the computer, he told me the item is available on store to pick up but delivery will be available July 13. I decided to purchase it and accept delivery July 13. Instead of giving me the information for the love seat, he gave sofa ( 206cm= 81 1/8") which much bigger than the love seat even bigger than the sofa I thrown away to buy the love seat. I just call customer service to let them know that the item the send me is not the love seat but sofa. The lady says the only thing to is to bring the item back to the store because they don't do pick up. I am frustrated because my husband is disable he is on a wheelchair. We went to the store to buy the right item and the ikea agent gave us the wrong info.  Now, we cannot use the sofa since it is too big for our apartment and we don't have anyway to bring back to the store.

articleTitle: Misleading Information on products and services
articleText: I ordered on June 11, 2021, a full kitchen furniture and full home appliances from Ikea (Romania), but I was delivered a kitchen without 5 doors and I wasn't delivered with handles for any doors or drawers. I wasn't told that the doors will arrive late in stock, it was only after I called Customer Services to ask for the doors that I found out they will arrive on September or maybe never. I was told that the doors will come in 2 months. I sent several emails asking for a solution, but Ikea came to install the incomplete kitchen and afterwards offered to change all doors with doors from an inferior product (as price and design), announcing me that the 5 missing doors will be delivered in 3 months instead of 2 months. I then asked for a discount, as all my things have been and are currently on the floor and I am not able to use the kitchen for more than 50%, and Ikea refused to grant me a discount and propose the installation of provisory doors at my cost. I proposed Ikea to pay for the provisory solution and refused to do so, claiming system issues :). I then asked for the handles to be delivered and I have now to wait one more week for their installation. I regret buying the kitchen from this company, I thought they are professional and customer oriented, but their approach is abusive and neglectful and rigid. Moreover, the advertising they make about their products and services is misleading, as the quality of their services is low.

articleTitle: Terrible experience buying a Ikea kitchen…
articleText: Terrible experience buying a kitchen from Ikea! Will never buy a kitchen from them again. NEVER!!!!Very poor customer service when you report a problem!Gerard Paagman - Invermere, BC

Bought a bed, typed in a wrong postal code (typo)... went thru hell to just to correct it. First time calling in the lady said she cant, system doesnt allow her, and transferred me to a dead line. Called back and the next lady she will try, and placed me on forever hold. So I ended up cancelling my order!!!

Horrific contact center RUDE, RUDE, RUDE: Unfit for purpose: Extremely RUDE agents, shouting at me and BULLYING by this male agent, never happy to help, DON'T wants to bother! articleText: Bought a new couch from Ikea in store and arranged delivery this Saturday. Old couch was gone on Friday and was eagerly awaiting the arrival of my new couch. articleTitle: My visit to IKEA Gateshead restaurant…
articleText: My visit to IKEA Gateshead restaurant was awful .It was the manner the ORDERS were given ,starting at the desk ,to finishing at our table .My friend and myself felt very unwelcome ,and so many obstacles were put in our way before we could get food .We were  told we had 45 minutes to eat and that started from me sitting down and my friend arriving 15 minutes later.Come on IKEA ,we know there's a pandemic but the attitude of one person in particular is worthy of being in charge of a prison camp ,and many others were commenting on her attitude .
Hideous company.Scam you on delivery charges,  scam you on return charges,  provide the worst service you will ever encounter.Go back to Sweden.

Provided the wrong parts. We asked for a part replacement and they told they replace the entire thing. They never did that. After repeated follow-ups, they sent us 4 screws. After that, we kept calling them and somehow the call got connected and we asked for the call to be escalated and they kept our call on hold for 20 mins and then the call disconnected.

articleTitle: I didn’t even want to give one star
articleText: I didn’t even want to give one star. IKEA is poorly organized. They make designer displays to dupe people into thinking the goods are high quality. Their goods are all from China VERY cheaply made!!!  Not made in Sweden sadly. IKEA has the nerve to make customers get their own products! Not just small stuff! Couches in boxes that you have to take out of stock and put on a dolly. Their is no staff to help customers! It’s apocalyptic shopping! We were going to buy a kitchen table and couch and left the stuff and walked out! You’re better off going to mom and pop furniture stores. Buy American!!!

Poorly informed staff on "smart" products. Dreadful covid regs supervision esp at checkouts.

This is about Ikea in Denmark - Copenhagen.Ikea in Copenhagen Denmark perform extraordinarily poorly on delivery. If I could have given 0 stars I would have, because even one star is stretching it. If you want anything from Ikea PLEASE go and buy it from the store, DO NOT ask them to deliver it to you, as they have a completely unorganized uncoordinated delivery service, that postpones your delivery time and time again, without offering compensation. Delivery service is appalling.

articleTitle: My experience is about Ikea Canada.
articleText: My experience is about Ikea Canada.One of the worst customer services I have ever seen! I will not be able to fit the entire story of my problems here, but overal do NOT buy anything from Ikea if you cannot buy it in the store and carry it yourself. If you opt in for online or over the phone order or if you get Ikea to deliver your order to you, there is a very high chance that you end up waiting for your bed more than 3 weeks just like me and sleep on the floor hoping that you would have a bed one day after 4 order changes (delays) and almost 20 follow up phone calls and two unsuccessful visits to Ikea store and a lot of time that is wasted over the phone before they hung up on you.
Just waited for 50+ minutes to hear the same recording over and over again.  Finally hung up as the customer service department is invisible.

Ordered a cabinet to be delivered to my home. It was missing a piece so I called customer service to ask for the missing piece. They proceeded to send me the piece without issue. As I started to assemble the cabinet there was ANOTHER piece missing. I called ikea back to request this piece. They said they’d send me it but nothing showed up for a couple weeks. I had to call back to find out they weren’t going to ship it because it was too large for the carrier. Now they are sending me a whole new cabinet. I have to now throw out the old cabinet which was only missing ONE part. They also refused to send me the missing piece with the NEW cabinet. It was all very confusing so now I’m throwing out a brand new cabinet…
Always reliable. Great service.

articleTitle: Damaged Product and Terrible Collection Service
articleText: EDIT: My problem is solved now (8th July 2021) but the collection team was not nice at all. articleTitle: MISSING ITEM.  VERY BAD CUSTOMERS'S SERVICE AFTER you BOUGHT the items.
articleText: I bought a LOHALS (a carpet rug, Flatwoven 5'3" x 7'7") AND a STOPP FILT (rug Underlay with Anti-Slip). They delivered a box contained a STOPP FILT rug underlay (wt about 1.5 bls or less) but NO LOHALS carpet. The man deliver a box and took a photo. My security cameras (all around my property, different angles) shown a man delivered only 1 item. I emailed IKEA and Delivery company 5 times and received NO answer except the first email they said delivers 2 items. I am so upset since its been awhile and they still....NO CARPET. I live in Irvine, CA.

Horrendous experience with kitchen. We bought a kitchen through Ikea, spending around 40.000 DKK. The oven hasn't worked properly since day 1, and we have now had 3 engineers to come out and fix the problem. Each time they have been there for 5 minutes and failed to do anything other than turn the oven on, stick there hand in it, and say 'well it feels warm'.So, 4 months later we still have an oven that burns half the food while the other half remains raw. Ikea continue to tell us that it's not their responsibility to fix this issue, despite it clearly being stated in EU law that it is clearly their responsibility.
The table I wanted delivered to me broke during shipping, the refunds dont cover the original price and they didnt offer to swap it out. Mind you all this happened before it even arrived...

We used Ikea kitchen planning serviceGeneral view1) It took them 2 weeks to respond to our online request2) the kitchen planner sometimes forgot what was agreed in our previous discussion. Some were even written in the email but he ignored it.3) there’s no way to contact the kitchen planner when the order went wrong. We were only allowed to call customer services. However, the customer service always said, “this is kitchen department issue. Please contact your kitchen planner.” And surprisingly the only way to contact the kitchen planner was to write email to him but he didn’t respond. Response rate: ca. 1 out of 5 emails. And then we fell into a vicious circle or a dead end to be more precise.4) customer service staff are not well trained. one of them even hanged up the call without advice, explanation or assistance. (Ps. I did speak German to customer service. Very sure it was not language issue)Key Incidents (what went wrong so that we finally understood how terrible IKEA service could be)Incident 1) we booked and paid for the dishwasher through our kitchen planner. Namely, it was in stock when we paid for it. However, the order was canceled one sided by IKEA all of the sudden one day before the scheduled delivery date. And we tried to call customer services. They said “sorry out of stock.” (So what’s the point for us to pay for it that earlier and trust it would be delivered before the installation guys came?) In the end, Amazon saved us.Incident 2) the kitchen planner forgot to make the booking for the fridge. We noticed this issue only one week before the scheduled installation services, which had became urgent. After trying to call customer service many times, we finally managed to get one customer service who could help us book the fridge without delivery fees as this should have been part of our kitchen package. (Btw, the kitchen planner still hid himself somewhere even we had emailed him about this missing fridge. No response still until today.)However, the customer service later called telling us he could rebooked the delivery of the fridge on the same date as other bookings. We said fine. Soon after we received a cancellation email of the fridge but no further rebooking. So we called customer service. They confirmed yes it’s canceled. We asked “could you booked it for us again?” This time, they responded “no can do. Please contact your kitchen planner.” After calling so many times and talking to different kitchen planners from different locations, they all said they could book it but with extra 99€ delivery fee. (yes our kitchen planner was just gone.) in the end, given the installation guys would be coming soon, we ordered it through one kitchen planner and paid for the fridge including delivery fee.And, and, and, finally the installation was finished although some doors are still missing. We happily thought that we would never need to speak to IKEA service people anymore. What a relief…. But the IKEA torture just returned today — we received an invoice from customer service for that fridge they never delivered let alone there’s no Auftrag Bestätigung for that fridge in our email inbox at all…. (this is the last draw to let me decide to write down our story on a public platform.)Thank you for reading our long complaint to this end ;)(Update: Just called customer services - they insisted that the fridge was delivered in "their" system. they asked us to go to the Einrichtungshaus again because the delivery was arranged by them. Again, IKEA one-sided decide what to invoice without a proof of delivery, our signature, not to mention there's even no Auftrag Bestätigung from us. How dare IKEA issue such an invoice like that? Their management and integrity are both questionable.)Conclusion: Doing business with IKEA is time and energy consuming at the same time. Think twice before placing any order of any IKEA goods or services.

articleTitle: Disability discrimation and insults at Ikea Edinburgh
articleText: Edinburgh customer serviceToday I received the most dismissive, arrogant treatment from Jamie on Information Desk. I was complaining about the process for ordering, paying and collecting bulky items and hiw it could be clearer and easier. He1. Did not look at me2. Did not acknowledge my complaint2. Did not say a word whilst processing my paperwork and didn't explain when he made a mistake and had to reprint3. Tossed my paperwork at me4. When I said 'thanks for nothing' he waited until I walked away and then shouted after me 'thanks for your happy disposition' then laughed at me with the next customerThat ignorant little sod is paid to listen to customers complaints....I was not swearing, personally offensive or aggressive, I was merely complaining about a process that was causing me extreme pain as a disabled person needing sticks.I would NEVER use this company again. Rather surprised to say my experience with customer support at Ikea was actually nice.After waiting more than two months for a delivery (in itself, pretty terrible service, but at any rate the order was placed during lockdown so I could not at that time go to Ikea to collect my items myself and the soonest delivery date was two months away, okay, fine whatever) and nothing arriving/no correspondence from them for 15 days past the date the delivery was supposed to arrive, I decided to get in touch.Email contact disabled. Live chat disabled due to "high volume" (gee, Ikea, wonder why). There was, however a local number. Forum after forum warned me I wouldn't get anywhere with the number but I had to try something. Being patient about "COVID delays" could only go so far, man.I was through to a super friendly and accommodating staff member pretty much straight away, who was able to tell me the order had been damaged and placed on hold. Apparently, no one had thought to tell me (cute, Ikea). They were able to offer me either a refund or a redelivery in a short window of time and cleared everything up really quickly.Four stars because this was genuinely a helpful and pleasant experience. Star off because I had to initiate it myself and because it's simply not good enough to have just one contact option in 2021 with so many people looking for work.

articleTitle: Buy cheap, buy twice. Faulty goods & unethical customer service
articleText: Avoid at all costs for big ticket items. As soon as something goes wrong, you'll pay a bigger price than any saving you intended to make on the cost of the product. It's no coincidence they don't have a complaints procedure (just a feedback form) and don't allow customers to post reviews on certain products!I ordered the Farlov 2-seater sofa bed for £795, which arrived with 2 screws missing and as a result would derail when trying to use the bed function. IKEA's customer services are so incompetent they were unable to send the correct screws to the store or in the post. Instead, they sent round an 'eco master' (engineer) to resolve the issue. Although he was able to replace the missing screws, the bed broke upon first use. After sending another engineer, who confirmed it's broken, I was told I'd be hearing from them soon. Unsurprisingly, after a week I'd heard nothing and again had to chase them.I've spent hours now trying to get a refund/exchange, I'm continuously told lie upon lie by their agents e.g. you'll receive a call within 24 hours, which never materialises. I've now been given a date for collection for a refund (though I have to disassemble the sofa myself), but even this has been rescheduled. The agent tried to tell me the cost of the sofa was £560 when the website and my order clearly states how much I paid. Unethical behaviour. This is the most expensive & time-consuming mistake I've ever made.

TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE, PAID DELIVERY NEVER TURNED UP! I’m still waiting for my bed that was supposed to be delivered YESTERDAY between 9am - 9pm ... Go woke, go broke. Terrible company getting involved in politics.

If I could give 0 stars I would. This is by far the worst customer service I have ever received. We ordered some seat pad cushions for the solleron sofa, a recliner chair and a load of other items which came to near £500 along with a £40 delivery charge. The day before we received confirmation that our order was due the following day between 7-11. We waited in (we booked the day off work especially) and it didn’t arrive. I rang IKEA customer services and the gentleman said on the phone “it should arrive today but might be late. It says your order is delayed” this had not been communicated to us at all via text or email. We patiently waited for a further 4 hours and the items still had not arrived. I rang up and spoke to the same gentleman as before who told me that our order had encounter an error… wouldn’t come today and that some of the items were out of stock. Again… no communication from IKEA. No email, text or phone call. It’s just common courtesy. The gentleman said they would redeliver another day which we begrudgingly agreed to only to be told there’s no guarantee it will arrive on that day and that we would be best ringing up two days before to check it would arrive. Why is that my job as the customer? It is the most basic level of customer service to keep customers up to date on their order. We then cancelled the order and we’re told as a gesture of good will…. That they would also refund the delivery charge. Big round of applause IKEA. Thank you so much for refunding me for the delivery that you never delivered. Oh and the icing on the cake, if our refund isn’t in our account within 10 days… we need to ring and chase that up too. Safe to say we won’t be ordering again in a hurry. I also fully expect that IKEA won’t learn anything from this review as the thousands of others I’ve read on here today say exactly the same and clearly that’s not worked. If you’re thinking of ordering, think twice.

articleTitle: Beware Of This Information By IKEA! - Bad Information
articleText: Okay everyone listen up.  Despite on the website that it says the following statement - scroll below my text. This is far from the truth!!! As I bought a vanity unit which is too big for my bathroom due to my designer getting it completely wrong. I appreciate not IKEA's fault but delighted to find out they do take assembled furniture back, which I think is a really good service and USP. I lugged the whole unit and washbasin and IKEA refused to refund or give me vouchers.  There is this back buy scheme? Which applies to second hand furniture. Admirable indeed, but not good in my case. I am so dissappointed that the reverse was told to me.  Be really careful when you buy things from this Company! As the ample information I found about them accepting returned assemble furniture is not TRUE.  HQ IKEA any chance you can make an exception or bring this policy back for customers? I am now stuck with £200 item which I do not need. Happy to except vouchers.  I am gutted that this policy no longer exists. Bad move in my opinion!SEE STATEMENT(NOT CORRECT)  IKEA does have a great return policy. Customers can return products up to 365 days after the initial purchase, even if the furniture has been assembled. If IKEA agrees that the product is unused and in resalable conditions, the store will issue a full refund.(NOT CORRECT) You don't need to disassemble the furniture before returning it at Ikea. Bring in the items as they are, and make sure you bring all the remaining pieces (and the box as well if you still have it).

articleTitle: Worst experience I have ever had
articleText: Worst experience I have ever had. My wife and I decided to redo our kitchen. We tore out almost everything because we wanted to pen up the area to make it less clustered. So we tore out almost everything and left just enough to be a usable kitchen. We decided to go to Ikea for our cabinets because they deal with the European designs. So we went on line, designed everything with there tools and went to the store which is over an hour ride from us. This is in 1/19/2021. The staff helped us put everything in (Several thousands of dollars) and we paid for delivery at the tune of 100 bucks. They said some of the stuff in back ordered due to the pandemic and we understood. They delivered the 1st part of the order which not 1 single thing was available to put together in 2 weeks. They said about 60 days or less and we will deliver the rest of it. We agreed. 60 days rolled around and dead silence, Not a text, call, or e-mail. I called and got a huge run around. Hung up on 2 times and spent over 2 hours on the phone. They said another month and we will have it all. Again we understood. And again dead silence. I called back and was again hung up on multiple times, transferred to more people then I what to do with, and told the order should be in by the 3rd week of May. (5 months now) I called because they again did not even try to reach out to me but when I went on line my order showed CANCELED! This really got me going. I called on 5/26/2021 and got the traditional run around, the traditional hang ups, spent 3 hours on the phone for them to tell me there computer systems are down. They took my name and number and said they will call me back. SILENCE! Nothing.... I called back on 6/1/2021 my day off. I got the 45 minute wait on hold, transferred to 7 people, told my original order does not show up and that the stuff I need to complete my kitchen is still not available even for online orders. I told them I want them to CANCEL this order and 100% refund my money including the delivery fee. We will wait and see if this happens. If I could give a Negative 5 stars I would. I have rebuilt 3 houses, and 2 kitchens. This has been the worst experience I have ever had to deal with. Be weary to deal with this company. Look on the BBB site and see they are a 1 Star business and are not even accredited with them.

articleTitle: I am rating 1 star because 0 stars is…
articleText: I am rating 1 star because 0 stars is not an option.  I placed an order on 4/24/21. It took IKEA seconds to bill my credit card. I am now on the phone trying to cancel the order.  Almost two hours and 5 departments later, I have not been able to get the order cancelled.  They have not yet transferred me to the "department" that can cancel my order.  Is this a scam??????????????????????A manager indicated that, as of today, the order is "delayed". I was so relieved to see with the "express delivery" you can have your products delivered 1 day later, at a time of your choosing. This of course comes at a premium delivery price, and also the time you choose will definitely not be taken seriously by Ikea. I choose 7 AM to 2 PM delivery, and it is 18.16 now. I couldn't even leave the house but still don't have my products. Please do not ever buy anything from this inconsiderate, sorry excuse for a furniture company ever again. I know I wont.

Online Order. Did not get my item in full. Had to call 4-5 times to check on every piece of it. I would spend from 45 minutes to an hour on hold.  Agents do not leave notes. I have to tell the story all over again. Still did not get my item in full. Poor customer service. If I could give NO stars, I would!

articleTitle: Got censored after notifying about no service
articleText: Called them for some questions about their service. The call was the answer I needed.After over 10 minutes of waiting while I got a few tones as if someone was picking up the phone, I had enough. Their service has been dropping like flies over the years. 20 years ago, at least it was reasonably priced.Now they're virtue signaling with their overpriced junk while not providing service at all.I called because their chat was disabled, giving an error message I didn't have internet. When I posted this on their FB page, I got promptly censored and the message got deleted.

articleTitle: IKEA Doesn't Answer Customer Service 888 Number
articleText: Purchased a Micke cabinet and the wheels do not connect to the supplied hardware. Either the packers included the wrong wheels or the wrong connectors. I've been on hold with IKEA for 45 minutes and have this sinking feeling they are never going to pick up. What an insult to its paying customers. We'll gladly take your money, but aren't there for you if you have a problem. I rank them up there with COMCAST for the worst customer service. Yes, IKEA is cheap, but once you add up the hours spent driving to/from the store, assembly (with poorly written instructions), and time spent trying to resolve their mistakes, its worth spending more and getting your money's worth elsewhere.

articleTitle: I really wanted to give you my money....
articleText: I want to order a couch. The couch is in only available in 4 locations across the US - and a 14 hour drive from me. I called the store. I can't pay over the phone. They can't ship to me. I have to be there in person to pick it up. First come first served? Your business is global. Your customers are everywhere at all times - not just in your location. Don't make your customers jump through hoops. There are a lot of other options out there - can't wait to go find one who's brought their business practices into 2021.

articleTitle: Was trying to order a complete kitchen
articleText: Was trying to order a complete kitchen, everything on stock acc. their internet site, with delivery option 129 €. Afterwards, two items could not be delivered, but could be picked up from a shop. So I ordered the rest with delivery and the two other I would pick up (3 hours drive). After I ordered, the site says that the two missing articles are not available for pick up... Like what the heck ? So now I will try and get the money back, which already seems too complicated. Very bad experience, poor customer service and false data on their internet site, which you would not expect from such a huge company. Very dissapointing.
Every time i go to IKEA i always have a great experience, and i also eat some cheap meatballs that are delicious. Much better than other retailers.
I’ve not been to IKEA for some time but it was always a lovely place to visit and check out all the bits and pieces they had, and the hotdogs were amazing in particular!!

articleTitle: Ikea failing on their sustainability promise and overcharging on delivery
articleText: Ikea say one thing and do another.One of their promises to customers is about being sustainable, especially with their packaging. However, I had two deliveries that took weeks (they gave me no reason why it took so long, and no apology), and both arrived in huge boxes full of paper and packaging. One of the boxes was so big that I could fit into it, and this was for a handful of small items such as candles and pots.Ikea have lost their way. I've complained and complained about this but they've not bothered to respond. I used to be a loyal customer but I won't be buying from them again.

Bought in store and arranged delivery of my items today. Was told delivery would be between 7am and 7pm so I waited in. Got a text message at 4:30 to say it will now be delivered tomorrow between 1pm and 5pm. I hope this is true but other reviewson here suggest maybe not! Such a shame because the instore staff were very helpful.

articleTitle: IKEA Wembley very unhelpful staff I ask…
articleText: IKEA Wembley very unhelpful staff I ask 4 staff to help me find an item none wanted to help and was ignored by all of them when I asked again a staff member got upset that I disturbed her awful awful staff lazy too

Online delivery system is extremely bad. If you want to waste your time then book an order and wait for result. If you want to cancel the order they will not refund delivery charges. What a service IKEA.

articleTitle: IKEA Dublin customer service by phone
articleText: IKEA Dublin customer service by phone. I only shop in IKEA when I have failed to get an Irish equilavent! I was trying to do an order online, for a few items at a total cost of €100. I could not get their system to work. I made five phone calls to sort out the issue. I was put through to what they laughingly call CustomerServices for times and left hanging with no response on the other end. I eventually spoke to someone called Caitlin who spoke so quietly that, with my phone on max, I could barely hear her. I wear hearing aids and had them at max too, to no avail. I had to repeat everything and ask her to repeat herself too. Eventually, she advised that all my information was correct, but it would take 48 hours for the system to confirm it! In this day and age of emails and instant responses, 48 hours for a confirmation seems illogical, ESPECIALLY AS I HADALREADY CONFIRMED ALL THE INFORMATION YESTERDAY TOO,

Horrible horrible service,Every furniture we ordered were delivered after months of delay, without the complete parts.Sofa without the armrests, bed without the middle support, shelf with defective parts, refurbished cupboard were repackaged and sold to us as new but were scratched and dented.What's worse is we have to drag the defective items weighing a ton, by ourselves, to their shop to claim a refund!No way to reach their phone support, I gave up after waiting for 45 mins on hold.Thank you Ikea for making me sleep on the floor for 2 months and for shipping defective items which I had to drag back to your warehouse to refund my own money.Finally, do something about your rude delivery men, they throw furniture on the street and run off, leaving me to carry it 3 floors. The delivery charges are quite high, some quality would be appreciated.
I returned items 19/05/21Transaction ID : 20210519/186/44/39Exceptional customer service,Could not do enough to help.I wish all customer service people would be like this lady.Thank you

Hi,I am EXTREMELY trustee dated with ikea. I placed an order on March 8th for a wardrobe system to be delivered originally on Saturday, April 10th. I got a call Friday April 9th in the morning saying the system was coming that morning when I was already at work and was unable to be there for the delivery to be made. Later on after hours on hold trying to speak to a representative, I was told the shipment would be coming at a later time. Finally got an email saying the delivery would be pushed back to May 10th. I had my grandma come to my apartment in the morning because I had still yet to receive a call as to the delivery window but the night before I spoke to an ikea rep. And he told me that the delivery was definitely coming that day. My grandma could only stay a half day so I worked a half day and on my way home from I was hit by a van and badly injured all because I was heading home to try to get this delivery. I have a police report filed and I will be bringing this to my local news channel to investigate as to why ikea has terrible customer service and where my wardrobe is because I am starting to think ikea doesn’t even have it. I will also be emailing the CEO my police report for my injury Now after speaking to multiple rep.s and being promised that my ikea wardrobe was brought from a warehouse in Long Island last week that it would be in a warehouse in the city to be put on a delivery route today, I have yet to get any call or email. I paid a lot of money for this and Ikea has terrible customer service. This is TWO MONTHS LATER and I have yet to receive this item. I need this ASAP.I have been telling everyone I know never to purchase from ikea, I will be writing to the CEO, I will be sure to be posting all over review sites as well as bring this issue to my local news channel to do a customer review and investigation with them.I would like a full refund and to be compensated for this issue. I would also like to be contacted by a superior employee to resolve this headache. I am disgusted by the absolute poor service!

articleText: if i can only give less than a star i will, i will never buy from them again, after i had pay 200 euro  and waiting for delivery for 3 weeks i have got only 1  unit that cost 100 euro,,, but the value of it is only 30 euro,, postage 70,,,,they promise to collect it, never did, cant get rid of, it cant return it as will cost me more money, the other 100 got refunded,,

articleTitle: Bed and mattress ordered after a month…
articleText: Bed and mattress ordered. After a month of being messed about I had to cancel the order. They sell stuff they don't actually have. They offered me a £40 'good will' voucher but I don't want anything to do with this lousy company.

0 stars. Looks like a scam. Ordered a flottebo sofa online. Only 2 parts were delivered. For the rest of my order no one can give any even approximate estimations. Customer service is terrible. No one can help. Absolutely. Online help just ask you to call their number. Almost a month has passed.
In Manchester, there was nothing but inhibition and racism at the customer service desk today
Ignores the Swiss states law and did not accept my attestation that I am excempted from wearing a mask. IKEA clearly breaches the law; this should be prosecuted.

We have had similar poor quality issues with the Hokassen mattress as in the review below.  Ours is probably worse as the mattress was rarely used, it was only on the guest bed.  The sides have started sagging, showing that the springs do not extend the full width, the foam sides sag and do not support.  I will never buy an IKEA mattress again and consider them very very poor value for money."Poor quality, meaningless warranties & horrible customer serviceI purchased a mattress from the Amsterdam location of Ikea in 2018. We went for the slightly higher-end HOKASSEN model, which cost us around €500. After just two years, one side of the mattress started caving in - it appears the layer of foam around the mattress has separated from the core. I contacted Ikea's customer service team about this issue, as their website claims all mattresses come with a 25-year warranty. After weeks of slow communication and lots of back-and-forth with the customer service team on Facebook messenger, they finally connected me to the claims team. They then asked for additional information and photos, only to then reply back saying: "We have started to process your enquiry and have thoroughly examined your photos. Considering this information, we have concluded that the damage stated is caused by circumstances that lie outside the product itself, e.g. daily use, impacts from dropping or falling, or incorrect use of the product." So apparently "daily use" is considered a legitimate reason to void the warranty, even though the Terms and Conditions say nothing of the sort. According to the T&C: "The claim must not be the result of incorrect use of the product, such as dropping it, knocking it over, using it for a purpose other than that for which it was intended, not maintaining it properly, or having it repaired by a third party." I replied with this information and asked for further explanation from the services team and never received a reply. So after over a month of emailing about the damage with my mattress, I end up ghosted by Ikea. One of the worst customer service experiences I've ever had. For anyone thinking about buying a mattress from Ikea, be warned -- the mattresses are not made to last and the warranty is worth nothing more than the paper it's printed on."

articleTitle: Do not shop with them - it's an absolute nightmare
articleText: IN SHORT: They didn't deliver but they kept the money, and I have been wasting months dealing with their awful customer service.I ordered and paid for a couch and a dresser online several months ago. Twice in a row, I was waiting for the delivery at home only for IKEA to suddenly reschedule it by several weeks in to the future. They then delivered about half the parts for the couch, and I had to figure out for myself that I would never receive the remaining parts and the dresser. They still charged me for shipping and the couch parts I had received, which are useless by themselves, and said that to get reimbursed I would have to deliver them back to an IKEA store ("we don't do pick ups right now"). Customer service was completely uncooperative and unreliable, I had to call them 4 times in total. Each time, I had to spend 2-3 hours on the phone, much of it on hold. Each time they made promises they then didn't keep -- when I'd call to check in, they'd have a new customer service person who said they had no knowledge of intentions to refund me for the random couch parts they had sent. They'd basically just tell me that there was nothing they could do. End result: about 10 hours on the phone (!!), several days of staying home to wait for them to deliver, and several months sitting in a half furnished apartment (I still have nowhere for my guests to sit). The nightmare is ongoing. I still don't have a couch or my money back. I wish I had the means to just have a lawyer handle it.

articleText: I would give these ###holes 0 stars if I could. I purchased a dresser a few months ago and got two of the right outer walls so I’m not able to put it together. Ordered online twice, first took over 8 weeks to arrive. The bulb they had suggested to go with the shades I purchased was bigger than the shades themselves and so useless. Called to speak to customer services. They seemed uninterested and rude. Second order was tiles, two boxes arrived instead of 3, the two that arrived were smashed into pieces.
